name: Save the Zoo
description:
DESCRIPTION:
You're excited about your first day at your new job - a Zookeeper at your local Zoo. You just didn't know what was in store for you. You arrived -- just as the animals have escaped! You must work together with the other zoo staff to recapture all of the animals. But be quick! Some of the animals are scary or dangerous. If all of the patrons leave before the animals are recaptured, the zoo will close.

GAME OBJECTIVE:
Recapture the animals before all of the patrons leave the zoo

GAMEPLAY:
Players collect activity cards, or team up to attempt recapture animals by using colored custom dice. Each character has strengths in capturing certain animal types (mammals, birds, etc.)

GAME ELEMENTS:
•Players perform activities to level up, or find helpful items
•Each character is uniquely useful against certain animals, but can assist other characters
•Lots of animal varieties and difficulties
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Simulation

name: Politiko: Sabah & Sarawak Expansion Set
description:
Politiko - the card game about wacky scheming, cynical realpolitik, and Malaysian general elections - invades Sabah and Sarawak!

Woo East Malaysian voters with clean water and electricity; alienate them with excessive logging. Force your political rivals to splinter and grant citizenship to immigrants. If nothing works, play up invasions by a foreign sultanate!

Fight West Malaysian oppression with three new political parties with unique abilities. Rally around the Huguan Siou or enforce the White-haired Rajah' will!

REMEMBER: the East is your fixed deposit. Spend it well.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Political
mechanics: Hand Management

name: Shattered Armada: Naval Battles of the Spanish Civil War 1936-39
description:
Publisher Blurb:

Command at Sea travels to the waters off Spain in 1936, where in July, right-wing "Nationalists" rebelled against the democratically elected leftwing "Republicans", resulting in the bloody civil war. Italy and Germany quickly backed the Fascist Nationalists, as the Soviet Union rallied behind the Communist-Socialist-Anarchist Republicans. Meanwhile England, with a reluctant France, desperately sought to keep war from expanding. Shattered Armada features 22 scenarios describing battles that actually did occur, "could have" battles with combatants who were close enough to fight; and "what if" battles drawn from war plans and journals. From shore batteries and minefields to battleships and gunboats, players will re-live the role of Spanish navies as they contend with each other and warships of the Great Powers, as war at sea reveals Spain's ultimate fate. Requires Command at Sea 4th Edition rules to play.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Nautical, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Simulation

name: King of New York: Washington Square Park
description:
Promo card first issued at Essen 2014.

Discard: Buy this card for 1 less energy if signed by Richard Garfield.

+ 1 VP. When you buy this card challenge a Monster to Monster Chess. Bet an amount of energy you both can afford.

MONSTER CHESS: You both roll 3 dice as fast as you can. Keep your claws and reroll the others. First to get three claws wins all wagered energy.

This promo is "meant to be signed and handed out by Richard Garfield himself. It was a much smaller print, as you can imagine."

Part of the King of Tokyo series.
categories: Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Open Drafting

name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – U.S.S. Hood Expansion Pack
description: This ship is the competitive prize for Month 1 of the Star Trek: Attack Wing Organized Play tournament, the Q Continuum.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Phase Order

name: Blood Bowl (2016 Edition): Hakflem Skuttlespike – Star Player
description:
Hakflem Skuttlespike, the result of decades of unpleasant Skaven experiments, a player upon whose shoulders Clan Rigens immediately placed the future of the Skaven game of Blood Bowl. A petty, jealous and vicious example of Skaven cunning, he ensured that no other player would be created to rival him by killing any Clan Rigens experiment or creation that looked like a potential equal.

Now, given the sheer amount of time spent ensuring the demise of any Skaven who look able to rival him, you might think that Hakflem Skuttlespike neglects his duties on the hallowed Blood Bowl pitch. Not so! With this bizarre, two-headed resin kit, you can field him as a Star Player in any Skaven team you choose. Furious, muscular and bedecked with spiky bits, he is posed in an appropriately aggressive manner, both of his sharply toothed maws likely shrieking unintelligible threats at whichever poor opponent is in the way. Each of his four (count ‘em!) hands is ready to kill, with metal gloves and a spiked ball among the turmoil. There’s even space for some Skaven symbols on his armour.

This resin kit comprises 10 components, and includes two 32mm round bases, one featuring a hole to slot a ball into, indicating possession of the ball in your games of Blood Bowl.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures, Sports
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: OX the Game
description:
OX is a two-player, portable, table top game which combines strategy and luck. It's fast and addictive.
The aim of OX is to get all of your counters across the board before your opponent, this is done by moving counters according to the roll of the dice. Depending on your roll, you can move one or two counters and attack your opponent, defend yourself or simply get your counters across the board. It becomes a battle in which you try and both advance your counters forward and push your opponents back.

The game is made of leather and wood and rolls up to make it portable. The game involves the leather board itself with a wooden centre piece, 16 counters and a pair of dice.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Heroes of Normandie: 2e DB Heroic Recon Platoon
description:
Exclusive punchboard as a gift for P500 #1 participators.

This mini-expansion adds a few units of the French 2nd Armored Division to integrate with FFI or American armies of Heroes of Normandie. It also integrates with the Investigator faction of Shadows over Normandie.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Bluffen
description:
Does everyone lay down the card that belongs to the opened symbol?
Is someone bluffing ?
In that case hit the bell and check the last card... Are you bluffing then you collect all the cards

He who loses all his cards first wins!

—description from the publisher (translated)
mechanics: Matching

name: Mar Rojo
description:
The Spanish Civil War at Sea
In summer of 1936 the Spanish Navy was the eighth world naval power, with 2 battleships, 4 cruisers, 15 destroyers and 12 submarines. Following the nation's fate, the Navy was also split in two. War at sea was mostly long and hard convoy warfare blockade, counter-blockade and a few naval suface actions (like the sinking of the Baleares heavy cruiser). Anyway, much like on land, both sides fought with equal valor at sea.

"Mar Rojo" (Red Sea, The name of a merchant ship that was part of both navies) is an exciting, fast-paced card battle wargame for one or two players about the Spanish Civil War at sea.

Each player begins with five cards in the hand and a fleet of 12-5 ships. The object of the game is try to sink the enemy warships while the own merchant ships arrive at secure harbour.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Civil War, Nautical, Wargame
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Hand Management, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Hats: The Incredible Hat
description:
A limited edition suit of six cards. The incredible hat was created by our community.

Winning words: Fishbowl, turtle, sloth, unicorn, teapot

—description from the publisher.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Novel-based
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection

name: Targi: Alternative Border Cards
description:
Mini-expansion containing six (now 12) border cards with alternative rules, replacing the Noble, Trader, Fata Morgana, Silversmith, Caravan and Tribal Expansion cards.

I added the new files with all 12 cards in English and German here in the files section.

Hope you enjoy them.
Andy
categories: Arabian, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Print & Play
mechanics: End Game Bonuses, Modular Board, Set Collection, Turn Order: Progressive, Worker Placement

name: Marvel: Crisis Protocol – Blade & Moon Knight
description:
Born while the vampire Deacon Frost fed on his mother, Eric Brooks had a portion of the vampiric condition passed on to him. He uses the abilities of this infection to destroy vampires as Blade, a super-powered hunter who possesses the strengths of vampire kind while having none of their weaknesses.

Marc Spector is Moon Knight, the “Fist of Khonshu.” On an archaeological expedition in Egypt, Spector uncovered a temple to the ancient Moon God, Khonshu. Betrayed and left for dead, the god gave Spector a second chance at life as Moon Knight, a supernatural crime-fighter with powers tied into the cycles of the moon.
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Age of Steam Expansion: Honeybee Hive Mind, Brooklyn & Escape Room
description:
A trio of expansions by Neon Comet Games, first released at Tokyo Game Market 2023 and available for purchase on their website.

Honeybee Hive Mind is a map for 3-5 advanced players. Players represent bees working to pollinate their network of flower fields, but competition exists against ever-present rival bee populations, making deliveries painfully expensive.

Brooklyn is a map for 3-4 players. Fashion shows and set-collecting provide trendy players with special mid- and end-game bonuses.

Escape Room is a co-opertunistic map for 2-4 players working collectively to solve four unique puzzles as they race against the clock. Special time-track discs are added to the board each round. There can only be one winner, but if the players fail to solve the puzzles before time runs up, everybody loses.
categories: Animals, Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Industry / Manufacturing, Puzzle, Trains, Transportation
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Catch the Leader, Dice Rolling, Loans, Network and Route Building, Pick-up and Deliver, Player Elimination, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Selection Order Bid, Set Collection, Team-Based Game, Tile Placement, Turn Order: Auction, Variable Phase Order, Victory Points as a Resource

name: TAO
description:
TAO is an abstract and strategic card game for 8+ / 2 players. It is inspired by oriental culture and Taoist philosophical thought. Although there are 4 factions facing each other (tigers and dragons, red and blue) the player stands above the parties and uses them as tools to achieve the goal: to open the portals and recover the greatest number of resources.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Deck Construction, Movement Points, Pattern Recognition

name: Eat Zem All
description:
Have you always dreamed of being a zombie?

In Eat Zem All, play as a horde of the living dead in competition with other hordes.

The humans are managed by the game's A.I. (no app). They try to escape from you, or even kill you! Intolerable! Eat them all!

Recover the powers of humans bitten by your zombie horde and win the game!
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Combopolis II
description:
A 6-card combo pack that allows you to combine Sprawlopolis and Naturopolis (to add some natural features to your urban environment).

Unlike the original rules for both standalone games, this variant eliminates the use of card-passing. Rather, players shuffle each game deck individually, flipping a single card from each to reveal 2 scoring conditions. Then, a 3rd card is drawn at random from the 6-card combo pack to reveal the 3rd and final scoring condition. A separate card from this pack is used as the starting tile, displaying 2 "blocks" from those terrains included in each game respectively.

On a player's turn, they draw 1 card from each game deck and must choose 1 to play and 1 to discard. In this way, both game decks with run out at the same rate. End game occurs after the last 2 cards are drawn and played/discarded.

Players score for the largest 2 block groups from each game, lose points for individual roads, and score/lose points according to the 3 scoring condition cards.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, City Building, Expansion for Base-game, Territory Building
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Layering, Tile Placement

name: Fantastiqa: Treasure Hunt Expansion
description:
In the Treasure Hunt Expansion for Fantastiqa, you stumble upon a curious collection of Treasure Maps. Use these maps—-and your dog-—to dig up mysterious treasures all over Fantastiqa! A new Victory Cup Quest is also added to the game (more on this exciting Quest below...)

Fantastiqa is required for you to play.

Components:

12 Treasure Map cards (2 for each Region)
14 Mystery Tokens (see details below)
12 +1 Point Bonus Tokens


Summary:
At the beginning of the game, one Treasure Map card is hidden face-down underneath the Quest Goal card. This Treasure Map indicates the Region where the Victory Cup is located--a final Quest required for victory!

During the game, one Treasure Map card is always visible as an Open Quest for any player to fulfill. To fulfill a Treasure Map Quest, a player must travel to the Region showing on the Treasure Map and dig there (using his "Dig Dog"). On doing this, the player claims one +1 Point Bonus Token and one Mystery Token (see below). The Treasure Map card is discarded face-up at the bottom of the Treasure Map deck and a new Treasure Map card is displayed on top (reshuffle as needed).

When one player reaches the Quest Goal, the Victory Cup Quest tucked beneath the Quest Goal is revealed, face-up, for all to see. The first player who fulfills both of the following conditions wins the game: a) the player’s score meets or exceeds the Quest Goal, and b) the player uses a “Dig” symbol (on his Dog card) to unearth the Victory Cup from the Region showing on the card.

List of Mystery Tokens:


Artifact: Draw one Artifact from the top of the Artifact deck and claim it for free. Immediately add it to your hand.
Beast: Draw one Beast from the Beast deck and claim it for free. Immediately add it to your hand.
Flying Carpet: Fly to any adjacent Region over a marked road. (Just like a regular Magic Carpet token.)
Magic Compass: Travel to any Region diagonally adjacent to your own (i.e., across the terrain occupied by an Open Quest card).
Pocket Portal: Teleport to any Region.
Potion of Persuasion: Use the potion to subdue any adjacent Creature while Adventuring (move your Adventurer as usual). Immediately add this Creature to your hand.
Secret Stash: The token is worth 4 Gems. These Gems do not count against you when the Mischievous Raven appears or when other players use Artifacts like the Rogue’s Purse. They cannot be stolen by the Mischievous Raven or by other players. Use these Gems just like regular Gems when purchasing items. No change is given.
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Point to Point Movement, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Set Collection, Team-Based Game

name: Planet Apocalypse: Lady Scylla
description:
"Scylla, a new Demon Lady with six heads, which must be destroyed separately."

This expansion contains a new Lord figure to switch up your game.

Contains:

1 Lord figure (Lady Scylla)
1 Lord Sheet
6 Deadhead Markers


A Crossover from Planet Apocalypse officially published by Petersen Games makes this miniature compatible with Cthulhu Wars.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Role Playing

name: Dark Deeds: Gen Con 2016 Promo
description:
Promo Item from Gen Con 2016

Contents:

10 Cards:
1 New Nemesis
1 New Plot card
1 New x2 Merchant loot cards (2 cards)
2 New x2 Artisan Loot Cards (4 cards)
1 D20 Dice
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: BattleTech: BattleForce – The Galtor Campaign
description:
From the back of the book: The inhabitants of Galtor, a sleepy little planet on the Davion/Kurita border, had nothing to interest their neighboring superpowers. Nevertheless, the manipulations of Hanse "The Fox" Davion and the bitter rivalry of two Kurita Military District Commanders engulfed Galtor in one of the largest battles in recent memory.

Davion planned to lure several Kurita regiments onto Galtor with rumors of a newly discovered Star League cache and then ambush the Kurita forces with his own secret reinforcements. Everything went according to plan until five regiments landed and Davion engineers discovered a real Star League installation. Soon Davion units were fighting for their very existence.

This BattleForce 1 scenario set includes a detailed history of the three-month campaign, orders of battle for the units involved and eight scenarios that recreate the pivotal battles.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Unspecified

name: The Twelve Doctors: Silence Will Fall
description:
Silence Will Fall is an unofficial, non-collectable, not-for-profit mini-expansion for the The Twelve Doctors: Doctor Who Card Game.

The expansion consists of the following six cards:

Master's Deck:
Ogron War Party
The Silence
Commander Lytton

Doctor's Deck:
Rory Williams
Donna Noble
Amy Pond
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Print & Play, Science Fiction
mechanics: Hand Management

name: Panzer Grenadier: Airborne (Third Edition)
description:
From the Avalanche Press website:

Floating down from the dark early-morning skies of Normandy, American soldiers taught the world a new synonym for courage: Airborne. Landing on 6 June 1944, these paratroopers would fight for the next 33 days and go on to represent their country in the victory parade through the ruins of Berlin.

Airborne is a book supplement for the Panzer Grenadier series. It contains 35 scenarios set in the Normandy countryside: 20 of them from the long-out-of-print boxed game, 14 new ones by Mike Perryman, and one mega-scenario by Patrick Callahan. Plus the usual background material.

Airborne includes a mapboard, but no playing pieces. Players will need playing pieces and some maps from Elsenborn Ridge and Battle of the Bulge; a few scenarios also use boards or pieces from 1940 - The Fall of France and Edelweiss.

Airborne is sold in both print and digital editions. The digital edition does not include a map
categories: Expansion for Base-game, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid

name: Fleet Commander: Orbit
description:
"Fleet Commander: Orbit", an expansion for "Fleet Commander: 1 – Ignition", is a 60 x 60 cm rubber game mat that allows players to extend confrontations to solar systems. This mat can also be used with the newest release in the Fleet Commander family, "Fleet Commander: Genesis".

The presence of a sun at the center of the battle field changes the spacetime within which your ships operate and the tactics required to win.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement

name: But Wait, There's More!: Geek Expansion
description:
The Geek Expansion is a pack of three mini expansions:

Fantasy RPG Mini-Expansion
Superhero Mini-Expansion
Video Game Mini-Expansion

Every mini-expansion contains six new features and four new products that can be added to the appropriate game decks separately or combined.
categories: Fantasy, Humor, Party Game, Real-time, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Acting, Storytelling

name: Busan
description:
Contract will be received for 5 days (rounds) from Monday to Friday. It is a game in which players earn money to construct a port facility, process contracts of contracts, and win he highest victory points.


This game is available for 2 to 4 players.
Players play for 5 rounds from Monday to Friday.
Each round consumes an optimal amount of time, depending on you situation, for an average of eight hours. Apart from that, 4 hours each round can be used at an additional cost. This is 8 hours a day you have to work overtime and pay for it.
You can become a winner of the game by optimizing your time and taking advantage of it.
mechanics: Action Queue

name: Titans: 5th Player
description:
5th Player expansion brings to the game a new Nation -- Holy Roman Empire with its capital in Wien. New Nation means a new ability, new Titan, new Nation Cards, and unique miniatures with all other components necessary to play with this Nation.

—description from publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Hand Management

name: Rising Sun: The First Sino-Japanese War, 1894-1895
description:
"Rising Sun: The First Sino-Japanese War, 1894-1895" is a historical board wargame that deals with the entire First Sino-Japanese War, which was the first foreign war for modern Japan. Players take charge of Japan or the Qing Dynasty and fight for control of the Korean Peninsula, Liaodong Peninsula, Shandong Peninsula, and Penghu Islands. Alternatively, the Japanese Army can challenge the Zhili decisive battle.

As with historical facts, the Navy has a big role to play in games. At that time, the infrastructure was not well-developed, and it was the transport vessels that could most efficiently carry large numbers of troops and supplies, and command of the sea was needed to secure maritime transport. How will the Combined Fleet challenge the Beiyang Fleet, which has the battleships Dingyuan and Zhenyuan, which were called the strongest ships in the Orient? And how will the Japanese Army capture the fortress of Lushun and Weihaiwei?

The game system of this game is called card-driven, and makes full use of cards that represent war resources and historical events and tactics. But more important than how to use the card is a "strategy" that looks at how to end the war.
mechanics: Area Movement, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Simulation

name: HeroQuest: Rogar's Hall
description:
This quest was posted online as an advertisement for the HasbroPulse crowdfunding of HeroQuest.

"As soon as I saw the fantastic sculpt for Mentor I wanted to write a Quest that would use the new miniature. Rogar’s Hall is a training Quest for Heroes that is run by Mentor. It is a tough challenge. One that will require the Heroes work as a team and truly optimize their skills, capabilities and resources. Mentor accompanies you and may help. But this is a test for the Heroes. Even though it is a training adventure Mentor promises you, “There will still be bruises and sore limbs in the morning.”

-description from publisher's website.

The website was taken offline in 2022.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Chocobo's Dungeon: The Board Game
description:
Game Overview:
Chocobo is lost in a mysterious dungeon! Work together to guide Chocobo to avoid monsters and traps, while gathering vegetables and items. Can you defeat the boss in the dungeon's depths and help Chocobo escape safely?

Contents:
• 1 Chocobo board set
• 3 Dungeon boards (double-sided)
• 100 Chocobo cards
• 15 Basic Monster cards
• 15 Elite Monster cards
• 1 Boss tile (double-sided)
• 21 Vegetable tokens
• 15 Book tokens
• 14 Damage tokens
• 1 Chocobo meeple
• 1 Reaper meeple
• 1 Vegetable counter
• 1 Health counter
• 1 Multi-language rulebook (English/ German/ French/ Japanese)

© SQUARE ENIX CO., LTD. All Rights Reserved
mechanics: Action Points, Action Queue, Cooperative Game, Hand Management

name: Divinity Original Sin: Haunted Keep Expansion
description:
In the Haunted Keep expansion, an old mage greets Origins at the entrance to a strange tower and tells the tale of a grave misfortune that cursed the place. Undead now roam the dark passageways, but somewhere within is a ritual that may end the curse.

First, the Origins must accept one of many hexes to survive the challenges of the keep where unnatural monstrosities lurk. Potions, weird science, and hexes greet them at every turn.

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Legacy Game, Narrative Choice / Paragraph, Role Playing, Storytelling, Variable Player Powers

name: RONE: New Forces
description: RONE: New Forces, the second expansion for the post-apocalyptic card game RONE: Races of New Era, contains five reprinted cards from the core set and 98 new cards with two new keywords (Slow Effect and Initiative), which advance the classic gameplay to another level. Recruit new units to your army, surprise your opponent with new effects, and fight for victory!
mechanics: Open Drafting

name: Suburbia: Collector's Edition – Sax Serenade Jazz Club
description:
Originally available as part of Game Boy Geek Season 7 Kickstarter campaign as well as the Kickstarter for the Suburbia: Collector's Edition.

A tile that can be added to the Nightlife expansion.

-$2 for every Office tile
categories: City Building, Economic, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Closed Drafting, Set Collection, Tile Placement

name: Midnight Legion: The World Reborn
description:
Game System

The Midnight Legion is a highly advanced, color illustrated gamebook trilogy in the style of the classic Choose Your Own Adventure series, but with MUCH more control over your character and world—think of an advanced version of SORCERY or LONE WOLF, with deeper character generation. An interactive story is combined with combat, strategy, puzzles, diplomacy, stealth and role playing elements. Collect information, knowledge, and goods from the world around you to advance your character.

2-player Version

In this variation, one player reads the entries like a game master to another player who experiences the world of Midnight Legion. All the rolls for the encounters are handled by the reader and the player handles all of his or her character's dice rolls. This is also a good way for the game master player to introduce the game to someone who doesn't know all the rules.

Game Play

You must choose whether to complete your objectives using combat, stealth or sixth sense and diplomacy. You can solve the puzzles that unlock the base’s secrets using logic, or you can try to recover your lost memories for clues.

Choices

Whatever you decide, your actions change the world around you and determine the encounters you face next. Every game you play will be different – and you will need all of your skills to survive.

Theme of The World Reborn:

More than four centuries have passed since the Devastation engulfed the Earth. The species that remained were fused and reborn in the alchemy of atomic fire. Now their diverse descendants have claimed the planet. You are an agent of the Midnight Legion, tasked with preserving life and rebuilding civilization. Only one other agent remains, and she is somewhere ahead of you, racing for your last remaining base. Unless you can reach it before she does, she will seize the command center and use its ancient weapons to unleash a second Devastation. This time, if she succeeds, nothing will survive. Your chase will lead you to new creatures, lost technologies and possibly even the clues your adversary leaves behind. But beware—there are no established paths across this constantly shifting land, and nothing is what it seems.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Role Playing

name: Sakura Arms: Inyou Jihen
description:
The final expansion for Sakura Arms( Although Sakura Arms II(tentative name) is in the works), this expansion adds 2 new megami: Utsuro「ウツロ」 and Honoka「ホノカ」. The set has a strong ying and yang theme(name roughly: ying yang incident)Utsuro is the megami of shadow, and brings the peaceful world to a close, while Honoka ushers on the future and represents life and hope.

Sakura Arms is a Japanese dueling living card game made for 2 players, in which players build 10 card decks from a limited pool in order to reduce the oponents life to zero.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Mythology
mechanics: Action Points, Deck Construction, Hand Management, Relative Movement, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Masters of Crime: Rapture
description:
White sandy beaches, the gentle sound of waves, and a well-functioning drug cartel: this is what the "Isla de Cubaidos" is known for — that, and its international superstar Dayana.

But for you, the Caribbean paradise could soon become hell because the secret drug network that you have built up on the island is threatened by a public scandal: Dayana has disappeared on the island without a trace. Can you find out what happened to her before the police search party arrives and inspects your island?

Masters of Crime: Rapture is a co-operative deductive murder mystery game in which players must solve puzzles, follow clues and make decisions to solve a case. They do this using the included deck of cards, twelve hidden realistic clue documents, and the Internet. Through a choose-your-own-adventure mechanism, players make decisions that influence the course of the game and lead to solving the case in the end. One by one, they enter different realistically designed locations and encounter the various suspects. Then they choose from three different ways to deal with the situation and receive points based on their decisions. Complex puzzles and escape room elements must be solved in order to progress further in the case.

The game is closely intertwined with the real world, and players have to keep using traditional apps like Google Maps or Wikipedia to gather information. Email, detailed web pages, and cell phone calls are also part of the immersive gaming experience.
mechanics: Connections, Cooperative Game, Deduction, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Storytelling

name: Thanos Rising: Avengers Infinity War – Nick Fury Promo Card
description:
Originally available at Gen Con 2019.

Ability: Each time you recruit another hero, remove one damage from a hero not on a player's team and draw a bonus token.
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Open Drafting

name: Hotshots: River Tile
description: Hotshots: River Tile is a single tile for use with the Hotshots base game that provides a firebreak due to the river that ends to three of the six edges.
mechanics: Modular Board, Push Your Luck

name: Big Thumb
description:
This is a game meant for young children. It consists of a board, some tiny poker-like chips, comical prosthetic thumbs, and plastic hammers. The board is used to move the game along. The object is to use your oversized thumb to trap the chips with your thumb and get them to your side of the board before your opponents whack the end of your thumb with the hammer.

It's sort of like a two handed version of Hungry, Hungry Hippos.

Two children can play, but it is best for four kids. Generally, play devolves from using the board to just whacking thumbs and trying to capture chips.
mechanics: Area-Impulse

name: Iberian Rails: Promo Pack
description:
Four additional characters are included in this promo pack for Iberian Rails.

Dali - Count city hexes as non-city hexes, and non-city hexes as city hexes!

Miro - Upgrade cities with public art.

Farmer - Develop tracks for non-city hexes.

Merger Attorney - Prepare for vicious mergers!
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Mistfall: Heart of the Mists Kickstarter Edition
description:
This entry is for the Kickstarter edition with additional content in the box. Limited content consists of 54 cards.

The 54 Kickstarter Limited cards are: 32 regular enemy cards, 9 regular encounter card, 3 companion ally cards, and 10 reward cards.

The Limited cards have a text at the bottom saying: LIMITED. They are numbered 331 - 384.

Mistfall: Heart of the Mists is is a fully cooperative card-based adventure game set in a world of mystery, eldritch powers and perilous adventures. Heart of the Mists continues the story of Mistfall in a standalone expansion featuring new Heroes, Enemies, Encounters and Quests, and introducing Allies, as well as alternative versions of some of the base game mechanisms.

At the start of the game each player chooses a hero with a fixed deck of equipment and power cards, as well as a set of upgrades that can be added directly to a player’s hand during the game. A semi-randomly created board makes for a different landscape every time the game is played, and randomized sets of encounters and enemies create different challenges for players to face before their time runs out.

Mistfall: Heart of the Mists introduces more of what made Mistfall great, making it a good entry point for new gamers, as well as a solid expansion for existing fans. With next to no elements replicated from the base set, Heart of the Mists is the perfect addition to the existing Mistfall set – and a challenging experience both solitaire, as well as with a group of up to three friends.

Gather up your resolve, check your gear and get ready to go to the smoldering heart of the unrelenting Mists!
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers
publishers: Board&Dice, NSKN Games, Passport Game Studios

name: Ark Worlds
description:
A two-player skirmish game inspired by MOBAs and hero-based team shooters, Ark Worlds takes an approach that simplifies the laning in MOBAs and emphasizes the team fight in order to gain strategic advantage.

In Ark Worlds, you gather a team of six heroes, then each player deploys four heroes per engagement, with players activating abilities back and forth until all actions have been exhausted. The team with the highest total dominance when the dust clears controls the objective. This game appeals to people who like the game play of Magic: The Gathering or Netrunner but do not want to sift through hundreds of cards.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Fantasy, Science Fiction, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Action Points, Open Drafting, Secret Unit Deployment, Variable Player Powers

name: Gundam G-Generation Digiboard Mission
description: This is a wargame based on the One Year War played on an electronic chessboard. Includes a playing board, 8 character pieces from the Gundam 0079 series and 2 base pieces. The board features sound effects from the SD Gundam G-Generation video games. 6 5-piece booster sets are also available.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Collectible Components, Miniatures, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Points

name: The Very Fashionable Miss Piggy Card Game
description: It's all yours, a glamorous deck of cards, strategic game play and lots of fun when you play the Miss Piggy Card Game, a unique follow-suit kind of game that's full of tricks for you. For example, in order to win you must get the fewest number of points to get the lowest score. You do this sometimes by collecting no Miss Piggy face cards and other times by collecting certain combinations of Miss Piggy face cards. It's up to you to decide what strategy to take.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection, Trick-taking

name: National Pro Hockey
description:
A stat based game with individual player cards representing
each NHL player. Players perform according to their real life stats while you as coach make all the in game coaching decisions.
mechanics: Dice Rolling

name: A Sky Full of Ships
description:
[From the Book]
A simple (but not too simple) set of starship combat rules, which allow huge fleets to engage each other in epic battle
(and finish in a reasonable amount of time).

You take the place of an admiral, commanding entire fleets.
Using simple, fast-moving game mechanics, these rules attempt to portray the important aspects of huge fleet engagements without becoming to bogged down in time consuming detail.

They're for those players willing to sacrifice some complexity to achieve a fast-moving, playable and most importantly, FUN game.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Hexellation
description:
A strategy board game for 2 or more players designed by Néstor Romeral Andrés in 2009 .

In HEXELLATION, the players try to create a previously fixed star constellation named ‘MODEL’ without creating a different one named ‘AVOID’. The first one to achieve this wins the game. No ties are possible.

The game admits more than 2 players.

Online Play


Play Hexellation on games.wtanaka.com (real-time or turn-based)
mechanics: Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition

name: The Jewel in the Crown
description:
In the run up to the release of the Talisman Expansion Set and following the release of the 2nd Edition of Talisman, Games Workshop released a number of new cards as part of an advertising feature in their house magazine, White Dwarf #72.

These cards comprised the Samurai Character, Curfew & Closed Shop Adventure cards and Bolster, Transmute, Bladesharp, Resurrection & Enrich Spells.

The Samurai was later officially released as part of the Talisman: The Adventure expansion.

Resurrection and Transmute were later released in the French language publication, Le Héraut Citadel #4.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Role Playing, Roll / Spin and Move, Variable Player Powers

name: The Twelve Doctors: Tomb of the Cybermen
description:
Tomb of the Cybermen is an unauthorised, non-profit, and non-collectable mini-expansion for the The Twelve Doctors: Doctor Who Card Game.

This expansion consists of the following cards:

Master's Deck:
Cyber Conversion
Rani's Minefield
Tomb of the Cybermen
Dalek Invasion Force

Doctor's Deck:
Ian and Barbara
"That is why my brain is so much superior to yours!"
76 Totter's Lane
Cloister Bell
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Print & Play, Science Fiction
mechanics: Hand Management

name: Babylon 5 Wars: Ships of the Fleet II
description: Over 350 pages of ships and ship descriptions, this compilation includes all units from everything published after SOTF1 (above) through October 2001: Dilgar War, Raiders and Privateers, Showdowns-3, Showdowns-4, Showdowns-5, Showdowns-6, Variants-3, Tactics Guide, and Wars of the Ancients. Includes updated ships where errors needed correcting, and of course you'll find a CD-ROM with over 250 ships available for your printing and modification pleasure! If you play B5 Wars and have a computer, this is a MUST HAVE!
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Africana: Die Farbwechsler
description:
This expansion includes four new cards. Two of them are so called color changer. These are two new travel cards.
Additionally two new adventure cards (with the color changer symbol) - Leopoldville & Addis Abeba are included.

These expansion is included in the Abacus Katalog-Edition 13 and was printed on high quality paper. This guarantees a perfect fit to the base game.
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Travel
mechanics: Open Drafting, Point to Point Movement, Set Collection

name: BASKETmind: The Special Players
description:
Have you get used to the basic players? Their variants will raise new challenges: a better shooting guard and center, that will force you to watch the perimeter even more; a faster forward and center, that will reach the basket more easily; a shooting guard, that will create more pass lines...

This expansion contains 5 new players, in Red and Blue, to improve some or all of those already in BASKETmind. There are no new rules to learn, since they benefit from abilities that were already in the game, although in other player types. The expansion rulebook suggests two playing modes to introduce them, "Better Teams" and "Draft Game".
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Pattern Recognition, Simulation

name: Flickin' Cars With Guns
description:
Flickin' Cars With Guns is a tabletop dexterity game for 2 or more players playable in as little as 10 minutes. Players use diecast toy cars (like Hot Wheels or Matchbox) to represent armed vehicles. The goal is to destroy your opponents by shooting and crashing into them.

The game is meant to be played on a standard kitchen table, and you can use household items as obstacles and terrain. A 4'x3' table littered with plates, cups, and bowls is pretty standard. In fact playing a quick game after dinner, before cleaning up the table, is one of the funnest approaches.

Each turn the player "flicks" their car twice and shoots once. The act of flicking is where the physical skill and challenge of the game come in. Crashing into an obstacle hurts your car, and accidentally flicking off the table is penalized as well, so players have to be careful.

Shooting is done by rolling 2D6 with a to-hit target number equal to the number of inches to your target. So if your opponent is 8" away you need 8+ to hit. Double damage on double 6s, and shots always miss on double 1s.

There are several variants and optional rules that can be bolted onto this core system, such as droppable weapons, demolition derby mode, a drinking game, stunt bonuses, power ups, using playing cards, etc. to ensure plenty of longevity and suitability for all types of players.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Player Elimination

name: A Game of Thrones: The Card Game – A Dire Message
description:
Game description from the publisher:

"It will not make us glad,” she told him. "There is grief in this message, Ned. I can feel it."
–George R.R. Martin, A Game of Thrones

A Dire Message, the final Chapter Pack in the "Conquest and Defiance" cycle for A Game of Thrones: The Card Game, continues the cycle's major themes, introducing additional Prized cards and giving even more support to the possibility of multi-House decks. Every Great House in Westeros gains powerful cards, including new versions of Robert Baratheon, Ser Balon Swann, and a neutral version of the Iron Throne itself!

Among the sixty cards from A Dire Message (three copies each of twenty individual cards), you'll find a host of new Prized characters, locations, and events, as well as a powerful plots that enable you to search your deck for out-of-House characters. Whether you strengthen the bonds between the Great Houses to possibly build a multi-House deck or utilize the power of Bannermen, you'll find new and powerful cards in A Dire Message!
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Medieval, Novel-based
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Simulation, Variable Player Powers
publishers: Edge Entertainment, Fantasy Flight Games, Giochi Uniti, Heidelberger Spieleverlag

name: Mage Wars: Dragonclaw Wolverine Promo Card
description:
This promo card was given on Gen Con 2014.

Dragonclaw Wolverine

Creature, Rage +3, Frost -2

Cost 14 Mana
Health 13
Armor 2

Fast Attack Ripping Claws: 3 Dice, 8+ Bleed, Piercing + 1

For each token on Dragonclaw Wolverine, he gains Armor +1. if he has 3+ Rage Tokens, his Ripping Claws attack gains Counterstrike.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Malifaux: Crossroads
description:
Crossroads is the newest addition to the Malifaux universe. This book contains rules for nearly two hundred models which have been updated to second edition or added to the line. It also contains a massive amount of new stories further exploring the characters of Malifaux and the roles they play in the lore. Everyone who enjoys Malifaux will find something they love about this book!

It clocks in at 320 pages and includes rules for all crews which have not yet been updated to second edition, along with a few new ones. Each chapter is divided up by faction containing a series of short stories, one for every Master in the faction. In this way, every master in the book gets some face time and none are left sitting on the bench! Finally, every story has a special scenario tied to it, allowing you to relive the trials and tribulations of some of your favorite characters.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Horror, Miniatures
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven

name: Let'stick
description:
The aim is to stick the letters from the sheet (16 letters of the same colour) as fast and smartly as possible onto surfaces around.
Players choose a room in the home and go on a mad race of tactics. Go go stick!
One player will stick a “T” on a table, the next follows with “A”, etc.
Mind, a sticker must not follow one of the same colour and only one word is allowed per surface.
The winner is the one who has completed the most words in the room.
Let’stick is the perfect game for kids big and small who like to keep on the move.

Eco-innovative stickers to use time and time again.
mechanics: Area Movement

name: Galleys & Galleons
description:
Subtitle: Being the truthful account of a tabletop wargame for wee ships in the Age of Discovery, put down in writing by Nicholas Wright Esq. and accurately rendered through illustrations by Orestis ‘Orestix’ Ermeides Esq.

Galleys and Galleons is a standalone set of naval wargaming rules based on the Song of Blades engine. G&G allows players to fight out fast-paced naval battles without cluttering the table with charts or unnecessary record keeping. Note that no miniatures are included: players can use any sailing ship miniatures of any scale from any source they want.

Easy to learn, fast to play, games concluded in around one hour.

Flexible: designed for each player to command up to 6-7 ships, the rules are equally enjoyable playing one-on-one duels or small fleet actions with multiple players per side.

Although the core rules focus on early modern voyages of discovery, mercantile exploitation and piracy, additional rules cater to players wishing to sail for stranger shores with the inclusion of mythical beasts, submersibles and more.

Expansive - includes rosters for 36 historic vessels plus numerous shore forts, monsters and more.
categories: Adventure, Book, Miniatures, Nautical, Pirates, Renaissance, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck

name: Ewetopia
description:
A storm has blown through the sleepy, fairy-tail hamlet of Ewetopia, releasing the sheep from their barns and now they’ve all congregated into a massive, mixed-up herd in the middle of the valley! Players step into the role of village farmers, who must use their feisty canine companions to help them herd back the lost flocks.

Ewetopia is charming, fast-paced, easily-to-learn, and hard-to-master. With warm, friendly graphics that have appeal for kids, it will also appeal to older audiences with it’s deceptively tactical game play: A strong denial game, board control, and a playing field that can change with every turn means Ewetopia enjoy plenty of play-time with old and young alike.

Players command their trusty dog around a 5x5 grid filled with tiles containing numerically ranked sheep, pushing rows and columns of them, adding the tiles that get pushed off the grid to their collection. The dogs are very fast and will always move at least 2 squares during their turn, so although they can be made to change direction after their 1st move, they can’t then move back into the square they just came from: Players will need to plan their turn to avoid collecting the wrong tiles or ending up out-of-position.

Opponents’ dogs can’t be pushed and will create obstacles on the board, but if this happens, or if a player wants to create a better move for themselves, fences can be built in the way of the charging sheep, diverting their path in a direction of the player's choice. Since these fences remain in the ground until the end of the game --and act the same for every player-- the result is a maze-like meadow where creative, zigzag moves aren’t just possible, but become the norm.

Adding to the brain-twisting mix are special tiles, including:
Motivating Bones: When collected, can be consumed at any time to “motivate” a dog to move an extra square. Useful to push your dog to get a rare sheep, or to force an opponent to make tough choice if their dog is in a bad position.
Wild Sheep: A mythical breed with technicolor wool, these sheep can count as any rank at the end of the game, making them especially versatile.
Wolves: A snarky, stenchy wolf-pack have sneakily donned sheep costumes in order to blend into the herd. Their own rank, having them at the end of the game will reduce your score by stinking up your other sheep’s wool.
Wood Carts: Contains enough lumber to build an additional fence on the board when traded in, and may be used immediately after being collected.

At the end of the game, points are awarded based on sizes of unbroken, numerical sequences AND sets of same-ranked sheep, allowing players to pursue different paths to victory if their original plans are foiled. Point values scale logarithmically with size, meaning a single big set or sequence will always be better than several smaller ones. After separating their sheep into the largest sets and/or sequences possible, totaling their values --and subtracting points for wolves-- the player with the highest score is the victor!
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Cooperative Game, Grid Movement, Set Collection

name: New World Magischola House Rivalry
description:
Description from the publisher:

Embrace your dream of going to wizard school, as you enroll in strange classes and clubs, study to improve your grade and accelerate your learning, and use magical spells and artifacts to cause mayhem as you race to win the First House Cup.

House Rivalry is a competitive card game that transports 2-5 players to the beginning of the semester at New World Magischola, North America’s premiere college of wizardry. Start your journey by selecting a unique character and house, then set out to complete your studies, where you’ll attend class, cast spells, fight monsters, and compete against rival students for the glory of the First House Cup!

But beware … like mundane schools, your success at New World Magischola will not only depend on how well you perform in your classes, but also how well you negotiate the social landscape. Will your popularity prevent other players from hexing you? Or will your overconfidence sow distrust and lead to your demise?
mechanics: Hand Management, Simultaneous Action Selection, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: The Walking Dead: All Out War – Julie & Chris Booster
description:
This booster pack contains 3 unique, collectible miniatures allowing you to add Julie and Chris to your games, along with an extra Walker to bulk out your herd.


Plastic Julie Miniature
Plastic Chris Miniature
Plastic Walker Miniature
Julie and Chris Character Cards
Felling Axe, Grenade, Police Vest, and UTAS-UTS-15 Equipment Cards
Mantic Point


—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, Zombies
mechanics: Dice Rolling

name: Fields of Arle: New Travel Destination – Wunstorf
description: Feuerland started a set of new travel destinations. You can get them in the towns printed on the travel destination
categories: Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Farming, Industry / Manufacturing
mechanics: Worker Placement

name: Campowe Tropy
description:
The adventure game for families.

The gamers join the route through the camps organised by Chris and located all over Poland. On their way they learn rare animals and plants characteristic for the visited places as well as have other adventures. For each plant, animal etc. the gamer is given points.

The winner is a person that after reaching the end of the route has most points.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Open Drafting, Point to Point Movement, Push Your Luck, Variable Phase Order

name: Warfighter: Expansion #18 – Nation Skills
description:
Nation Skills adds skill cards and more for the current nations previously released in the Warfighter modern series. The previously released nations are the United States, United Kingdom and the Russian Federation.

This expansion offers 56 cards including:


22 Player Soldiers (8 US, 7 UK, 7 Russia)
12 Non-Player Soldiers (4 US, 4 UK, 4 Russia)
8 Squad Soldiers (3 US, 3 UK, 2 Russia)
11 Weapons (3 US, 3 UK, 5 Russia)
3 Skills (1 US, 1 UK,1 Russia)


—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Modern Warfare
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Hand Management

name: Deception: Murder in Hong Kong – Game Boy Geek Season 6 Kickstarter Promo Cards
description:
Originally available from the Game Boy Geek Season 6 Kickstarter.

2 promo cards available as part of kickstarter promo collection
SD Card - Clue
Rulebook - Clue
categories: Bluffing, Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Murder/Mystery, Party Game
mechanics: Storytelling, Team-Based Game, Traitor Game

name: Mesozooic: Triassic Mini Expansion
description: The Mesozooic: Triassic Mini Expansion introduces three new advanced cards types, all of which utilize the beautifully-sculpted topiary found on certain basic cards as well as on every card back. Build cafés near shady topiary, place lovingly-cultivated conservatories, and utilize skilled groundskeepers to provide a touch of elegant flora to your dino zoos.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Real-time
mechanics: Open Drafting, Tile Placement

name: Six Sided Summoner
description:
Six Sided Summoner is a cooperative tactics game for 1-4 players.
Players control a group of Guardians that must defend a light crystal from waves of AI controlled Shadows.

Shadows are summoned in waves at one end of the board and move down lanes toward your crystal in the style of moba video games. When a new wave spawns, modifiers are added to the shadows that make them more powerful as the game goes on.

Players defend their crystal (represented by a set of tiles at one end of the board) using guardians, each of which have unique movement types and abilities. All Guardians can attack by rolling a six sided die, but their special abilities make them suited to different roles. Some guardians can lay traps for shadows to fall into, others can heal allies, others focus on damage and maneuverability. While these are powerful, they are also limited, so you must use them strategically. Try to manipulate the board to slow down enemies and maximize your damage.

Abilities and shadow modifiers are determined randomly at the start of the game,so every game is going to play a little differently.

Additionally, while the game is focus on cooperative play, it also includes a 2 player competitive mode in which both players defend their own crystals from each other.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Catan: Big Box Jubileumeditie
description:
Catan: Big Box Jubileumeditie contains the classic Catan board game, along with the expansion that allows up to six players to compete on the base game, the Frenemies scenario, the Helpers of Catan mini-expansion that gives each player a character with a bonus ability, the Mallorca scenario (printed on paper), and the New York scenario (printed on paper).
It also contains a voucher for Catan Universe.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Modular Board, Network and Route Building, Trading

name: War Along the Great Lakes
description:
War Along the Great Lakes is Volume III in Worthington Games War of 1812 series.

The game uses blocks and point to point movement to recreate the fighting along the Great Lakes during the War of 1812 between the United States and Great Britain. A British loss in the Great Lakes could have easily meant Canada would be part of the United States today.

During each turn each player receives action points plus random action points to activate his units for movement and combat. During combat each unit rolls dice and scores hits on opponent units. Careful planning is required not to get trapped.

Victory is determined by occupation of key terrain features and elimination of enemy units.

Due to the randomness of the action points no two games play the same. For this reason the game plays great solitaire (no solo engine - but by playing both sides).

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Secret Unit Deployment, Simulation

name: Match-o-Rama
description:
In this press-your-luck party game, test how well you can predict what others will say at the table! Get points for matching answers that fall within a specific range of people-whoever gets the highest score wins.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Push Your Luck

name: Munchkin Pathfinder Goblin Dice
description:
When goblins aren't busy pillaging farms and slaughtering the defenseless... well, that's never. But if they did have downtime, they'd definitely play games with pretty dice like the ones in this pack. It also has four bonus cards for use with Munchkin Pathfinder or any Munchkin game.
Contains six 16mm dice and four Munchkin cards.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Humor
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Napoleon's Battles: Marechal (4th) Edition
description:
"Napoleon's Battles: Marechal (4th) Edition" is a “grand-tactical” wargame rules book which covers the period of the Revolutionary and Napoleonic wars, from 1792 to 1815.

In these rules, players can assume the role of Army or Corps commanders.

A flexible set of Napoleonic wargame rules that allows:

the play of tournament battles with a standard championship army that can be played in two hours,
or recreate bigger historical Battles like Waterloo, Austerlitz, Talavera, Marengo to enjoy such large scale engagements involving multiple players in each side.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Line of Sight, Measurement Movement, Simulation, Variable Set-up

name: Mr. Cabbagehead's Garden: Leticia Colewort promo card
description:
Promo neighbor for the KS campaign "Mr. Cabbagehead's Garden returns!" (2020)

Leticia Colewort ...loves to house sit for her neighbours, she also loves looking in their closets and drawers.
Leticia will actually cause one of the Neighbours not used in the current game to visit Mr. Cabbagehead's Garden!
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Farming, Puzzle
mechanics: Open Drafting, Pattern Recognition, Push Your Luck, Set Collection, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Lasalle (Second Edition)
description:
Lasalle is a tactical Napoleonics game suitable for beginners or veterans in which any army can fight any other or you can play historical scenarios. Players are a division or corps commander leading battalions of infantry, batteries of artillery and regiments of cavalry. A game is an affair for about three hours’ play on a modest table with about a dozen units on each side with no paperwork other than marking disruption against a unit's track.

The second edition has a new sequence of play, driven by momentum and interrupts, allows players to do virtually anything in any order, differently every turn. Completely new rules for the use of the general figure (i.e. “you”) permit you to choose the personality and effect of your intervention in the sequence. Skirmishing has been reinvented from the top-down. The two sides contribute skirmishers to their opposing “screens” and each turn they determine which side’s screen has the advantage. That, in turn, affects the momentum and sequence, not to mention possibly preventing worn units from rallying, obscuring targets from shooters, or even sniping at infantry units as they try to change formations. Movement has been radically simplified. Rather than worrying about evolutions of individual units, movement gets you from point A to B with a certain number of “complications” that accrue as you try to do difficult things like changing formation near the enemy, moving through difficult terrain, interpenetrating, or attacking. Combat has been redesigned so that it is a more decisive either/or experience. Troops either press an attack home, or they are discouraged and fall back with few casualties to either side.

Second Edition Lasalle is a much more holistic game where you are playing not just individual units but rather an entire military effort, and everything affects everything else. You control the sequence and pace of events while your opponent tries to wrest that control from you. What your soldiers can accomplish is not just the result of moving them and rolling dice, but part of the overall situation into which you’ve led your army.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Line of Sight, Measurement Movement, Simulation

name: Reavers of Midgard: Hnefatafl Promo Cards
description:
Originally available as part of Pack C from the Dice Tower 2021 Kickstarter campaign.

Includes 3 identical cards.

When you collect this card, roll 2 combat dice and immediately score Glory equal to the number of hits you rolled.

Optionally, you may choose to take a Terror token and roll 3 combat dice to score additional Glory.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Asking for Trobils: Bonus Items
description:
Contains:
Wormhole
Bag
Ship
Ship Card
Achievement Cards
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Worker Placement

name: Swedish Parliament 2022
description:
Every player chooses one of the six parties and play policies/opinions and move the party markers on a hexagonal voter map with 91 voters. For every card, the player gets to strengthen the relation between two parties who agreed, or weaken the relation between two parties who disagreed.

At the end of the game, the weakest relations are removed, until there is a government which has at least half the voters. The centre of gravity of that government is the winner of the game.

The game is 100% symmetrical, with inspiration from Sweden, although there are also special rules inspired by reality for those who want to play the Swedish election of September 2022.
mechanics: Grid Movement

name: ÍNTIMOOS Parejas: Conversaciones para [re]conocerse
description:
The game that will cheer up your relationship as a couple. Cards with questions divided into 3 levels (flirting, intimate and love) depending on where you are in your relationship.

Contains a total of 180 cards with 5 different categories:


Intimate revelations
Complicity
Future & Plans
Challenge
Hot


First person to get 5 questions right wins
mechanics: Questions and Answers

name: RWBY: Combat Ready – Team JNPR Expansion
description:
Team JNPR has entered the fray! Introducing four unique Huntsmen to battle alongside team RWBY against the forces of Grimm. Play as honorable Lie Ren, dependable Jaune, feisty Nora, and the legendary Pyrrha – or mix-and-match Huntsmen from the base game to craft your perfect team.

Earn experience to customize your Huntsmen’s abilities between scenarios and prepare for the formidable challenges ahead!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Player Elimination, Variable Player Powers

name: Abgetaucht
description:
10 years after your old friend Gunther Waldgraf fled, a mysterious package turned up at his wife Sieglinde's home. Apparently Gunther has disappeared somewhere in South America. Can you help Sieglinde to finally find her husband again?

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Storytelling

name: Order Overload: Burgers
description:
You and your fellow players work in a burgershop in Order Overload: Burgers, and to keep your jobs, you need to keep a handle on all the orders coming in. Will you be able to make the right drinks?

In a round, you deal a certain number of cards face up and read them aloud so that everyone knows all the orders placed, then you deal these cards out face down to the players. On a turn, you need to name an order that's in someone else's hand. Fail to do so, and you're eliminated from play! If you collectively reveal a set number of items before everyone is eliminated, then you clear the level and are ready to take on tougher challenges...

What's the highest level you can clear?
mechanics: Cooperative Game
publishers: Oink Games, 小学館 Good Games

name: Cursed Gifts
description:
Welcome to "Cursed Gifts", a quirky card game where the goal is as amusing as it is devious: dish out "Cursed Gifts" to your pals and see them squirm! It's like a fun twist on Secret Santa where the gifts are meant to be dreadful!

Get ready to unveil a side of your friends you never knew existed... it's devilishly entertaining!

Each player is armed with a hand of 7 cards. Each turn, they have the chance to play up to 3 cards, but beware! Only one of these can be a "Cursed Gift", a hilarious surprise to any chosen opponent. It's a cunning game of strategic gift-giving!

Watch out for the danger zone! If a player accumulates 10 points in their Cursed Area, they're out of the game. To clinch the victory, you have to be the last prankster standing.

To aid you in your journey to becoming the ultimate trickster, you've got an assortment of cards at your disposal. From crafty Treacheries and robust Defenses to valuable Draws, humorously pointless Useless Gifts, and lifesaving Antidotes.

"Cursed Gifts" is all about action and reaction. When you're targeted (or even when you're not), you can respond by playing defenses, bouncing back Treacheries or Cursed Gifts, guarding yourself, or even sneakily stealing cards and swapping Cursed areas.

The possibilities for fun and mischief are endless in this light-hearted game. And the illustrations? They're just the icing on the cake, bringing an extra dose of humor to an already immersive game. Dive in and let the fun of "Cursed Gifts" take over!

-description from designer
mechanics: Player Elimination, Take That, Trick-taking

name: Terraforming Mars: Directed Heat Usage Promo Card
description:
Autumn Season Promo 2023 of FryxGames, which you can buy on its own, or get for free if you order something at their webstore during Autumn 2023.

It is a blue project card with a cost of 1 M€.

Effect: Pay 3 heat to either gain 4 M€ or 2 plants.

Promo card X48.
categories: Economic, Environmental, Expansion for Base-game, Industry / Manufacturing, Science Fiction, Space Exploration, Territory Building
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Set Collection, Take That, Tile Placement, Variable Player Powers

name: Carcassonne: The Wonders of Humanity
description: Carcassonne: The Wonders of Humanity adds historic wonders to the tile-laying game, with each of these marvels having a unique effect on play.
categories: City Building, Expansion for Base-game, Medieval
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Tile Placement

name: Battle of Wagram Game
description:
From Publisher - July 6, 1809 - The Austrians have re-entered the war against Napoleon in an attempt to regain lost territories and power while French forces are tied down in Spain. The Austrian army has been reorganized under the competent Archduke Charles. Napoleon in typical style launches a lightning campaign against the Austrians and giving battle at the town of Wagram near the Austrian capital Both leaders are confident of success and prepared for a spectacular victory.

The game takes about 90 minutes to play. One player commands the French forces and the other player commands the Austrian army. Cards vary the game play.

The "Battle of Wagram" is a low to moderate complexity tactical game set in 1809. Napoleon's French army has cornered the Austrian forces. The Austrian men hold their ground at Wagram, the urban barrier between the invaders and the vital city capital. Which side will prevail? The stage is set...
mechanics: Command Cards, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid

name: PULP
description:
In PULP two players face off in a smoothie duel. Will you mix the right ingredients and be the first to score 13 points?

A game of PULP is played in a maximum of 5 rounds. Each round players will alternate in playing ingredient cards where the number of cards matches the round number. Your goal is to create the most impactful flavour combinations. For example: Playing a pineapple will boost the flavour of all apples you play afterwards and score you an extra 2 points per apple. The person with the highest score that round, wins the round card and its corresponding points.

In the base game of PULP players play with identical decks. More experienced players can decide to construct their own deck by replacing cards from their standard deck for cards from one of the four advanced decks. Will you add a Healthy Booster to your deck or go for a Deep Cleanse?

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Deck Construction, Hand Management

name: Garden Geckos
description:
The garden is full of geckos, scurrying around capturing bugs and seeking out new areas to hide.

Each player represents five geckos that must work together to capture as many bugs as possible along with achieving objectives to score victory points. Objectives come in two forms, creating chains between geckos to link certain bug types, or simultaneously occupying certain patterns of terrain. Players have an on-going hand of 3 terrain tiles plus are dealt a secret bonus at the beginning of the game (a certain bug or terrain type).

On their turn, players place a terrain tile (which contains a mix of 3 patterns) adjacent to a tile on the board with a matching terrain side and place a gecko over the matching pattern across the two tiles. If the placed tile fully surrounds a previously placed tile, the bug on the surrounded tile is awarded to the player with the most geckos touching it. Additionally, if the gecko placed results in a bug sequence in the objective market and/or a terrain sequence, the player is awarded the corresponding objective(s).

The game end triggers when a player achieves six objectives, or if the last tile available is drafted.

Each objective card has bug points on the bottom of it. The winner of the game is the player with the most bug points collected (objectives + awarded tiles + secret bonus) at the end of the game.

-description from designer
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Terraforming Mars: City Parks Promo Card
description:
Promo card X71 given with issue 2/24 of Spielbox Magazine.

7M€ automated (green) project card requires that you have played 3 cities, but grants you with Plant tag and two Plant resources as well as 2 endgame VPs.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Dungeons & Dragons Dice Masters: Faerun Under Siege – Collector's Box
description:
Dungeons & Dragons Dice Masters: Faerûn Under Siege is a game that utilizes WizKids Games' proprietary Dice Building Game platform in which two players take the role of warlords, collect and assemble their "party" of adventurer dice and battle in head-to-head gameplay. Each turn, players roll the dice to see what resources they have available, buy dice, send their party members into the field, and then strike at the enemy warlord. There are multiple cards available for each type of die so players get to choose which one to use. This lets players specialize dice to suit play style.

Additional cards and dice to expand your collection can be found in expansion packs. Each Foil Pack contains two cards and two dice that players can add to their Dice Masters Faerûn Under Siege collections. Players can create teams of their favorite fantasy characters from the Forgotten Realms universe.

The D&D Dice Masters: Faerun Under Seige Collector's Box, This box contains: 20 Custom Dice, 1 Full Color Cloth Dice Bag, 10 Basic Action Cards, 4 Reminder Cards, 1 Full Art Promo Card, and 2 Dice Storage Trays that hold over 300 dice!
categories: Collectible Components, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: PAPER ROLL & Write
description:
"Grandpa, can you tell again the story of when all the toilet paper in the world disappeared?" The old man's face closed, stripped of his usual smile. And, as he pulled the children into his lap, all those memories kept within him, closed by the invisible key of the passage of time, began to flow. His voice sounded calm and painful. “In that strange period of our lives, there were a number of people who, without reason, decided to use up all the toilet paper in the world. These people were part of a radical terrorist movement called P.O.O.H., which basically meant the Party of the Organized and Obsessive Hoarders.”

PAPER ROLL & Write is a roll & write game, for 2 players. One of the players takes command of the Party of the Organized and Obsessive Hoarders (hereinafter referred to as P.O.O.H.), whose aim is to try to deplete the toilet paper stock in the stores, leading the population to total panic. The other player assumes the role of Coordinator of a group of specialists called by the government to resolve this crisis, ensuring the production and supply of paper to the city.

In each round, the P.O.O.H rolls a certain number of dice. Then, the Coordinator chooses how many dice will be used during that round by BOTH players. For each dice that he decides not to use during that round, panic increases by 1. The more dice the Coordinator choses, the more dice he and the P.O.O.H. will use. The more dice he choses not to use, the more the panic increases.
The Coordinator will use dice to produce and distribute paper across stores, while P.O.O.H will use the same dice to accumulate bonuses in his headquarters and to visit stores on the map, buying all the paper and spread the panic, while avoiding being slowed down by the police.

The Coordinator wins the game if at least 5 stores are supplied with paper.
The P.O.O.H. wins the game if the panic reaches the end of the panic track.

In the end of each round, players exchange the game sheets they have in their possession. This creates a constant back and forth between players, because the sheet that one player is currently using, will be used by the other player in the next round.

Also, the Coordinator and the POOH play two completely different types of games, which highly increases replayability.

“PAPER ROLL & write is a free Print & Play Roll & Write board game for two players. But for us it is more than a game, it is a cheerful and positive manifesto in times of uncertainty, and a joint effort from 3 designers in Lockdown due to Covid-19.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Network and Route Building, Pick-up and Deliver, Variable Player Powers

name: Call of Cthulhu: The Card Game – Ebla Restored Asylum Pack
description:
Game description from the publisher:

Knowledge stolen from the ruins of an ancient city now steers the fate of the world.

Ebla Restored, the third Asylum Pack from the upcoming "Revelations" cycle for Call of Cthulhu: The Card Game, adds to the cycle's focus on the power and dangers of eldritch knowledge. Its new cards promote exciting new synergies between dark Tomes and the daring Relic Hunters who seek them. Meanwhile, players gain unprecedented control over their decks and discard piles, finding new ways to work with lost knowledge.

Will the forgotten secrets of ancient Ebla provide you the answers you need to stymie your foes? Will humanity tremble before the terrifying might of the Ancient Ones restored to their former glory, or will heroic investigators and scientists thwart them and their zealous cultists to maintain sanity, at least for another day?

Ebla Restored introduces sixty new cards (three copies each of twenty cards) that provide players with new incentives to hunt down ancient Tomes, visit remote Libraries, and prevent rival Relic Hunters from fetching powerful artifacts for their respective factions.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Novel-based
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: DC Deck-Building Game: Zatanna Zatara Promo Card
description:
Promo from GenCon 2022 as a freebie with the purchase of a DC Deck Building Game item, or for purchase without.

Zatanna Zatara is a super hero for use with Forever Evil or Injustice. She costs 12 to defeat, and has the following abilities:

When played: Gain the top card of the main deck. Choose up to 3 cards in your discard pile. Put one of them on top of your deck and the rest on the bottom.

First Appearance -- Attack: Each player gains a Weakness for each Super Power in the Line-Up.
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Variable Player Powers

name: Caldiero, 1796 (Second Edition)
description:
Caldiero, 1796 is a Tactical level board-wargame on the battle fought during the Napoleon's Italian Campaign.
It was one of the few Austrians victories in this campaign and represents the first defeat suffered by General Napoleon Bonaparte.
The day of the battle was characterized by heavy rain, cloudburst, snow and a ice storm.
The game uses a simplified version of the one used in Massena at Loano and Wise Bayonet.
The game is included in the Para Bellum II magazine.

Available with Italian rules, but English rules can be downloaded from Para Bellum web-site.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Ratio / Combat Results Table, Simulation, Zone of Control

name: Warfighter: WWII Expansion #14 – Japan #1
description:
Warfighter Pacific: Expansion - #14 Japanese Soldiers! Gear! Hostiles! - This expansion adds 56 cards to your Warfighter WWII Missions! This is a Soldier pack with new Soldiers, Locations, Missions, Objectives, Weapons, Equipment, and Skills.

Cards included are:

22x Japan Soldier Cards (8x PS, 6x NPS, 7x SqS)
2x Mission Cards
2x Objective Cards
2x Location Cards
13x Weapon Cards
5x Equipment Cards
7x Skill Cards
3x Action Cards
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling

name: Star Wars: X-Wing (Second Edition) – Xi-class Light Shuttle Expansion Pack
description:
The First Order's agents are scattered across the galaxy, from enclaves in the Unknown Regions to pockets of sympathizers within the New Republic. The Xi-class light shuttle is swift and lightly armed, suited to conveying First Order VIPs quickly but surreptitiously from base to base. It can also serve as a command craft, directing forces in raids before the attackers slip away into the depths of space once again.

Within this expansion, you’ll find a beautifully detailed Xi-class Light Shuttle miniature along with everything you need to launch it on your own secret mission, including a medium plastic base and two medium ship tokens.
