Four ship cards let you dispatch some of the First Order’s most elite agents to do your bidding while 14 upgrade cards let you assign additional crew members to the ship and outfit it with new technology.

—description from the publisher
categories: Aviation / Flight, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Player Elimination, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: My First Dragon Adventure
description:
Race to the mountain top and convince the dragon to save the smore’s! The magical marshmallow fire in the kingdom has gone out, and it’s up to the heroes to race to the dragon’s nest and convince the dragon to help them relight the fire. Players move their hero through the lands collecting keys for hidden shortcuts and gems for the dragon, trying to be the first one to reach the dragon’s nest. Once players reach the nest, they will roll the dice and offer the dragon gems to convince them to come and help the kingdom.

In My First Dragon Adventure, kids will race through the different lands, using numbered cards to jump ahead, while trying to become the hero of the kingdom. But they better watch out! Along the way there are obstacles to avoid and gems to collect. Players move along the board by using their numbered cards to move ahead. Strategically use your cards to avoid landing on obstacles, pick up special items, and slow other players down. Once players reach the dragons nest, they roll the dice to see how the dragon will respond. The first player to make it to the nest and convince the dragon to help is the winner!

Colorful and detailed images make this story driven game a great way to help kids develop their strategic thinking and counting skills. Limited reading and basic counting make this an easy game for kids aged 5+ to learn and enjoy!

-description from publisher
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Valeria: Card Kingdoms – New in VCK2E
description:
Add-on available during the Valeria: Card Kingdoms – Darksworn Kickstarter campaign that included all the new cards found in the 2nd edition of Valeria: Card Kingdoms for first edition owners.

Includes:
5 Herald Starter Cards
6 Event Cards
5 Reference Cards
2 Card Dividers (Starter Herald and Monster Events_
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Dungeon Brah
description:
Dungeon Brah is a comical Dungeon Deck-Builder game. It's a game you play with friends to test those friendships and hopefully share a laugh (sometimes haha, sometimes bwhahaha, usually muhahaha).

Within the dungeon roams a terrible Cathulhian beast, Kevin. You are on a noble quest to steal the loot or be the sole survivor...

With noble intentions you and your party members embark on this quest, which will very soon devolve into disarray as loot runs low. Avoid Kevin at all costs when you’re weak, and storm into glorious battle when you’re OP to claim the beast's treasures!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Player Elimination

name: Mythic Mischief Vol. II
description:
In the standalone sequel to Mythic Mischief, you play as a faction of Mythic Manor students competing to get as many of the other students caught by the Groundskeeper as you can without getting caught yourself.
The Gargoyles, Gnomes, Werewolves, and Fairies each have their own unique set of abilities to move around the board, move the other factions into the path of the Groundskeeper, and even alter the course of the Groundskeeper by moving hedge walls.
Players are able to upgrade their Faction’s abilities throughout the game by collecting powerful Tomes from around the hedge maze.
The winner is the first Team to score 10 Mischief Points or the Team with the most points when the Groundskeeper finishes returning all of the Tomes after lunch!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Points, Grid Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: World in Flames: 93 Annual
description:
World in Flames 93 Annual contains 84 pages of information about World in Flames(based on 5th edition rules).

Contents includes:

Country specific straegy notes
Tactical hints on play
Harry Rowland's Russian set-ups
A World in Flames series reply (with a challenge scenario)
Force pool sheets for all countries
A look at Planes in Flames
A workable PBM system
Complete errata for World in Flames, Days of Decision and Planes in Flames
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Ratio / Combat Results Table, Simulation, Variable Phase Order

name: Vs System 2PCG: The Buffy Battles
description:
Vs System 2PCG: The Buffy Battles is an expansion for the Vs System 2PCG game system but is a stand alone game.

The Buffy Battles will feature 200 cards with images taken from the show, split between "The Good Scoobies" and the "Evil Forces of Darkness," the two teams in the game.

The Good Scoobies are naturally led by the Slayer herself, Buffy, whose "Slayer" ability allows her to kill Evil supporting characters regardless of how much health or vitality they have. Her team includes characters like Giles, Xander, Cordella, and Willow.

The Evil Forces of Darkness, on the other hand, is composed mostly of vampires like Drusilla and The Master, who can gain vitality by wounding opposing characters. Other villains, including the demonic Mayor Wilkins and the voice-stealing Gentlemen also put in an appearance.

The set also includes some characters that can join either side, or even change sides during the game, including Buffy’s love interest Angel, who can become the evil Angelus, and the evil Slayer Faith.

Contents:
200 Playable Cards
1 Token Sheet
1 Rulebook
categories: Card Game, Fighting, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: 1846: The Race for the Midwest – Mini-Expansion
description:
This expansion includes two new private companies for 1846 -- one blue square private named "Boomtown" and one orange dot private named "Little Miami". These privates provide more variety in the private company draft, and in particular mean that different sets of privates can be used in different 5-player 1846 games. These privates focus on the area around Cincinnati, which in some groups tends to be overlooked in the base game.

Also included are two markers for Boomtown and a reprinted private from the base game with clarified wording but no changes in play.

This expansion will be included with the GMT 2nd edition of 1846 and with the upcoming game 1833NE, and will also be made available separately following the release of the 2nd edition.
mechanics: Investment, Market, Network and Route Building, Ownership, Stock Holding, Tile Placement, Victory Points as a Resource

name: Suburbia: Collector's Edition – The Dice Towers
description:
Originally available as part of Dice Tower 2019 Kickstarter campaign as well as the Kickstarter for the Suburbia: Collector's Edition.

A tile that can be added to the Nightlife expansion.

-1 income for every school
categories: City Building, Economic, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Closed Drafting, Set Collection, Tile Placement

name: Planetary Reign
description:
Welcome to Planetary Reign, the strategic game of empire building, space exploration, planet colonization and resource management. Planetary Reign is a space civilization game based on classic video games of the same genre from the 1980's and 90's in which each player is the leader of a space-faring empire that is attempting to expand into and exploit the riches of a new-found galaxy. Planetary Reign provides a rich 4X experience without an overly complex rule-set and can be played within a couple of hours.

As a leader of THULE, VEYNA, METHIOS or CALDERA, you will assign your workers to a variety of actions - choosing which, when and how often they will be performed - with the ultimate goal being to dominate the galaxy and ensure the survival of your people. Your empire will build, upgrade and send its fleets into a galaxy to explore its unknown worlds. There, you will encounter planets with strange environments, hosts of alien species and a variety of resources as well as occasionally running into your opponents.

The main mechanics employed in Planetary Reign are worker placement, area control and a new specie assimilation mechanic. With nearly 5 years in development, Planetary Reign has been designed for players who enjoy medium to heavy games with low luck factors. There are multiple scoring paths and rounds - the winner being the empire with the most points at the end of the game.
categories: Civilization, Print & Play, Science Fiction, Space Exploration, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Action Points, Area Majority / Influence, Modular Board, Worker Placement

name: iCartonauti
description:
Can a literary game help your writing?

iCartonauti is a collaborative literary game. T​he players will be storytellers tasked with writing a story from beginning to end. They will have to work together to finish the story before writer's block reaches them.

The game consists of 84 different illustrated ‘inspiration cards’. [The art was made by the students of the ‘International School of Illustration’ of Sarmede (Treviso, Italy)]. It also includes 24 ‘obligation cards’ and a table board with an ‘inspirations path’ on it. During the game, all players will contribute to create a story that will be both personal and collective at the same time: it will talk about each one with the contribution of everyone.

It’s a simple game in its mechanics - with a short learning time thus allowing to start playing right away - but complex enough to keep the attention and involvement - even emotional - of the players.

The game consists of five phases plus the ending. Each phase corresponds to a narrative stage: beginning, purpose, hindrance, overcoming, achievement and ending.

Each phase consists of several turns whose number depends on the initial choice, made by the players, between short story, novella and novel.
​Each ‘inspiration card’ shows four elements: a rule, an illustration, ‘words in freedom’ and either ‘hidden truths’ or ‘suggestions’.

These elements will encourage the players to find inspiration in their imagination or in their everyday life, to enrich the story with episodes and anecdotes, thus making the narrative structure more fascinating to all participants.

The writer's block flips one card: at the end of each turn starting from Phase 2 "Purpose"; when players make a mistake; if stated by the drawn obligation card; if players choose to discard an obligation card on the board.

If the writer's block flips all the cards played until that moment, the game is over, the players have lost.

If, instead, the players reach the final slot "Ending" without the writer's block reaching them, they won collectively.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Paper-and-Pencil, Storytelling

name: Dungeon Drop: Flame Demon
description:
Flame Demon levels up! This limited mini-expansion includes a special class cards and an amazing metal Flame Demon cube that replaces the standard wooden cube included in Dungeon Drop: Dropped Too Deep!

Additionally, this pack includes a metal Draglin Flagon and a special Flame Demon feat card to be used in Tavern Tales!
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Summit: The Board Game – Sanity
description:
The final expansion in the Summit Series, Sanity brings another dimension of play and immersion as players attempt to refine their character's focus while maintaining their sanity - all while trying to survive the world's deadliest mountain.

Can they keep their wits, or will they breakdown under the immense pressure of the expedition... or the competition?
With a Yeti on their heels, and/or a rival Team pushing for the Summit it's just a matter of time before someone cracks like the ice under their feet...

Mind over matter? Prove it.

Sanity works in all play modes (competitive, cooperative and solo) and can be played with any/all expansions (Yeti and/or Teams).

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Events, Network and Route Building, Push Your Luck, Race, Solo / Solitaire Game, Take That, Tile Placement, Variable Player Powers

name: Stonewall at Cedar Mountain
description: Excellent, simple, brigade-level wargame of a battle between Stonewall Jackson and Nathaniel Banks. A desktop publishing title, now unavailable (sadly). Features an excellent orders system, something missing from most Civil War simulations.
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Simulation

name: Tamega
description:
TAMEGA (Tactical Memory Game) is played using 44 wooden tokens (22 pairs with matching illustrations) and 1 special 'bridge' token which is placed in the center of the board. The other pieces are randomly placed face-down on the remaining spaces. Each player gets a pawn and places it on top of a face-down token.

A turn consists of moving towards a face-down token and turning the token in the space you just left face-up. You cannot move towards face-up tokens or empty spaces. You can move over the bridge token.

If the revealed illustration does not match another one on the board, play passes towards the next player.
If the illustration on the token you just turned face-up matches another face-up illustration on the board you remove both pieces and turn the other face-up tokens face down. You may then place the bridge token to a free location of your choice and turn another token of your choice face up and resume play.

The game ends when no player can make a legal move. The winner is the player who has the most matching pairs.

The game is for sale in Belgium, all proceedings go towards a go cause.
mechanics: Memory, Set Collection
publishers: Les Petits Riens asbl, Spullenhulp VZW

name: How To Play War Games in Miniature: A Forgotten Wargaming Pioneer Early Wargames Vol 3
description:
From the dust jacket:

"Fighting battles on table tops, with miniature soldiers and model terrain features, is one of the oldest and most exciting of indoor sports. A good war game combines all the strategy of chess, all the fun of model railroading, and all the excitement and challenge of a game of baseball. Thanks to innovations in the manufacture of military miniatures, large numbers of excellent figures can now be obtained at very low cost. The result, in recent years, has been a dramatic upsurge in the popularity of war gaming.

Joseph Morschauser's How to Play War Games in Miniature explains every step in setting up and playing a table top war: how to obtain soldiers and their equipment; how to construct model terrain; how to deploy and maneuver troops; and how to fight battles which accurately reproduce the tactical conditions appropriate to any historic period from remote antiquity to the present.

Mr. Morschauser is an award-winning editor of one of America's greatest weekly magazines and a long-time war gamer. His book will introduce an exciting new pastime to thousands of older boys - and, indeed, their fathers."
categories: American Civil War, American Revolutionary War, Ancient, Book, Medieval, Miniatures, Napoleonic, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling
publishers: The History of Wargaming Project, Walker and Company

name: Djarhun
description:
Djarhun is a world in peril. The evil wizard Gharad has stolen the Book of Avrakar and has unleashed many creatures throughout the land. In a desperate hope, the King of Elidor is seeking the help of a few brave adventurers to recover this book and return it to Elidor in the hopes that the City's mage may put an end to the evil that runs amok throughout the land. Others, of vile morality, seek to take the Book to the Gypsies in a hope of finding its secrets for their own evil purpose. You are one of these adventurers that seek the Book. Along the way, you will encounter many perils and much treasure. You will gain new friends and meet helpful strangers. When you are strong enough, you will travel to the Abyss, where you will fight Gharad in a battle that may decide the fate of Djarhun.

Djarhun is a fantasy board game that can be played by up to 6 players. As players move around the board, they will find items, and slay monsters, that will increase their power. When a player is powerful enough, they may head for the center of the board and try to claim the Book of Avrakar. Whoever brings the Book to the predetermined location, is the victor.

Expanded by:

Ruined Urthe: A Djarhun Expansion
Goblin Invasion: A Djarhun Expansion
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Role Playing, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Star Fleet Battles: Module X1R – X-Ship Reinforcements
description:
(From the back cover)

MAGIC AT WARP SPEED

From the last days of the General War, and the dark days of the wars that followed, come more than 90 new starships to secure your future and desperately seek the bases of the Andromedans determined to destroy you.

X-RAIDERS, designed for the last days of the General War and often denounced as an expensive folly, these proved decisive during the Andromedan War. Here you will find X-raiders that carry gunboats, X-raiders that carry heavy fighters, and X-raiders with the ultimate mega-fighter squadrons!

BUILD YOUR FLEET with the "missing" X-ships from previous data files: War Destroyers, New Heavy Cruisers, modular Heavy War Destroyers, heavy Scout Cruisers, and swift Frigates.

X-MAULERS for when you really need to send the very best in total target destruction.

NEW BASES: X-technology ground bases to improve your planetary defenses. X-technology sector bases since nobody can afford an X-starbase. X-technology base statins for those annoying planetary governors who have the chairman's phone number on speed dial.

SUPPORT SHIPS: Was it a waste to divert the limited number of X-ship technology to build drone bombardment ships, medium carriers, stasis ships, and penal ships? Find out for yourself!

THE LOST X-SHIPS: X-ships that were built in small numbers for unique reasons, failed experiments, special missions, or political chicenary: Federation Drone Destroyer and Strike Cruiser, Romulan BattleHawk, Kzinti Escort Frigate, Gorn Commando Cruiser, Hydran Pegasus, Luran Wildcat, WYN Auxiliary Battlecruiser, ISC Medium Cruiser, LDR Military Police, Seltorian CAX.

NEW X-WEAPONS: Particle cannon, shield cracker, and web breaker are all given X-technology!

PARTIAL X-REFITS: Complete guide to how to convert your ship to be the best it can be, when you cannot afford to build an entirely new X-ship.

CONTENTS: 216 die-cut counters, 96-page Ship Book, 64-page Starship Guide & Scenario Book.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: BattleTech: Era Report – 3052
description:
Era Report: 3052 describes the state of the Inner Sphere and the Clans at a pivotal period in BattleTech history: the early years of the Clan Invasion. Presented as a general overview of the period, rather than a focused report on a single conflict, this book includes descriptions of every major Inner Sphere and Clan faction. Notable personalities, military forces, and an overview of the technological capabilities of the Inner Sphere and Clan powers of this critical era in history are also provided, along with special advanced-level rules for campaigns set in this era, whether played using the Total Warfare core rules or those found in A Time of War: The BattleTech RPG.

From the publisher's website:
For three hundred years, the nations of the Inner Sphere waged war in the name of the fallen Star League, sending armies of MechWarriors into battle for glory and power. Yet even as BattleMechs clashed over the forgotten ruins of humanity’s Golden Age, the descendants of the long-lost Star League Defense Force gathered their might among distant stars.
Then, in 3048, amid reports of a technological renaissance in the Sphere, the leaders of Kerensky’s children decided the time for invasion had come. The Clan Invasion would transform the face of warfare and the fate of nations across the Inner Sphere, marking an all new era for all of humankind.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid

name: DarkStar
description:
Set thousands of years in the future, the board game DarkStar is based on classics such as Dune, Cosmic Encounter, and Diplomacy.

Strategically, DarkStar plays out something like Chess, although the game mechanisms are wildly different. Your key pieces are squadrons that you move around the board in stacks. The board itself being gridded into systems (where resources are located) and subsectors (empty space). Squadrons move from square-to-square on the board as in Chess. As the game proceeds, stargates twist space so that squares change their position relative to one another.

Another big difference from Chess is that conflicts are resolved using tactical core cards that will feel to you more like rock-paper-scissors. Unlike in Chess, attacking pieces won't always win. Furthermore you will get free moves and other kinds of special actions through playing Imperial edict cards.

The most destructive force in the game are antimatter missiles. You build missiles in stages on your systems and launch them during your turn. These missiles are the reason why the goal of the game — collecting three different deep-defense codes — is so important. Missile detonations destroy everything in a square and even burn up the square itself so that nothing can enter it. Owning three colors of deep-defense codes makes some of your squares immune to antimatter detonations, upsetting the balance of power and giving you a chance to win.
categories: Fighting, Negotiation, Political, Print & Play, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Variable Player Powers

name: DreadBall:  Greenmoon Smackers
description:
Ex-pirate scum turned major league heroes? The Greenmoon Smackers bring a wealth of violent tricks and brute force to the arena floor in a spectacular demonstration of brawn over brain!

The Greenmoon Smackers are an Orx and Goblin Marauder expansion team for DreadBall. This boxed set provides 3 Orx Guards and 5 Goblin 'Jacks for your DreadBall teams.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Sports
mechanics: Dice Rolling

name: Blocky Mountains: The Big Game Adventure Book
description:
The Big Game Adventure Book provides the following for Blocky Mountains:

2 Scenarios
The Panorama of Zoë
Getting to Ghorab Peak

5 Variants
Piggyback
Way up & Way down
Solitaire Route
Tournament Variant
The Route Card Game

Bonus Materials
The Obstacle — a blue disc, slightly larger in diameter than the provisions, used in certain Level 3 routes
Small Provisions — a small grey disc, used in certain Level 3 routes
The Bonus Routes — 30 new Level 3 routes (The base game routes are Level 1, and the built-in expansion are Level 2), but not as cards; they're merely shown on the pages of the book
Set-up Aid — shows how to build the more intricate Level 3 routes

Self-created Routes — a chapter to guide you in creating your own routes, which includes graphical templates you can use to make your own route diagrams
categories: Action / Dexterity, Adventure, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Modular Board

name: Quartermaster General: Air Marshal – Air Supply promo tile
description:
Sent to backers of the 2015 Kickstarter campaign for Quartermaster General: Air Marshal.

Details on this card:
You may remove an Air Force from the board at the beginning of your Supply Step to prevent an unsupplied Army or Navy from being removed this turn.

Game designer notes:

(First FAQ - No, the Air Force does not have to be supplied.) I'd expect to see this rule used about once per game, Can allow for some strategies that have hitherto been a bit to dependent on supply. Can vastly decrease the impact of supply in certain situations.

(Second FAQ - an Air Force can only save one piece; it doesn't put a piece back in supply, to supply other pieces.) Of course the rule is optional, as are all the "tiled" rules.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Hand Management, Team-Based Game

name: Krosmaster: Arena – Yugo Unleashed
description:
A promo character for Krosmaster games.

This version of Yugo is still a member of the Brotherhood of the Tofu, and has the ability - "Wakforce"

Attack spells gain Pierces armour if the targeted character is adjacent to YUGO
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Shadowfist: Flashpoint
description:
This was the last expansion published by Daedalus. Lots of cards for the Dragons and Architects of the Flesh, as well as the Jammers, finally making them a viable faction to use.

From the booster package: "The Architects of the Flesh are raising a sinister Arcanotower in the South American jungle - and it's up to the kung fu-kicking, gun-toting Dragons to save the day! More than 140 new cards, plus bonus info cards with background notes, Q&A, and extra goodies! The war is on - and the jungle explodes with action!"
mechanics: Hand Management

name: Slaughterville: Jack the Ripper Expansion
description: The spirit of Jack the Ripper has returned and he has come to Slaughterville! Jack has possessed one of your friends and it is your job to find him. Unless you are Jack, then it is time to relive your infamy. Jack the Ripper is an expansion to Slaughterville allowing you to introduce this Villain and Player vs Player gameplay into your town to cause havoc on the citizens whether they are awake or asleep!
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling

name: XenoShyft: Oathkeeper Promo Card
description: A promotional item that was given away at Cool Mini Or Not's 2016 CMON Expo, this card is an upgraded "Plasma Arc" Shotgun, which can cancel an enemy's reveal ability, but also has the potential to deal additional damage when the equipped troop is killed.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Open Drafting, Variable Player Powers

name: Red Flags: Fairy Tale Red Flags
description:
75 new cards to add a dose of magic to your terrible dates

New perks include: "Has animal friends to do all their chores," "Lives in a magic castle," and "Can rescue you from any danger."

New Red Flags include: "Begins every sentence with 'Once upon a time,'" "Demands you be buried alive with them to prove your love," and "Ate your grandmother."
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Party Game
mechanics: Storytelling

name: The Red Dragon Inn: Crew Brew
description:
This card is a promotional item included in The Red Dragon Inn: Battle for Greyport – Pirates!

+ 2 Alcohol Content, -1 Fortitude. Draw a card from your Character Deck, then order a Drink for any other player's Drink Me! Pile.

"Brewchuggin'" is a time-honored rite of passage among Greyport's sailors
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Humor
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Player Elimination

name: Pocket Pharma: R&D Mini Expansions
description:
The expansion comprises 52 cards split into 5 exciting modules; mix and match the modules with the base game in any way you wish!

1. Advanced Drugs (4 cards)
Four new Drug formulas to compete to create. For expert pharmacologists only!

2. Specialists (20 cards)
Each player gains a team of four expert scientists to help you boost the work of your lab and get ahead of your competitors in the race to develop new drugs.

3. Market Forces (8 cards)
New opportunities to earn additional profits by achieving dominance in certain areas.

4. Experimental Fragments (8 cards)
Eight experimental “wildcard” fragments that cost an extra action to research but could plug the gaps in your formulae, possibly putting you ahead at the critical moment!

5. Biotech Startup (12 cards)
Adds a new core action to the game, that allows all players to earn additional end-game profits by collaboratively boosting a new biotech startup. Working secretly towards you own goals while competing to gain a majority in a new race for competitive advantage.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Żywioły Lasu
description:
Our climate is changing and the elements that prevail in the forest are unstable. We experience this by dealing with the effects of violent weather phenomena such as: drought, storm or heavy rainfall. We have no direct influence on them, but we can predict the effects they cause and try to prevent them. We can counteract some of these changes, others need to be adapted to. The way we manage water and how we protect forests against fires is crucial in adapting forests to climate changes. Keeping forests in good condition is your task now.
It is your decisions and your actions that determine whether you manage the elements of fire and water.
"Żywioły Lasu" is an original board game designed to be played individually among several people. The game balances the aspect of luck and the impact of player's decisions on the course of the game. Clear and intuitive rules allow you to quickly feel the vibe of the game regardless of age or experience with board games. Protect your forest from the effects of the forces of the elements, be ready for possible disasters and make sure the forest lasts longer for the benefit of people and nature.

In each round, players simultaneously pick the card with action which they will perform on the board and then pass the cards to the next player. The action is to place their marker in one of the forest zones: red, blue or neutral respectively. At the end of the game, after an appropriate number of rounds, the players gain points for the advantages in the regions or the proper arrangement of their markers in relation to each other and the selected cards during the game. The winner is the player who collects the most points.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Set Collection, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Panakizhi
description:
Panakizhi started life as a design challenge to see if we could design 3 fun games using a common set of pieces and game board. Over time we experimented with, and discarded, a number of different ideas - streamlining game play to keep the games as simple yet challenging as possible. With game times lasting 5-10 minutes each we feel that the 3 games presented in this set enable strategy players to always have access to a quick, tight, and challenging game wherever they are thanks to the compact and light design.

The three games are:

Vancanna

With only 12 pieces on the board the simplicity of its looks belies the strategy involved in winning. Players are attempting to move 3 of their coloured pieces off the opposite side of the board, the catch being that if they can jump their opponent's piece then they must make that move - and doing so will cause the piece jumped to be flipped to their colour. It may sound counter-intuitive, but the strategic use of forcing your opponent to jump your piece, and thereby losing it, can actually be advantageous as it could trigger a series of moves that see your pieces advancing across the board.

Talluka

This game is deceptively simple yet players can quickly find themselves with a limited number of optimal moves. Pieces are slid across the board one space per turn, the catch being that they can only move if they are on the outside of a line and are adjacent to another piece in the direction they are moving so that they can push that piece as well. Align 4 of your pieces adjacent to each other and in a vertical or horizontal line and you win.

Gopurrum

Gopurrum involves moving and jumping your pieces around the board as you attempt to make a stack of pieces 4-high. Each time you jump a piece, or a stack of pieces, the top piece on that stack is flipped so that it changes sides. Only your pieces, or stacks where your colour is showing on top, can be moved on your turn - and no move can end with more than 4 pieces being on a stack. Players can shed the top piece of a stack to an adjacent empty space if the top piece is theirs, but be careful as you may also be helping your opponent.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Grid Movement
publishers: Garage Games Australia, State of Mind

name: Warfighter: WWII Z Expansion #49 – Castle Frankenstein
description:
The discovery of Dieselium in the late 1930’s, even with its’ toxic instability, has driven the development of engines capable of power to weight undreamt. Nowhere seen more striking than on the Battlefield of today, where Dieselium engines drive the metal frames surrounding armored soldiers faster and stronger than ever imagined. These Augmented Infantry are taking the war to the enemy, wherever they are to be found, even to the secret Nazi Laboratory Factory under Castle Frankenstein.

1946 and the war in Europe rages on, with a powered suit of armour encasing you, carrying an array of heavy fire power will it be enough to take on the might of the Nazi War Machine?

Warfighter WWII-Z Expansion - #49 Castle Frankenstein adds 56 cards to your Warfighter WWII Missions! This is a Soldier pack with new Hostiles, Soldiers, Locations, Missions, Objectives, Weapons, Equipment, and Skills.

—description from the publisher
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling

name: WOT 2025: Kompania w Obronie
description:
The Territorial Defence Force - TDF (Polish: Wojska Obrony Terytorialnej – WOT) is the fifth military branch of the Polish Armed Forces, following Land Forces, Air Force, Navy and Special Forces. The force is made up of professional and part-time volunteer soldiers, forming part of the country's defence and deterrence system.

Game covers several situations that WOT soldiers might face - mostly recon, slowing down enemy advance, irregular combat and asymetric warfare. Game uses platoon-company scale.
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Movement Points, Paper-and-Pencil, Ratio / Combat Results Table, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Stat Check Resolution, Turn Order: Role Order, Zone of Control

name: Corpse Cat
description:
Corpse Cat is a silly card game where the objective is to keep your cat alive while killing off the other players' cats. The player with the last cat alive wins. Game play is based off luck not skill.

On a player's turn, a D6 die roll and a chart determine the action taken. Actions can be playing a card on yourself or another and playing a card from your hand, another's hand, or the deck.

The cards have various ways a cat can die and different combination requirements. Some cards require two or three of the same card to be lethal like "Choked on a Hairball", and some cards are instant death such as "Hit by a car". Some cards are positive and heal or protect your cat.

When a player's cat is killed, the player has lost the game but continues to play, taking turns as normal to get revenge against those who harmed the player's cat.
mechanics: Dice Rolling

name: Let Me Off
description:
The trick-taking game Let Me Off was one of the finalists in the 2017 Trick Taking Party design competition in Japan, and Taiki Shinzawa, one of the judges, selected it as his personal award.

In the game, players each have 3 hands of cards. Each player has one hand to themselves that they hold, but 2 additional hands, one on each side, that is held in a card rack and shared with their neighbor.

Players may only follow suit, and if they cannot follow suit from any of their hands, they do not play a card at all. A round ends when one player has no cards left in any of their hands. Any person who has played all of the cards from each of their hands earns 1 point per trick won. All players lose 1 point per card left in each of their hands as well as losing a variable number of points based upon aces collected in tricks.

After several rounds, the player with the most points wins.
mechanics: Trick-taking

name: Imperial Settlers: Empires of the North – Common Field Promos
description:
Available as part of the 2020 Dice Tower Kickstarter Discoverers Pack.

A set of new common field promos. These give players access to harvest resources that they normally have limited access to. But there is only one harvest per field. Who will claim them first?

At the start of the game place all of the common fields in the middle. Every time you Harvest, you can harvest one of the common fields (instead of harvesting one of yours). Turn it face down afterwards, to mark it as used - it can't be used anymore this round. After each round turn all of the common fields face up.
categories: Ancient, City Building, Civilization, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration
mechanics: Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: Gü
description:
The Güs are experts on plants and they have given funny names to each full with the letter ü. They have created secret recipes, with different ingredients for each plant to heal them. These can not be mixed up! Only the appropriate combination of crystals can help with the messy sprouts and the rashes, too. The healing crystals must be collected on certain clearings in the forest. But the trees are in continuous motion, the entrances of the clearings are changing their place, which can make the Güs job easier or harder. The movement can also lead to
unexpected meetings with forest creatures.

The aim of the game is to collect the correct color combinations and help as many plants as
you can during the game. The player who collects the most recipe cards and heals the most plants
is the winner.

The game ends when there are no recipe cards left. The player who collected the most recipe
cards and healed the most plants is the winner. If there is an equal number of recipe cards then it’s
a tie, you are both equally good healers!
mechanics: Race

name: Crimibox: Dossier Undercover
description:
Solve your own murder mystery. With the help of a chat bot you investigate police files, photo's and evidence. Search the internet and use social media to unravel the secrets of your suspects.

Walk into the footsteps of undercover agents Bob and Kim. Infiltrate the crime scene where drug trafficking and arms trafficking are rampant.

Explore the police files and question your suspects. Follow leads to the web and social media in your search for the truth. But be careful not to blow up your own cover. How far will you go to get the killer?

The Undercover Crimibox contains a lifelike paper police file, evidence and a mysterious cover with exciting clues that you can explore further online.

—description from the publisher (translated)
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deduction, Narrative Choice / Paragraph

name: Transformers Deck-Building Game: Clash of the Combiners
description:
As the war between Autobots and Decepticons rages, a new force has emerged to bring the conflict to a scale of gigantic proportions. Combiners - colossal warriors created from a merging of multiple robots - have taken to the field of battle and now you can bring their titanic might under your control!

Features:

- Six new playable Combiners with GIANT-sized cards and standees!
- Over 75 new cards, including:
- 31 new Wrath/Courage cards with unique combiner robot art!
- 10 New Ruin cards to spread your devastation across the Matrix!
- 8 New Boss Cards!
- 5 new Damage Cards!
- and more!

-description from the publisher
mechanics: Deck Construction

name: The Struggle For Zorn: The Red Blight
description:
The Struggle for Zorn: The Red Blight is a 1-5 player semi-cooperative fantasy wargame. Players collectively represent the various Houses of the Kingdom of Zorn, and these Houses have joined together to defeat the existential threat of the vile Red Blight. The Red Blight is an evil entity that has just launched an invasion of peaceful Slumbering Troll Valley, the northern-most province of the kingdom. The monsters of the Red Blight are now holding the citizens of the valley hostage and have absconded with the province’s valuables, treasures, and vital resources. The Houses have been summoned by King Rufus V of Zorn to launch a Royal Crusade to free the valley and rid it of this blight. The game’s players will each control a Commander, a Magic User, and a House Army, made up of various types of military units. Each player attempts to defeat enemy units and capture Treasure Tokens, and by so doing earn Glory Points. The player scoring the most Glory Points will be awarded with the title “Hand of the Crown” and win the game. However, players must cooperate and assist each other as well. If the Red Blight achieves certain conditions, all the players lose the game, regardless of their situation or amount of Glory Points. If players can stave off The Red Blight’s attempt to exploit the valley for four full days, the monsters will lose access to the malignant power that sustains them. If this evil has been successfully thwarted, peace and freedom will be restored once again to the valley and one of the intrepid Houses will gain the ultimate royal reward. Will you become Hand of the Crown, Sire?

-description from designer
mechanics: Area Movement, Chit-Pull System, Dice Rolling, Events, Semi-Cooperative Game

name: Jaliz
description:
Try to get the best out of your arbor with planting the most valuable seeds and selling them at the right time... But the success of this business, as much as hard work, needs attention, calculation and bit of a chance... plant the best seeds, harvest them at the right time, expand your lands and make the best deals with other farmers so you can be the best farmer.

Jaliz is a card game for 3-7 farmers based on a popular game of Bohnanza. Jaliz has some twists in the rules and gameplay that make it a fast and smooth. For instance tractor and fertilizer tokens adds more layers of decision making, plus event cards that reveals a new surprise for all players each round!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection, Trading

name: Mage Wars Academy/Mage Wars: Arena Dice Tower Promo 2016
description:
A pack of 8 promo cards that can be used with either Mage Wars Academy or Mage Wars: Arena originally available as a reward in the 2016 Dice Tower Season 12 Kickstarter.

Promo Cards:


Bound Healing
Cowardice
Miss
Royal Armorer
Sanctuary
Servant of Malacoda
Silverclaw Ratel
Stench of Death
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Reindeer Races
description:
Santa has an opening for Head Reindeer, and he's organized a contest for four reindeer to show off their speed, endurance, and leadership skills as they attempt to lead their team to victory.

In Reindeer Races, you'll control a team of four reindeer, racing along five modular paths to try to get the highest-scoring tiles. You can play any number of matching cards from your hand to move your reindeer, but you should always be on the lookout for opportunities to use action spaces on the paths or even other reindeer to your advantage. Once all of the tiles have been taken from one of the paths, the player who has collected the highest total number of points wins the game.

Ever since that one foggy Christmas Eve, the guy with the red nose has gotten all of the attention, but if you play your cards right, perhaps this is the year we'll be singing about Stuart, the Silver-Nosed Reindeer!
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Print & Play, Racing
mechanics: Hand Management, Modular Board, Set Collection

name: DropMix: Series 4 Discover Packs
description:
Expand your mix and build your music collection with DropMix Discover Packs. Each pack includes 5 DropMix cards that can create a full song mix and more music mixing possibilities with the DropMix Music Gaming System (sold separately). There are 30 DropMix cards available to collect in each series featuring songs from top artists. Each pack of 5 sold separately.

Dropmix: Series 4 Discover Packs is a collection of 6 such packs. While the packaging of each pack is identical, they can be identified by the card showing through the front window of each pack.
categories: Card Game, Electronic, Expansion for Base-game, Music, Party Game, Real-time
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence

name: Soldiers of the Negus
description:
Critical Hit Scenario Pack for ASL

Contents: 4 page historical booklet, 2 rules pages (punched for a 3-ring binder), 8 scenarios, 1 counter sheet

Soldiers of the Negus features 8 scenarios depicting actions from the Italo-Ethiopian War of 1935-1936.
All the counters are 1/2", a few counters that are normally represented by 5/8" counters (like AT-Guns and snipers) appear in a small version here.

The set includes rules for the Ethiopian Army. They can try to flip (YES: flip!) over the small Italian tank-ettes.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Line of Sight, Modular Board, Simulation

name: Arrivée
description:
Unpack the whole cycling world on your table! Enter the strategies of the biggest cycling teams in a great family game Arrivée.

Compete in the stages for the jerseys of the best cyclist, World champion, best climber, best sprinter or U-25.
The game realistically simulates all point and bonus awards of the major cycling races of the world.
As you ride each stage, time is measured so that you can know what advantage or loss you have in comparison with your competitors.
Your journey to victory can become complicated due to sudden weather changes, falls or defects, but team co-operation can help you back to the pack. Refresh your team and have the best performance with the use of a dice, cards and intuitive game mechanism.

Arrivée is the best simulation of cycling race stages in the world!
mechanics: Simulation

name: Fortes fortuna iuvat: Plinius adversus Vesuvium
description:
Fortes fortuna iuvat: Plinius adversus Vesuvium (Fortune favors the brave: Pliny against the Vesuvius) is a small and simple postcard game published as a freebie by SNAFU Design, first as a gift for the attendees to the Collonera Russa 2022 wargaming convention (Vilafranca del Penedès, Catalonia) and later released for free as a PDF. It's the third of the Snafu Postcard Games.

It's a solitaire game in which the player, as Pliny the Elder, tries to rescue as many people as possible from the Vesuvius eruption of 79 AD, guiding the quadriremes of the Misenum fleet. The game uses a standard deck of cards. After shuffling them, the player reveals cards, one at a time. Black cards affect the progression of the smoke and of the pyroclastic flow, while red cards allow the player to act (move the inhabitants of the zone, move the quadriremes, move Pliny's liburna).

The name of the game comes from a line in a letter from Pliny's nephew, Pliny the Younger, to the historian Tacitus in which he retells the last moments of his uncle: "'Fortes' inquit 'fortuna iuvat: Pomponianum pete.' (Fortune favours the brave, he said, head for Pomponianus!)

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action Points, Pick-up and Deliver, Point to Point Movement, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Tobruk Expansion Pack 2: Benghazi Handicap
description:
Expansion pack for Advanced Tobruk covering the desert war in March/April 1941. Adds 12 scenarios, a sheet of counters a terrain overlay. Comes in a ziploc bag.

Expands:

Advanced Tobruk: Tank Battles in North Africa 1940-43
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Sea battles in miniature. A guide to Naval Wargaming.
description:
A comprehensive guide to Naval Wargaming with miniatures,covering ancient galley warfare, Napoleonic naval battles,the Ironclad period and the Dreadnought period. As well as providing and excellent potted summary of each period, there are simple and playable rules for each era.

"The chance to be an Admiral in command of some of the finest fleets in the history of naval warfare is not one which many me could resist. Here, at last, is a book which will not only enable you to reconstruct battles with great historical accuracy, but also to take charge of the fleets and shape the destiny of nations! The pages almost reek with the smell of powder and ring with the clmour of battle."

Contains chapters on:

-Naval wargaming in General, including building your own models and writing rules.
-Ancient galley warfare
-Napoleonic nval warfare.
-The Ironclad period.
-The Dreadnought period.
-Campaigns.
categories: Ancient, Book, Miniatures, Napoleonic, Nautical, Wargame, World War I
mechanics: Dice Rolling

name: Age of Muskets Volume II: Eagles Rising
description:
Age of Muskets Volume II: Eagles Rising
"Eagles Rising" is the second volume of our Age of Muskets Series, it covers Napoleon's Campaign in Northern Italy 1796-97. There, Napoleon made a name for himself and earned the prestige that would put in his hands the destinies of France and, eventually, of Europe.

The Campaign started with Bonaparte's offensive in the spring of 1796 that knocked the Piedmontese Kingdom out of the war and subjected it to French power. Then followed the struggle against Austrian attempts to relieve the besieged Mantua, and retake the Po River Valley that led to the Battle of Rivoli in January 1797. Finally with Napoleon's offensive in the spring of 1797 that led to Leoben (on the road to Vienna) and, eventually, to his victory over the First Coalition.

As in Volume I the game includes all the elements that characterized pre-industrial warfare. However, the player will also find some elements distinctive of this campaign, as Alpine terrain, a different map and time scale to reflect the duration of the campaign as well as certain historical details (the systematic looting by the French, the revolts against French occupation ...). Given the size of the armies involved most of the scenarios of this Volume are quite adequate for two players since there are few headquarters and their size is quite manageable.

However, the game title would be incomplete if it referred only to this first campaign of Napoleon. The box also includes the necessary counters and scenarios to play the Austro - Russian counteroffensive of 1799-1800 that ended at the famous Battle of Marengo, the first that Bonaparte fought and won as First Consul of the Republic after his return from Egypt.

Marshall Suvorov and the Russian Army, with their Austrian allies, expelled the French from all their Italian conquests. Bonaparte's counterattack in 1800 came after Suvorov and Russia retired from the conflict but, what if things had been otherwise? You may explore this exciting possibility in the Napoleon vs. Suvorov scenario.

Each game contains:
- 2 70x50 cm maps (together form a 50x140 cm map of northern Italy, Switzerland and Germany)
- 8 battlefield terrain overlays
- 2 sets of Player Aid Sheets (3 sheets per set)
- 2 HQ Display Sheets
- 2 ten sided dice
- 1 set of Army Sheets for photocopying
- 832 counters (4 counter sheets)
- 1 “Age of Muskets Series Rules" booklet
- 1 Eagles' Rising booklet including special rules, scenarios, historical notes and designer notes.
Eagle's Rising is not just a game, it's a whole gaming experience including 6 battle scenarios (Rivoli, Marengo, First Zurich, Second Zurich, Novi and Trebbia) and 11 campaign scenarios, ordered by increasing complexity, from the 2 turns of "Piedmont's Defeat" to the full campaigns of 1796-97 and 1799-1800. This includes Suvorov's campaign in Switzerland and a hypothetical campaign pitting Suvorov against Bonaparte!!!!

It will be possible to put together Volume II with the next in the series: "Vienna or Death" which deals with the campaigns of 1796-97 and 1799-1800 in southern Germany with Moreau vs Archduke Charles in action.



[En Espanol:]El juego está en inglés pero encontrarás en esta página (Apoyo al Jugador) los archivos en español necesarios para jugar –Hojas de Ayuda, Reglas y Escenarios.
mechanics: Action Points, Area Movement, Area-Impulse, Dice Rolling

name: Shield Wall: Hastings 1066
description:
Shield Wall is a low complexity wargame on the Battle of Hastings. The game uses traditional hex-and-counter mechanics to simulate the combat and emphasizes the ineffectual assault of Norman archers, the combination of Norman foot and cavalry units, and the defensive strength of the Saxon shield wall. The game also highlights the difficulty that the Saxon leaders keeping the shield wall intact. Saxon Units may involuntarily pursuit the Normans down the hill and lose their high-ground advantage after successfully causing the Norman units to route.

The game features rules for demoralizing of the armies, rallying the troops, and Saxon reinforcements. Also included are optional rules for army fatigue which increases the difficulty for both players.

The Saxon Player wins by holding the hill or eliminating the Norman king, William. The Norman player wins by taking the hill or killing the Saxon king, Harold. Either player can win by eliminating all units.

The game features about 147 counters and a 22x17 inch gameboard.
mechanics: Hexagon Grid

name: Bei bao ke zi you xing: 60 fen zhong you shi jie
description:
The title of this game roughly translates to "Backpackers' free travels - 60 minutes to travel around the world". The goal is to be the first player to reach 40 points through traveling to various famous tourist sights around the world.

The game has two game boards; one working board and one traveling board. Each player starts in his/her personal corner of the working board. The players take turns rolling two dice and moving around the board accordingly. A player landing on a personal working field gains experience. A player landing on another players working field triggers a bank payment to that payment, depending on that player's experience for that particular field. There are also travel fields on which a player collects a bus, train or flight ticket. A player moving on or over his/her personal starting space gets some money and another travel ticket (up to a maximum of five that can be held in the hand.). Additionally, s/he can decide to go traveling by moving his/her pawn to the traveling board. A player who is on the traveling board starts his/her turn by paying 500 Dollars, then rolling the dice and moving on the traveling board towards any of four tourist attractions that have been randomly marked. After doing the move determined by the dice, the player can use a ticket to influence his/her movement, as stated on the ticket (however, using the ticket costs dearly, too). If a marked tourist destination is reached, the player scores points. If at the beginning of a turn a player cannot afford further travel, s/he moves back to the working board, trying to raise more money.

When a player has reached a sum of 40 points, the game ends and that player is declared the winner.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move

name: Fish Frenzy: Events & Goals Promo Pack
description:
10 additional Event/Goal cards for Crash Games version of Fish Frenzy. Each card has a "P1" promo designation in the upper right corner.

EVENTS (6)

First Loser
Royal Fish
Not so Tasty
Loan Shark
Full Belly
Squak Beach Diet

GOALS (4)

Sneaky Seagull
Glutton
Budget Fisher
So Long and Thanks for ALL the Fish
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Tavern Masters: Games Of Chance Mini-Expansion
description:
The tavern has been drawing in more interesting characters, and with each one a new set of possibilities!

Tavern Masters: Games Of Chance Mini-Expansion adds in 20 new Tavern, Patron, and Dirty Deed cards; each utilizing a dice-rolling mechanic to add a touch of randomness to the card's ability.

A fun way to introduce some variable-powered Patrons, Goods and Staff, plus each expansion comes with a custom pair of Tavern Masters six-sided dice!
categories: Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Humor, Negotiation
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Simultaneous Action Selection, Trading

name: Dark Ages Britannia
description:
"Dark Ages Britannia" is the first game of a new wargame series about the tactical medieval warfare. In this card-driven game, players will fight 7 historical scenarios: 3 concerning the fight for the English throne in 1066 (Fulford, Stamford Bridge, Hastings) and 4 regarding the Scottish Independence War (Stirling Bridge, Falkirk, Bannockburn day 1 and 2). You can command your troops all over the battlefield, with no restrictions due to any division of the map into areas, and activate your units using cards or issuing specific tactical orders to them. Units can both attack or defend with 2 different parameters, allowing players to change their combat stance and tactical deployment.
The game system is very straightforward and does not require any combat table to be played: everything you need is on the beautifully illustrated blocks and cards.
mechanics: Action Points, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Hexagon Grid, Line of Sight, Simulation

name: Main Event Boxing
description:
Main Event Boxing is a round by round game in which fighter’s will perform uncannily close their real life abilities. In Main Event Boxing, fighters are rated for scoring ability, punching power, endurance, defense, ability to absorb punishment, ability to be knocked down or knocked out, susceptibility to cuts and swelling, and how often a fighter commits a foul.

Main Event Boxing features all of the nuances of professional boxing that you see in real life bouts. Quick KO’s, TKO’s, and close decisions, will all occur on your tabletop with real life accuracy in Main Event Boxing. As in real life boxing, ANYTHING can happen, but you won’t see the flash KO’s and huge upsets with regularity in Main Event Boxing, like you do with other boxing games.

Main Event Boxing is a sequel to FAST Boxing. However, the game has changed a great deal, and it is much more than a ratings update, which is why I gave the game a new name. If you have played FAST Boxing, the game will be somewhat familiar. However, if FAST Boxing wasn’t your cup of tea, I ask you to give this game a look, as it is truly THAT much better.

I always felt that FAST Boxing was a “complimentary game”. It was a game that bridged the gap from a quick playing game, like Ultra Quick Boxing, and a detailed game like Title Bout. Main Event Boxing has shed the “complimentary game” title now. This game stands on its own with the best of them. While the game does play rapidly, and it’s certainly not a punch-by-punch simulation, I stand firmly behind the accuracy of the game. And most importantly, I find the game play to be quite compelling and easy to pick up and play. This ultimately is the most important thing about any game!

Fighters, Fighters, Fighters…

The standard game features a vast array of today’s current boxing stars. With the standard game, you get over 190 heavyweights, 90 Cruiserweights, 78 Light Heavyweights, 94 Super Middleweights, 82 Middleweights, 108 Junior Middleweights, 112 Welterweights, 122 Junior Welterweights, 115 Lightweights, 75 Junior Lightweights, 89 Featherweights, 76 Junior Featherweights, 74 Bantamweights, 76 Junior Bantamweights, 68 Flyweights, 45 Junior Flyweights, and 128 Strawweights. That’s over 1600 active fighters. No other game company can match that! You can rest assured that my research and analysis yields very accurate fight ratings.

The match-ups are limitless!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Simulation

name: Midway: Turning the Tide in the Pacific
description:
This is a game on the Battle of Midway that took place on June 4, 1942. During the battle, the imperial Japanese Navy (IJN) lost four aircraft carriers at once, turning the tide of the war in the Pacific Theater. Yes, in the game, the player's decisions may alter history.
One player controls the US forces, while the other the IJN Kido Butai.

Solitaire rules are also included, in this case the player controls the IJN Kido Butai, with the game system controlling the US actions.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Nautical, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Secret Unit Deployment, Simulation
publishers: Bonsai Games, Kuro Neko Design Workshop

name: Clank! Legacy: Acquisitions Incorporated – Fabulous Display
description:
This card was offered as a promo item at the Renegade Game Studios booth at Gencon 2019 and Spiel 2019.

Text says:
You may discard a card to get 2 gold. If you discarded a Tome (of any kind), get 5 instead.
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Open Drafting, Point to Point Movement, Push Your Luck
publishers: Dire Wolf, Lucrum Games, Penny Arcade, Renegade Game Studios, Schwerkraft-Verlag

name: Wild West Exodus: Showdown at Retribution
description:
Wild West Exodus is a dynamic, fast-paced tabletop miniatures game pitting a cast of heroic characters against each other in a brutal world - very much a twisted reflection of our own. In the twilight years of the Nineteenth Century, mankind is perched upon a new age of discovery and enlightenment.

However, humanity’s greed and ambition have created a Dystopian Age where nations clash and the threat of war forever lingers. We must remember that all is not lost. In Wild West Exodus the bravery and actions of individuals on the frontier can still forge legends and change the world.

Showdown at Retribution is a two-player starter set designed to give you a comprehensive introduction to the savage Wild West in the Dystopian Age. Containing dozens of fantastically detailed Warcradle miniatures, the full third edition rulebook, quick start guide to help you get going straight away and much more - this hefty boxed set is an easy way to explore the game and start your hobby adventure.

—description from the publisher
categories: American West, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Quaking Aspens
description:
Quaking aspen is a species of trees that often propagates through its roots to form large, clonal colonies that all share a single root system. In this game, you will play as an aspen tree, spreading its roots to grow clones in order to become the best grove of Quaking Aspens.

The active player rolls all three dice and then claims one of those dice. The player to their left will then claim one of the remaining two dice. All other players (if any) will use the final die.
Each player will then use their die value to connect a leaf to another, already circled leaf (or the start leaf). They will do this by finding a solid path containing their die value leading from a circled leaf to another leaf, drawing a line over the path, and circling the new leaf.
Each time a player circles a leaf, they gain the benefit of that leaf, which will either be a bonus or a scoring opportunity. These benefits will be tracked on your tracking mat.
The game will be played in rounds, with all players taking simultaneous turns, until a single player has reached any 4 of the goal leaves. All players will finish the current round and then proceed to scoring.
mechanics: Dice Rolling

name: Creatures and Caverns
description:
On the outskirts of the village of Handerley there lies the entrance to a large network of caverns running deep below the ground. And within these caverns can be found untold treasure - riches jealously guarded by all manner of fearsome creatures. Many a brave, or foolish, soul has ventured into the darkness to seek their fortune. But very few have returned to tell their tale.

Creatures and Caverns is a solo game consisting of just 18 cards and is played completely in-hand.

The aim of the game is to journey through 3 levels of pathways and caverns, overcoming creatures and other obstacles to gain treasure and useful items... and to make it out alive!

The game was developed as an entry in the 2022 In-Hand Game Design Contest.

-description from designer
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Exploration, Fantasy, Medieval, Print & Play
mechanics: Hand Management, Move Through Deck, Push Your Luck, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Roll on the Range
description:
Working on a ranch can be an exciting adventure, full of challenges, triumphs, and unforgettable experiences. Whether you're rounding up animals into their corrals, or taking them to the state fair, there's never a dull moment when you're living and working in the heart of the countryside.

Imagine the thrill of loading up your prize-winning cows, pigs, chickens, and sheep onto a trailer, driving them to the fairgrounds, and watching as they compete against the best animals in the state. It's a chance to show off your hard work, your skill, and your dedication to raising the finest animals around.

Of course, running a ranch is a big job, and sometimes you need a little help. That's where hiring farm hands comes in. Whether it's a few extra hands during the busy season or a full-time specialist to help manage the day-to-day operations, having a team of skilled workers can make all the difference.

Roll on the Range simulates all of that adventure into a single page PNP roll and draw experience. Designed and illustrated by Danny Devine, this new print at home game will be a favorite among ranchers of all ages.

Roll the dice. Allocate the dice by number order on the various actions selection cards. Players will take turns drafting and taking actions on their score sheets, unlocking new skills and bonuses along the way. From herding together animals into fenced configurations, to winning prizes at the state fair, you'll have plenty to explore in Roll on the Range.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Ange Unite
description:
《門》によって繋がった5つの世界。
世界の異変とともに現れた、異能《エクシード》を持つ少女たち――プログレス。

これは、プログレスたちの日常と戦いを描いた物語。
あなたはプログレスの力を引き出す存在である《αドライバー》となり、彼女たちを勝利に導くのです。

『アンジュ・ユナイト』は1対1で遊ぶ2人対戦型のカードゲームです。
2013年〜2017年にトレーディングカードゲームとして展開していた『アンジュ・ヴィエルジュ』に続く
『アンジュ』シリーズの新作カードゲームとしてお届けします。

商品形態は全種類のカードがひとつの商品で揃う「固定セット型カードゲーム」となり、
より集めやすく、始めやすい形に進化いたしました。

5つの世界のプログレスを描いた美麗なカードイラスト、
そしてドラマチックなゲーム展開を演出する「リンク」システム――
白熱の「ブルーミングバトル」を、ぜひお楽しみください。

Translate：
Five worlds connected by the "Gate".

Girls with the incompetent "Exceed" that appeared with the abnormality of the world - Progress.

This is a story that depicts the daily life and battle of Progress.

You will become an "α driver" who brings out the power of progress and lead them to victory.

"Ange Unite" is a two-player card game played one-on-one.

Following "Ange Vierge" which was developed as a trading card game from 2013 to 2017

We will deliver it as a new card game in the "Ange" series.

The product form is a "fixed set card game" where all types of cards are available in one product,

It has evolved into a form that is easier to collect and easier to start.

A beautiful card illustration depicting the progress of 5 worlds,

And a "link" system that directs dramatic game development -

Please enjoy the heated "Blooming Battle".
mechanics: Deck Construction, Hand Management, Take That

name: Wroth
description:
Wroth is a 1-4 player area control board game that can be played competitively, cooperatively, or solo.

Players choose a faction and vie for control of the island of Wroth by drafting action dice to gain resources, deploying and moving troops, and attacking the opposition - all while trying to hold key positions and dominate the region. Wroth rewards cunning troop management and the clever use of your faction’s elite troops and powerful once-per-game abilities.

Wroth can be taught in 10-15 minutes, and is playable in roughly an hour. Wroth is Chip Theory’s way of bringing their penchant for deep strategy, asymmetry, multiple play modes and beautiful production into a concise and approachable package, all at an affordable entry point. Wroth is the perfect game to pull out at game night, even if you’ve never tried it before!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Drafting, Area Majority / Influence, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Die Icon Resolution, Moving Multiple Units, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Open Drafting, Variable Player Powers

name: Atlas Lost: Rise of the New Sovereigns – Ability Expansion: In-Depth Research Team
description: Ability Expansion: In-Depth Research Team includes two types of special tokens that enhance your existing advance team tokens. Special abilities are added to the advance teams sent by the factions. Develop deeper strategies using abilities that vary among the players
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Botany: Regal Roses
description:
A mini-expansion available from the original KS.

1 Character card: Miss Elizabeth Price

7 Specimen cards:

Rose of Philippe Noiselle (2 pts)
Red Cabbage Rose (3 pts)
Cabbage Rose (4 pts)
Rosa Persica (3 pts)
Austrian Copoer Rose (2 pts)
Cuspidate Rose (3 pts)
Roses (England) (1 pt)


1 Title/ Rules card
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Krosmaster: Arena – Wakfu OVA Pack
description:
A window box containing 6 new playable figures and cards, using characters from the Wakfu series’ second OVA.

Includes:

1. A new version of Yugo
2. A new version of Percimol
3. A new version of Remington Smisse
4. Ush
5. Atcham
6. Maskemane
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling

name: Panzer Grenadier: Panzer Lion – Grossdeutschland in Action, 1944
description:
From the front page:
"In a series of actions along the frontier between Romania and Ukraine, Lt. Gen. Hasso von Manteuffel’s Panzer Division Grossdeutschland and supporting units effectively destroyed four Soviet tank corps and their supporting infantry. Five years after the war Manteuffel, known as the Panzer Lion, would help the Allies analyze these battles.

Panzer Lion is a supplement for the Panzer Grenadier series of games, with 10 scenarios based on these battles. Panzer Lion includes just this booklet; you’ll also need to use boards and pieces from our Eastern Front, road to Berlin, Battle oF the Bulge and Elsenborn Ridge games and our Red Warriors supplement. We hope you enjoy them."

Available as either a PDF download, or a pre-printed booklet, direct from the Avalanche Press website.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid

name: Bastogne: Command Decision Campaign Module
description: Bastogne is a Command Decision Module for the Battle of the Bulge. Covering the battle from an operational point of view, the 48 page book has many photos and rule changes to the Command Decision II rulesset. This module can be used for any comparable ruleset of operational level combat. Included are complete OOB, Maps and 16 scenarios to recreate on the tabletop.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Variable Phase Order

name: Age of Steam Expansion: Special 2008 Spiel Limited Edition – Essen Spiel & Secret Blueprints of Steam Plan #3
description:
It's the most glorious time of the year: October in Germany, where the annual Essen Spiel takes place. It's your job to set up a network of deliveries from booth to booth, to help ensure that all vendors have the games they need to sell to the masses. Of course, each day different vendors want different games, which makes your job even harder...This map features an extra layer of strategy involving city placement that makes your brain think a little differently than in traditional Age of Steam maps.
This limited edition (300 copies) full color, professionally-designed Age of Steam expansion contains five maps containing unique twists on Age of Steam, including a never-before seen modular expansion that allows a consistent playing experience from 3-6 players. These maps are compatible with both Age of Steam and Steam.

Secret Blueprints of Steam Plan #3 is another set of four different maps for the Secret Blueprints series (plans 1 & 2 are sold separately). This set of maps can be played together, or maps from this set can be interchanged with the maps from Plan #1.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Commodity Speculation, Network and Route Building, Pick-up and Deliver, Tile Placement

name: A game about quickly grabbing creatures that are totally different, and watching out for turnips.
description:
A speed/dexterity game that is about finding creatures that do NOT match.

Starting with all the cards face-down, players quickly flip over a card, which they may put into one hand as the first card in their stack. (You may flip another card if you wish.)

Everyone rushes to flip cards and find totally different creature - each card in your stack must be TOTALLY DIFFERENT to the one before - a different number of eyes, mouths, arms/wings/tentacles, and legs.

You may grab turnips - totally different to any creature! But if you have more than 5, you lose.

The game ends when everyone has grabbed as many cards as they can.

Pass your cards left to be checked. If you had 2 cards in a row that are similar, or more than 5 turnips, you lose.

Otherwise, the person with the most cards wins.


Grabbell reimplementation suggested by David Brain.

Turnip idea heavily inspired by Andrew Beardsley.

—description from the designer
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Children's Game, Memory, Party Game, Real-time
mechanics: Matching, Memory

name: Dice Hospital: Kickstarter Pack
description:
Includes:

5 wooden pill bottles (for use with the maternity expansion and alternatives for the punchboard ones from the base game)
1 helicopter mini
1 parking garage (base game upgrade)
1 screen printed birthing die
new round tracker (base game upgrade)
4 wooden syringes (base game upgrade)
5th player expansion

The 5th Player expansion adds everything you'll need to play the base game and the other expansions with a 5th player including:

A new player hospital
Extra nurse meeples
Extra score tracker
Extra Dice

The Helicopter from the Community Care expansion acts as ambulance '0' - the 6th ambulance for a 5 player game.

These will not be included in the retail version of the game but will be available to non backers at conventions and directly from the publisher's store at a much higher price.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Phase Order, Worker Placement

name: Skull Tales: Full Sail! – Kickstarter Extras
description:
Comes packaged in its own cardboard box but with no text or picture on the box.

Includes the following bonus items from the Kickstarter campaign:

Noble Rebel stat card
"Ember" card and mini
Anne "The Dutchess" card and mini
2x Giant Scorpion cards
Guardian of the Temple small card
Buried Scorpion small card
Cloth bag with pirate symbol
Metal pirate coin
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Miniatures, Nautical, Novel-based, Territory Building
mechanics: Action Points, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Role Playing

name: Planet Apocalypse: Lord Asmod
description:
"Asmod, a new Demon Lord who takes over and controls individual heroes."

This expansion contains a new Lord figure to switch up your game.

Contains:

1 Lord figure (Lord Asmod)
1 Lord Sheet
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Role Playing

name: Expos: Arts, Business, & Collections
description:
An Art Game that you don't need to know anything about Art to play and enjoy. If you can tell a nude from a vase of flowers you are in with a good chance!

Expos, is, as far as I know, only available from the Musee du Louvre, the Musee des Beaux-Arts de Marseille and the Musee d'Orsay in France. My copy was obtained by contacting the Louvre by mail. It was a gift, so I am uncertain of price.

The game is in French, English rules can be provided.

There are 126 cards in full color, showing a detail of a famous painting (eg Gauguin's The White Horse or Van Gogh's Sunflowers) and classifying it by one of the 21 painters and one of the 12 themes.

Everything is on good quality card stock.

Also provided are 34 Event Cards which are drawn after each player's turn and detail things like Fire or Critical Success or compulsory or optional auction of a painting.

There are 6 'cheat sheets' or Expos Catalogs, giving the names of the painters and the categories. In French, but they're easy enough to work out for the most part, (eg: Nu, Portrait Masculin, Marine, Hist. Relig ou Allegories,etc) and translations are given in the rules. The painting cards are helpfully colour coded which assists)

Also 6 screens help people hide their Euros, and provide a place to hang exhibition posters (there are 2 of these for each painter [so only 2 players can exhibit Monet for example] and 3 per theme [so only 3 players can exhibit Marine scenes]

140 money and loan chips in Euros are provided to buy and sell the paintings with, and to go into debt to the bank with should things get hot...

The rules are provided in French, I am not certain if the English rules are provided without request.

The plastic insert of the box provides the revolving centre of the game. 10 painting cards are separated and the rest are divided more or less evenly into four and placed in each the four easels of the carousel. The information on the card is covered by the one of the numbered cardboard easels' insert so that the painting can be seen, but not who it's by or whether it is classified as a Nude, Historical, Marine, or whatever. 1,2,3,4.

The event cards are placed face down on one side of the middle of the carousel, the spare paintings on the other.

Players are given a screen, 100.000 Euro and a cheat sheet, and a starting hand of 4 paintings.

Play proceeds by a player choosing to a) buy a painting by spending 20,000 Euro and taking a painting from any of the easels or the top of the face down spare painting pile

OR

b) exhibit one or more collections (receiving 20,000 Euro)

You need two or more paintings by the same artist to make an exhibit, or three with the same theme. You take these from your hand and put them on the table face up, and hang the appropriate poster on your screen.

OR

do nothing. A player may also in each case choose to supplement an existing exhibition in which case they will get 5,000 Euro per exhibit, regardless of how many paintings are added.

They then must take an event card, react to it as required: There may be a sudden auction, or the current exposed paintings may be destroyed or they may keep the card if it is one to be used later and then their turn is over.

The game ends when a player exhibits their 4th collection. The winner is the person with the most money at the end. The exhibitions worths are calculated using the chart on the cheat sheet.

Exhibits by artist gains the most points, but it is easier to collect by theme.

Unexhibited paintings: ie those still concealed in players' hands have a penalty of -5000 Euro each at the end of the game. Any debts are paid off if they can be.

Fast, attractive, as challenging as you want it to be.

It appears to have won some awards:
1997 Double D' Argent (Double Silver) Besancon Festival Internationa des nouveaux jeux
1998 De D'OR (Gold) Concours International de Boulogne Billancourt
1999 Prime au Salon International du Jouet de Paris Concours Lepine A.I.F.F, which I think may be a bronze.

The only other information which may be of use on the box and insert I can find about it is:

Fabrique aux Pays-Bas
Information: EXPOS Art, Business & Collections
O. Dlevaille, J-F Desbordes
112, rue Championnet - 75018 Paris - France

Expos A B & C (c) 1999 - Photos RMN - Monet (c) ADAGP 1999
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Memory, Set Collection

name: King of Crime: Bootleg Edition
description:
