name: Shadows over Normandie: Cthulhu Mythos Call #3
description:
A set of four fan-made 'Print & Play' punchboards that expand Shadows over Normandie and introduce the FFI army into the Cthulhu world. Made by the Devil Pig Games French forum moderator, Guillaume Duprez. Approved by Devil Pig Games' Yann and Clem as an 'official product'.



Two punchboards for the FFI army:• Recruitment tile for Julie Aubrac.
• Recruitment tile for Michel and his 'Cellule de Guesclin'.
• PIAT squad
• Side-car motorcycle squad
• Mortar squad
• 'Traction à Gaz' car with the scout ability
• Citroën T23 Transport Trucks (without weapons)
• Recruitment options: 'Bicycles', 'Knife', 'Tricky' and 'Concealed' to improve your FFI troops.



One punchboard with the evil version of Heinrich Von Kamptz:• Heinrich Von Kamptz recruitment tile as a Black Sun hero
• FFI Civilians and FFI Civilians at Arms support options
• Bloodborn units and spell
• Claus Feuerhart, Black Sun Feldwebel hero
• A few new recruitment options: Arcane Fire, ...



One punchboard with N°666, Black Sun Executioner• N°DCLXVI, Black Sun Executioner recruitment tile and unit
• Black Sun Flammwerwerfer Group.
• Claws recruitment option
• Pyramid of Leng tokens
• Recruitment options to introduce the FFI army into the world of Shadows over Normandie, with the Mythos Fighter, Insiders, Watchers and Insiders abilities
______________________________

Quoting GDuprez, January 2018:
"As you know, during the past months the Pigs have been extremely busy (that’s putting it mildly): finalisation of the card game KS as well as that of Age of Towers, add to that of course, the creation of Black Reach.

Meanwhile, since HoN and SoN were lying somewhat dormant, I tried to create units, tiles, markers and other options. Thanks to Clem and Yann who generously gave precious advice and granted access to the rich graphic library of Devil Pig, I have been equiped with both intel and means to embark on this adventure which is in all quite new to me.

But where to begin? Clearly, the problem was not finding an idea but choosing the right one from my vast amount of ideas… The arrival of the FFI dice and order tokens tilted the balance. Reading up on the subject along with finding several internet images pertaining to the French Resistance provided inspiration. My vision on how this page of our history is intertwined with the secret war in the universe of Achtung Cthulhu prompted me to create a new FFI unit and different options.

For a long time I wanted to expand this faction so as to turn it into a complete and in certain cases independent army. Initially made to represent only the French Resistance, an FFI army can be used to depict any group of civilians that has taken up arms, regardless of their nationality in the scenario or whether they are deployed in the HoN or SoN universe. I spent many hours in front of my screen, with trials and errors, corrections, new attempts… So finally today, I have the pleasure of presenting to you, my first punchboard. It is approved by Yann and Clem and validated as an official DPG product."

Armed with a blistering array of long-range weaponry, fire lance MechWarriors are expert marksmen that bring over-matched firepower to any conflict. Whether with PPCs, lasers or missiles, they bring the pain to smash any assault...

name: マギアルマ (Magiarma)
description:
User summary
マギアルマ (Magiarma) is a Japanese speed, dice rolling, dexterity game. Players must construct their chosen weapons by stacking small cubes in the form shown on the weapon card. Once this is completed, the weapon is activated for the fight.

Gameplay summary -
This real time dexterity game tasks players with protecting the kingdom of Charme from Apocalys.

Each player chooses one of the 5 witches and then takes the corresponding character card and die. Mana cubes in five colors are placed within easy reach of all players. The game then proceeds through three rounds consisting of: Preparation, battle, and totaling points.

Preparation consists of laying out the enemy character for the round along with their damage cubes and each player taking a weapon card in their color. Four stacks of weapon cards are then placed on table. After one player shouts ""magiarma"", play moves onto the battle phase. Players then race to grab weapon cards, build them using the mana cubes, and then roll their die to inflict damage on the current enemy. The battle comes to a close when all the enemy damage cubes have been collected by the players. Points are then awarded to the players based on the number of damage cubes they collected.

The player who has amassed the most points is then named the winner.

Publisher's summary
マナクリスタルにより人々が生活を営んでいる魔法使いの国、シャルム王国。この国に突如として世界を終末へと向かわせる敵、「アポカリス」が現れた。このシャルム王国を救うために若き５人の魔法使い達が立ち上がる。

プレイヤーは魔法使いの1人となり、対アポカリス必殺用の武器を魔法で生成し、「アポカリス」にダメージを与えろ！「アポカリス」にトドメの一撃を刺せば多くの勝利点が与えられる。一番勝利点を稼ぎ、この国の英雄となったプレイヤーがこのゲームの勝者だ！！
mechanics: Dice Rolling

name: Big Picture
description:
Movies have the power to excite and inspire, to elicit gasps and tears from audiences, to linger in memory for a lifetime. There is no question movies have moved multitudes. But for you, a powerful Hollywood executive, movies are just an elevator pitch and a high-stakes gamble. Let those directors and critics sweat the details when it comes to a film’s “artistic merit.” All you care about is… the BIG PICTURE!

Big Picture is a card game for 2-4 creative players about funding and releasing big budget movies in the hopes of securing a financial hit. From your lofty perspective, movies only amount to a few ideas thrown together and backed up with several million bucks so they can lure different demographics into the theaters. The real trick is in timing your movie’s release so it can go down in history as a box office smash rather than a humiliating flop.

Big Picture is a “Make-as-You-Play” game, which means that this game starts with a few materials: index cards, a print-out to track market trends, and a few coins. Players will modify cards during the game as they create the movies that will cement their place in the annals of Hollywood.

As movies are added to the deck, each future game will draw on the imagination of past games. The deck can grow indefinitely, preserving a legacy of movies and ideas. Players can return to the saga of their Hollywood executive careers over and over for gambles on brand new motion picture releases.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Economic, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Print & Play
mechanics: Legacy Game, Paper-and-Pencil

name: Return to Ravingspire
description:
In the far future, an accident aboard the orbital research vessel Chronomega-1 causes the station to slice backward through the fabric of space-time, leaving loose threads in its wake. As the maelstrom fades and the threads pull together, knots are formed...

The haunted Tower of Ravingspire sits upon a prime nexus of this entropy, and its immortal lord has haunted the peoples of the Vorpal Realm for generations. The Dark Lord of the Tower was defeated long ago, but time doesn’t work like it should in the Tower, and those who should have succumbed to mortality… have come back.

Return to Ravingspire is a cooperative questing game for 1-4 players. Take on the roles of Heroes climbing the ever-shifting Tower to the Spire and face its Dark Master. But beware! For the Tower lies upon a nexus of space-time, and its portals may as easily lead to other dimensions as they will up the Tower.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Role Playing

name: Legends of Andor: The Dragon Song
description:
Das Drachenlied (The Dragon Song) is a semi-official bonus card for The Legends of Andor Legend 5. This card was released in German by the game developer on the Tavern of Andor game forums.


Hallo zusammen

Der Schwierigkeitsgrad in „Die Legenden von Andor“ steigt mit jeder Legende stetig an. Darum sollte Legende 5 auch bewusst eine echte Herausforderung sein. Für alle Spieler denen die Version im Grundspiel ein bisschen zu schwer ist, habe ich hier eine Variante aufgeschrieben, mit der ihr den Schwierigkeitsgrad ein bisschen senken könnt.

Viel Vergnügen
Michael Menzel

Spielvariante für Legende 5: „Das Drachenlied“
Legt eines der 6 Pergamente verdeckt auf den Baum der Lieder (Feld 57). Ein Held der auf Feld 57 steht, kann das Pergament aktivieren. Wenn er den Wert des Pergaments an Willenspunkten besitzt, kann er damit den Erzähler 1 Feld auf der Legendenleiste zurücksetzen. Das Pergament kommt dann aus dem Spiel. Er muss die Willenspunkte nicht abgeben, er muss diesen Wert nur besitzen. Sollte er den Wert nicht haben, bleibt das Pergament offen liegen. Er oder ein anderer Held kann später zum Baum der Lieder zurückkehren. Wenn dieser Held dann den geforderten Wert hat, kann der Erzähler 1 Feld zurückgesetzt werden und das Pergament kommt aus dem Spiel.
Wichtig: Wenn der Erzähler zurückgesetzt wird, werden Legendenkarten oder Kreaturenplättchen nicht erneut aktiviert.

Wer es noch ein bisschen leichter haben möchte legt zusätzlich ein zweites Pergament verdeckt auf die Taverne (Feld 72). Dieses Pergament funktioniert auf die gleiche Weise.


Hello everyone

The level of difficulty in "The Legends of Andor" increases steadily with each legend. That's why Legend 5 should be a real challenge. For all players who are a bit overwhelmed in the basic game version, I have written down a variant that will allow you to lower the difficulty a bit.

Have Fun
Michael Menzel

Legend 5 Game Variant: "The Dragon Song"
Place one of the 6 parchments face down on the Tree of Songs (space 57). A hero standing on space 57 can activate the parchment. If he has at least the value of the parchment of willpower points, he can use it to move the Narrator back 1 space on the legend track. The parchment is then removed from the game. He does not have to give up the willpower, he just has to have that value. If he does not have the value, the parchment remains on space 57. He or another hero may later return to the Tree of Songs. If this hero then has the required value, the Narrator can move back 1 space and the parchment is removed from the game.
Important: If the narrator is reset, Legend Cards or creature tokens will not be reactivated.

If you want to have it a bit easier, put a second parchment on the tavern (space 72). This parchment works in the same way.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Puzzle
mechanics: Action Points, Area Movement, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Cooperative Game, Role Playing, Variable Player Powers

name: Revelación
description:
Revelación is an exploratory and memory eurogame along with tactical and strategic overtones. Players assume the role of one of ten intrepid explorers, each with their unique abilities, to venture into the immemorial forest and discover its ancient secrets. They will have to face each other (a lot), to cover themselves with glory once they find the three relics.
Players move freely around the board, trying to discover and memorize scattered objects throughout the forest.


[Spanish]

Revelación es un eurogame de exploración y memoria, con tintes táctico-estratégicos. Los jugadores asumirán el rol de uno de diez intrépidos exploradores, cada cual con sus habilidades únicas, para aventurarse en el tupido bosque inmemorial y descubrir sus antiguos secretos. Habrán de enfrentarse entre sí, sin cuartel, para quedarse con la gloria al encontrar tres de las reliquias pérdidas.

Los jugadores se mueven libremente por el tablero, intentando descubrir y memorizar los objetos dispersos en todo el bosque.
categories: Deduction, Dice, Electronic, Exploration, Fantasy, Medieval, Memory, Racing, Travel
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Memory, Point to Point Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: 姫と魔法のタイル〜彼女は意外と重かった〜 (The Princess and Magic tile)
description:
姫と魔法のタイル〜彼女は意外と重かった〜 (Hime to mahō no tairu 〜 kanojo wa igaito omokatta 〜) (The Princess and Magic tile) is a Japanese tile placement game. A witch has kidnapped a princess and locked her in a pavillion, bound by magic. The players must complete magic spells to get into the pavillion and rescue her. The full title is "The Princess and Magic Tiles - She Turns Out to Be Amazingly Heavy -". In the game, as you carry the Princess away to safety, she grows heavier and heavier, cursed by the witch.

During the game, players place tiles in front of themselves to build a tableau. Players are trying to build certain patterns to match spell cards, open to any player. A pattern works either by have the same symbols on the tile match up, or by having the same background on the tiles match. So a diagonal line of purple stars might fit one spell card, whilst the same tableau also has a crossway pattern with a gold background. Building combos like this helps the player advance quickly.

Once a player reaches the Princess, they carry her away. The player puts the princess token on top of their piece. But the Princess is cursed and weighs too much, slower the player down. In this way, the other players can catch up and carry her away.
user summary

This is a tile-laying game to rescue the princess, who turns out to be amazingly heavy. The players enter the witch's mansion to save the princess from captivity.

To advance in the mansion, you need to remove the barrier by magic spells. Make make combos of tiles to form magic and rescue the princess before the others!

姫を助けるタイル配置ゲーム。だが、彼女は意外と重かった。
プレイヤーは魔女の館に潜入し、囚われた姫を救い出すのが目的です。
ただし魔女の館は結界が張られていて、魔法で解除しなければ先に進めません。
タイルを使って魔法を作り、姫を救いだしましょう！
publisher's summary
categories: Card Game, Fantasy, Medieval, Puzzle, Racing
mechanics: Open Drafting, Pattern Building, Tile Placement

name: This Game is Nuts
description:
This Game is Nuts is a fun-filled, family friendly tabletop card game for the impatient, back-stabbing trickster in all of us. The object of the game is to be the first player successfully use all the cards in their Win Stack (usually 10 cards) to build Sequence Stacks in the center of the table.

The game is broken into rallies, where all players are able to simultaneously place cards from their hand, discard, and Win Stack in piles on the table in sequential order from one to ten. A rally ends when the play reaches a stalemate because players are either unable to continue building on stacks or they choose not to.

After a stalemate, the next player starts another rally by drawing cards for their hand until they reach 5 total cards and they play more cards. The standard deck comes with 3 nut card variations that spice up the game play.

Wild nut- Can be played in place of any numeric card.
Draw Two Nut(double nut)- Also can be played in place of any numeric card, but the player selects a victim that must immediately add two cards to their win stack from the draw deck.
Swap Deck Nut- Also can be played in place of any numeric card, but the player selects a victim with whom they immediately exchange win stacks- for better or worse.

—description from the designer
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Party Game, Print & Play
mechanics: Hand Management, Pattern Building, Take That

name: Droplets
description:
Droplets is an abstract, strategic placement, area control, chain reaction game, in which you play droplets of water onto the board. As droplets accumulate in a space, they can trigger a splash, causing all the droplets within to move outwards. These can, in turn, cause other splashes to be triggered – though not always under your control, and not always for your benefit.
Your goal is to splash your droplets onto the fountains around the board, while sending your opponents’ down the drain.

—description from the designer

AWARDS
Finalist in the 2023 Cardboard Edison Award

Third place Best Overall Game in the 2020 Two Player PnP Game Design Contest
Additionally:
- 2nd place Best Rule Book
- 4th place Best Mechanics
- 4th place Best Gamers Game
- 4th place Best Use of Theme
- 8th place Best Date Night Game
- 9th place Best Gateway Game
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Hexagon Grid, Mancala, Pattern Movement, Zone of Control

name: Reboot
description:
After a Roborg or Robotic Battlefield Operator for Recon and General purpose had raised against human and destroyed all humanity, but something important for the Roborg also disappears.
That is “Energy” enough to operate all Roborg. So all Roborg have started the new war to take control of the last man made energy source. Every Robrog has to fight it out there is only 1 left and also try to survive through all the disasters that happen. If they shut down once they will never start up again. Which Roborg will able to survive and take all the energy? maybe REBOOT is the only thing Roborg

After the battle with losing of humanity, all the Roborgs still not having the "Energy" they wish to survive.
The war of Roborgs for the last energy source begins again, but not only to fight each other, they also have to fight with natural disasters which had all the Roborgs cornered.
Maybe "Rebooting" is the only thing all Roborgs need...

Set up
1. Place Main Board on the table and distribute Roborg Board to each player and put their energy marker on the 12 slot
2. Place 4 wall on each middle spot of the SAFE ZONE(middle section) edge and place 1 wall on other borderline(yellow line) and then randomly place
all the wall and any line except inside or borderline of SAFE ZONE
a. Each wall can only connect to 1 another wall
b. You can’t make the close space
3. Randomly place 5 Retrieve Component Tokens on every section except in SAFE ZONE and on the start point of this round
4. Player who have the most robot will take the 1st player cube and be the first to choose his/her spawn point (depending on the player size) and next player in clockwise order choosing until every player have done

Item Card
1. Card Type
a. Equipment Melee Weapon/Shield can’t hold in hand you must equip it immediately if you already equipped that type of Equipment you can decide
to either discard the newly draw one or replace current equipment and put the old equipment at the bottom of the drawing deck
i. Shield can take only damage form the attack
b. Ranged Weapon when use place it at the bottom of the item deck
c. Reusable Ranged Weapon If successfully make an attack with this card return this card to your hand if fall place it at the bottom of the
item deck
d. ENERGY can use in 2 ways
i. When you fail on you attack you can discard this card to +1 of your dice result you can use as many energy as you have
ii. In your turn you can spend 1 action to play this card and increase your ENERGY equal to number on the card and then place it at the
bottom of the item deck
2. This card can make an attack through the wall
3. This indicate the dice value you need to roll to make an attack
4. This is the range for the attack


Each player never have item card in their hand more than 4 cards and they must discard until they have 4 cards before continue playing
If card used >> place it at the bottom of the item deck
If card unused >> place it at the discard pile




Action
In each round start from a player with 1st player cube, Player can spend a maximum of 3 actions the same action can be repeated after players finished their turn player the player on their left starts their turn. When every player finished their turn, The player with the 1st player cube flip all face down disaster tokens and random select 1 disaster token and place on any section except SAFE ZONE after that reveal 1 event card and resolve its effect (detail on page 7). Pass 1st player cube to the player on the left and start the next round

1. Move
a. Use 1 action to move 1 space orthogonality can’t move through the wall
2. Use energy card
b. Use 1 action to play ENERGY card from hand to increase Roborg ENERGY equal to value to on the card then put it on the bottom of the deck
3. Attack
a. Player must first declare an attack and select a target and then select a weapon card(* * these symbols) and place it face down in front of
you if you want to attack with Melee weapon you can select any card on your hand instead after you finish the target can decide to do a
counter-attack and select a card from their hand but they can also select an ENERGY card instead to increase their ENERGY after attacker
finish their attack
b. When both players ready, reveal their face-down card at the same time if you decide to do an Unarmored or Melee attack take your face down card
back to your hand without reveal it. Start from the attacker rolls a die if die value equal or exceed requirement on the card that attack
is successful defender receive damage indicate on the card and if the attack is successful the defender is being knock back 1 space and then
start a counter-attack if their attack still in range
c. When an attack failed you can use ENERGY card to +1 value of a die you can use multiple ENERGY cards at once
d. When you roll a 6 it’s a CRITICAL HIT, your attack deal x2 damage but 5 + 1 ENERGY card does not count as CRITICAL HIT
e. When Roborg Energy go below 0 they’re destroyed and don’t do a counter-attack
f. After player finishes an attack their turn ends even if they still have action left

Roborg got attacked with ** and must lose 5 ENERGY but he has armor with 4 value so and decides to put 2 damage on the armor by put Broken Armor Tokens on the armor and lose 3 ENERGY and if a number of broken armor token equal the value on card remove it from player board and place it at bottom of the deck

A1 SEXY ROBOT GIRL declare an attack on LUCKY ROBO BOY and roll a die successfully make an attack and LUCKY ROBO BOY get knock back in the same
direction of the attack 1 space
A2 LUCKY ROBO BOY didn’t has any armor so he loses 3 ENERGY and left with only 1 ENERGY

A3 LUCKY ROBO BOY use ENERGY card as a counter-attack so he gains 2 ENERGY

B1 SEXY ROBOT GIRL declare an attack on SATAN MACHINE and successfully roll

B2 SATAN MACHINE doesn’t have any card on hand so he can’t counter-attack, but he has armor so he decides to put 3 Broken Armor Tokens on
armor instead of losing his ENERGY
Type of Attack
1. Unarmored Attack
a. Range 0
b. Damage 1
c. No knock back
d. Can only use when you don’t equip a Melee weapon
e. No dice roll
2. Melee Weapon Attack
a. Range 0-1
b. Damage 2-3
c. Knock back
d. Don’t discard when used
3. Ranged Weapon Attack
a. Range 0-3
b. Damage 3-5
c. Knock back
i. If attack successful take it back to your hand
ii. Can attack through wall or other Roborg

Knock back from the attack
When Roborg get hit they will always get push 1 space but can’t push out of the main board or though the wall if after got pushed and the attacker not in range of the attack anymore, it counts as your attack missed

1. If attack from the same space(Range 0) attacker can decide where the target will get knock back to
2. If you use Weapon Attack Target will get knock back 1 space in same direction as the attack
3. There will be no knock back there a wall behind the target

Free Action
1. If you are in the same space with a Retrieve Token you can reveal it and resolve it effect
2. You can discard any number of cards you want to the discard pile and then put Lost Component Token on your space
a. You can't discard when your space already have any token on it
3. If you are in the same space with a Lost Component Token you can take it and randomly draw an item from the discard pile
a. You can’t take Lost Component Token that just adds on this turn
4. When you have no cards in hand When in the Search space you can draw 2 cards from the deck you can only use this action once per turn and if
you draw an Equipment card you must equip the newly draw one
a. You can’t discard or place a token on this space

In each section can only have 5 tokens at once and each space can only have 1 token



Disaster Token
When everyone finishes their turn playing with the 1st player cube randomly select a disaster token and place it face-down on any section except SAFE ZONE and reveal the previous face-down disaster token
When the disaster token is revealed each Roborg in that section lost ENERGY equal to the value of tokens in that section
When Roborg enter the section with revealed disaster token (either by a move in or get knock back ) will lose ENERGY equal to value on tokens in that section
When the last disaster token is revealed place the addition -1 ENERGY tokens on each section except SAFE ZONE and remove 4 walls around SAFE ZONE out of the game

Red 1
In the 8 round of the game player with the 1st player cube select last disaster token and place it face-down and reveal the previous face-down disaster token, Yellow and Purple each lost 1 ENERGY because they section have revealed token, Red and Green didn’t lose ENERGY yet

Red 2
In the 9 round of the game player with the 1st player cube reveal the last face-down disaster token and then place -1 ENERGY Token on each section except SAFE ZONE and remove the walls around SAFE ZONE then every Roborg outside SAFE ZONE lost ENERGY equal total value of Tokens

Event card

After player place disaster on the main board and resolve effect from revealed disaster tokens draw an event card from event deck and reveal it to all players and resolve it effect starting from player with 1st player cube and still have effect until the next round card is revealed. You don’t draw new if there is no disaster token placed down

1. Each player randomly stole a card from the hand of the player on their left at the same time
2. Each player randomly stole a card from the hand of the player on their right at the same time
3. Each player lost ENERGY equal to the number of cards in their hand
4. Player with the 1st player cube place an addition disaster token with the same rule
5. Take all cards from each players hand and shuffle then deal it back to player starting from a player with the 1st player cube and go clockwise
6. Every Roborg gain 2 ENERGY
7. Each player can move to any location on the main board starting from the player with the 1st player cube and go clockwise
8. Every Roborg lost 2 ENERGY
9. In this round, every player have +1 Action

Game End
• When each player Roborg have ENERGY = 0 or below that player lose and leave the game and if this Roborg die from an attack the attacker gain 2
ENERGY but if Roborg die from the Disaster after got knock back the attacker didn’t gain any ENERGY
• When Roborg die discard all cards from that player hand and all equipment card to the discard pile and place one Lost Component Token on the
spot that Roborg die if the Roborg don’t have any equipment or any card in hand don’t place the token and if this token place in the same place
as the attacker, He/She can take it immediately
• The last Roborg standing is the winner

Team Variance
After deciding who is the 1st player deal team card to each player. Players that have a card with the capital letter are the team leader and always reveal their team card to all players. Player with the lowercase letter is the team member and keep their card face down

Team card setup

4 players
5 players shuffle and randomly remove 1 member card
6 players 2 team
6 players 3 team

And in this team mode, there is special free action once per turn if there are other Roborg in the same space they can exchange or give cards from their hand to other Roborg in same space
If Roborg get destroyed by your own team leader reveal your team card to all players otherwise keep your team card hidden which team have the last Roborg standing win

Shorten Manual

Setup
1. Place the Main board and distribute Player board
2. Place Walls
3. Place Retrieve Component Token
4. Choose 1st player / Spawn point
5. If desired.Deal team cards to each player

Turn Sequence
1. Start from 1st player use his action and go clockwise
2. Place Disaster Token face-down in 1 section except SAFE ZONE
3. Reveal the previous Disaster token(s)
4. Draw an Event card
5. Pass the 1st player cube to the left
6. Resolve event card effect
7. Go back to the 1st step

After every section have revealed disaster token add -1 ENERGY token to each section and remove walls from SAFE ZONE

The last Roborg Standing Win
mechanics: Unspecified

name: The Fantasy Trip: Death Test and Death Test 2
description:
The mighty Thorsz is hiring guards. But the test is a killer. You have to make it through his labyrinth full of traps, monsters, and other would-be guards!

These adventures can be played by a single player or a group of up to four. You can even play with a GM, but you don’t need one . . . these are “programmed adventures” that take you through the labyrinth. Your choices – and whether you conquer or flee – determine what paragraph you go to next. Until you succeed, gaining rewards and honor . . . or lose.

Losers die.

Death Test is 24 pages of murderous goodness. Death Test 2, the sequel, is twice as long and at least twice as deadly. These games use the Melee map and the Melee and Wizard rules.

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid

name: Operation Compass: North Africa, December 1940
description:
Operation Compass: North Africa, December 1940 is an Operational level Solitaire board-wargame where the player primarily takes on the role of commanding the Allied forces during the first 4 days of the campaign in Egypt that saw the Italian forces forced out of that country in 1940. The Italian forces are managed by the player in accordance with the rules. The game is not designed for two players. Each hex represents 3 miles from side to side. Each turn represents half a day. Unit counters represent battalions, or Regiments/Reinforced Regiments. Playing time, typically less than two hours.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Movement Points, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game, Zone of Control

name: Invictus: Odin
description:
Invictus the Odin is a 2 player tactical card game. The player will be the Odin and fight with opponent. While fighting with opponent’s army on the battlefield you must take care of your Kingdom because in this game, building better Kingdom than opponent’s, also let you win the game.

Destroying the enemy soldier might not always be the best move in this game. Capture them and make them your own to prosper your land.
There are multiple ways to use each card. You may use it as a soldier, as a citizen and as an assistance force. Use your cards wisely to win the battle.

2 player battle card game combined with unique mechanics such as Kingdom and Reserve, will lead you to the next Battlefield.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Hand Management, Take That
publishers: Hemz Universal Games Co. Ltd., Igiari

name: Universal Fighting System: Cowboy Bebop Collectible Card Game
description:
A game in the Universal Fighting System represents a battle between two adversaries. Each player controls one of the two characters, with the objective being to defeat the opponent, typically through loss of vitality. The two characters need not be from the same universe.


for Cowboy Bebop

In 2071, roughly fifty years after an accident with a hyperspace gateway made the Earth almost uninhabitable, humanity has colonized most of the rocky planets and moons of the Solar System. Amid a rising crime rate, the Inter Solar System Police (ISSP) set up a legalized contract system, in which registered bounty hunters chase criminals and bring them in alive in return for a reward.

The Cowboy Bebop Booster Display contains 24 booster packs of 10 cards each for The Universal Fighting System (UFS).

https://jascogames.net/product/ufs-set-28-cowboy-bebopbooste...

--description from the publisher
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Wings of Glory: World War 1 – UFAG C.I
description:
The UFAG C.I was a two–seat biplane that served the Austrian Air Service in many roles. First released in April 1918 and intended to update or replace earlier observation airplanes, its excellent speed and handling saw the UFAG C.I used for everything from escorting observation airplanes to ground attack to light bombing. The fastest two-seater produced by the Central Powers, its Hungarian manufacturer could not keep up with demands and only about 170 had been delivered when the war ended.

UFAG C.I (161–37)
In an attempt to improve UFAG’s firepower against enemy fighters, a second forward–firing machine gun was experimentally added to this airplane. This model has special cards to reflect the upgrade.

UFAG C.I (Flik 62/S)
Flik 62 was originally a divisional observation unit, formed in Trentino, Italy. It was turned into a ground attack unit, and renamed Flik 62/S, when it was equipped with the UFAG C.I.

UFAG C.I (161–138)
As a high–performing 2–seater, available in limited numbers, the UFAG C.I was often reserved for the best available crews. This model has special cards to reflect that.

Each WW1 Wings of Glory® Airplane Pack is a ready–to–play model, painted and assembled, 100% compatible with any other WW1 Wings of Glory game product.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, World War I
mechanics: Action Queue, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Star Wars: Dark Side Rising – Promo pack
description:
Set of 8 promo cards that came with pre-ordered and early copies from FLGS.

The 8 cards inside the promo pack are:

2 red Rebel Heros: Bo-Katan Kryze and PAO
1 green Rebel Hero: Bistan
1 purple Rebel Hero: General Merrick
1 green Rebel vehicle: A-Wing
1 blue Rebel vehicle: Phantom II
1 purple Imperial Villain: Shoretrooper
1 purple Imperial vehicle: Delta Class T-3C
categories: Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Open Drafting

name: Warhammer 40,000 (Eighth Edition): Codex – Astra Militarum
description:
The Astra Militarum is the implacable military arm of the Imperium, and one of the largest forces in the galaxy. On thousands of battlefields scattered throughout the galaxy, the soldiers of the Astra Militarum march to war. They are the Hammer of the Emperor, who with faith, fury and sheer weight of numbers crush heretics and xenos alike beneath their boots. Massed ranks of Guardsmen unleash concentrated salvoes of las-blasts while officers bellow orders over the thunderous roar of tank and artillery fire.

Codex: Astra Militarum contains a wealth of background and rules – the definitive book for Astra Militarum collectors. Within this 144-page hardback, you’ll find:

Background

- Hammer of the Emperor: the origins of the Astra Militarum – dating back to the Great Crusade – with details of their structure and organisation, the methods of recruiting (some more humanitarian than others…), their training and deployment;
- A Galaxy of War: an annotated map of the current state of the galaxy, with key war zones where the Astra Militarum battle;
- Detailed background and colour schemes of the Astra Militarum regiments of Cadia, Catachan, Armageddon, Vostroya, Vahalla and Tallarn;
- Regiments of Distinction: background on 12 regiments – Armageddon Ork Hunters, Athonian Tunnel Rats, Miasman Redcowls, Mordian Iron Guard, Tanith First and Only, Savlar Chem-Dogs, Ventrillian Nobles, Indigan Praefects, Mordant Acid-Dogs, Faeburn Vanquishers, Truskan Snowhounds and Vresh Grenadiers;
- Heroes Beyond Number: a history of the major battles fought by the Astra Militarum;
- Background and details on each character, vehicle and unit available to an Astra Militarum army;
- A showcase of beautifully painted Citadel miniatures, depicting the colour schemes of several regiments painted by the renowned ‘Eavy Metal team – including expertly-converted models showing you how to represent the more esoteric regiments on the gaming table.

Rules

Everything you need to get an Astra Militarum army primed for games of Warhammer 40,000 is in here:

- 56 datasheets containing rules for every Astra Militarum unit and vehicle;
- Army abilities reflecting the Astra Militarum’s methods of war, including Astra Militarum Orders and Regimental Orders;
- Armoury of the Imperium: wargear both ranged and close-combat used by the Astra Militarum;
- Points values for all miniatures, weapons and wargear for use in Matched Play games;
- Bulwark of Humanity: rules for Battle-forged armies:
- Regimental Doctrines for Cadian, Catachan, Valhallan, Vostroyan, Armageddon, Tallarn, Mordian, Militarum Tempestus Regiments;
- 6 unique Warlord Traits,
- 25 Stratagems, with 8 specific to the Regiments named above;
- the Heirlooms of Conquest: a selection of rare wargear;
- The Psykana psychic discipline, available to any Astra Militarum model with the Psyker keyword,
- 6 Warlord Traits for use by any Warlord, with a further specific to the above-named Regiments;
- 6 unique Tactical Objectives.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Storm the Gate: Woodland Warfare
description:
In the times before The Divide, the inhabitants of The Veiled Forest existed harmoniously. The seasons came and went each year, and there was peace among all creatures that made these woodlands their home. One morning, at the very edge of the winter solstice's arrival, all of this changed.

Storm the Gate: Woodland Warfare, the sequel to Antsy Labs' Storm the Gate, is a frantic tabletop dexterity game in which you must rapidly move your army of heroes into your opponent's battle camp.

Introducing more depth than its predecessor, Storm the Gate: Woodland Warfare offers players the choice between two factions and six heroes - each hero belonging to a class with its own unique abilities and token dimensions.

You win the game by clearing all tokens from your camp before your opponent can do the same.

—description from the publisher
categories: Action / Dexterity, Fantasy, Party Game, Real-time
mechanics: Real-Time

name: Compendium: The Overlord – Tome IV (fan expansion for Batman)
description:
A collection of fan-designed scenarios available through the-overlord.com

4 game-play scenarios for Monolith games:

Resuscitation (Batman: Gotham City Chronicles)
Claustrobowl (Claustrophobia 1643)
Tournament pool — A selection of powerful and varied units (Mythic Battles: Pantheon)
Razzia in Aquilonie (Conan)


Also includes:

Removable Game aides for Batman: Gotham City Chronicles
Character Bios and Painting guide for Batman: Gotham City Chronicles
Master of the Hounds — A story set in the world of Claustrophobia 1643
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Fantasy, Fighting, Mythology, Novel-based
mechanics: Action Points, Area Movement, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers

name: Desdemona
description:
Two players B&W.
Played on a 10x10 checkerboard.
8 Chess queens, 4 White and 4 Black.
A supply of B&W stones.

SETUP
Black queens are set on squares (A4, D10, G1, J7). White queens are set on squares (A7, D1, G10, J4) or vice versa.

PLAY
Black moves but does not shoot on the first turn. Turns then alternate. On a turn, a player must do one of two things.

1) Move a queen in a straight line across any number of empty squares (orthogonally or diagonally) ending the move on an empty square. Then place a stone in your opponent's color on an empty square away in a straight line across any number of empty squares (orthogonally or diagonally) from the queen that was last moved, or

2) Move a queen in a straight line across any number of empty squares (orthogonally or diagonally) ending the move on an empty square adjacent to an opponent's stone. The queen and the stone now define a line (straight or diagonal). If the next square of that line, going in the direction of the opponent's stone, is vacant or the next squares hold your opponent's stones followed by an empty square, then your color stone is placed on that square, thus trapping your opponent's stones between itself and the moving queen. Captured opponent stones are replaced with moving player's color stones.

GOAL
If a player is unable to make a move, he must pass, when all players pass the game ends.

The player with the most pieces on the board wins.

Description by the designer.
mechanics: Enclosure, Grid Movement, Square Grid, Tile Placement

name: Lances and Steel: The Battle of Mokra, September 1, 1939
description:
“The blow must be struck. We must act now or go under.” –Adolf Hitler.

“The marauders’ attack will be smashed against the steel wall of our heroic army.” –Dobry Wieczór Kuier Czerwony.

The German attack on Poland, codenamed “Case White,” on September 1st, 1939 was a gamble on Hitler’s part. He wagered Poland’s allies of France and Great Britain would once again cave-in to his demands and not oppose his invasion. Even if they did, a lightning-fast war (blitzkrieg) would make mote any of their objections once the rival to the east was subjugated. That a mutual defense treaty stipulating an invasion from the east by the Soviet Union only “sealed the deal” and further secured Hitler’s risk.

Lances and Steel is a war game simulation of the battle fought near the town of Mokra during the 1939 invasion of Poland by Nazi Germany. The area was held by the Polish 7th Infantry Division and the Wołyńska Cavalry Brigade supported by the Smialy armored train and the 21st Tank battalion. The German attack here sought to separate the Polish Lodz and Krakow Armies and effect a breakthrough to the Polish rear areas. The first major battle of WWII was fought here. Can you do as well or better than your historical counterparts? Learn and Enjoy!

Each turn of the game represents one and half hours of time. Most units represent a battalion; Polish armor units represent a company. Each hex is approximately one-third of a mile across.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Chit-Pull System, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Simulation

name: The Zorro Dice Game: Stunts and Allies
description:
This expansion to The Zorro Dice Game gives each player an Ally, who will level up throughout the game, providing your hero with special abilities and a subtle catch-up mechanic. If your Ally reaches its max level, you will unlock your own, personal Ally Die as well. But each Ally has a weakness that you have to mitigate as you fight Scoundrels and Villains, which increases the difficulty of the game overall.

Stunt Tokens were added as well, which offer additional opportunities for mid-turn tactics, like switching Heroic Feats or re-rolling dice.

Lastly, it will add more Equipment, Scoundrels, and Villains to the base game as well for additional replayability and more combos to try in your overall strategy.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Dice Party
description:
The night is still young and the Party community starts off to find the best Party in town. For now the streets are full of people but soon the vibe will rise on the dance floors. Who is the host making the most money out of his guests? Who throws the coolest Party? And which Party will end in a brawl?

Dice Party is a dice game for 2-4 players in which every player acts as a party host, throwing a party that competes with the parties of the other players. Each player has up to 60 dice to throw, representing party guests of three types: cool Party People (yellow), high society VIPs (orange) and experience-driven rowdys, referred to as Mob (red).

While each round is a tactical challenge, since you have three different win conditions to outreach your opponents, the game unfolds its strategic depth with its Party Animal mode. Playing this full mode you're playing multiple rounds, trying to achieve complete victory by winning once with each of the 3 victory conditions:

All other Partys escalate due to their Mob guests.
A VIP millionaire hits your Party.
You pickpocket six wallets from your Party People.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Player Elimination, Push Your Luck, Race

name: Storm Chasers
description:
Thick clouds billow on the horizon as you speed towards a rising storm. You are a freelance storm chaser, risking it all by placing yourself in the heart of the storm. Will your actions pay off or will your livelihood be swept away with the changing wind?

Storm Chasers is a hand management, tile manipulation game for 2-4 players. In Storm Chasers, players manipulate the weather across region tiles to maximize their film footage of Thunderstorms and tornadoes as they sweep through regions.

In a turn, a player can use cards in their hand to benefit themselves or to affect other players. They can move from one region tile to another to increase the number of regions they will view when a storm is activated. They can flip/rotate tiles to create longer storm fronts, maximizing their potential income, and change the type of storm to strategically meet their goals. Players can clear rubble left from previous tornadoes, and complete special assignments to earn additional income. A player's turn ends by activating a storm using a card from their hand. Income or loss of income due to damage are subsequently dealt to each player who is affected by the activated storm. But players should be careful not to get to sure of themselves. The competition is fierce, you never know when a competing storm chaser might surprise you by adding an unanticipated challenge.

After 4-6 rounds (depending on player count of 2-4 players) the player with the highest earned income value wins and is awarded the coveted "Eye of the Storm Award" for excellence in extreme weather videography.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Contracts, End Game Bonuses, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Modular Board, Tile Placement

name: Scarlet Envelope III: Distress Call from Outer Space
description:
The third game in the Scarlet Envelope series.

If you love detectives and sci-fi, this tabletop escape room by Scarlet Envelope is for you. The year is 2220, a century into human colonization of Mars. Your spaceship picks up the distress call from a Martian spy who has discovered a dark secret that can stop the war between Earth and Mars! Now, encrypted Martian files are in your hands, along with the fate of our Galaxy. Will you accept the challenge?

GAME CONTENTS:
- A huge space map (you’ll be surprised that it fits into the envelope!)
- Constellations map
- A cryptic ruler (to be used together with a map)
- Piece of evidence on a transparent film
- Audio SOS-signal from the Martian spy
- Spaceship Main Control interactive terminal (use commands to access info & additional files)
- “Earth Today” web news portal
- Two more hidden websites
- Two more hidden digital files
- Email correspondence with the United Planets Secretary-General

A fun detective investigation narrative with over a dozen of various puzzles to solve, from encryption to altering items. You will need a computer or a mobile device to play. Expect a lot of digital interaction (it’s the 23rd century after all.) Answer submission and a storytelling video at the end. Tons of quality time in the middle!

-description from publisher
categories: Deduction, Murder/Mystery, Puzzle, Real-time, Space Exploration
mechanics: Real-Time

name: World of Tanks Miniatures Game: American – M10 Wolverine Expansion
description:
The M10 Wolverine is your typical tank destroyer, a glass cannon! It packs plenty of punch but if you concentrate your fire you can break it quickly. It has a solid firepower stat, which can be upgraded by replacing the 3” gun that comes as standard with the 76mm AT Gun M1A2 that improves both its firepower and initiative. Pair it up with lower initiative tanks that can shield it from enemy fire and a radio operator with Signal Boosting to improve the initiative of every other tank in your platoon.

Inside the M10 Wolverine Expansion Pack, you will find a highly detailed, assembled, pre-primed plastic M10 Wolverine tank miniature and tank card. Your tank can be further personalised to match your requirements using the five crew, module, and upgrade cards included.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement

name: Vitamors Conspiro
description:
In the realm of the Grim Reapers, it is the Joker’s party who rules, for now. They oppress the reapers and banish the heretics. The banished Grim Reapers wish nothing but regaining their power, so they assemble secretly, endeavoring to take back their control over the Reaper’s Realm through a mysterious sacrificial ritual. However, the assembly room is already penetrated by the Jokers --- the orders of the offerings are disrupted, and the real class of the offerings can’t be identified! The clock is ticking, and the right moment for the ritual is about to pass. The Exilers have no choice but to start a “Life-and-Death” battle with the Jokers……

"Vitamors Conspiro" is a social deduction game of hidden loyalty. Players take the role of either the “Exiler” or the “Joker”, through “Offering Up a Sacrifice” and “Start the Ritual” to attain victory. Players may start the ritual whenever the number of the character cards on the altar meets the requirements; however, to start the ritual successfully, the combination of the character cards have to be correct, too. That means players may also win the game by cheating their opponents, misleading them to start the ritual with a wrong combination and cause the ritual to fail. When there are 9 character cards on the altar, yet the ritual hasn’t been started, the Jokers automatically win the game (they are already in charge of the Reaper’s Realm, after all).

－－－－－－

目前的死神界，乃是由小丑派系所統御。祂們高壓統治眾死神，並強行流放異己。被流放的死神們心有不甘，於是秘密集結，意圖透過神秘的獻祭儀式奪回對死神界的掌控。然而，儀式的集會所早已被小丑派系滲透，不僅獻祭的順序被打亂，就連祭品的真實身分也無法辨識！眼看就要錯過儀式發動的時機，流放者們只得和小丑決一「死」戰……

《生死逆謀》是一款陣營心機遊戲。玩家將扮演「流放者」或「小丑」，透過「獻祭」並且「發動儀式」以取得勝利。遊戲中有許多資訊是隱藏的，但又有許多環節需要投票表決，因此玩家在任何時候都可以自由發言，透過討論、協商或是話術以獲得資訊，幫助己方陣營推理並有策略的投票。當然，玩家也可以選擇不透露資訊、或是提供錯誤資訊，利用資訊落差製造己方陣營的優勢。
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction, Fantasy, Medieval, Negotiation, Party Game, Spies/Secret Agents
mechanics: Hidden Roles, Roles with Asymmetric Information, Simultaneous Action Selection, Team-Based Game, Traitor Game, Voting
publishers: Play With Us Design (玩聚設計)

name: Quiz Club: Rollenspiele & Geek-Wissen
description:
Quiz Club is a tactical quiz game in which cooperative and competitive rounds alternate.

Rollenspiele & Geek-Wissen is an expansion for Quiz Club with 120 themed questions to expand and personalize your game experience.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Party Game, Trivia
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Cooperative Game, Semi-Cooperative Game

name: Wonky Blocks
description:
The aim of the game is to rid your hand of all cards, or to stack all 9 blocks - which is highly unlikely. Play a card from your initial hand of seven, and place a block on the stack, using only one hand. The cards specify size and/or colour of the block to be played. The stack may not be steadied. If the stack collapses, take 3 cards as penalty, and start a new stack. The two action cards are pass and reverse direction.

—user summary
mechanics: Stacking and Balancing

name: Village Pillage: À L'Abordage
description:
Village Pillage - A L'Abordage is a stand alone game with new villagers, but also pirates to help you become the king!

To become the king, you will have to acquire 4 relics.
In this lawless world, everything is paid for in turnips, including the precious relics that are essential to your royal victory. With the same villagers as the other players, you will have to make the difference and play skillfully against your table neighbours. During the game, you can recruit new villagers for more powerful effects. Add pirates to the game to enjoy even more powerful effects... and risky ones!
categories: Card Game, Fantasy, Humor, Medieval, Pirates
mechanics: Hand Management, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Simultaneous Action Selection, Take That

name: Batman: Escape From Arkham Asylum
description:
Batman: Escape from Arkham Asylum is a semi-cooperative dungeon crawl for 1 to 5 players in which the Super Villains of the Batman universe are the protagonists. This is one of the few games where you must defeat Batman, and that gives the player the opportunity to play as dozens of characters. The players will put themselves in the shoes of the most iconic Super Villains of Gotham City: The Joker, Harley Quinn, Two-Face, The Penguin, Bane, Poison Ivy, and The Scarecrow. The goal? Escape from an iconic institution of Gotham City: Arkham Asylum.

Batman: Escape from Arkham Asylum offers the funny and wild vision of the comics of the Batman universe and introduces a novel element: confronting Batman. Players must join forces to achieve their common goal. However, each one of them will have their own hidden objectives, which can range from escaping on their own or sowing as much chaos as possible in the asylum, something they must achieve to gain an advantage over their companions and be the one who finally wins the victory.

The players choose a Super Villain and play their turns one after the other. In each of these turns, the players can perform different actions such as moving around on the board, attacking their enemies with crazy weapons, searching rooms or crafting tools to use in their escape. The game ends when the players escape or when everyone is defeated by the forces of order that run Arkham, from the tough guards of the complex to, of course, the Dark Knight himself.
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Dice, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Move Through Deck, Semi-Cooperative Game, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Disuko!
description:
Disuko! is an abstract puzzle strategy sudoku dice game in which players strive to run out of their dice first by taking turns rerolling, moving, and/or placing their dice on a 6x6 sudoku grid. Extra actions are acquired by completing sections of the board (rows, columns, boxes, or the sixth of any number). Players must keep an eye out for opportunities to block opponents and to acquire as many actions as possible in order to win.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action Retrieval, Dice Rolling, Grid Coverage, Grid Movement, Lose a Turn, Pattern Building, Pattern Movement, Pattern Recognition, Square Grid, Variable Set-up

name: BarBEARian Battlegrounds: Candy Horde
description:
Foul pollution blights the beautiful lands of Barbearia; Impossibly sticky and unnaturally sweet, this darkness corrupts anything it comes in contact with. The once lush landscapes are becoming tainted with an irresistibly delicious slime, and bears who fall to temptation are transformed into ravenous abominations.

The Unbearable Expansion adds two new features to Tales of Barbearia gameplay:

The Horde - Rampaging bears who have become mutated by the darkest magic in the known universe - candy! These mindless monstrosities have begun invading the realms of Barbearia, governed only by their insatiable cravings. Adds 15 Zombear cards.

Heroes - Powerful new allies you can recruit for battle. As grizzled veterans of war and adventures, these heroic bears are more powerful than your average barbearian. Adds 12 Hero cards.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Die Icon Resolution, Worker Placement, Different Worker Types

name: Ram vs. Stag: The Battle of Bir el Gubi, November 19, 1941
description:
“…an encounter battle carried out too enthusiastically against prepared positions…not seen or recognized until the attack had been launched.” –Summary of the British attack at Bir el Gubi by Lieutenant General Willoughby Norrie.

Ram vs. Stag is a low complexity war game simulation of the first battle fought near the village and oasis at Bir el Gubi in Libya. In response to General Erwin Rommel’s bold offensive the British-led Allied forces launched a counter offensive to defeat the Axis forces that were besieging Tobruk. Dubbed Operation Crusader, the Allied attack was launched on November 18th and caught the Axis by surprise. However, Rommel reacted quickly by withdrawing his armored forces into an arc that stretched south and west of the crucial port. The British armored units groped their way forward attempting to identify and fix their enemy’s positions. Late on November 18th units of the Italian Ariete (Ram) Division were discovered near the village of Bir El Gubi. The 22nd Armored Brigade (Stags), a recently deployed unit to the North Africa, was ordered to attack. In the past, British tanks had sent the Italians into head-long flight and a repeat was expected. Instead, the Italians had dug in and were prepared to fight.

Can you do as well or better than your historical counter parts? Lean and enjoy!

Each turn of the game represents one hour of time. Each hex is approximately a third of a mile across. Units represent companies of men (infantry), batteries of 4-6 guns (artillery and AT), or 10-12 vehicles (tanks and armored cars).

Each copy of Ram vs. Stag is composed of the following:

8 pages of rules
Two 11 by 17 inch map sheets with game tracks and tables
160 single sided, un-mounted counters

Players will also need a six sided die and an opaque container (mug, envelope or anything similar) to play the game.

Each turn of the game represents one hour of time. Each hex is approximately a third of a mile across. Units represent companies of men (infantry), batteries of 4-6 guns (artillery and AT), or 10-12 vehicles (tanks and armored cars).
mechanics: Chit-Pull System, Hexagon Grid

name: Awkward
description:
Awkward is the ultimate test on finding out how well friends, couples, and family know each other!

In Awkward, on a players turn, they pick up a question card and choose between two options labelled A or B. They then place one of the voting cards (either A or B) facedown while everyone guesses which answer they chose and also place a voting card facedown. The answer is revealed and the players who guessed correctly are awarded with a Wick Point and the first to get 10, wins!
categories: Card Game, Mature / Adult, Party Game
mechanics: Storytelling, Voting

name: ハナニソム (Hananisomu)
description:
ハナニソム (Hananisomu) is a 2 player game from Japan where players compete to enjoy the cherry blossom viewing. In Japan, since the 8th century, it is custom to pass a pleasant afternoon in the spring, sitting under the cherry and plum trees, enjoying the blossoms while eating and drinking with your friends. This is known as Hanami, and is seen all across Japan as the blossoms open.

In this game, the two players are trying to create the best flower viewing experience for their friends. By laying out ground sheets under the trees, and providing food and drink, players score points. The most points wins the game.

Players take turns laying tiles in three colours, and putting markers for people on them. By controlling the largest areas connected to trees, and having the right type of people connected to the foods they like, a player can maximise their score.
user summary

This is a two-player game where players line up leisure sheets in a park full of cherry blossoms and the winner is the one who gets the best basho (spot under the trees) for the visitors. The player who gets the best basho for the visitors wins the game.

桜の咲く公園にレジャーシートを並べていき、訪れるお花見客により良いバショを取ってあげたプレイヤーが勝利する、2人用の陣取りゲームです。
自分のバショ = 陣地を、他のバショより大きくしたり、桜に隣接させたり、お花見客の好物を集めたりすることで得点が上がり、勝利に近づきます。
publisher's summary
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Grid Coverage, Square Grid, Tile Placement

name: A.D.E.L.E.: Kickstarter Mini Expansion
description:
Exclusive mini expansion for backers of the game during the Kickstarter campaign.
This expansion includes 2 new anomalies for ADELE and 4 new objects (2 copies of each) to make your game a little more different.

The new anomalies: Simply add these new tiles to the ones already in the game; just keep in mind they are not suitable for game modes where ADELE plays as an automaton.

Maintenance Robot and Surprise Attack

The new objects:

Computer Virus, Portable Charger, PDA, Portable EMP:

You may just add the new objects to the common pool of objects but there is a risk that some vital objects will become too scarce, like the batteries or the space suits. So it is recommended removing some existing objects when using the new ones as follows:

Computer Virus - remove 1 battery and 1 Stimulants
PDA - remove 1 flashlight and 1 space suit
Portable charger - remove 1 flashlight and 1 pieces
Portable EMP - remove 1 teddy and 1 first aid kit
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Points, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Events, Hand Management, Pick-up and Deliver, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Heroes of Normandie: War Stories #00 – Hell's Fury
description:
American troops are advancing into Germany. The beast is wounded but still dangerous. After many adventures, Wardaddy's Sherman runs over a mine and is immobilized at a crossroads. The radio broke down and has to be repaired as soon as possible. But young Norman, out on a reconnaissance mission, returns with grim news. An SS battalion is heading straight for their tank. Wardaddy convinces his men to stay and resist. They will hold to the last!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: CIFRA Code25
description:
CIFRA is 2-players pure abstract strategy game on 5x5 flexible board.

Players take their turn alternately. During their play the player can move their own piece according to the moving rules. If a player moves their piece onto the tile which an opponent piece occupies, they can capture it like a Chess piece. If player moves their piece onto the opposite side, the piece is a goal and fixed there. Both players can't move it nor capture it.

When all alive five pieces of any one of players are captured or goal, then game is over.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Grid Movement, Square Grid, Variable Set-up

name: Mysthea: Monsters Set
description:
The Miniature Bundle completes the Monsters Miniatures set in addition to those already included in Mysthea: Essential Edition.

Contents:

3 Additional Monster Miniatures:
Boulron the Reaper
Kodror the Infestation
Obsidusa the Devourer

With related cards and 1 English rulesheet.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Miniatures
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: Ironclads of the American Civil War
description:
On March 9, 1862, the clash of the ironclad gunboats CSS Virginia and USS Monitor at the Battle of Hampton Roads heralded a new age of naval warfare. The innovations of the early industrial era yielded powerful new warships, armed with strong new guns, and plated with thick metal armor. A new ironclad navy threatened to revolutionize the practice of naval warfare, rendering old wooden fleets obsolete.
This solitaire book game explores the use of ironclads during the American Civil War through a series of scenarios that teach the system gradually. In seeking to capture essential qualities of the battles in a fast and playable system, many aspects of these conflicts have been abstracted. Simplicity and ease of play have taken precedence over intricate rules and historical detail.

Each scenario consists of a playsheet (left) and mapsheet (right), and features a short historical introduction. The scenarios, which each usually take 20 to 30 minutes to play, walk you through the rules. As you progress from scenario to scenario, new rules will be added, basic rules will be upgraded to ‘standard’ or ‘advanced’ status, and scenario-specific rules may come into play. By the end of the book, you’ll have experienced the game system in full, and perhaps something of ironclad history as well.

—description from the designer
categories: American Civil War, Book, Nautical, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid

name: Great European War
description:
Great European War is a Strategic level two-player wargame of an alternative World War II in Europe, based on the premise that Adolf Hitler did not order the invasion of the Soviet Union in June 1941. Instead, the Axis goes over to a naval-air offensive against the British with additional operations in North Africa and the Middle East, while waiting for America to enter the war and keeping a watchful eye on Stalin who may intervene.

The game assumes that the Western Allies decide on a Europe First Strategy, diverting forces and logistics from the Pacific. The Axis is under pressure to win the war before economic collapse sets in, the Allies to win before the Japanese seize too much of the Pacific. Given the shift in Axis logistics and planning against the British Empire and the US. only the westernmost Soviet Union is shown on the map, but there is emphasis on North Africa and the Middle East.

There are two players: Axis and Allied (to include the Western Allies and the Soviet Union). Both players can develop orders of battle by expending Mobilization Points. The game shows the war in Europe during the early and mid-war years before the full Allied buildup. Both sides will be fighting a war which is markedly different from that fought in the historical event. The game ends in 1943, the time when the Western Allies originally planned to return to Europe.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Hexagon Grid

name: Lóng Soul
description:
In Lóng Soul, you play as a water dragon competing to return honor and good fortune to your island-dwelling creators. Your gameplay is influenced by your dragon's elemental alignment, and you will need to gather raw elemental rings from the sea purifying them at elemental shrines. Once the elemental rings have been purified, they are placed onto your island, protecting your creators and also scoring you points. May the best water dragon win.

Lóng Soul provides a new spin on the classic archetype of resource drafting and set collection by funneling resource gathering through the player's dragon avatar on the gameboard. The 3D board physically holds all of the ring resources, stacking them up to four rings deep, so you peer into the depths of the board and examine how these rings are stacked when making plans for future turns. As the game arc advances, new late game mechanisms will emerge as a result of the evolving board state.

On a player's turn, they must fly, then do one of three actions: ability, shrine, scale. Flying is a single point-to-point movement adhering to the 5x5 grid, often gathering a single ring. An ability is a positional puzzle for your dragon avatar to solve with the potential to gather two rings. Visiting a shrine is your opportunity to convert gathered rings into points on your player board. Shedding a scale is an alternate path to pursue to gain points, taking advantage of particular board state opportunities.

When you're done with the game, simply reload the 3d board for storage and affix the lid to enable a quick set-up next time you play.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: End Game Bonuses, Grid Movement, Pick-up and Deliver, Set Collection, Tile Placement, Variable Player Powers

name: Sagrada: 2022 Mini-Tournament Pack
description: Rules allowing up to 4 players to play a series of 3 games against each other. Each game uses 1 of the 3 Great Facades expansions.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Fortitude
description:
A game of Fortitude lasts 16 hands during which you will play a trick-taking game against a German bot. Each round consists of eight tricks--four played in the Calais, France location and four in Trondheim, Normay--with a final ninth trick, that you're trying to lose, played in Normandy.

Between rounds, if you've played tactically then you can earn upgrades that help modify your future cards. But be forewarned because you'll draw periodic setback cards that might well turn a winning position into a loss.

While you want to win tricks in Calais and Trondheim, winning in Normandy will eventually clue Germany into its importance to the Allied forces. So every Normandy win requires you to fill in spaces in a limited polygonal area. If you can, then you continue your campaign. But if you can't fill in the required boxes, you lose.

Fortitude is a trick-taking and write game that asks if you can successfully deceive the Germany military intelligence long enough to ensure D-Day happens as planned.

-description from designer
categories: Card Game, Print & Play, World War II
mechanics: Events, Trick-taking

name: Railroad Ink: Essen 2022 Blueprint Promo Card
description: Promo Blueprint card for any of the Railroad Ink or Railroad Ink Challenge base games. The card is double sided with the cities Essen and Modena. The card was handed out during Essen Spiel 2022.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: The Stifling Dark: Mini Expansion
description:
A promotional mini expansion that introduces five alternate item cards so players can choose which version of the items they want to play with each game. The alternates retain the original spirit of the base cards but enhance or modify them to create a unique experience.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Deduction, Hidden Movement, Line of Sight, Memory, Negotiation, Pick-up and Deliver, Point to Point Movement, Team-Based Game, Trading, Variable Player Powers
publishers: Game Harbor, Sophisticated Cerberus Games, LLC

name: Four Humours: Kickstarter Pack
description:
Four Humours Kickstarter-exclusive content:

9 Revolt scene cards, replacing regular scene cards


New Ship region:

5 scene cards
1 beastiary card
1 board
1 party tile


These were packaged together but separate from the base game.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Doomlings: Techlings
description:
The 18-card Techlings Expansion introduces attachment traits for advanced play.

The tech boom on Enderas sparked a new type of Doomling, one with certain...modifications.

Attachments must be attached to a host trait (a non-dominant, non-attachment trait without any attachments).
mechanics: Unspecified

name: パンピンポンゲーム (Pang Ping Pong Game)
description:
パンピンポンゲーム (Pang Ping Pong Game) is a speed card game from Japan. Similar to Uno, players must play their cards to the discard pile as quickly as possible. But the cards must be played in order: Pang>Ping>Pong>pang and so on. Players play as quickly as they can in no turn order, but a player cannot play twice to pile; another player must play a card before they can play again. The first player to shed their hand wins the round, and winning three rounds wins the game.

There are also special cards such as double cards like PangPing which counts as player two in a row, and Skip, which lets you skip a card in order: Pang>Skip>Pong.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Last Aurora: Dice Tower 2022 Promo Pack
description:
Originally available in pack D of the Dice Tower 2022 Kickstarter campaign.

Contains 3 cards:

Outpost 42
-Card 198
-Location

Chopper Pilot
-Card 199
-Survivor

Snow Cat
-Card 200
-Truck
-3 Trailer
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Battles in the East 2: Uman Pocket and Guderian's Final Blitzkrieg
description:
These two battles were fought during Barbarossa. Uman is a lesser-known battle fought just south of the more famous Kiev Encirclement. Guderian’s Final Blitzkrieg is the final lunge to encircle Moscow from the south.

Components include a double-sided full-size mounted game board, 440 large counters, a 16-page series rules booklet, and scenario/exclusive rules sheets and displays, plus full-color set-up charts for each scenario, series charts and tables for each player.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Hexagon Grid

name: Dead Center
description:
In Dead Center, you must kill twelve zombies surrounding your 3x3 cabin before the deck runs out. You do this by playing cards into piles within the cabin to attack adjacent zombies. The power and precision of your attacks is determined not by the card you played, but by the two other cards on the same line.

Dead Center is a solo game playable with a deck of regular playing cards, with rules created by Wil Su and made available free online as part of his "Isaludo" series.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: ARCANA PROPHETIA: A Game About Fate
description:
Arcana Prophetia is an asymmetric, tarot-inspired game where 2 players face off in a battle of wits and prediction.

One player takes on the role of the Fates, who seeks to usher in the end of days by corrupting the pantheon. Standing against them is the Last Sovereign, who attempts to surmount the odds and constantly tries to divine the Fates' next move.

Each round, the Last Sovereign makes a prediction while the Fates choose a god to corrupt - represented by the Arcana cards. The Fates then plays the chosen card onto the Spread, on either its Corrupted or Sanctified face, depending on whether the Sovereign's divination proves true. Every god has their own unique effects; flipping, moving or otherwise manipulating other Arcana cards and the Spread. Should adjacent Arcana sum to 10, they will bind together, locking them in place. After nine short-but-tense rounds, the game moves to its conclusion, where the player with the most cards aligned to them wins.

No two cycles of Arcana Proheptia are identical - each of the arcana feature three different aspects, and the Fates can choose a face card that warps the game in unique, fun ways. Likewise, while the Last Sovereign often finds themselves on the back foot, they're not without tools. With a limited arsenal Sigils and the Relic of the Dead God, they must work to have predictions strike true, lest the pantheon falls to chaos.

-description from publisher
mechanics: Deck Construction, Tile Placement, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up, Zone of Control

name: Golem: Extra Book Cards
description: This small promo expansion adds 4 new Book cards to play with the base game.
mechanics: Action Drafting, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building

name: Taco Football Women's World Cup
description:
Taco Football Woman World Cup ! Keep this crazy string of words in mind. As soon as there is a match between a card and a spoken word, race to slap your hand on the central pile of cards. The last person to do so must take them all! Be quick to get rid of all your cards, but watch out! Your mind will play tricks on you. This addictive game is as unique as its name!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Flicking, Race

name: Battle of Son Tay Game
description:
1883. The French have decided to crush the renegade Chinese Black Flag army. The Eastern forces have taken control of Tonkin and the illustrious Red River. The Black Flag army, along with its Vietnamese allies, have been illusive and put up a fierce resistance. A plan to capture the fortress of Son Tay is put into place in the hopes of a quick end to the war. The shadowy army has fortified Son Tay and is confident that the French will be repulsed. The stage is set...

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Events, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Simulation, Zone of Control

name: Raccoon Rampage
description:
The North American Raccoon shouldn't be in Europe, but it is. Play as one of four different roles as they try to minimise the impact this invasive species has on the native species, and human population of Europe.

Semi-Cooperative (Coopetitive) game for 3-4 players. Work together to reduce the Impact or everyone loses. Succeed and 1 player will have pushed the agenda in their favour enough to be the overall victor.

Propose and Vote on Policies that try different approaches to managing the Impact. Policies are played to a Queue for resolution, Action cards can be used to manipulate the queue and the votes.

—description from the designer
categories: Animals, Educational, Environmental, Negotiation, Political, Print & Play
mechanics: Action Queue, Ordering, Voting

name: My Treasure Mug
description:
Story
The notorious Big Bad Pig and his pirate crew, the Three Little Wolves, stumbled upon a massive treasure chest on a deserted island. When celebrating at the Whisker's Bar, Big Bad Pig grabs a handful of gemstones and drops them into a mug, saying, “Whoever can guess how many gemstones I threw in gets them!” Thus begins an adventure of treasure-seeking and rivalry over the coveted mug!

Overview
You and your fellow pirates will take turns secretly tossing Treasure into the mug. Who can guess the total value correctly or catch others claiming an exceeding value will be able to split the roots! Watch closely and listen to the “clanks!” carefully, you might become the pirate hoarding the most treasure!

Unique features
The treasure is composed of glass marbles, acrylic gems, wooden coins, and metal fake coins. The clanks of these materials when they are tossed in the mug differ but you have to pay attention not to be misled by other players' bluffing moves.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Animals, Bluffing, Party Game, Pirates
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Set Collection

name: Marvel Zombies: A Zombicide Game – Agent Coulson Promo Cards
description: A set of Super Hero ID card + Enemy Super Hero card for Agent Coulson (Marvel Zombies – A Zombicide Game) given out at GenCon 2023.
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Zombies
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game
publishers: CMON Global Limited, Spin Master Ltd.

name: Boba Life
description:
Bubble tea is life! As the owner of a bubble tea shop, your aim will be to serve as many orders as possible to be crowned best shop in town! But be careful not to accumulate too many bubble teas for fear of affecting your reputation! An addictive game to play with friends and bubble tea in hand!

How to play?

Player can choose between:

Draw a card from Boba deck and feed the line
Take Bubble Tea and Preparation cards from the Boba line


Once a player take cards, Sell your Bubble Tea to the line of customers, make combos and earn money !

Check that your Bubble Tea hasn't gone out of date or you'll lose money!

The richest player wins and become the best boba shop in town !

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Connections, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Push Your Luck

name: Case #27
description:
The Elevator Pitch

Case #27 is social deduction game, meaning that the people around you will be participating in the game--although they will not know they are involved.

In Case #27, you are a private detective, hired to solve a murder which the police have given up on. You must question your friends, relatives, acquaintances, or even strangers about their whereabouts at the time of the murder, as well as dredge up some information about their lives, in order to determine who the murderer is. Have casual conversations with them, ask innocent questions, but don't let them know that they are murder suspects!

Number of Players

One. However, this solitaire game requires the player to speak with at least five other people.

Expected Play Time

Anywhere between 30 minutes and several days, depending on how often you speak with people.

The Longer Pitch

To play, print out the Case #27 PocketMod and put it in your pocket, along with a pen or pencil. Go about your day, having casual conversations with those around you. When someone asks you "How are you doing?" or a derivative thereof, that triggers the start of the game. That person is designated as the murder victim. You must now find out where they died, how they died, who killed them, and why.
