As you go about your day, other conversations you have and other people you encounter will give you further clues. Piece together the evidence to bring the guilty party to justice!

Record your evidence on the PocketMod. Once you have solved the case, post your results online to reveal the murderer!

The Explanation

This is an idea I've had for a long time. I wanted to encourage gamers who are naturally shy or reserved (ahem... like myself) to have conversations with those around them. I thought it would be fun to have a game where the player's conversations with others and the things happening around them would trigger events or give the player tools to solve problems in the game.

Detective stories largely involve the protagonist going around having conversations with people in order to gather clues. That's easily translated into a game that can fit into one's pocket or purse!

I came up with different "triggers" that will give the player pieces of evidence. For example, the first suspect you encounter will be the first person to say some derivative of "Hello" to you once the game has begun. This will force the player to carry on a conversation with that person to find out such things as: where they were during the time of the murder, how they knew the victim, and whether they possessed the murder weapon.

Try to innocently ask people questions without giving away the game!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Acting, Paper-and-Pencil, Role Playing, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Krosmaster: Arena – Percedal Promo
description: Promotional Figure for the Krosmaster: Arena game. Two-in-one brute: Handle the rank and file, Percedal takes care of the big fish!
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Push Your Luck, Variable Player Powers

name: Babylon Gardens
description:
Abstract strategy in ancient Babylon.

Choose your path wisely!
Each path will bring you different results and will condition your rivals' decisions.
As you leave a trail of water, every plant that you fully irrigate will award you precious nectar.
The nectar is the key to winning the favor of the goddess Ishtar and winning the game!

The rules of the game are really simple, in your turn:
1- Choose a path from the central well without using the same tile twice
2- Put a water gem in each tile in the path
3- Collect a nectar wink for each tile filled with as many water gems as flowers
4- Put that nectar wink in your scoreboard
5- Repeat the steps for each player until someone completes the scoreboard

Despite the simplicity, strategy can be quite deep, you'll have to consider:

Which tiles will give the next player an advantage if you add a water gem?
Which tiles are worth completing to mess with your rivals' strategy?
Which tiles are worth completing based in your position in the scoreboard?
Speed vs precision. Is it better to finish first or to get more points per wink?
categories: Abstract Strategy, Ancient, Card Game, Farming, Puzzle
mechanics: Modular Board, Network and Route Building, Point to Point Movement, Tile Placement

name: Warfighter Shadow War: Expansion #43 – Captured Oil Platform!
description:
Each Shadow War Mission Pack is a real-world location. Shadow War Mission Packs put you in command of SpecOps teams running missions in real-world countries in the facilities you see on the news.

Contained within each pack are Mission Locations, Objectives and Hostiles relevant to each unique location.

Jihadists have captured an Oil Platform off the coast of Angola. It's up to you to lead your team through the platform's maze of compartments, disarm the booby traps and take down the terrorists before they destroy the platform and all aboard!

This expansion offers 56 cards including:


2 Squad Soldiers
3 Skills
2 Equipment
21 Hostiles
3 On the Grounds
4 Night Events
4 Night Missions
4 Night Objectives
1 Objective Hostile
12 Night Locations


—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Modern Warfare
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Hand Management

name: Bears vs Lumberjacks!
description:
Bears vs Lumberjacks is an light, fast-paced 2-3 player micro card game. It takes around 10-15 minutes to play and only seconds to learn. It's a card laying game relying on how and where you place your cards.

The goal is to end the round with the most points. The round ends when all 18 cards have been played. The first player to win 2 rounds will be victorious! There are four cards in each deck that contain a scoring icon. Points are awarded when your numbers on the cards played are touching your scoring icon. If a point is touching more then 1 scoring icon you get that point for each scoring icon.

HOW TO PLAY
You must play 1 card on your turn. All cards have values in the 4 corners.
You must play your card on top of another players as long as your number is higher. The first player each round will play a card to start the round.
4 cards have scoring icons. The scoring icons have no point value but can cover any number! However, the scoring icons cannot be covered.
You CAN’T play over your own cards, 2 corners, or 2 cards. You can only cover 1 number at a time.

-description from designer
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence

name: Nobunaga's Greatest Crisis
description:
Nobunaga's Greatest Crisis (信長最大の危機) is a game about Nobunaga's campaigns in Japan.
This game chronicles the rise of Oda Nobunaga from 1570 to his death in 1582.

Units represent Samurai lords and soldiers under their command.

Number of counters: about 400
Number of cards: 64 color cards
Map size: 1 full map
Game period: Genki 1 (1570) to Tensho 10 (1582)
Time scale: 1 turn = half a year
Number of players: 2
Difficulty (5 levels, 5 being the highest): 3

(adapted from publisher's webpage)
mechanics: Chit-Pull System, Open Drafting, Point to Point Movement

name: Zeppeldrome
description:
Zeppeldrome, is a serious steampunk race through silly obstacles with a hazardous, modular board and cards that are used to help you or mess with opponents as you all race to be the first to travel the length of the airship raceway.

Game-Play
Each turn, players look at the top half of the cards in their hands and choose one that shows the route they will attempt to take that turn in their effort to get past (or through) silly, yet hazardous, obstacles. The players reveal the chosen flight plan cards simultaneously.

Next, each player uses the often silly, but always strategic, actions on as many of their remaining cards as they like. These actions will either disrupt their opponents, or help themselves (or both).

Once card-play is finished, the last-place player moves any obstacles that need moving on the board (such as the falling Lemmings in the "Tragic Lemming 'Migration'"), and then the players move their dirigibles along the now-final path that resulted from their initial plan, plus cards that were played on them.

As players move, obstacles on the board (including the other players’ dirigibles) affect movement in positive or negative ways (depending on how skillful and lucky the players were in their card-play).

The first player over the finish line is the winner!
mechanics: Action Queue, Modular Board

name: Magic: The Gathering – Planechase: Zombie Empire
description:
Zombie Empire is a black zombie deck

Planechase was originally released in 2009. This deck was released in 2012.

Planechase is a card game and a variant of Magic: The Gathering with an emphasis on multi-player games. The set utilizes new oversized Plane cards, cards that are based on various locations (Planes) within the Magic multiverse, to modify the rules of gameplay.

To play a game of Planechase, each player needs his or her own planar deck, consisting of at least 10 different oversized cards. The players may also use a "shared planar deck," which requires ten cards per player. Players cannot use more than one plane with any given name. When the game begins, the player going first reveals the top of his or her planar deck (or the shared planar deck), which is the plane the game starts on. Each plane card has a name, a type, one ability that applies at all times (either to all players or to whoever is the turn player at the time), and one "Chaos" ability.

Players also need a six-sided die, called the "planar die." Each Planechase pre-constructed deck comes with a "planar die" that has four blank faces, one "Planeswalk" face with the "Planeswalker" symbol, and one "Chaos" face with its own symbol unique to Planechase. During a player's main phase, that player can roll the planar die, with three possible outcomes. A blank roll of the planar die does nothing. If "Chaos" is rolled, the "Chaos" ability of the current plane card triggers. If the "Planeswalk" symbol is rolled, the player "planeswalks away" from the current plane (put it on the bottom of its owner's planar deck) and he or she reveals the top card of his or her planar deck, which becomes the new plane that has been "planeswalked to." A player can roll the planar die as many times as he or she likes, but successive rolls cost an additional one mana for each time the planar die has been rolled this turn.

Other than the above, the normal rules of the game are followed, and Planechase can be adapted to any multiplayer variant.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Elimination

name: Lords of Vegas
description:
The Lords of Vegas 6-player base set is a new printing of the classic board game, expanded to support 2-6 players and including modernized graphic designs, plus all of the components from the Up! expansion.

In Lords of Vegas you start out with empty lots, build small casinos, and expand them as your bankroll grows. Your rivals can build next door, and they just might take you over with a clever paint job or a lucky roll of the dice. Buy, sell, trade, and gamble your way to the top as you build your empire along the storied Strip. Channel your inner casino mogul and build your piece of Paradise!

This new edition from the creators of the game features redesigned money, cards, tray, and more. All the rules and components are functionally the same as the classic edition, just with a fresh coat of paint in some cases. The new Lords of Vegas includes updated components and the 5 & 6-player expansion Up!, which lets players build their casinos in three dimensions, adding new stories as their towers compete for control of the sky. Here are some improvements in the new edition.

-Plays with 2-6 players.
-Contains 72 dice!
-Risers and the raise rule are included, at any player count.
-Streamlined property cards work seamlessly with Vegas, as well as the expansion boards for Americana.
-More reference cards with turn orders, replacing the less useful House and Player cards.
-Turn order has been streamlined based on years of player feedback.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Catch the Leader, Dice Rolling, Layering, Random Production, Tile Placement, Trading

name: Burke's Gambit: Salvager
description:
Promo from Dice Tower 2017 Indiegogo Campaign

Salvager character card says "Once per game, you may use a role card ability that has already been used."
categories: Bluffing, Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Negotiation, Party Game, Science Fiction
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Memory, Player Elimination, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers, Voting

name: Dice Fishing: Roll and Catch – Double Hook Mini-expansion
description:
Double Hook Mini-expansion is a 7-card expansion for Dice Fishing: Roll & Catch.
The expansion brings you 7 new Fish cards, and also introduces new variant rules to play the game - Reveal two Fish cards each round and you might catch both with one roll of your wagered dice!
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck

name: Merchants Cove: The Entertainer Crossover Pack
description:
Assume the role of a fantastical Bard on a journey for fame and glory. Enjoy a unique tempo-dial mechanism in your quest to be the best.

This character is a crossover character with the game Bardwood Grove, and can only be obtained by backing the Bardwood Grove Kickstarter campaign at any level that includes the Spirits of the Grove expansion or as an add-on in the Pledgemanager of the Merchants Cove campaign.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Silent Death Annex: Hostile Takeover
description:
From the back cover:

GOT ANY COLLATERAL?
The crowd fell silent as the powerful voice of President Martinez echoed across Espan space.
" The economic problems of Espan are caused by one factor: dependence on outside houses for assistance, most notably the,Kashmere Commonwealth. Reparation payments and lost tariffs are draining the Espan Economy...
" ...all debts owed by the Espan system are now null and void. No power will be repaid any debts, nor are any previous agreements still valid. We do this in defiance of the powers that would hold our economy hostage for their gain."

Hostile Takeover documents the presidential term of Pedro Martinez, his efforts to free Espan from the stifling yoke of Kashmere debt, and the war that resulted.

Hostile Takeover includes:
• 2 new Kashmere fighter wings
• 2 new Espan fighter wings
• 12 new scenarios with maps
• One new weapon system
• Four new Space Fighters:
-Agni
-Strata
-Prowler
-Surya
• One new Warhound:
-Kali
• One new Freighter:
-Astrahauler
• Six refited ships:
-Scorpion Beta
-Epping Beta
-Narwhal MK III
-Eagle Beta
-Kosmos 111
-Blood Hawk II
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Hexagon Grid

name: Pit: Tulip promo card
description: A set of nine tulip cards valued 70 thay you can use to add 1 extra player to the game. Free give-away from Repos matching their edition of Pit.
categories: Card Game, Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Farming, Party Game, Real-time
mechanics: Set Collection, Trading

name: Necromunda: The Book of Peril
description:
Necromunda: The Book of Peril explores the perilous wastes between the more established zones of the underhive. While gangs might fight for the fate of settlements, or become masters of prosperous holesteads and scrapyards, sometimes their constant turf wars take them into the desolate Badzones.

Venture into the Badzones, forge alliances with mighty guilds and add new Bounty Hunters to your gang – or even field a Venators gang made up entirely of Hired Guns – with this supplement to Necromunda.

Inside this 96-page hardback book, you'll discover the secrets of the guilds who hold the web of commerce in Necromunda's underhive together, as well as how to add them to your campaigns as fast allies – or bitter enemies – for your gangs. You'll learn about Venator gangs, coalitions of hired guns who band together for profit, protection or the joy of the hunt, and how to use them to cause havoc in your games. You'll be introduced to ten new Hired Guns, including rogue psykers, dashing heroes and many more.

The Badzones will open up to you as well, giving you new settings for your games, complete with new events to survive, hazards to avoid and scenarios to play across an expanded range of scenery. And when the battle is done, check out the Badzones Trading Post and all the new and exotic equipment available to give your gangs the edge over their opponents.

CONTENTS

The Great Web of Necromunda: Read up on the background of the guilds.
Venator gangs: Assemble a motley array of hired guns for your games.
Alliances: Team up with a guild for greater rewards… but at equally great risk.
Badzones Trading Post: Discover new weapons and wargear.
Badzones Battlefields: Play across new areas of the underhive – Ancient Manufactorum, Stygian Depths, Sump Sea, Dome Jungle, Warp-tainted, and Unstable Dome – complete with new events to encounter.
Badzones Terrain: Add Sector Mechanicus, Sector Imperialis and Death World scenery to your games.
Badzones Scenarios: Experience five new ways to play in the Badzones.
Hired Guns: Add Kal Jericho, Scabs, Freikstorn Strix, Arbelesta Raen Catallus, Aramista Dae Catallus, Mortanna Shroud, Apollus Kage, Thaetos 23-2, Rex Spires and Vorgen ‘Gunner’ Mortz to your gangs.


—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Warhammer 40,000 (Second Edition): Codex – Eldar
description:
The Warhammer 40,000 Codex books contain the complete rules for playing various armies in Warhammer 40,000. They also contain in-depth painting guides, army lists, and much more.


Codex: Eldar (2nd Edition) is an expansion book for the Games Workshop tabletop game Warhammer 40,000. This book was published for the first time in 1994, and is for the 2nd Edition of Warhammer 40,000.

The book has 96 pages and the cover is printed in color while the majority of the book remains in black and white, although there are usually several pages of colour images of miniatures.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Underwater Cities: Building Box Promo Card
description:
Building Box is a green endgame special building that costs 3 credits and grants you 12 VP if you have at least one building of each type (regular + upgraded) by the end if the game.

This promo card was given for free in Spielbox 01/2022 and the English Version of this card will also be part of the German Spielbox 06/2022 or 07/2022. (info from the publisher)
categories: Card Game, City Building, Civilization, Expansion for Base-game, Industry / Manufacturing, Nautical, Science Fiction
mechanics: End Game Bonuses, Hand Management, Income, Network and Route Building, Solo / Solitaire Game, Turn Order: Stat-Based, Worker Placement

name: Dungeon Fighter: Second Edition – Betty Loudscream Promo Hero
description:
A Kickstarter-exclusive Hero.

This "vampire metal queen" has a chilling self-healing skill: her "Blood Donation" ability allows her to "kindly ask" one of her teammates to "willingly donate" some of their life energy to her.

Card text: before a fight, Betty can force one of the other party members to lose 1 HP; if she does, she will gain 2 HP in return.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Party Game
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Player Elimination, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Player Powers

name: MicroMacro: Crime City – All In: In Hot Pursuit Of The Bank Robbers
description: An exclusive bonus case for MicroMacro: Crime City - All In. Was handed out with the base game at the fair in Essen 2022.
mechanics: Unspecified
publishers: Edition Spielwiese, Hard Boiled Games, MS Edizioni

name: 1833NE
description: 1833NE (called 1834 in prototype) is an 18xx game set in the Northeastern United States. The scale is significantly smaller than many 18xx games, and the game includes both standard and takeover versions. 1833NE is most like 1846 (and therefore has a linear stock market, multiple types of trains available at each phase, and paying for most track lays), but adds ferries and takeovers.
mechanics: Network and Route Building, Stock Holding, Tile Placement

name: Romolo o Remo? God Demands Expansion
description:
The Romolo o Remo? God Demands Expansion contains 18 game tiles in three categories: military, civilian, and economic. Each tile represents an objective that players can accomplish during the game. Scoring a tile allows a player to immediately gain 1 resource, in addition to victory points at the end of the game.

This expansion is in a limited edition available only for preorders and for the Essen Fair game launch.
categories: Ancient, City Building, Civilization, Expansion for Base-game, Territory Building
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Trading, Worker Placement

name: Fantastiqa: The Abandoned Abbey Adventure Expansion
description:
Fantastiqa: The Abandoned Abbey Adventure Expansion

Note: this expansion is compatible with both the original Enchanted Edition of Fantastiqa as well as the new Rucksack Edition. You must use one of these editions in order to play this expansion.

Press your luck to find treasure and glory by exploring the eerie Abandoned Abbey!

Components
• 18 Abandoned Abbey cards
• 4 Abandoned Abbey Quest Goal cards

Setup
• Shuffle all the Abandoned Abbey cards into a single deck and set them face down on the lower Open Quest space on the table. In the game you will still put out two Open Quests at a time as usual, along with +1 Bonus Tokens, but these cards will now go side-by-side in the upper space.
• Flip the top Abandoned Abbey card face-up.
• Use the Abandoned Abbey Quest Goal cards instead of the regular Quest Goals. These cards list possible victory conditions and length of game. Choose one before beginning play and return the others to the box.
• To win the game using the Abandoned Abbey expansion, you must acquire the number of Quest points shown on the Quest Goal PLUS the number of Abandoned Abbey cards indicated on it. Fulfill the conditions of any single line on the Quest Goal to win -- the game can be won using fewer Quest points and more Abandoned Abbey cards, or vice-versa.

Rules
1. Treat the Abandoned Abbey deck as a new kind of Quest.

• Players may explore the Abbey as their Turn Action (“Complete a
Quest”) if they occupy any of the four Regions diagonally adjacent to the Abandoned Abbey deck.
• Leave the Adventurer Standee in one’s current Region when exploring the Abbey.
• Because entering the Abandoned Abbey counts as one’s Turn Action, a player may not perform any Free Actions while in the Abbey. (Players may still perform Free Actions before and after.)

2. The Abbey is explored one card at a time. To do so, a player must discard a card symbol that matches the required symbol on the face-up Abandoned Abbey card. As with regular Quests, the symbol used must be an exact match -- using a “double-symbol wild” is not permitted. (Double-symbol cards and
Curious Companion cards work fine as long as one symbol matches.)

3. After discarding the matching card, set the top Abbey card to the side, face-up -- do not claim it yet -- along with the reward shown on top of the card.

4. Immediately draw one card from your personal deck, as indicated on the Abbey card, to replace the card you just played. (!)

5. You must now decide if you wish to keep exploring, or stop. You must make this decision before revealing the next Abandoned Abbey card!

6. If you decide to keep exploring, flip over the top card of the Abandoned Abbey.

• You must again discard a card with a symbol matching that on the face-up Abandoned Abbey card.
• If you succeed then return to step 3, above.
• If you fail, you lose all the Abandoned Abbey cards and rewards from this turn of exploration. This can mean losing multiple cards and rewards! (Do not lose anything already acquired in earlier turns of the game.)
• Return unclaimed rewards to the supply. Discard unclaimed Abbey
cards to the bottom of the Abandoned Abbey deck, face-up.

7. If you decide to stop exploring, then claim all the rewards and cards received in this exploration and add them to your supply (keep Abandoned Abbey cards separate from your deck; turn them face-down). Players should keep track of all the Abandoned Abbey cards that they collect. Sets of these cards apply towards victory as shown on the Abandoned Abbey Quest Goal card. Combine totals for partnership games. Each player (or partnership) may collect no more than 7 Abandoned Abbey cards in total.

8. End the turn. No matter how the exploration ends, make sure that the top Abandoned Abbey card is turned face up after the turn action ends.

9. If Abandoned Abbey cards are ever depleted, reshuffle them to form a new face-down draw deck.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Point to Point Movement, Push Your Luck, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Set Collection, Team-Based Game

name: Genesis 48: The First Arab-Israeli War
description:
Genesis 48 is an expansion to the Advanced Squad Leader game system.

From the game sleeve:
"Genesis 48 tells the story of a war unlike any before or since. Kibbutzniks defending their homes, fighting alongside their wives. Homemade armored cars trundling into battle. Davidka mortar shells exploding with terrifying shrapnel--due to the soft metal used in the underground shops--with unexpectedly deadly results. The 1948 siege of Jerusalem. Numerous, well-equipped but poorly organized Arab armies.

It's all here in Genesis 48 in a well-researched and extensive module presentation. Three sheets of color die-cut counters include 20 troop-types ranging from elite Israeli Palmach soldiers to Moslem Brotherhood conscripts. Israeli Molotov Tank Hunting Heroes. And more. You also receive numerous new vehicles, including 3 types of Israeli Homemade armored cars, Davidka and Parosh mortars, the Marmon Herrington IV, Jewish 'Sandwich Car' APC, and a variety of half-tracks up-armed with small turrets and a variety of armaments. You also receive a 22" x 34" historical map of Old Jerusalem, a color overlay of a kibbutz, three color card-stock play aids and a 32-page VARIANT rulebook full of vehicle and ordnance notes. All of this equipment is provided to use with the Jerusalem Campaign Game and the 15 well-tested scenarios provided." (Ownership of ASL, Beyond Valor, Hollow Legions, and Croix de Guerre is necessary to play this game).


Second Edition - GENESIS II The Arab Israeli Wars

From the Publisher:
GENESIS '48 2nd Edition aims to polish every rough edge of its predecessor, while adding value in the form of new counters and situations. Rules such as the "Molotov Tank Hunting Hero" and others have been streamlined. Squad types have been reduced appropriately and redundancy in rules addressing their use edited down. Scenarios continue to use mostly non-desert, daytime situations and are moderate to small in size and play on geomorphic boards. An all new Kibbutz geo board is provided and a separate JERUSALEM '48 historical map-based module is coming with a fully remastered map that utilizes larger hexes than its predecessor. Thus, GENESIS '48 2nd Edition is a 100% geomorphic board product with 16 exciting scenarios and a LARGE COLLECTION of 1000+ of new counters! In keeping with the CH approach used in the Berlin and Omaha releases successfully, all you'll need to own is your ASLRB and a collection of marker counters. EVERYTHING YOU NEED in terms of color, die-cut counters is provided in GENESIS '48 2nd Edition! Punch it out and play, no more hunting through tray after tray of old counters to get into the action.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Modern Warfare, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Line of Sight, Simulation

name: Latitude 90: The Origin
description:
L90: The Origin is a social deduction game inspired by Werewolf and Mafia, but focused on everyone playing until the end.

You are researchers at an Antarctic research station. Beneath the ice, something has awoken... One of your team members has become infected, and is now "The Origin." They are toying with the other researchers -- luring them with clues about his or her identity. But if the researchers make a misstep, they will become infected themselves, joining The Origin and spreading their infection to the others. Survive, or become a minion of The Origin.
mechanics: Events, Real-Time

name: Mi Mic
description:
You can mime as many words of "subject", "action" or "object" as you like. Your teammates must guess them and make with them all the craziest sentence possible. But beware, if you risk too much and the time runs out, you will lose everything.

Playing by teams in your turn you have to roll the dice and take as many cards as it showed. Then, turn down the sand clock and you have to mime all the cards. When your mates guess them, they have to construct a sentence with all of them to win the cards. If done, you can choose to roll the dice again and take new cards but if your time ends before they get the words and the sentence, you will lose the cards and some of yours yet won. At the end of the game, team with most cards is the winner.
mechanics: Acting

name: Castle Panic: Engines of War – Jury-Rig Promo
description: Play this card as any one Resource. Declare which one when committing.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Medieval
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Cooperative Game, Hand Management

name: Base Roll
description:
A baseball/softball themed dice and card game.

There are three levels of gameplay: Rookie, Professional, and All-Star. The Rookie level is the basic level using only dice, while the other two levels add cards, which add levels of strategy. As a bonus, this game will teach you the game of baseball as you play. If you don't know baseball, it's still easy to learn Base Roll.

Each team uses three dice to roll combinations that move their players around four bases to score points. Using your dice and cards, you can affect rolls and block potential base hits, bunts, and even home runs!

The game lasts 9 rounds (innings) and the player with the most runs wins the game.

-description from publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling

name: The Girl and the Robot: The Card Game
description:
Take on the role of the girl and the robot as you battle the evil queen in this strategic card game inspired by concepts from Russian roulette and classic shedding card games.

Plan strategies with your ally, deceive your opponents and play cards at key moments to avoid death by the demon.

Basic Gameplay:

Each player takes turns one after the other.
Draw a card at the end of your turn, if it’s a Demon, you’re dead.
When you play in teams, if both you and your ally die, you lose the game.
To prevent this from happening, use your character’s Abilities, play Action and Weapon cards during your turn.


—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Fantasy, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Player Elimination, Push Your Luck, Set Collection, Take That

name: Evolution: Venom
description:
Promo cards created for The Secret Cabal 2018 Kickstarter campaign. Contains 7 Venom trait cards for the base game, Evolution.

Venom
Disregard Body Size when attacking.
This species may only make 1 attack during each Feeding Phase.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Educational, Environmental, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Prehistoric
mechanics: Action Points, Hand Management, Push Your Luck, Secret Unit Deployment, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection, Take That

name: Chandigarh
description:
In 1951, the Indian government commissioned the renowned architect Le Corbusier to design a new capital for the state of Punjab. Thus, Chandigarh was born.

In the game Chandigarh, players in the role of urban planners are in charge of building this modern city from scratch. They will construct buildings, try to take advantage of buildings constructed by others, use the abilities of the different municipal employees, and try to position themselves in the key locations of the city, all with the aim of achieving the patterns of the plans they have chosen. Whoever scores the most prestige points wins.

In more detail, the city of Chandigarh is represented by a 4x4 grid of sector tiles, with each sector having multiple plots. These sectors intersect at junctions, with the edges of these tiles creating streets between the sectors. You each start with a project card that shows an arrangement of buildings, along with two different colored buildings from the four colors available; your architect starts on a junction in the city.

On a turn, you can move your architect up to the total numbers of footprints on your active project cards, stopping at each junction (if you wish) to place a building from your reserve on an empty plot next to a street that's adjacent to the junction you occupy. If you occupy the final plot of a sector, place one of your supervisors on this tile. Alternatively, on a turn you can choose a new project card from the display, placing it on the left or right side of your row of active project cards and taking buildings from the reserve based on the card you just placed and the card adjacent to it. If you now have four cards in a row, you immediately score the card at the opposite end of the row from the card you just placed. Score the points listed on this card each time the pattern on it occurs in the city.

Four specialist tokens start in the corners of the city, and if you construct a building of the specialist's color in the sector where they are located, you gain the power of that specialist for the remainder of the game and move them to a different sector. Each specialist has six different abilities, some that score you bonus points and others that give you special powers during play.
mechanics: Pattern Building, Point to Point Movement

name: Rewild
description:
Rewild is a light solitaire tile-laying game in which you (nature) are shaping and restoring a once intensively farmed land to a wilder state, creating habitats for rare and diverse wildlife.

Each tile has 4 areas featuring 3 types of habitat: woodland, scrubland and wetland. The tokens represent wildlife of different habitats and values.

Tiles are laid (offset to one another by 1 area) to create spaces that are surrounded by habitats on all 4 sides. Once such a space is made, a wildlife token is placed in it.
There are rules around the order in which tokens are placed and how the player can manipulate it.

At the end of the game the wildlife score points based on their value and how much of their preferred habitat surrounds them, and also for the largest area of each habitat.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Matching, Pattern Building, Solo / Solitaire Game, Tile Placement

name: Tramways: the Heart of Commerce
description:
This is the second set of mini expansions for Tramways.

It contains:

2 new modular boards with a new type of land — the rivers
10 blue discs for a new actions during the action phase
5 Ticket inspectors


This expansion is released in a blue cover flap.
mechanics: Network and Route Building, Pick-up and Deliver

name: Assembly: Re-Sequence & Override
description:
Re-Sequence & Override brings 2 fresh new challenges which will test even the most experienced of Assembly players. The computer is now trying to take over the assembly line. Will you still escape? A new double expansion for Assembly, mixing up the rules and introducing Robomeeples. Base game is required.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Puzzle, Science Fiction
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Modular Board, Push Your Luck

name: Bastille: Queenie 2
description:
Bastille: Queenie 2 includes new mid- and endgame scoring tiles that change the conditions for what scores and what is most valuable to collect throughout the game. Players can choose to play with only the new scoring tiles or shuffle them with the tiles from the base game and randomly draw for the game set-up.

Additionally, new round tiles are added to the game that give more variety to the bonus provided for having the most flags.
categories: Age of Reason, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Set Collection

name: DuploHex
description:
DuploHex is a connection game, related to Hex, that includes disc and rings. In order to play DuploHex you need a 7×7 Hex board, 25 black and 25 white rings, and 25 black and 25 white discs.

White starts by placing one disc or ring on any cell of the board. Then, each player in turn must perform two actions: 1. add one of her discs to an empty cell or move one of her discs on the board into any ring located in a neighbor cell, and 2. add one of her rings to an empty cell or move one of her rings on the board to a neighbor cell occupied by a disc. The disc-ring pair (a disc inside a ring) cannot be modified for the rest of the game.

The game ends the moment that a player establishes a chain of her discs or rings connecting the two opposing sides of the board marked by her color.
mechanics: Pattern Building

name: Castlevania: Nocturne of the Tabletop
description:
Unofficial fan-made board game based on the Castlevania series, previously available to download as a free print and play until Konami demanded in November 2018 that it be taken down.

The game is mostly co-op, and loosely based on Castlevania 2: Simon's Quest. 2-6 players work together to fight their way through the castle while a curse is slowly killing all of them. The goal is to move through the castle, fighting monsters and overcoming various traps and other events, to gather 5 parts of Dracula's body. Bring them to the tower to resurrect Dracula and break the curse before time runs out, and then, hopefully, kill him again to win the game.

13 playable characters to choose from, each with their own deck of unique weapons and skills which are gradually unlocked throughout the game, and plenty of monsters, events, and items, so that no two games are exactly the same.
categories: Adventure, Horror, Print & Play, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Open Drafting

name: Dwar7s Winter: The Legendary Expansion
description:
This is an expansion for Dwar7s Winter, a cooperative "tower defense" game in the Dwar7s family.

This expansion adds new rules and 3 legendary classes of dwarves, as well as compatibility with Dwar7s Spring (includes "The Legendary Conversion Pack").
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Points, Area Majority / Influence, Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management

name: Banditen!
description:
"Banditen!" it is a tactical wargame covering two battles between Italian Partisans and forces of the R.S.I (Repubblica Sociale Italiana).

Tarnova is a simulation of the battle fought on 19-21 January 1945 at Tarnova della Selva, near Gorizia.

Gravellona Toce is a simulation of the battle fought on 12-14 December 1944 at Gravellona Toce, 110 km NE of Torino.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Line of Sight, Movement Points, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Variable Set-up

name: Genotype: Alternative Inheritance Pattern Overlays
description: Two Alternative Inheritance Pattern Overlays introduce new Research Goals. The Codominance Overlay adds a Purple and White Flower Research Goal, and the Incomplete Dominance Overlay adds a Medium Height Research Goal.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Sagrada: Promo 8 – Apollo/Godfather Window Pattern Card
description:
Play this card to complete your goal.
Ref : Sagrada-PROM-8 Apollo and Godfather.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Fleet Commander: Avatar
description:
Fleet Commander: Avatar

As the conflict between the "League of Phoebe" and the "Hegemony of Amycles" intensified, great leaders emerged to impose their views of warfare. Some of them earned their leadership by their zeal, their determination, or their ingenuity -- while others simply took power from their defeated opponents. However, one thing nobody dares to contest, is that each of them has their own distinct advantage to lead these huge fleets to victory.

Avatar is an expansion for ''Fleet Commander: Genesis'' that will allow players to add to their fleet the heavy battleships and commanders which give bonuses during any battle. It also contains new terrain tiles and special weapons.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hand Management

name: Magic: The Gathering – Odyssey
description:
Take a 100-year leap forward to a harsh Dominaria, where deadly pit fighting is the new world order. Odyssey features new mechanics designed to harness the power of your graveyard. It also marks the beginning of a new trilogy, with all-new races and locales.

This 350-card, black-bordered set includes randomly inserted foil premium cards and two new graveyard-based mechanics: Flashback and Threshold.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Hand Management

name: Railroad Rivals: Robber Baron Expansion
description: The Robber Baron Expansion adds new content to the game. Also adds everything to allow 6 Railroad Rivals to play the game.
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver

name: Snowdonia: The Lord Mayor's State Coach
description:
A promo card give away at Essen 2016.

This card acts as a "train" card and can be used in place of one during the setup.

Card detail: Comes with 1 ore, 1 stone, 1 coal, and 1 rubble. It is worth 3 VP. Additionally, player taking this card gets the First Player marker. Owner may pay one coal at the start of a round to gain a temporary laborer for the round.
mechanics: Worker Placement

name: Fireteam Zero: Monster Pack C
description:
Think you've seen the the worst that the Artifacts can throw at you?

Not even close.

Challenge your squad with these all new creatures for Fireteam Zero, each with their own unique and devastating abilities!

Contains a miniatures and monster reference card for each of these creatures:


Marrow Fetch x4
Exhumed Fetch
Splinter Fiend
categories: Adventure, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror, Miniatures, World War II
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Storytelling, Variable Player Powers
publishers: Emergent Games (II), Play & Win, Ulisses Spiele

name: Face Off!
description:
Effectively, a version of pit where the players call for cards using specific sounds instead of numbers.

You are on a wild adventure in a far-away land, trading gems with strange and exotic natives. The scene is frantic! All around you, people are clucking like chickens, oinking like pigs, bulging their eyes, sticking out their tongues. They're using wild native signals to bargain for rubes, jade, emeralds, pearls... nowits time for you to join the action. Get read for some fast and frantic fun! Its Face Off!

Everyone is trading gem-cards fast! Be first to collect all nine cards of a single gem and you'll win the riches!

Quick, how many cards do you need for a complete set? Use the wild Trading Signals to let your opponent know!

Need one card? Then cluck like a chicken! Need two cards? Oink like a pig! Need three cards? "Baaaa-baaaa" like a lamb! Need four cards? "Gobble" like a turkey!

Trade cards with anyone who signals the same number back to you. Everyone keeps trading cards, fast, 'til someone has all nine cards of a single gem. It's a frantic race to the finish!
categories: Action / Dexterity, Humor, Party Game, Real-time
mechanics: Hand Management, Simultaneous Action Selection, Trading

name: Age of Steam Expansion: Heavy Cardboard
description:
This map was put together to commemorate the 1 year anniversary of Heavy Cardboard podcast, a podcast about heavy boardgames. The city and town names used on this map are boardgames featured or discussed in Heavy Cardboard podcasts.

This map is intended to be fairly open with plenty of space for route building and goods availability. The Heavy Cardboard hex in the center of the map acts as a cube fountain generating new goods every round making it an important location as there is no production action with this map.

A new special action, "Heavy Lifting", adds the ability to deliver over land between Cities. This adds some interesting decisions for players during the game.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Trains, Transportation
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Network and Route Building, Pick-up and Deliver, Tile Placement

name: Burgenland
description: This is the wooden version of Terra Turrium or the oldest forerunner of Torres (game of the year 2000). It was published 1986 by ABRA in a very beautiful wooden version.
mechanics: Action Points, Tile Placement

name: Hitler's Fire Brigade
description:
Hitler's Fire Brigade is a supplement to Flames of War: The World War II Miniatures Game, The World War II miniatures battle system. This book provides complete organization and equipment for German armored forces on the Eastern Front. This includes Panzerkompanies, Panzergrenadierkompanies, and variants for both reconnaissance and engineering companies.

New rules for Tiger heavy tanks, minefields, barbed wire, and fortifications are are all included. Also includes a comprehensive painting guide, color photos, historical commentary, a new mission, and a tactics guide.
mechanics: Simulation

name: Doomgloom Dungeon
description:
The dungeons of Doomgloom are said to be treacherous, in fact, those “brave adventurers” who’ve said “Doomgloom dungeon? No problem.” have never been seen again.

No one knows what lies in Doomgloom dungeon as no one has ever returned to tell the tale but you’re about to change all that. Having trained for many years and been through many adventures you think it’s time you tackled the ultimate adventure that is Doomgloom Dungeon.

Doomgloom Dungeon is a light and quick solo 'card dungeon crawler' that will take around 10 to 15 minutes to play. You will be playing cards and rolling dice in order to beat the various Dungeon cards that appear.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management

name: Vinyl: British Invasion
description:
The British Invasion is a Vinyl band expansion that builds on the base game of Vinyl and introduces the Listening Booth and singles (aka 45s). Historically, 45s were purchased to initially and eventually encouraged buyers to acquire the associated LP album or even another album from the band. In BI, players can acquire 45s by matching the band icon. Each 45 has an "A-side" with locked attributes that can be unlocked at the Listening Booth. At the Listening Booth, players will discard a magazine card with one matching icon to flip the 45 to its "B-side" giving the player more points and the opportunity to use the 45 to acquire LPs with similar attributes in future rounds. BI leverages the same collection rewards system (Pure, Mixed, Double Mixed) that comes in the base game and can be further integrated with Top Shelf, Publisher Expansion, Clearance Bin, or even the memorabilia from Masters of Metal!

For 6 the new bands (Half & Half, Lead Balloon, Scarabs, The What, Rolling Bones, Pink Fluid), the following is included in this expansion:

66 Magazine Cards
72 LP Album Cards
24 45s Cards


—description from the publisher
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection

name: East Indiaman: Solo and 5 player
description:
1. Solo expansion:

For solo game, you will play against the dummy player John.
Whenever John performs an action, he is not required to spend or use any resource. In addition, he also ignores the effects of empty spots on the pirate alert track.

John's action will be determined by the action marker, the dummy player action tile and the result of the die roll.
For a more challenging game, you can play against John on B side of the dummy player action tiles; the more rounds you play against John on B side of the action tiles, the harder the game will become.

2. 5 player expansion:

In a 5 player game, after the first player has been determined during the game preparations, the 5th player in player order will place two additional tokens in his/her reserve area.

When scoring for arms level at game and, in a 5 player game, each player will receive 2 points for each other player that falls behind on the arms level track.

—description from the publiser
mechanics: Action Points, Area Majority / Influence, Set Collection, Trading, Worker Placement

name: Head for Glory
description:
Head for Glory is a fast-paced arena fighting-game set in an alternate-reality of ancient Rome, where headless Romans compete for the right to rule the empire as the new Caesar.

Each player enters the fight headless and has to choose out of a pool of 9 different heads, each with a unique ability or attack modifier. But the powers you choose may change by the swing of a sword. As you get decapitated you lose your powers and have to re-evaluate your strategy by changing heads.

When entering the final stage of the fight, Caesar's head enters the arena and grants the bearer special abilities. The fighter who can defend the head while not being decapitated, wins the game.

Determine your fighting style by enhancing your character traits. Your style will evolve during combat as you get to know the benefits of each trait and how to combine your abilities. Plan your attacks by moving on the hex-grid and by creating synergies of card-based abilities combined with your head abilities.

Expand your tableau and build your dice-pool. Draft your abilities, choose your fighting style and master each matchup as you play.
categories: Ancient, Card Game, Dice, Fighting, Miniatures
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: É Top!? Natureza
description:
In É Top!? each round a new Top 10 category is revealed and players must guess something from the list. You don't win the game just knowing the answers, because you can earn points by contesting the guesses that you consider wrong. Just be careful, because if you contest a correct guess, you are the one who will lose...

This new version of É Top!? features cards with themes from the animal, mineral and plant kingdoms and can be played alone or combined with other versions of the game.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Deduction

name: Shogun no Katana: Promo Tiles
description:
During the Game Setup, shuffle the 4 tiles and randomly place them in the last spaces of each row in the Academy.
The first player whose Decorateur reaches the last space of a row removes the tile and immediately resolves its effect.
mechanics: Variable Set-up

name: Book It!: The Pro Wrestling Promoter Card Game – The Gorilla Expansion
description:
Step Into Gorilla

The first expansion for Book It! adds over seventy new cards and a brand new mechanic: Production Cards! Work towards hidden objectives that will boost your bankroll, reputation, or give you other helpful bonuses!

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Sports
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Open Drafting

name: Teruel: Turning point of the Spanish Civil War
description:
"Winter of 1937. Madrid, the republican capital, is threatened by an imminent nationalist attack. To recover the initiative the Republican high command decides to launch a strong offensive to occupy the city of Teruel. Among heavy snow, 30,000 Republican soldiers march from their positions; the battle that will decide the fate of the war begins."

Teruel is tactical level game depicting the two months of hard fighting over Teruel.

The game includes 216 counters representing Battalion and Brigade sized units and command units up to Corp level of the Republican ("Levante")and Nationalist ("Norte") armies in the area of Teruel. The counters are in the style of Spanish Civil War military symbols representing cavalry, infantry, armor, artillery, etc. Five separate scenarios are presented, including a solo scenario (Plan T).
mechanics: Area Movement, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling

name: Underwater Cities: MvM Island Facility Promo Card
description:
Promotional card offered by the "Man Vs Meeple Season 3 Kickstarter".

In Production phase you may use 1 of your displayed action cards. It could be used or unused already. You receive 1 VP in addition.
categories: Card Game, City Building, Civilization, Expansion for Base-game, Industry / Manufacturing, Nautical, Science Fiction
mechanics: Income, Network and Route Building, Turn Order: Stat-Based, Worker Placement

name: FNG
description:
FNG lets you lead a unit of soldiers during their tour of duty in Vietnam during 1967. Players can play U.S. Army, Marines, Special Forces, Australian SAS or Communist troops. The game can be played as a straight one on one wargame or co-op with the mechanics of the game running the other force. The campaign system involves getting your men through their year in country in one piece and sees your squad develop from "cherry" to veteran during the course of the campaign. Additional rules cover helicopter insertions, tunnel fighting, riverine warfare, booby traps, and air strikes. FNG can be played in any scale with any models.

Re-implemented by:

FNG: Second Tour
categories: Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Vietnam War, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling

name: Fields of Honor
description:
Fields of Honor - an Historical Simulation of Warfare in the 19th Century" is a set of miniatures rules for recreating the wars from 1843 to 1902 in five different unit scales from section to brigade.

The 120-page book contains army lists and weapon data for 21 different wars, including the Crimean War, Mexican-American War, Americal Civil War, Franco-Prussian War, most British colonial wars and the Boxer Rebellion. Five scenarios are also included: Alma, Isandhlwana, Gravelotte-St. Privat, Khartoum and Little Big Horn.

The rules later inspired two sequels - FoH: the American War for Independence and FoH: WWII.
categories: American Civil War, Book, Miniatures, Post-Napoleonic, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Simulation

name: Imperial Starmada Sourcebook
description:
From the website.....

"So it was with a sense of relief, rather than concern, that the citizens of Terra watched the ascension to power of Purser Wheylan.

"To them, the one-time opposition leader offered a chance for humanity to pull itself from the ashes, and more importantly, for Terra to take back her rightful place as the center of human civilization…"
—Vicar Buros (AA +315- )

Welcome to the Imperial Starmada Sourcebook, the first in what is hoped to be a long series of setting books in support of the Starmada game.

These pages describe the universe of the Imperial Starmada: the interstellar naval arm of the Terran military. Although in a state of uneasy peace with its immediate neighbors, the Starmada is now faced with its greatest threat—an alien power of unknown size, strength, and intention. Can the Terrans summon a coalition to face down this new adversary, or will old enmities force the Empire to its knees?

In addition to historical background for five different factions in the Starmada universe, the Imperial Starmada Sourcebook includes:

* Thirty starship designs for the Starmada and its major adversaries;
* New starship options and weapon traits, including anti-fighter batteries, overthrusters, limited ammunition, and more;
* Rules for three-dimensional movement and combat interception;
* The "Simplest Campaign System"; and
* A complete board game that can be used as a scenario generator for Starmada.

The Imperial Starmada Sourcebook is not a stand-alone product; ownership of the Starmada Admiralty Edition Core Rulebook is required.

Expands:

Starmada: The Admiralty Edition
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Print & Play, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Operations Special Issue #3
description:
Operations Special Issue #3 contains Fury in the East, Starvation Island, and Warriors of God: War by Proxy.

It also includes ASL material.

The Hell's Corner SSR rules with a 25.5 x 22" Guadalcanal Map.
5 Hell's Corner Scenarios:

HC1 First Matanikau, Guadalcanal 19 August 1942
HC2 Bailey's demise, Guadalcanal 26 September 1942
HC3 Samurai sunset, Guadalcanal 8 October 1942
HC4 Whaling good time, Guadalcanal 9 October 1942
HC5 The sand spit, Guadalcanal 23 October 1942


The five scenarios depict confrontation between American and Japanese troops around Matanikau Village and One Log Bridge, Guadalcanal.

Aditionally there are two independent SK scenarios:

S35 The Volga is reached!, Stalingrad, Russia 14 September 1942
S36 Satisfaction and confidence, Slobodka, Russia 25 June 1944


The first SK scenario depicts one of the first German assaults on Stalingrad's Volga ferry landings.
The second SK scenario depicts a heavy armor clash during Operation Bagration.

Read more: Operations Special Magazine.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid

name: Warhammer Age of Sigmar: General's Handbook 2017
description:
The General’s Handbook 2017 is the definitive resource for every Warhammer Age of Sigmar gamer. However you play, the book is packed with new content that’ll make your battles more balanced, more exciting and more fun than ever before:

Inside the book, you’ll find:


Powerful new allegiance abilities for 15 factions, including the Seraphon, Fyreslayers and Hosts of Slaanesh
Allies rules that allow you to add your favourite models to your army without losing your faction’s Battle Traits
Updated matched play profiles, including points changes, new battleline units for every army and updated rules of one based on feedback from the community and extensive playtesting
Tons of new battleplans, including a totally overhauled set of matched play scenarios to test your tactical abilities
Rules for running multiplayer games, from epic clashes to deceiving your friends in Triumph & Treachery


This book is set to be revolutionary for Warhammer Age of Sigmar – get your copy and get ready for a new era of gaming in the Mortal Realms.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Haunt the House: Darker Corners
description:
Expansion for Haunt the house.

Add new rooms / hunters / scare cards / ghost

The new rooms :

Armoury : Take one of your played Phantoms back into your hand

Master Bedroom : Pick a player; that player may not BOO on their next turn

Stables : Remove one of your own Ghost hunters from the game. Draw one randomly from the deck to replace it

GreenHouse : Reveal scares from your deck until you reveal the second of a matching pair. Take all revealed cards into your hand.

The new Scare cards :

Courage Cards, these cards can only be played invisibly. During a BOO, when the invisible scares are revealed, rewards are doled out as normal, then any revealed Courage Card eliminates 1 Scare of the matching type. Then that Courage card is removed from the game!

The new Ghost :

Possessing : Pick a player; take one of their played Phantoms into your hand. Placre this card in front of that player as if they'd played it.

Wild : Play when finishing a BOO; this phantom count as any one scare of your choice.

Terrifying : Remove one room's ghost hunter from the game. Discard all Scares from that room then draw a fresh ghost hunter for the room.

Wandering : Trigger the power of any currently active Room as if you'd played a visible Scare there.

The New Ghost Hunters :

The professionals are calm, cool, and they need more Scares to be frightened out than your average Ghost Hunter. They don't carry the typical sorts of gear, either... each Professional is worth a cool 5 points in Skulls, and, when a Professional arrives in a Room, you draw a random Phantom and place it face down in the Room.
Any time a Bad Boo happens to this Pro, another random Phantom is added to their Room (these experts are very good at capturing spooks, you see)! Whoever eventually manages to frighten out the Pro collects the card of course, and also all Phantoms from the Room.
mechanics: Hand Management, Push Your Luck, Set Collection

name: Aeronautica Imperialis: Rynn's World Air War Campaign Book
description:
When Waaagh! Snagrod descended upon Rynn’s World, it heralded a conflict so devastating that it led to the near destruction of the Crimson Fists Chapter. The Rynn’s World Air War Campaign book enables you to refight the brutal aerial battles fought over the course of the war between the Imperial Navy and the Ork Flyboyz.

This 88-page hardback campaign book includes the following information (and more!):

- The full Aeronautica Imperialis game rules, including how to build your force using Squadron Lists, how to perform Ace Manoeuvres, field different classes of aircraft and unleash ground defences. Learn how to manoeuvre your aircraft, adjust their altitude and change speed while avoiding the risks of crashing and breaking up (if you exceed your maximum speed). There are even rules for special manoeuvres including landing, taxiing, and taking-off.
- In an-depth background on the infamous war that took place when Waaagh! Snagrod fell upon Rynn's World, the homeworld of the Crimson Fists Space Marines Chapter.
- Six narrative scenarios set, each with descriptions of how these relate to the War for Rynn's World and optional special rules that can be used to accurately reflect that war.
- Rules for campaign play, including how to replace destroyed aircraft, and level up your pilots as they gain experience.
- Squadron Lists, providing details of the following aircraft, including their weapon options and special rules: Thunderbolt Fighter, Thunderbolt Fury Fighter, Marauder Bomber, Marauder Destroyer, Dakkajet, Fighta Bommer, Eavy Bommer, and Grot Bommer.
- Rules for ground assets such as the Hydra Flak Battery, Manticore Missile Battery, Flak Platform, and 'Eavy Flak Kannon.
- Rules for the following legendary ace pilots: Flight Commander Dagor-Jarni, Flight Lieutenant Gale Barret, Da Black Baron, and Sky Boss Toofkraker – each including a profile of their aircraft and special rules.
- Example colour schemes of Imperial Navy and Ork aircraft.
- A reference page showing the 8 different manoeuvres aircraft can take, as well as a 2-page quick reference containing the key game rules.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Sentinels of Earth Prime: Sub-Terra
description: Sub-Terra is the strange realm deep beneath the surface of Earth-Prime, where the Serpent People and Morlocks engaged in a long and brutal war. It is a place of monsters, myth, and menaces spawned from both science and sorcery.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Photoghasts: The Haunted Photo Game
description:
Dare you take on the haunted terrors that reside within each Photoghast?
Photoghast is a 42 card set with 30 Augmented Reality Photoghast character cards and 12 action cards.

The assigned dealer, shuffles and subsequently splits the pack by the set number of players (up to 4) laying the cards face down. The 30 Photoghast cards are split into the equal number of players playing. With each player also dealt a set number of ‘action cards.’ Then, the dealer launches the Photoghast app on their phone.

Once the game begins, each player takes turns in scanning their cards in the allocated time in the hope of exorcising or ‘fading’ each photo. Exorcise as many ghosts as possible. But beware, that camera shutter can stick, allowing more ghosts to be scanned by your opponent. Or even worse, you might scan the wrong card unleashing the ghost trapped inside.

Each card has its own point value system and every time one is scanned it’s very own custom animation will be triggered.

Oh and here’s the scary part. Play the game after 9pm and you run the risk of disturbing the original Photographer, which adds additional dangers. There's a 'safe' mode to allow you to play the game as usual after 9pm.

The game ends when the decks have been exhausted. The player who has exorcised the most ghosts wins.
mechanics: Real-Time, Solo / Solitaire Game, Turn Order: Pass Order

name: Night Parade of a Hundred Yokai: Ronin Yokai Clans Promo Pack
description:
Originally available during the Dice Tower 2022 Kickstarter Pack A.
Now included in the Monkey King Expansion

It includes two new clans:


Yogen no Tori (3 cards)
Mononoke (3 cards)


Seven cards total including the rules card.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Hidden Victory Points

name: Wayfarers of the South Tigris: Townsfolk Promo Cards
description:
Originally available in Pack Bard from Dice Tower 2023 Kickstarter campaign.

A set of 4 promo cards (+1 rules card).

Inventor/Physician:
Copy the dice placement space above, including all required assets, costs, and effects.

Teacher:
When the above vista activates, activate it a second time.

Writer:
Resolve the immediate effect of the above open water card again.

—description from the publisher
categories: Arabian, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Medieval
mechanics: Set Collection, Worker Placement with Dice Workers, Worker Placement, Different Worker Types

name: Bitaak
description:
Bitaak is a climbing game for 3 players, where you bid to face-off against a team of two to see who will shed out first.
It is in the same family as Dou Dizhou (Fight the landlord) and Big Three.
It uses easier to remember meld combos and a non-standard deck with 3 jokers.
The game name comes from a slang expression used in Bangalore Kannada. Bitaak means Let it go.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Ladder Climbing, Trick-taking

name: Flamecraft: Stuff the Magic Dragon
description:
A new shop has opened up in town and this one has a soft squishy center...

Stuff the Magic Dragon is a charming toy shop filled with delightful plush and soft toys to delight the children, and grownups, of the town!

It is a CARDBOARD ALCHEMY EXCLUSIVE, featuring artwork from Sandara Tang.

Featuring one promo shop card, Stuff the Magic Dragon, to add to your game. This promo is only available in English.

—description from the publisher
categories: Animals, Card Game, City Building, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Contracts, Modular Board

name: Giant Monster Rampage 2: World War
description:
(From the Book)

The battle rages on in the sequel to our huge hit Giant Monster Rampage. So pick up your favorite monster toy and join the war. The MCCC is sending in the troops and this time you get to command the massive array of powerful military forces as well. In GMR 2: World War you will find:

Rules for military troops and vehicles to assault the giant monsters.

Expanded kingdoms and added powers.

New environments like fighting in space or on the moon.

Rules to create terrible swarms of monsters.

New campaign and battle rules for on-going play

Additional optional close combat rules.

And much more!

Expands:

Giant Monster Rampage
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Rolling Realms: Risky Rewards
description:
With this mini expansion, you can boost your games of Rolling Realms.

Each round, players can use a number of Rewards that give additional possibilities for gaining resources and scoring stars.
The pack comes with 6 unique new abilities (of which 2 are used each round), and player cards in all 6 player colors.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Unspecified

name: The Siege of Alesia
description:
The Battle of Alesia took place in September 52 BC around the Gallic oppidum of Alesia. Situated probably atop Mont Auxois, above modern Alise-Sainte-Reine in France, but this location does not fit Caesar's description of the battle. A number of alternatives have been proposed over time, among which Chaux-des-Crotenay (in Jura in modern France) only remains as challenger today. This battle was fought by the army of the Roman Republic commanded by Julius Caesar, aided by cavalry commanders Mark Antony, Titus Labienus and Gaius Trebonius, against a confederation of Gallic tribes united under the leadership of Vercingetorix of the Averni.
Alesia was the last major engagement between Gauls and Romans, and marked the turning point of the Gallic Wars in favour of Rome. The siege of Alesia is considered one of Caesar's greatest military achievements, and is still one of the classic examples of siege warfare and circumvallation.
Now, in this game free to download and play, as Caesar, You will defend a system of ramparts, forts and awesome fortifications with units representing legion cohorts, leaders, archers, Germanic cavalry and, as Vergingetorix, you will assault the Roman besiegers with infantry and cavalry units from 46 Gallic tribes. The game system comes from the Ancients freeware game with some modifications.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Simulation, Zone of Control

name: The Dragon and The Cross
description: The Dragon and The Cross is a remake of Manchu: The Taiping Rebellion (S&T #116). This remake is newly added event cards.
mechanics: Chit-Pull System, Hexagon Grid

name: The Quest for El Dorado: 2023 Promo Pack
description:
This promo pack was part of the Spielbox issue #1 from 2023. It contains a collection of old promos - The Quest for El Dorado: Promo Pack – Letter of Recommendation in its entirety and 2 of the 3 modules from The Quest for El Dorado: Promo Pack – Telegram.

3x Botanist (previously part of the "Letter of Recommendation"-Promo Pack)
3x Elevation Map (previously part of the "Telegram"-Promo Pack)
3x Missionary (previously part of the "Telegram"-Promo Pack)
3x Trail Chart (previously part of the "Letter of Recommendation"-Promo Pack)
4x Letter of Recommendation (previously part of the "Letter of Recommendation"-Promo Pack)

The cards are language independent, rules are in 5 languages (German, English, Spanish, Italian and French).
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board, Open Drafting, Race

name: Peacemakers: Horrors of War
description:
Peacemakers: Horrors of War is a thematic board game in which you co-operate and attempt to bring peace. In the game, you are an adventurer seeking to stop conflicts between a colorful cast of animalfolk nations, who all have grievances with one another.

All six scenarios in the game are designed to provide a different challenge each time you play. Peacemakers: Horrors of War can be played with up to four players or solo, and you can play the scenarios in any order with different players no matter which scenario you choose.

Peacemakers: Horrors of War is an evolution of Dawn of Peacemakers, which was released in 2018. Some of the changes in this design include:

• Stronger emphasis on theme, allowing you to fully become a force for peace.
• Characters with unique strengths which bring a new dimension to the gameplay.
• Faster set-up as well as the ability to play with different groups.
• Streamlined rules that are easier to learn, teach, and remember, without sacrificing any gameplay depth.
• Individual scenarios instead of a campaign, which provides more flexibility and varied experiences.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: Relics of Rajavihara: Montalo's Revenge
description:
Returning to Cambodia after receiving a mysterious letter detailing Professor Montalo’s previous theft of the powerful Seer Stone, you find yourself in a trap set by his vengeful son, Arioch.

He has created an even more dangerous set of traps than you faced previously. So, this is Montalo’s revenge…

30 new levels. 3 additional new elements.

Are you up for the challenge?
mechanics: Area Movement, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Grid Movement, Move Through Deck, Slide/Push, Solo / Solitaire Game, Square Grid, Three Dimensional Movement

name: Underwater Cities: Federal Priority Promo Cards
description:
Special Promo for Underwater Cities for backers of the 2021 Dice Tower Kickstarter:

Introduces the "Federal Priority" scoring card, which rewards having the most connected upgrade buildings by the end of the game.
categories: Card Game, City Building, Civilization, Expansion for Base-game, Industry / Manufacturing, Nautical, Science Fiction
mechanics: Income, Network and Route Building, Turn Order: Stat-Based, Worker Placement

name: Wibbell
description:
Description from the publisher:

The fastest wordgame in the west.

Players race to shout a word that contains at least one letter from each of the 2 central cards AND at least one letter from each face-up card in front of you.

To start with, you have no cards in front of you, so including a specific 2 letters will get you a point.

As the game goes on, better players will have more and more cards in front of themselves. This gives the game escalating difficulty, and also provides a catchup mechanism.

This is one of many games playable with the Wibbell++ deck.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Eastern Empires: The Special Buildings Expansion
description:
This Special Buildings Expansion is an expansion for Eastern Empires and contains 9 unique miniature buildings in total, 1 for each playable Eastern civilization. During the game players may choose to construct a special building which grants various benefits. Building the right building at the right time will provide additional victory points.

Both the Special Buildings Expansion for Western Empires and Eastern Empires can be combined with Mega Empires altogether. The expansion is also compatible with Mega Civilization.

—description from the designer
categories: Ancient, City Building, Civilization, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures
mechanics: Area Movement, Set Collection, Trading

name: Sea of Dragons: A Module for Harpoon 4
description:
Sea of Dragons is a module for the Harpoon 4 Naval Rules System.

Sea of Dragons concerns conflicts among 16 nations of the Pacific Rim, all of whom have their own agenda and means to try to advance it. The scenario book includes a brief introduction to the political and economic aspirations of the potential belligerents, and is followed by a discussion of their capabilities and military plans for the immediate future. There are 4 scenario sets containing a total of 26 engagements, many of which are suitable for solitaire play. The scenarios can be played individually or as part of a mini-campaign. And just in case 26 scenarios are not enough, a scenario generator for the hotly contested Spratly Islands is also included.

The fleet and air force lists contain all the platforms currently in service plus those expected to come on line over the next few years. Rounding things out is an extensive bibliography and reference section and errata for Harpoon 4 rules and data annex.

The Data Annex contains almost every platform available since 1980 as well as quite a few older ones that are now out of service. The vast majority of the data on the weapons and sensors are new and have previously not been listed in Harpoon 4. This wealth of information will allow the modern naval enthusiast to explore various combinations of systems, much as the nations involved do when preparing threat analysis.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Modern Warfare, Nautical, Wargame
mechanics: Hexagon Grid

name: Pirates!  Miniature Battles on the High Seas
description:
From back cover :

It is time for your miniature armies to join the navy! Now you can finally add naval, shore, for, and fleet encounters in your 25mm miniature gaming!

Game Features:

Historical Rules! Ships and ordinance are based on historical examples, as well as national differences in crew types. C.1400-1650!
Fantasy Rules! Magic spells, fantasy races, fell beasts, and more!
A plethora of vessels, both sailing and oared, with the option to design your own!
Heavy ordinance, small arms, boarding actions and Ramming - mayhem for everyone!
Custom design rules for star forts, shore batteries, bastions, and buildings!
Expand your games with a complete campaign system that doesn't bog down!
Easy to learn and play! Skill is more important that luck, but luck doesn't hurt!
mechanics: Paper-and-Pencil, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Samurai Lords: The Wars of Feudal Japan
description:
Originally published in 1983, Samurai Lords has been enjoyed by Japanese for decades and remains to this day, the Japanese gamer's strategic game of choice for simulating the most turbulent period in Japanese history. Now MMP is proud to offer for the first time this remarkable game to the English-speaking world.

Players scheme, plot, plan, fight, and deal with unforeseen events in the quest to become the supreme Samurai on the land. With 26 scenarios to represent periods ranging from the 12th to the 16th century and with some 500 major samurai that vied for power during this the long period of civil war individually represented, players will gain a unique insight into the inner workings of feudal Japan.

This is by far the most comprehensive game on Japanese history ever published.

Samurai Lords scale:
Game Turn: 1 year
Counters: Individual Leaders and 1000 men per strength point
Map: Area map representing feudal Japan

Samurai Lords Game Details:
Players: 1-16 (9-16 requires two copies)
Scenarios: 30+
Complexity: Medium
Playing Time: 1 to 20 hours

Samurai Lords was designed by Yukihiro Kuroda. English development by Adam Starkweather, with graphic arts by Mark Mahaffey.
categories: Civil War, Medieval, Negotiation, Political, Renaissance, Wargame
mechanics: Area Movement, Chit-Pull System, Simulation

name: En Pointe Toujours!: Combats pour Huguette 6
description:
A tactical expansion to En Pointe Toujours !, game system originally published (in French) in Vae Victis magazine issue 16.

This game, is a campaign during the long siege of Dien Bien Phu, during 5 nights, 1st to 6th April 1954.

Fighting for the ancient "Anne-Marie 3", north to the vital runway, the French forces (I/2REI, III/13 DBLE and II/1 RCP) French Foreign Legion and Paratroopers, must hold the strongpoint, Huguette 6, night after night, against the Viet-Minh forces humans waves and artillery support.

New counters and rules.
A4 map.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Modern Warfare, Vietnam War, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Line of Sight, Movement Points, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation

name: Top Speed Mini
description:
TOP SPEED MINI is a fast and furious racing game for 2 to 8 players (recommended 2 to 5). It’s the simplified version of Top Speed.

TOP SPEED MINI uses one single Top Speed deck shared by all players (instead of one deck per player), one small car for each player and a small board (1 pad instead of 3). The games are shorter than in Top Speed and are based on Kart racing.

All the components come in a single set as opposed to Top Speed, where the components are purchased separately (one team per player).

The rules are quite different from those in the Top Speed rulebook. For example:

- There is no Safety Car, Pit Stop or Drive Through penalty.
- The number of laps for the race is smaller (usually 3-4 instead of 60).
- You can fix your car by just passing a whole round, but you can only discard 1 damage card each time.
- The maximum recommended number of players is 5 (but it accomodates more).

You can play TOP SPEED MINI with a Top Speed set, but not the opposite.

Components:

- A small TOP SPEED board (one pad) depicting the Montmeló circuit (SPAIN).
- A TOP SPEED deck of cards.
- 8 cars in different colors (white, black, red, yellow, green, orange, blue, purple).
- 8 color markers.
- A carrying case.
mechanics: Push Your Luck, Simulation

name: Skirmish Tactics Apocalypse
description:
CONTROL A FACTION
DESTROY YOUR ENEMIES
EMERGE VICTORIOUS

Skirmish Tactics Apocalypse (STA) is a two player dice-based skirmish-level tabletop game set in a post-apocalyptic near future.
