http://www.pagat.com/rummy/cuajo.html
mechanics: Set Collection, Team-Based Game

name: Verðbréfaspilið
description:
A family game for 10 years old and up. The goal is to become the Chairman of Iceland.
To achieve that goal, players buy and sell stock, bonds and private companies, and seek to become major stock holders in each company.
Players' money can be stored in a bank or taken as a loan, both options with interest.
Players can hold auctions to sell their stock, and they can also make an offer for other's stock.
The game ends when one player owns everything and becomes the Chairman of Iceland.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Dice Rolling, Stock Holding

name: Legions of the Petal Throne
description:
Rules for conducting miniatures battles on the world of Tekumel (the setting of the fantasy role playing game "Empire of the Petal Throne"and the more recent "Tekumel: The World of the Petal Throne"). The single booklet contains basic and advanced rules for 25 mm miniatures on a 1:100 scale. The advanced rules describe the particular powers and military formations of the five great human empires and the various non-human races. Other rules govern the use of magic and ancient technological devices.

TSR first published the rules in 1977. Tita's House of Games later republished the booklet. These were the first published miniatures rules for the Tekumel universe. Later rules were "Missum!" and "Qadardalikoi."
mechanics: Simulation

name: The Whites of their Eyes:  A Guide to the American Revolution
description:
"The Whites of their Eyes" is an introductory miniatures guidebook for the American Revolution using the system published in "Habitants and Highlanders" and "Rockets Red Glare". The author includes an overview of the war, strategy and tactics, and a uniform guide. Most of the book is a series of scenarios from the American Revolution (both skirmishes and battle), including maps and orders of battle for both sides.

Unlike other books in the Canadian Wargames Group series, the miniatures rules themselves are not included (you must have "Habitants" or "Rockets"), but a boardgame on the siege of Quebec and a campaign game "Washington and Howe" is provided. Also included are systems for using the Avalon Hill games "1776: The Game of the American Revolutionary War" and "We the People" as campaign systems.
categories: Age of Reason, American Revolutionary War, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Unspecified

name: The Sex Game
description:
We would have called it the "Love Making Game" but let's face it, The Sex Game just sounds better. Don't be fooled though, The Sex Game is all about making love and exchanging ideas. Created for you and your lover as a means to encourage playfulness, stimulate secret sexual delights, while also bringing new and exciting elements into your love life...

Okay, okay... it's really about getting LUCKY! But get too cocky! The Sex Game is a bit of a gamble. After all, you could end up rolling "Solo in the Garage" Think you can handle the odds? Take a chance and see what you can roll up between you and your partner!
mechanics: Acting, Betting and Bluffing, Dice Rolling, Role Playing, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Panzer PaK 3: Normandy to Berlin
description:
The decisive battles around Arracourt commenced on 15 September 1944 when elements of the German 15th Panzer Grenadier Division clashed with the reconnaissance units of the USA 2nd Cavalry Group. After initially withdrawing, the Germans again advanced near the town of Luneville, with the 111th Panzer Brigade committed as reinforcements.

Panzer PaK 3 covers the fighting from the allied landing at Normandy until VE Day. All forty American unit cards are included in this expansion, along with three scenarios and the organizations for Wehrmarcht and US Army forces on the western front.

Panzer PaK 3 is an expansion to Panzer Miniatures Rules: A Tactical Game of Armored Combat.

Included Components:


Scenarios — Three historical scenarios focusing on Operation Cobra



Detailed US Army TO&E: General organizations from 1942 until 1945 — includes Heavy and Light Armored Divisions, Infantry Division, and Airborne Division to the individual vehicle, gun and squad level



Optional Rule: Hidden movement rules for Panzer



Unit Data Cards: 40 new unit data cards (completes USA units)



Hidden Movement Cards: two hidden movement play cards


Expands:

Panzer Miniatures Rules: A Tactical Game of Armored Combat
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Realms of the Unknown
description:
Realms of the Unknown is a pencil and paper game where players take on the roles of Nobles or other leaders of a population. They give orders to their troops and population, explore, invade other territory, encourage population growth, etc. One player is the Realm Controller and sets up the Realm in advance, and gives the players the results from their orders. The game is structured in a way similar to PBM games in that the players hand in their orders each day for a time period covering 1 week in the game. There are rules for Population growth and characteristics; resources including livestock, mines, farms, logging, etc; Technology development, and combat. Combat involves a series of formulas taking in as many factors as possible including number and training of troops, armor, troop types, leaders, weather, terrain, and other factors. This results in a modified strength of each force. When these are compared the relative strength determine losses for each side as well as the victor in the battle.

The rules come in two books - Player's Manual and Realm Controller's Manual.

See also the roleplaying game listing Realms of the Unknown
mechanics: Paper-and-Pencil, Role Playing, Secret Unit Deployment, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: The 100 Games
description:
This game is being described as "7 original cardgames interesting and exciting for the whole family." and more info can be found at www.the100games.com

Actually, the game consists of the following 7 games :
Game 1: The Digits’ Game
Game 2: The Great Digits’ Game
Game 3: The Numbers’ Game
Game 4: The Multiplication Game
Game 5: The Primes’ Game
Game 6: 100 Rummy
Game 7: Numbers Memo
categories: Card Game, Educational, Math, Memory, Travel
mechanics: Hand Management, Memory, Open Drafting
publishers: Mandoo Games, Popcorn Games, The 100 Games

name: Modern Micro Armour: The Game
description:
Micro Armour: The Game - Modern provides players with rules for tanks, transport vehicles, aircraft (including helicopters), infantry, guided weapons -- in fact, every aspect of tactical combat developed over the last hundred years! Included are 50 pages of weapons & aircraft data, a scenario generator, tutorial and full color graphics for artillery impacts, minefields, smokescreens, napalm, wrecked vehicles and more.

As a bonus, 10 ready-to-play scenarios are included. The rules are concise, easy to learn and fun to play.

The game includes vehicle and equipment data for the following countries:

Afghanistan
Algeria
Angola
Argentina
Australia
Bosnia
Canada
Chad
China (Peoples' Republic of)
China/Taiwan (Republic of)
Cuba
Egypt
France
Germany
India
Iran
Iraq
Israel
Jordan
Korea (North)
Korea (South)
Korean War Allies
Lebanon
Libya
Mexico
Morocco
Pakistan
Persian Gulf States
Russia/USSR/Chechnya
South Africa
Spain
Syria
United Kingdom
United States
the United Nations
Vietnam
Yugoslavia
plus the 2003 Gulf War & 2003 Iraq


The publisher's goal is to provide the gamer with the tools needed to create the most satisfying game experience. To this end they have compiled an extensive online collection of country histories and TO&Es to download FREE. Use these with the guidelines in Micro Armour:The Game - Modern to customize modern wargaming.

There is also a free download version "Modern Micro Armour:The Tanks" using tanks only.

Expanded by:

Modern Micro Armour: The Game - The Vietnam War Supplement (TO&E, 2 Riverine scnarios where 1 model = 1 boat, and 12 normal scenarios)


Re-Implements / Uses the same rules as:

WWII Micro Armour
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Simulation

name: Shootist
description:
Shootist is a simple, quick-play, Wild West Shoot-Out game.

Extract from Overview of the game:

"Each player controls a gunslinger, or "Shootist", and takes part in an Old-fashioned, Movie-style, Western Shoot-out.

As few as two can play and although it can be played with any number it is particularly suited to groups of between five and ten players, each controlling one Shootist. A typical game should last an hour, although with very large numbers the game can take longer than this.

Players may also control groups of Shootists."

The game includes the miniatures rules, five scenarios and some Stand-up Counters to cut out.
mechanics: Dice Rolling

name: Meta
description:
Meta is a gaming system, consisting of a 10x10 board that may be laid down or stood upright and 44 wooden tokens in 3 colors. The 8 dark green tokens are identical on both sides, but the yellow and light green ones have a dot on one of their sides. The components are of excellent quality.

The system comes with four games:
Menos: an evolution of solitaire where the player jumps over the pieces to remove them (for one player).
Esca: a five-in-a-row game, where the board stands upright with the two players on either side. Players try to make 2 5-in-a-rows by placing their tokens, blocking and removing enemy tokens.
Tremplin: a chinese checkers sort of game where players try to reach their respective goals by jumping over pieces. (2 configurations: for 2 or 4 players)
Arriba: an original concept where the board is positioned at an angle. Players try to reach the top row but the holes become deeper and deeper towards it, so multiple tokens have to be positioned in the holes to create stepping stones.
mechanics: Pattern Building

name: Starship!: 3D Miniature Space Combat
description:
From the introduction of the game:

Starship is a game of miniature battles fought between giant capital ships and their smaller escorts versus their enemies in the cold depths of space. Combat is intense and deadly, capturing the feel of starship combat in anime and science-fiction films.

The world of Starship! Is not one of hard-science, instead portraying the sci-fi we have come to know and love as portrayed on television and the movies. We have given the laws of physics and space a cursory nod, but eventually led them behind for the more enticing subjects of fun and playability. If you have any interest in the future and battling it out amongst the stars, then we know you will find Starship! An immensely enjoyable game.

Starship! is a truely three dimensional space combat game that allows you to create any insterstellar battle you desire. Whether you want to use ships and races from an existing genre, or create your own, Starship! gives you everything you need.

Game features:

Thrue 3D combat in a format that eliminates complicated mathematics and keeps play fast and full of action!
Ten different starships and star bases classes, from Corvette to the Superdreadnought!
Dozens of weapons systems and construction options!
Fighters, Mecha, Shuttles and Assault Pods!
Great for anime style space combat, or for recreating the battles of your favorite sci-fi book, movie or TV series!
True playability, no ponderous turns spent writing orders and performing incremental movement. Starship os about speed, action and fun!
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Bushido: Sengoku Jidai
description:
(from first scenario published)

Nobunaga is forced to move towards Kyoto (because of his brother-in-law Asai Nagamasa) therefore to clash with the Asakura Clan. After some days 20,000 men of his army are on the march again, this time to go against the Asai Clan. Thanks to the aid of his trusted ally Tokugawa the defeat of the Asai Clan will be total and may end in Nagamasa committing Seppuku… perhaps….

A wargame set in feudal Japan. Will your force be victorious, or does Seppuku await you instead?
mechanics: Unspecified
publishers: (Web published), Club Amici del Wargame Esagonato (CAWE)

name: Oktagrid
description:
Oktagrid is a game for up to four Wizards.

This game was created by the Archmage Pedramor the Wise, trying to find a peaceful way to resolve magical duels.

Oktagrid is played on a octagonal chessboard.
Every player controls a Wizard: moving it on outer part of the board, the miniature activates the magical Runes, which can create and move the Oktawoods, the enchanted pieces of this ancient game.
The player that scores the higher number of Oktawoods, moving them to the center of the board, is the winner.

The game has two set of rules, basic (suitable for children) and advanced, for more experienced players.
The game is entirely language independent; all the pieces are made of wood, except the four miniatures of the Wizards, made in Kerasin-S and hand painted.
mechanics: Dice Rolling

name: Arnold Palmer's Inside Golf
description:
Game is a 9-hole round of golf where each hole is laid out on a 20" x 26" card. Players select their club and, using a standard deck of cards, draw one and consult a result chart. Using the result and a special ruler, players move their ball markers along the hole, including possibly slicing or hooking the ball (approach shots do not conform to the slice and hook requirements though).

Each hole has standard features of a regulation golf hole, including out-of-bounds, water, and sand traps. Hitting from the rough or from other course features may require the pull of an additional card to incur a "penalty hazard" (a modifier to your shot).

All in all, the game simulates a real game of golf with simple gameplay but decisions you would be face with in a regular game as well.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Among the War Parties: Adventures in the Early Americas
description:
(From the Publisher's Web Site)

Among the War Parties brings the high adventure of Gloire: Swashbuckling Adventure in the Age of Kings into the forests, jungles and frontiers of the Americas! Create imposing war chiefs who do great deeds in battle, or terrifying and greedy Conquistadors, or stealthy and straight-shooting frontier woodsmen. This book introduces over a dozen new character archetypes, as well as new skills, weapons, and equipment for you to fight and survive in the unforgiving wilderness. This supplement contains a mammoth 35 Scenarios in five linked campaigns, ranging from the streets of the Aztec capital, Tenochtitlan, to the frozen and trackless forest in winter, to the wars of colonists and natives in early America.

Sharpen your tomahawk and check your flint, and set out on the trail Among the War Parties!

108 Pages
categories: Age of Reason, American Indian Wars, American Revolutionary War, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Line of Sight, Simulation, Storytelling

name: Old West Shootout
description:
From the Old West Shootout Guide:

Old West Shootout is a set of free rules accompanying em4miniatures' Old West Heroes, Painted Miniatures Set 2. It is designed for use with either or both of em4's Old West Heroes Painted Miniatures sets. Shootout gives a fast fun game but don't let the simplicity fool you. Good tactics and an iron nerve are required to play and win Shootout.

A Western town plan is provided on mini CD ROM with the miniatures set.

Additional Miniatures available in Old West Heroes, Painted Miniatures Set 1. This set like Set 2 above comes with 5 pre-painted miniatures and 5 distinctly colored dies (but no CD ROM or rules).

New sets of these miniatures (Both Set 1 and Set 2), come with the multi-colored dice, CD ROM and colored token sets.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: The Isle of Dread
description:
"Based loosely on the old D&D Expert Rules system. This is a conversion of Dungeon Module X1 'The Isle of Dread'. Each player has an Adventuring Party in search of Adventure & Fortune. Each party is represented by a pawn on the track."

Each player controls a party of six adventurers. Each adventurer has a class (Fighter, Thief, Cleric, Magic User, Elf, Dwarf, or Halfling) and skills in three attributes (Stealth, Magic, and Fighting.)

The game is played on a track ninety spaces long, which abstractly represents distance and time. The game ends when the first party reaches the end space. The player who has the most gold at the end of the game wins.

Played using the WarpQuest game system.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move

name: Die Siedler von Luxemburg
description:
Die Siedler von Luxemburg is a scenario for the game The Settlers of Catan. It was created by the Luxemburg gaming club Guilde vun de Phantasiespiller for the national Catan championship 2008 and plays on a fixed map of the state of Luxemburg. The game includes the board, rules, and some additional components. A copy of Settlers is required for game play. Only 700 copies of the game were released, 300 of which were retained by Klaus Teuber and Kosmos for promotional events and corporate gifts.

Part of the Catan Series.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Network and Route Building

name: He Lücht (Die fröhliche Hafenrundfahrt)
description:
The game is called "He Lücht", translated this means "he's lying".

Each player rolls a die and moves around the game map (which depicts the Hamburg harbour). On special spaces he may ask a real or a "He Lücht" question.
If he can answer the question he may move on.
Some special events happen if the player moves on defined spaces.
The player who reaches the last space is the winner.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move

name: Rapa-nui
description:
After a trip to Isla de Pascua (Easter Island), the author brings to us this game based on the inhabitants of the island and the extinction of them.

The Rapa-Nui tribes were isolated about 1000 years in a remote, tiny and volcanic island. There were a lack of resources and the population lived in a unstable balance with the environment, the rivalry between tribes and the collective society.

THE GAME

Players manage the building of the 'moais' (these big sculptures with big faces, facing to the sea), using quarries, men, palm trees (to take wood) and even 'slaves'.

I had heard from some testers that the mechanics of the game were very similar to Puerto Rico, but the only similarity is the 'role selection' phase.

The game is only available (rules and components) for Print & Play at: http://kokorin.wordpress.com/2008/06/15/rapa-nui/
mechanics: Variable Phase Order

name: DICE Quick Play Baseball
description: DICE Quick Play Baseball is a streamlined version of DICE Baseball (also by Gen1400 Gaming), which allows you to play entire games with the roll of two 10-sided dice. Each game only takes minutes and allows you to play an entire season in a matter of hours.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Simulation

name: Con6
description:
Con6 is a unique game that combines elements of thinking, strategy and luck.

The aim of the game:
To be the first to form a sequence of 6 “riders”.

Game parts:
1) 24 triangular “bases” (large) – 12 per color.
2) 24 triangular “riders” (small) – 12 per color.
3) Game bag.
4) Playing instructions.

Preparations for the game:
1) Each player chooses his color.
2) Each player places the 12 riders in the chosen color next to him.
3) The bases of both colors are inserted into the game bag and thoroughly mixed.

Course of play:
1) The younger player randomly draws a base out of the bag. The person whose color is the same as the base that has been drawn begins. The drawn base is returned to the bag.
2) Each player randomly draws one base from the bag and places it beside him, so that it is visible to both players.
3) The first player places his base on the table and randomly draws a new base from the bag. It is now the other player’s turn, and so on.
4) Each player, in his turn, can place a rider on a vacant base or place a new base next to an existing one, in accordance with the game rules.
If a player chooses to place a base, he randomly draws a new base from the bag and places it beside him, so that it is visible to both players.
Winning the game:
The winner is the player who manages to form a sequence of 6 riders of his own color.
mechanics: Modular Board, Tile Placement

name: Giuthi
description:
A mancala game.

From Mancala World:

http://mancala.wikia.com/wiki/Giuthi

"Giuthi ("to place", "to distribute") is a mancala game of the Kikuyu and the Embu in Kenya. It was a popular pastime of young boys when they were herding cattle of goats. The game is almost forgotten today. There were special terms for certain moves and various holes, but no one seems to remember them now.

The board was usually dug into the ground. The game was played with small pebbles or the seeds of the mubuthi tree (Caesalpinia volkensii).

Giuthi was first described in 1925 by the English ethnologue Orde Brown in his book The Vanishing Tribes of Kenya.

Rules:

Giuthi is played on two-rank boards numbering from five to ten holes per row.

The number of stones in each pit varies from four to nine. Four is preferred on the smallest boards, six on the medium-sized ones and eight on the larger boards. Nine stones per hole on a two-by-ten board gives the first player a big advantage and could therefore be regarded as a kind of handicap when two players of unequal strength are playing.

Each turn starts with a hole that contains at least two seeds.

The seeds are either distributed in the clockwise or the counterclockwise direction into the succeeding holes in the first lap of a move.

If the last seed falls into a non-empty hole, its contents (including the last seed) are distributed in another lap in the opposite direction.

If the last seeds falls into an empty hole of your own side, the player moves again, unless he has placed at least one seed into an enemy hole during this move.

If the last seeds falls in one of your empty holes and you have played into the opponent's territory (see proverb (bottom)), then you capture the seeds in the enemy hole just across and the last seed that was distributed.

If this empty hole is followed in an unbroken chain by more empty holes on your side, then the seeds in the opposite holes are also captured.

When the last seed falls into an empty hole of your oponent, the turn is over.

A player must move if he can. He must pass, if he can't, but must move again, if he has something to play with.

The game ends when no longer any moves can be made or when the board position repeats.

Each player scores as many points as he has captured seeds and as he has seeds in his holes at the end of the game.

The player who has more points wins the game.

Variants:

The following board sizes were recorded by ethnologues:

2 x 5 holes. Number of seeds not given.
2 x 6 holes with 4 seeds per hole. For beginners.
2 x 7 holes with 6 seeds per hole. According to Driedger a typical starting arrangment among the Kikuyu.
2 x 8 holes with 4 seeds per hole. Said to be the most popular variant when played on a casual basis.
2 x 10 holes with 9 seeds per hole. Quite unbalanced - the first player can capture 10 seeds in the first turn without being threatened in the next.


The most challenging variant that is well balanced is played on a 2x10 board with 8 seeds per hole.

Giuthi proverb:

You can't steal the cattle of another man without entering his land!"
mechanics: Mancala

name: Swordsmiths of Spain
description:
The Prince of Castile has announced his desire to obtain the finest sword in his kingdom. You are one of the famed swordsmiths of 16th century Toledo, and challenged to meet the prince's impeccable taste.
He demands the rarest metals, the most precious gems, and the finest leathers. There is little time, but you must purchase all the necessary raw materials, forge new and unique metals, and finally construct the most prestigious sword the world has ever seen. Do you have what it takes?

Swordsmiths of Spain is an innovative auction game that will have you asking for "just one more turn." Countless combinations of Metal, Gem, and Leather Cards keep the game fresh each time you play. What's more, you can combine Metals to forge entirely new alloys, including the elusive Eastern Soul Steel.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Industry / Manufacturing, Medieval
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Pattern Building, Set Collection, Trading, Variable Phase Order

name: Vandaria Wars
description:
The First TCG/CCG made in Indonesia, have something in common with Magic and Legend of Five Rings.

In Indonesian Language

In This game you play as a landlord in the Vandaria world, you compete with each other to rule the world.
Players can build Forts and Territories, hire armies (Followers), use technology devices (Relic), or use magical powers (Rune).

Races : Human, there are 4 Factions (Order, Chaos, Prosper, Noble).
Frameless, there are 1 primary Faction (Mystic) and 2 supporting Factions (Eden & Reigner).

Official Web
http://www.gamequarters.net/vandaria/?page_id=272
Wiki Entry
http://id.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vandaria_Wars
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: Peiper At The Gates: A NUTS! Supplement
description:
Scenario book for Nuts!

“I’d never been so damn cold. The snow was flying sideways like, we could hardly see a thing. I’d never seen a Panther before, and hearing it clanking up put the fear into me, right to my toes. They hit us hard and fast, knocked us dead. Fierce, them SS Krauts. Even though they were people just like us, scared all to Hell, they fought like no one else. That was The Bulge to me; freezing cold, Kraut tanks, and horror. Horror all around me. Even when we started winning.”
-Conversation with Lee Johnson, 391st Engineers, Ardennes veteran.

On December 16th, 1944, three German Panzer Armies hurled themselves at surprised Allied lines in the Ardennes area. This desperate bid to drive to the English Channel for a second time, attempting to recapture the port of Antwerp and forcing the Allies to sue for peace, would be called The Battle of the Bulge. In the end, this massive offensive would fail, costing the Germans the war. But it could have gone differently. PEIPER AT THE GATES is a mini-campaign of branching linked scenarios set during the advance of Kampfgruppe Peiper and the 1st SS Panzer Division towards the Meuse River.

Smash through all opposition as the Germans, capturing the bridges at Trios Ponts and driving into the American far-rear. Hold the Panzer advance at Stavelot, stopping them cold with a small rag-tag band of American fighting men. Fight the climatic battle of a lone King Tiger against massed Sherman tanks as Task Force McGeorge attacks the La Gleize Cauldron from the north. Play solo or with friends. Play the Germans. Play the Americans. But just play. The fate of the Western Front is in your hands.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Kvinnofrågor
description:
Translated "Kvinnofrågor" means Questions about Womens issues.

Kvinnofrågor is an educational game where two or more teams answer questions about feminism, equality and womens history.

There are one hundred cards, each depicting a person or an organisation. Examples of cards: Emma Goldman, Wonder Woman, Grupp 8, Aung San Suu Kyi, Gerd Brantenberg, Le tigre.
On the back of the cards are five questions worth different points.

Fifteen of the 100 cards are randomly drawn from the deck and placed with the portrait side up. One by one, the cards are picked up and the teams tries to answer the questions on it. The team with the most points wins the card. When all questions on ten of the fifteen cards have been answered, the team that has won the most cards wins.

Game content:
- Rule sheet
- 100 Cards
- 34 page book with information about the people and organisations depicted on the cards.

This game is right now only avalible in swedish. (januari 2009)

Publishers site:
http://www.athenaspel.se
mechanics: Open Drafting

name: Frantic Revenge of the Unscrupulous Xorbas Optima aka F.R.U.X.O.
description:
Tabletop game using the swedish bag of candy called Fruxo. The game is in swedish and uses the candies as pieces to play out a galactic war.

Self published, with no intent to profit. First published in 1999 and then in 2007 as the Deluxo-edition.
mechanics: Rock-Paper-Scissors

name: Railway Rivals Map N: New England
description:
A map for use with the Railway Rivals game.

The map covers New England from New York in the South West, Boston in the East and beyond Portland in the North. A hilly map that is probably not suitable for beginners, unless the leapfrog variant is used.
mechanics: Crayon Rail System, Dice Rolling

name: 1830: The Pere Marquette
description: 1830: The Pere Marquette by Federico Vellani, published in the Train Gamer’s Gazette volume 3, number 1, adds a new western railroad and related rules to 1830: Railways & Robber Barons, an 18xx game.
categories: Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Trains, Transportation
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Network and Route Building, Stock Holding, Tile Placement

name: El Plan: la Aventura de Emprender
description:
The Plan aims to develop competencies and skills related to the process of entrepreneurship, challenging and entertaining. The elements that support the process of entrepreneurship has not been chosen at random but are guided by the processes involved in the Michael Porter’s Value Chain.

In this game each player must administrate a business plan according to a Plan Card he receives.
It is also possible to play in teams.
mechanics: Worker Placement

name: Dungeon Escape
description:
The one with the most treasure wins! … Just watch out for the dragons! Dungeon Escape uses a regular deck of cards and an ingenious set of rules to create a Euro-style game board. Choose one of the classic fantasy characters and gather treasure while attempting to escape alive. This ultimate dungeon crawl is for 1 to 8 players, ages 8 and up; game time is 30 minutes.

Goal: Escape the dungeon alive while collecting the most treasure.

Equipment required: 1 deck of cards, 2 six sided dice and a scorepad to keep track of health points
mechanics: Open Drafting

name: Operation Saar: The French First Strike (Europa Battle Scenario #5)
description:
Appearing in Europa Magazine #29, Operation Saar is a pullout from the magazine.

Operation Saar posits a French attack on German forces in Poland in 1939.
As the designer states: "Due to consistent over-estimation of German military might and poor intelligence, the French made only a token effort to fulfill their obligations to Poland by a desultory advance a couple of kilometers into Germany on September 7th that was soon withdrawn. I've thought it a fascinating "what-if" to consider what might have happened had the French attacked before the Germans had redeployed from Poland."

Operation Saar uses the First to Fight (1991) rules set with various adjustments, along with maps from Second Front.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Simulation

name: Monopoly: International Euro Edition
description:
This edition is different to the other European version. It uses a much smaller gameboard 32cm x 32cm.

The values of the properties are shown in Euros, plus it uses a plastic 1 Euro coin instead of notes.

The other notes are similar to real Euros.

The Gameboard squares are made up of Capital Cities, the order is based on when the countries joined the EU. The stations are the busiest airports in Europe. The Utilities are now the European Court of Justice and the European Parliament.

As this is an International version, there is almost no words - "Free Parking" "Just Visiting", "Go", "Go to Jail" have all been removed, just leaving the image.

This applies to the deed cards, no words are shown. The Chance & Community Chest cards have words, but are shown in four languages (English, French, German, Spanish).

Other than that the game remains the same.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Midway Island
description:
The first point of the four pages of its rules' manual says:
"Present Avalon Hill Midway rules (1964) shall apply except where noted, as follows:"
This, for sure, identify this Panzerfaust 53 insert as a Midway expansion. It expands the basic game by adding destroyers, transports, more details and, last but not least, a map of Midway Island and the ground forces that must contend it.
Besides that it remains a product that shows all its age, with a spartan graphics, the best that could do, in 1972, a semi-homemade magazine like it was Panzerfaust in that period.
The result is the best that could have been made by R.W. Garbisch with what could allow a magazine like Panzerfaust in 1972.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Nautical, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Movement Points, Secret Unit Deployment, Simulation, Variable Set-up

name: Midgard
description:
Midgard is a two player abstract strategy game of area enclosure and dominance. Players take on the role of Odin and his brothers in creating Midgard, the homeland of humanity from the remains of the vanquished ice giant Ymir. One player-god creates the seas and other the land masses.

The board is composed of 124 equilateral triangles; a 10 x 10 regular grid with 24 additional triangles attached to the middle eight cells along each of its edges.

Player turns alternate starting with the sea player. Each turn, players must place one of their tiles on an empty ice cell which may not share an edge with any other occupied cell and it may not be the center cell. The newly occupied cell is terraformed into a sea or land cell and influences the transformation of its adjacent cells. These adjacent cells are referred to as blizzard cells because what they will become is unclear. Later, sea and land tiles are also placed when regions of blizzard cells are completely enclosed. The blizzard cells are assigned to and terraformed by the player who exerts the most influence on the enclosed regions. A player’s influence is determined by counting owned edges around the enclosed region. In the case of a tie, half the cells are filled with sea tiles and the other half by land tiles. The gods have decreed that this will always be possible when a tie occurs!

When the board is completely terraformed or a player has no more tiles in hand, the player with the most tiles on the board wins the game. If the players tie for most tiles, the player occupying the most perimeter cells wins.

Detailed rules, a Flash MX implementation and a print-and-play sheet can be found in the File section.

Have fun.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Enclosure, Tile Placement

name: Dracula Must Die!
description:
Transylvania, land of dark forests, dread mountains and black unfathomed lakes, still the home of magic and devilry as the nineteenth century draws to its close. Count Dracula, lord of corruption, master of the undead, and monarch of all vampires, is about to act on his long-contemplated plan for world domination.

Abraham Van Helsing, and his loyal vampire hunter companions, must battle against all manner of horror to save the people of Klausenberg and march upon Castle Dracula. Once inside, can they fend off the three bloodthirsty Brides, in order to infiltrate Dracula's secret tomb, deep within the walls of the ancient castle, and ultimately defeat the dreaded Prince of Darkness?

Consisting of one 90-card deck, the game pits four to eight players against each other. One team takes on the role of Van Helsing, assorted pitchfork-waving villagers, god-fearing priests, and various stalwart companions, and the other team assumes control of Dracula, the Brides, the Hound of Dracula, and numerous hissing, bloodsucking vampires. Each player must manage his hand of cards effectively to win. Gameplay is swift and slaughterous, with vampires staked, maidens drained, holy water administered, vampiric teeth exposed, and crucifixes brandished, frequently.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction, Fighting, Horror, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Elimination, Team-Based Game

name: Four Operations Math Deck
description:
Four Operations is a free, print-and-play card deck that can be used for designing and playing a wide assortment of math games.

It includes 54 cards, numbered 1-9 in six suits: rain, clouds, leaves, clovers, fish, and butterflies. The six suits are divided into three colors: gray for the weather suits, green for the plant suits, and purple for the animal suits. Each card has a number in the center, surrounded on the edges by the four basic operations.

The deck is designed to support a variety of mechanics and scoring systems and allows for the use of negative numbers.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Game System, Math, Number, Print & Play
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Tischfußball
description:
A football-Simulation that the author used for his own leage. It is a rather complex simulation with a lot of dice-rolling and many rules, really designed to simulate a (European) football game.
The dice decide over angle height and speed of the ball, but can be influenced by the players. Since its a complex simulation and would take quite some time, the game is played over a fixed time.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Simulation

name: Zhao Pengyou
description:
Chinese Trick Taking game that uses at least 2 decks of cards. There is a trump number as well as trump suit. Also there are big and small jokers. The order of strength is:
Big Joker> Small Joker> Trump number of trump suit> Trump number of other suits (they are all equal)> Ace of Trump> King of Trump > ... > 2 of Trump.

There are temporary allies (partners) in each deal that specified by an arbitrary card. Also a player can lead more than one card if they are identical or sequence of identical cards.
mechanics: Team-Based Game, Trick-taking

name: BattleTech: Jade Falcon Sourcebook
description:
From the back of the book:

"From the unknown regions of the Periphery, they came to conquer.

When they first arrived in the Federated Commonwealth, no one knew who these mysterious invaders were. Soon, Clan Jade Falcon became a name to be feared. They seemed completely unstoppable. They piloted strange new 'Mechs. Their armored infantry, nicknamed "Toads" by their stunned opponents, were unlike anything seen before. They nearly killed the heir to the throne.

This ComStar document details the history and development of Clan Jade Falcon from their beginnings in the chaos of the Exodus Civil War to the battlefields of Tukayyid. Contains a complete roster of the invading Jade Falcon forces, along with personality profiles of prominent officers."

User comment:

Providing a counterpoint to the BattleTech: Wolf Clan sourcebook, the Jade Falcon sourcebook gives a crusader-faction viewpoint on some events before delving into the Jade Falcon part in the invasion of the Inner Sphere. Largely useful for background reference in use in MechWarrior, or in forming campaign scnearios for BattleTech/BattleForce. It also provided profiles for four new BattleMechs - the Baboon, Hellhound, Kraken and Vixen, which were reprinted in the BattleTech Technical Readout: 3055 Upgrade a decade later.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Role Playing

name: Tailath
description:
Tailath is a cross between TAIJI and Yavalath, that can be played with a Cross set (7x7x7 hexhex board and pieces in 2 colors) or a OMEGA set (setting up the board to 7x7x7).

It was generated by a human searching the game space.

RULES:

Each player has an allocated color (red or blue).

On your turn, you must place one red piece and one blue piece adjacent to each other on any 2 adjacent free spaces on the board.

You win by making 4 in a row of your color at the end of your turn, but you lose if you make 4 in a row of your opponent's color (even if you make 4 in a row of your color).

The player in turn also loses if he cannot make a legal move.

DESIGN:

TAIJI was created by a human (Néstor Romeral Andrés), and Yavalath was created by a computer program (LUDI, by Cameron Browne).

One day TAIJI and Yavalath just drank too much and...
mechanics: Pattern Building

name: Classic BattleTech: FedCom Civil War
description:
From the back of the book:

Forty years ago, Hanse Davion and Melissa Steiner were joined in holy matrimony, reflecting on a personal level the joining of their two realms. The superstate formed through the union of the Federated Suns and the Lyran Commonwealth was meant to usher in a new era of peace and prosperity, eventually leading to the creation of a new Star League.

But it was not to be.

Now the eldest children of Hanse and Melissa are battling for control of their parents' legacy. This sourcebook details the long struggle between Victor Steiner-Davion and his sister Katherine, a struggle which raged across two realms and affected many others. Complete unit listings and wave maps show the progression of the war from its initial sparks to its devastating conclusion.

User comment:

This BattleTech expansion uses the same format used in earlier expansions that detail major conflicts within the Inner Sphere. At 216 pages it was the largest expansion for BattleTech that had been produced at the time. In addition to giving descriptions of the various battles within the war and the associated Clan Jade Falcon invasion, it provides details of all th eunits involved and rules on running games and campaigns set within this period.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Variable Player Powers

name: Recon... by Fire!  Issue #1
description:
First issue of Recon...by Fire!

From the table of contents:

Luckiest Guy in the Marines by Eddie Zeman
A Brief History of VASL by Rodney Kinney
ASL in Desert Storm by Eddie Zeman
Hard Point Tarawa by Heat of Battle
ASL Matinee: Red Barricades CG IV by Heat of Battle
Clubbing 101 by Matt Shostak
Fear and Loathing in Baltimore by Rob Seulowitz
Crossfire: Blazing Chariots by Rob Banozic and Rich Summers
Crossing Open Ground by Matt Romey
Evolution of Marine Firepower by Eddie Zeman and Steven Swann

Scenarios:

RBF I #1 Weather the Sturm - A German Company reinforced with tank destroyers and artillery are dug in and must hold off an elite Russian attack force during the opening days of Operation Bagration (1944).

RBF I #2 Aggravation at Agrigento - A dug in Italian company with artillery support has to hold off an American infantry company as General Patton’s army rolls through Sicily (1943).

RBF I #3 South Park - A German infantry company supported by assault guns attempts to silence and artillery battery. The Americans throw together a scratch force of infantry and armor to repel them during the Battle of the Bulge (1944).

RBF I #4 Used and Abused - Japanese armor and infantry attempt to recapture an airfield on the island of Biak. The airfield is held by an American infantry company (1944).

RBF I #5 Paper Line - The “Paper Line” is a defense line in Belgium that the French envisioned using to stop the Germans. In this engagement French armored cars with infantry support arrive on the scene just as scout elements of a German panzer division arrive. The French must keep the Germans from securing vital a vital road junction (1940).

RBF I #6 Desert Fortress - As the Germans created a foothold in Tobruk (1941), the Australians were sent in to dig them out.

RBF I #7 Into the Cauldron - In the first push on the factories of Stalingrad, hastily assembled factory workers and stragglers attempt to stop an scratch group of Germans with engineers and an assault gun to support them in their attempt to take a factory (August, 1942).

RBF I #8 Germeter by Meter - Dug in and fortified, German infantry have to hold off an American company supported by tank destroyers during the battle for the Hurtgen Forest (1944).
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Secret Unit Deployment

name: Federation Commander: Transports Attacked
description:
From the back of the package:

Anybody can win a battle flying a cruiser, but can you win a battle flying a transport? For that matter, can you win a battle when you have no drones and are nearly out of fuel? We didn't think so. It's time for the unsung heroes of the war effort to take center stage.

Sixteen full color double sided dry erase ship cards. Three bonus freighter cards to enlarge your convoy. Ship & Scenario guide with new rules and new scenarios.

Transports Attacked is an expansion product for the Federation Commander product line.

Included are a rule booklet, map board and 16 ship cards.

Ship cards:
Large Freighter/Small Freighter x3
Federation Light Tactical Transport
Klingon D5H Light Tactical Transport
Klingon T6 Transport Tug
Kzinti Medium Tactical Transport
Kzinti Tug
Lyran Light Tactical Transport
Lyran Puma Transport Tug
Romulan Sparrowhawk-H
Romulan KRT Transport Tug
Hydran Mule Light Tactical Transport
Hydran Caravan Fleet Tug
Gorn Heavy Destroyer Transport
Gorn Tug
Tholian Light Tactical Transport
Seltorian Light Tactical Transport
WYN Cluster Light Tactical Transport
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Stern Wissensquiz: Die achtziger Jahre
description:
Quiz game for 2-4 players or teams.
Questions are all about the eighties.
Be the first/best after 20 rounds.

All players including the player who asked the question put a token (with the answer they think is the correct one ==> multiple choice) in the middle - the less correct answers the more you can move forward - if you were right.
Special (red) questions for additional moves:
Die is used to determine the year - make a guess if the requested event happened earlier, later or during that year.

Content:
200 cards - with 4 questions per card
4 large & 4 small meeples (scoring positions month & year)
10-sided die
1 board
24 answer cards
1 rule sheet & solutions
No extensions were published - but different editions regarding other decades.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Asalto al poder
description:
“Asalto al poder” (Assault on power) is a strategy game that takes place in the world of business and influence peddling. The player will have the opportunity to get rich doing business both legal and illegal (scams), obtaining grants, creating enemies, going to trials ...

The game begins with an election to determine who initially hold the different powers (central, regional and local). With these premises, each player must manage the money they have to achieve the objective that will be assigned at the beginning of the game.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Commodity Speculation, Roll / Spin and Move, Stock Holding

name: Mecanisburgo: Copa Motordead Promo
description:
Promo card given out in 2012 at various conventions and most likely will be available at Essen 2012.

Copa Motordead is an Event using the autoduel skill and awards 10 VP, 25 money, and can be rotated to give 2 Major Projects points.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Seeking the Gift
description:
In Seeking the Gift, you take on the role of the Wise Men;

Follow the star to Bethlehem...
Present gifts of Frankincense, Gold, and Myrrh...
and Prove wiser than Herod.

Gather and discard matching sets of cards to place your Wise Men Tokens on the scroll, gaining points equal to the number they're on.
Placing too early might benefit the other players, but too late and you could miss your opportunity.

Time your moves wisely... once Mary and Joseph reach Bethlehem, the game ends!

Include the caravan card to add more options.

Turns are quick, allowing up to 6 players.
Two player games take 10-15 minutes.
Six player games take up to 45 minutes.
mechanics: Push Your Luck, Set Collection, Worker Placement

name: FUBAR Generic Sci-Fi
description:
From the publisher website:

"These allow you to games across a range of popular SciFi settings and genres from Aliens to Terminator and Predator."

Keeping in line with the one-page philosophy of FUBAR System, this simple expansion permits to players to give a sci-fi flavor to their FUBAR games.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement

name: Crusaders
description:
A tabletop adventure game where 2-4 players take the role of a Hero and pursue 1 of 10 fantasy quests. The board is a modular tile based system with a Castle, Forest, and multi-level Ruins. Each Hero can gain skills and items along the adventure.

Heroes can buy and sell gear, use magical items, fight a variety of creatures, and gain skills to give themselves advantage in various situations. Variety and re-playability are accomplished through the random board layout, "smart" random creature encounters, "smart' random treasure, Event cards that do not require luck, and role playing elements.

Day and night add variety to events, locations, encounter behavior, and treasure. Poisons, curses, blessings, secret rooms, Hero abilities, and treasure chests add additional variety. All this ensures no two plays are the same. A new story unfolds each game.

This game has light role playing elements. No Game Master or writing is required. All information is written on the cards and only a single d6 and various markers are needed.

WIP thread: https://boardgamegeek.com/article/24779218
mechanics: Modular Board, Role Playing, Variable Player Powers

name: Flames of War: Red Bear – Allied Forces on the Eastern Front, January 1944-February 1945
description:
Publisher Blurb:

Red Bear contains all the Soviet, Polish and Romanians forces you will be familiar with from Stalin's Onslaught, Hammer and Sickle, River of Heroes and Stalin's Europe. We've also added our most popular PDF Intelligence Briefings as well as some new Briefings and some forces from Fortress Europe.
categories: Book, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Simulation, Variable Player Powers

name: Bumeráng-sziget
description:
Original description from the game box:

"BOOMI, the Chief-Deity of the BOOMERANG ISLAND was very angry because his quarrelsome islanders had started war against each other and disturbed his afternoon nap, immediately he teleported all magicians of the tribes summoning them and told them: "I am fed up with you. In the future there shall be but one tribe on the island, that one which succeeds first to carry out my order given to you'-" And all in a flash, the magicians found themselves home again and each holding an order of the Chief-Deity in his hand. And thus the last clash of the islanders -- our game -- began.

Each player is a sub-deity of a tribe and tries with the help of his fearful chieftains as well as with that of magicians with superhuman crafts to gain the victory in the last struggle of the savages of the Boomerang Island. And all this happens in the course of the breathtakingly exciting and sometimes humorous game on the lovely coloured fanciful playing field."

Design: Imre Vincze and the Pancserek
Artwork: Zoltán Tarnóczy

The game can be considered an unofficial Risk spinoff (or even clone) with a different theme, some added features and some different rules. The main difference is the presence of chieftains and shamans (aka magicians) that have a special (random and secret) power and can kill/teleport an enemy tribesman regardless of the dice rolls.

The board pictures an imaginery continent divided into 6 distinct countrysides with 42 areas total and most command cards that players must draw at the beginning of the game requires to conquer 2-3 "countries" of those.

It's very much like in Risk, but the board offers more variety both in area names and in relation to the rules. (Eg. one chieftain's special power lets you swim between lakes, another lets you recruit new tribesmen based upon board graphics.)

Playable by 1-6 players with special rules (victory conditions) for 1, 2 and 3 player games.
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: War Against Russia
description:
War Against Russia is a free Print and Play game covering the German assault against Russia. It is an introductory wargame designed to introduce people to wargames. The map covers the area between the Baltic Sea and the Black Sea. The game covers the time frame of May 1941 to May 1942 with each turn representing a month.

Each turn the players will move units, attack, and check supply. Supply lines are determined by counting hexes from roads, cities, and the edge of the board. (The number of hexes ranges from three to six, depending on the weather.)

Weather is determined each turn and can range from clear to muddy, snowy, hard frost, or subarctic. Each type of weather affects movement, and attacks.

Combat is determined by rolling on a Combat Results Table. Movement is determined by the unit movement value combined with the terrain effects.
categories: Print & Play, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Simulation, Zone of Control

name: DreadBall: Locust City Chiefs
description:
DreadBall: The Futuristic Sports Game is the hyper-kinetic sci-fi sports game of unparalleled speed and ferocity – a fast, fun and tactical miniature sports board game written by Jake Thornton and created by Mantic Games.

Two coaches compete for victory with teams of beautiful miniatures on a stunning sci-fi pitch. The game is easy to learn, yet challenging, with carefully orchestrated plays and counter attacks hinging on positioning and the mercy of the dice gods.

This expansion adds an additional team made up of Z’zor Miniatures, the Locust City Chiefs.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Sports
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Variable Phase Order

name: Kopano
description:
IntroductionKopano is a drawless connection game for two players: Black and White. It’s played on the intersections (points) of a square board, which is initially empty. The top and bottom edges of the board are colored black; the left and right edges are colored white. "Kopano" is the Tswana word for "connection".



DefinitionsTwo like-colored stones are strongly connected if they are orthogonally adjacent to each other, and weakly connected if they are diagonally adjacent to each other without sharing any strongly connected neighbor. Note that two stones of different colors are never considered to be connected.

A chain is a set of (weakly or strongly) connected stones.



PlayStarting with Black, the players take turns placing stones of their own color on empty points of the board, one stone per turn.

It's illegal to place a stone on a point where it makes a weak connection unless placing an enemy stone on that same point would also make a weak connection. It's also illegal to form a crosscut, i.e. a 2x2 pattern of stones consisting of two diagonally adjacent Black stones and two diagonally adjacent White stones.

If a player can't make a move on his turn, he must pass. Passing is otherwise not allowed. There will always be a move available to at least one of the players.

The game is won by the player who completes a chain of his color touching the two opposite board edges of his color. Draws are not possible.



Pie ruleThe pie rule is used in order to make the game fair. This means that White will have the option, on his first turn only, to change sides instead of making a regular move.
mechanics: Chaining, Connections, Paper-and-Pencil, Pattern Building, Square Grid, Tile Placement

name: Dreadball: KickOff Extra Time
description:
DreadBall KickOff mixes the simplicity and brutality of DreadBall in a simple new format designed to get you playing even quicker, and the Extra Time pack allows you to upgrade your KickOff Boxset to include the Cards and Referee, with a downloadable copy of the full rules!
Alternatively it's a fantastic add-on for any club or league games where you need extra components!
Upgrade DreadBall Kick-off with the Extra Time add-on pack or upgrade to the complete hobby version of DreadBall: The Futuristic Sports Game to expand your DreadBall Experience!
mechanics: Dice Rolling

name: Asgard's Chosen: Artifacts
description:
SETUP:

-In a 4 player game, use all 3 artifacts.
-In a 2-3 player game randomly remove 1 artifact.
-In the solitaire game randomly select 1 artifact to use.

When building the map, when you place the 1st town marker, select an artifact and place it on that town. Place the remaining artifacts as you place the final town marker(s).

3. CAMPAIGN PHASE

If you take control of a town with an artifact in it, place the artifact next to the gender tile of the hero that attacked the town. You decide which side of the artifact is placed face up (artifacts have opposing terrain on each side). That hero is now considered to be wearing the artifact.

Your hero wears the artifact until that hero is Vanquished. You may not switch an artifact to it opposite side while your hero wears it. If you Vanquish another hero who is wearing an artifact, then remove the artifact from that hero. Your attacking hero may choose to wear it, if you wish. A hero may never wear more than 1 artifact. If you do not take an artifact, it remains on the space until any hero without an artifact wears it.

In a 2 player game no player may have more than 1 artifact.

An artifact allows the hero wearing it to use the heraldry symbols as a power bonus in battle. If you play a creature in battle with a heraldry symbol that matches your hero's artifact, that hero gains +1 power when attacking or defending. If you play 2 symbols that match your artifact in a single battle, then you may return 1 of your played creatures back to your hand (return 2 if 3 match, 3 if 4 match, etc).
mechanics: Unspecified

name: BattleCON: Legacy Promo Guest Character
description:
Legacy is non-canonical. He is a guest character from the "Sentinels of the Multiverse" board game. He comes with four Striker cards to represent his superhero team, the Freedom Five - Wraith, Tachyon, Absolute Zero and Bunker.

Originally available to backers of the Devastation of Indines Kickstarter Campaign.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting
mechanics: Hand Management, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Smart Green Heroes
description:
Based on the book by Jonathan M. Estes, Smart Green: The Board Game puts players in the role of small business owners looking to go green while still making money. Players will collaborate on projects, making progress toward converting their supply chain to sustainable practices.

The first player to go completely green is the winner. The change isn't easy, though, and players will have to stay profitable to meet the goal. Smart Green: The Board Game combines negotiation and resource management gameplay while teaching players about the principles in the book.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: RPG Merchant Tycoon!!
description:
In RPG Merchant Tycoon!!, players take the roles of optimistic start up entrepreneurs, looking to set up shops in the bustling villages, towns or cities spread throughout the world of your typical 8-bit RPG game. However, these said villages, towns and cities aren't big enough for the 2 (to 4) of yas'! So it's time to get busy and dirty, trading and searching for loot to fulfill the growing line of adventurers looking for some gear! Expand your shop, spend your Gold stock (or hoard it!) wisely, trade with other rival shops, keep secret Stock all to yourself, call in favors from your happy Clients.....do whatever it takes to clinch market Dominance and be the only show in town and start reeling in the BIG money! Who knows, maybe that Flaming Sword of Justice you just sold will be used by the Hero that will save the world?!

RPGMT!! is a 30-60min 2-4 Player high strategy card game in which the player's goal is to finish the game with the best balance between: The amount of Client's orders they were able to fulfill; the amount of Gold they personally have by the end; and the total quality's worth of items in their Display.

Each turn Players can take up to 2 "Actions" (unless they get extra Actions thanks to fulfilling certain Client orders) in their attempt to fulfill Client orders for certain weaponry or item...ry. These Actions let the Players manipulate their Stock items (or Hand cards) and/or their Display items (cards face up in front of a Player for everyone to see/trade) in specific ways to try and beat the rush to fulfill those orders! Ran out of Actions for your turn, but you're only ONE Action away from fulfilling that order?! No Worries!! There are "Gold Actions" that you can use in a pinch, which let you spend Gold to do certain Actions that DON'T count towards your Action limit for your turn....WOOHOO!! After all the Clients have been fulfilled, the game ends and Players then move on to calculating "Dominance", which will determine who the TRUE Merchant Tycoon is!!

The strategic decisions and stiff competition in RPGMT!! really heat up quick due to the fact that Players start out with only a limited number of Actions per turn AND a limited number of cards they can have, so EVERY decision counts! Everything from in what order you'd like to take your Actions, which Client you should fulfill, and should you or shouldn't you use Gold are crucial to Dominance. You might spend all your Action efforts to build up enough items to fulfill an order for a specific Client, but then the Player before you fulfills them leaving you at a disadvantage with items that you might not need now!! Remember, it's not just playing the current Client market, it's also knowing and playing to the weaknesses of your fellow Players!
mechanics: Action Points, Hand Management, Set Collection, Trading

name: Das Labyrinth des Pharao: Sphinx und Triamide
description: Das Labyrinth des Pharao: Sphinx und Triamide consists of five new double-sided player boards for use with the Das Labyrinth des Pharao base game.
mechanics: Pattern Building, Tile Placement

name: Malifaux: Arsenal Box – Resurrectionists (Wave 1)
description: The fate of Malifaux is approaching a crossroads. Forces continue to vie for power, as new allies join the struggle. Contained in this Arsenal Deck you will find all the stat and upgrade cards needed to play the Guild characters and crews found in the Malifaux 2E: Crossroads book.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Horror, Miniatures
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven

name: Traveller Ascension: Imperial Warrant
description:
“The Long Night ends, the Ascension begins!” – CLEON, EMPEROR OF THE IMPERIUM

It is the dawn of the Third Imperium. The Solomani War has ended, and the vast Terran empire claimed from the Valani has finally crumbled. Worlds spread throughout distant sub-sectors of space have lost all communications; they either survived or fell into darkness during the Long Night. The Valani empire has been biding its time, licking its wounds from the war. At last, the Emperor has decreed the Ascension; a reclamation of lost, but not forgotten, worlds the Solomani left behind. It is through you that the Emperor will reach out and reclaim what was once his.
Traveller Ascension™: Imperial Warrant lets you take the helm of untold adventures, space-faring exploration and the thrill of uncovering long-lost riches left from the First Imperium. Granted an Imperial Warrant from the Emperor, you will Expand, Explore and Exploit any surviving world and bring it back into the Imperium’s fold. Rewards come only to those who are bold enough to seize this once-in-a-lifetime opportunity.re, to Expand and to Exploit this new area for the glory of the Imperium… and for your own fame and glory.
mechanics: Open Drafting

name: Super-Bee!
description:
The Relay Race For Honey Jars!

Super-Bee! is a fun family board game. It can be played by 2 to 6 players and it takes about 20 minutes to play.

You are a racing bee and you have to find and collect as many Honey Jars as you can. At the end of the game the bee with the most Honey Jars in storage wins the game. If one of the bees manage to get the storage full before everyone else, then that bee wins the game.

Of course, there are plenty of other surprises on the board, other than Honey Jars. You can discover friends that can help you collect even more honey (Super Bee, Caterpillar) or not so friendly characters like the Drone, who'll make you lose the precious Jars. Sometimes you might find a Spider Web, but don't worry, the spider is nowhere near to harm you. But, you can use its spider web to gather even more honey!

Try it once and you'll be hooked forever!
categories: Animals, Children's Game, Collectible Components, Dice
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Roll / Spin and Move, Stock Holding, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Iqishiqi
description: Iqishiqi (pronounced EE-chee-shee-chee) is an abstract strategy game designed by Joao Neto that is played on a hexagonal board composed of hexagonal cells. Players own designated edges of the board, and by clever placement of stones they push a neutral stone around the board. A player wins if he/she moves the neutral stone to one of his/her edges, or leaves his/her opponent unable to move. The game can be played with 2 or 3 players.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Grid Movement

name: Dungeons & Dragons: Attack Wing – Chimera Expansion Pack
description: The Chimera Torquo is the competitive prize for Month 5 of the Dungeons & Dragons: Attack Wing Organized Play Tournament, Tyranny of Dragons. The prize includes one pre-painted miniature and numerous upgrade cards and tokens.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Malifaux: Hired Guns – Von Schill Box Set
description: For he is the mustache. Von Schill leads his mercenary group; the Freikorps. Their main strength as a whole is they really don't have a weakness. There's no hard counter to Freikorps, they are good at melee, good at shooting, decent Df, good Wp, hardy amount of wounds. And then you have VS tossing out a buff here and there, or just straight up murdering some tough targets and you have a truly fearsome crew. Don't underestimate the power of your opponent not having an easy way to deal with you.
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven

name: The Rise and Fall of Galactic Empires
description:
The Rise and Fall of Galactic Empires is a game where the players garden the civilizations through the phases of birth, rise, glory, fall, and death. It's played in turns, and each turn you do one of the following:


Explore: push the boundaries of the galaxy and find seeds of civilizations. Mechanically, draw and place a few hexagonal sector tiles and then deal and draft three event cards per player.



Conquer: plant a civilization in a sector, in control over anyone who's already there. Mechanically, play a card and place a matching disk on a tile. Cards have special powers that trigger (most often) during this action.



Reap: harvest the power of the civilizations you've cultivated, then decide whether they live or die. Mechanically, simultaneously sell a card with the other players. Its value is based on the value of sectors the matching civilization controls. Then do a simultaneous bid to determine how many disks survive the reaping.
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Stock Holding

name: Berlin '45: The Nightmare Ends – German Heavies
description:
This variant adds 6 new units to the German OB (heavy Assault Guns and Self Propelled Heavy antitank Guns, for the 3 scenarios: Historical, "Maximum" Historical and Operation "Eclipse".
Published in Command magazine #19.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Hexagon Grid

name: Oolong
description:
Oolong is a strategy game of area control for two players. Take turns serving tea to tables in the tea house in an attempt to serve more of your tea than your opponent. Your turn consists of simply placing a token on a tile, but your play tells your opponent where they’re allowed to play next. Controlling a tile will trigger that table’s special of the day, a unique one-time ability. Will you be shrewd enough to fully serve the most tables and savor sweet victory?

The 9 tiles are arranged like the points of a compass rose (plus the center). Players take turns placing a token of their color. The space in which a token is placed indicates the tile on which the next player will place their token. The player who is first to occupy 5 spaces on a tile controls that tile. Unique special abilities for each tile are triggered at different levels of completeness. Whomever is first to control 5 tiles wins.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence

name: Mayfair Games' Limited Edition Promo Expansion Set #18
description:
Flea Market: 15 pieces of cash, 1 Three for the Road token
Giza: The Great Pyramid: 4 Fast Sled tokens


This promo came in Game Trade Magazine (Issue 184 - Jun 2015).
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Dice Brewing: Red Moon Pale Ale
description: Dice Brewing: Red Moon Pale Ale is a promo card which was included with orders of the 2015 re-print of Dice Brewing. The promo card has a space theme, which evokes Board&Dice's new game, Exoplanets, and will most probably be available at conventions.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Set Collection, Worker Placement

name: BattleCON: Vincent Grey Promo
description: A cross game promotional character from Jasco Games' Red Horizon, Vincent Grey gets the opportunity to guess his opponent's attack pair, getting a small but sizable bonus if he gets it half right and outright stunning his opponent if he is completely on the mark. This, along with his hard hitting and surprisingly versatile styles and unique base, makes Vincent both a heavyweight fighter and a predictor fighter -- a combination which should strike fear into the hearts of BattleCON players everywhere.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting
mechanics: Hand Management, Point to Point Movement, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Zobrist Cube
description:
Zobrist cubes are similar to the classic "Soma Cube" puzzle, except that there are many more 3d shapes having sizes up to 5 small cubes. There are enough pieces in the set to simultaneously construct 5 3×3×3 cubes.

The set comes with a code book containing thousands of codes, each of which specifies a set of pieces from which a 3×3×3 cube can be constructed.

The competitive version is to race another player to construct a cube with similar difficulty, but different pieces.
mechanics: Tile Placement

name: Draftica
description:
In Draftica, each player is a Celtic chieftain assembling a tribe of 18 cards. Combinations of cards score points, and the player with the most points at the end of the game wins.

Players do this by collecting (or "drafting") both common cards in the colours red, green, blue and yellow, and rarer special cards that can provide a substantial reward for specialising in certain types of card.

Unlike some other drafting games, there is no lengthy playout phase to determine a winner - the game takes place entirely in the drafting phase itself, with many opportunities to outwit and outmanoeuvre your rivals. May the best drafter win!
mechanics: Open Drafting, Set Collection

name: Lock 'n Load Tactical System: Modern Era 1960-Present Demo
description:
Lock ’n Load Tactical’s System Demo Version 4.1 (v4.1) Modern Era edition. This demo uses the latest set of guidelines and regulations for the game system written by Jeff Lewis, Lead Developer of the Lock ’n Load Tactical Series.

The demo comes with a basic printed rule book, printed map with extra large hexes, one scenario and seventy 1” counters to help you get into one of the easiest tactical systems available. Everything you need to try out LnLT is here.

The Modern Era Edition takes you to Vietnam in 1969, where you can play either the US Army or the Viet Cong forces.
mechanics: Hexagon Grid

name: Marvel Universe Miniature Game: The Avengers Starter Set
description:
From the publisher:

This game is a small scale skirmish level game where Superheroes and Villains face off against each other in a 3D tabletop set up. It could be a city, the Wakandan desert, the Savage Lands, the blue area of the moon or anything you like. In Marvel they fight anywhere.
It is played on a 36" x 36" board so will fit on most tables without a problem.

In a game you will usually have between 4-7 characters on your team. Each of these characters act individually using their own Power to carry out different attacks and use Special Powers.
Many can help or hinder each others though with boosts and actions like a Fastball Special.

The aim of the game is to win set scenarios by completing different tasks and scoring Victory Points. These could be anything from take down / save the highest Level model in the team or rescue and keep a Cosmic Relic.

Each character comes with their own Stat Card which shows everything they can do. Attacks, Defence, Skills, Power, Damage and such.
These are then used in a 2 D8 mechanic during the game. For example, 2D8 plus Attack Stat vs Defence Stat or 2D8 against your own Agility.

Earth's Mightiest Heroes joined forces to take on threats that were too big for any one hero to tackle. With a roster that has included Captain America, Iron Man, Ant-Man, Hulk, Thor, Wasp and dozens more over the years, the Avengers have come to be regarded as Earth's No. 1 team.
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Midgard: The Card Game – Desafio das Runas
description:
Expansion to Migard - The Card Game. The "Desafio das Runas", besides being a new set of challenges, brings a new mode - the cooperative / competitive game.

In "Desafio das Runas", the players come together to win a number of runic challenges and trying to control the magic in the Nine Worlds Vikings. It's a race against time in which every challenge met, the calendar can rotate and mean the end! Still, there is a dispute as to who will be the Jarl with more Renown , when the runes are defeated!

A new set of challenges for the basic game and a new game mode in a single expansion! A very good expansion to "Midgard - The Card Game".
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Pattern Building

name: Midgard: The Card Game – Heróis do Norte
description:
"Heróis do Norte" is an expansion to "Midgard - The Card Game". Comprising 16 Viking heroes, two new event cards and 12 new cards of rewards, this expansion brings to the game a new component to the troops of Jarl - The Hero.

Each hero comes in the player ranks to assist in their dispute by Renown. When active, the hero has two special abilities that can be used at any time in the player's turn and a defense capability in battles against other players.

Bring the northern heroes to fight alongside you and expand your Renown!
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Mythology
mechanics: Hand Management, Pattern Building

name: Midgard: The Card Game – Arsenal de Guerra
description:
"Arsenal de Guerra" is an expansion to "Midgard - The Card Game".

That would be the North Warriors without the best equipment, weapons and artifacts? This expansion brings a number of items that can be incorporated into the troops in the game, expanding its Puissance or providing special skills.

It also introduces the trade because the items can be sold and exchanged between players throughout the match. Altogether there are 22 new items , 02 horses (troops) and 06 new cards that give bonuses to Challenges.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Hand Management, Pattern Building

name: Midgard: The Card Game – Fúria Nórdica
description:
"Fúria Nórdica" is an Expansion to "Midgard - The Card Game". The "Fúria Nórdica" is reflected in the ability of Viking warriors fight like brothers! The expansion Fury Nordic introduces the new letter of class - Bror Krig (War Brothers), which enters into the formation of troops in several different positions.

This opens up the range of possibilities from each Jarl and allows the player to create different configurations in their troops... and more powerful troops! In addition, the expansion brings a new item, Soster vapen (Weapons Sisters), to be used by Krig Bror and 09 new challenges including Krig Bror as a requirement and bring new life to the game!
mechanics: Hand Management, Pattern Building

name: The Red Dragon Inn: Grandma's Sweat Stout
description:
This is the Table Top Day 2016 promo card for the Drink Deck.

This drink gives the player 5 Alcohol Content.

The text of the card reads:
If you gain 5 or more Alcohol Content from this Drink, gain 5 Gold (and a party!) from the Inn.
"Yes, my new friends. The legends are true."
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Humor, Medieval, Party Game
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Hand Management, Player Elimination, Variable Player Powers

name: Moonshot
description:
Gianrix was once the bustling center of life and abundance in this system, but it was taken for granted. They were wasteful and depleted all the planet’s natural resources. Now it lies in ruin, a barren wasteland visited only by thrill seekers and outcasts.

Fortunately, with the help of the other races in the system, we were able to leave Gianrix and build a new life for ourselves…
Yutera is the only habitable moon of Kridana, the largest planet in our solar system. Though the planet is inhospitable, the moon boasts an incredible climate, fertile soil and a host of natural resources. We are grateful to have been given new life on this moon, and in celebration of arriving here we honor the founders with the annual Moonshot Race!

Symbolic of our epic journey, it is a great honor for Squad Commanders to win the trophy for finishing the race first. But things are not always as they seem, as each Squad can and will be found at remote outposts wagering on the outcome of the race! As is often the case, the true victor is the one who wins the most Yuteri.

Moonshot is a fast-paced space race game driven by dice. Players earn points throughout the race and will also attempt to win points by wagering on the outcome. Be the player with the most points - reverting back to Yuteri - to win the game.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Roll / Spin and Move, Take That

name: Fierce fight! Kiev Blitzkrieg
description:
The Fierce fight! Barbarossa series tries to portray the Barbarossa campaign with the popular Series: Fierce fight! system.

This is third game of Fierce fight! Barbarossa series. All 3 games can be linked.

This game focuses on Army Group South's operations. The Axis player needs to defeat the Soviet armies in Ukraine and occupy Kiev.

Time scale: 10 days per turn
Unit scale: Division
Counter: 252
Map: 1 A1 size
Duration: 1941 Jun-Sep


Issue game of Game Journal #57
mechanics: Chit-Pull System, Hexagon Grid

name: Бестиарий Сигиллума: кузница хаоса (Bestiary of Sigillum: Forge of Chaos)
