description: This expansion brings 9 new characters and adds a little bit of uncertainity to the game via random events or fluctuations of damage.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Grid Movement

name: Cosmail
description:
Cosmail can be played by 3 to 6 players and 1 game master. Each player has two planes and one ship. The players begin at the starting spaces, numbered I to VI. Movement is determined by the players by spending a set amount of gas (for the planes) or coal (for the ships), which is printed along each travel route. The players may either travel between to neighboring locations or between two locations which are not next to each other, but can be reached by spending a maximum of 24 units gas or 11 units coal.
Gas and coal can be obtained by rolling two dies or by stopping by a location at which gas or coal can be restocked.
The players can obtain merchandise by by flying to a harbor where the wanted merchandise is in stock and file a purchase option with the game master. The next step is to pick up the merchandise with the ship, before an other player too files an option and picks the merchandise up faster.
The players have to pick up 12 different merchandise-cards before they are allowed to obtain gold at one of three possible locations. After obtaining gold, the players return to their starting space. The players may exchange merchandise, gas and coal according to their value.
The first player to return his ship and his planes to his starting space ends and wins the game. The other players win 2nd to 6th place according to the value of their accumulated merchandise, gas, coal and gold.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Set Collection

name: BattleTech: Handbook – House Davion
description:
Handbook: House Davion is the third in the series of books detailing the nations of the Inner Sphere and is the definitive source book on the Federated Suns.

It includes a detailed history of the Suns, its capital New Avalon, and House Davion that begins in the 23rd century and ends in 3067.

It includes a description and brief history of many worlds that are representative of the Suns as a whole, and it lays bare the often byzantine, multi-layered bureaucracies that run the Suns government and the Armed Forces of the Federated Suns. It glosses over the military that Field Manual: Federated Suns detailed, spending more time on the society, culture, and economics of the most popular BattleTech faction, including brief descriptions of many of the companies that drive the Suns' economy.

Finally, the book includes a rules annex that expands on the sub-regions from Field Manual: Federated Suns and Classic BattleTech Companion, as well as rules for using the fax machines developed by the New Avalon Institute of Science, among other rules expansions and suggestions.

The book closes with new creatures native to the Federated Suns and new terrain and units for use in Classic BattleTech games.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Role Playing, Variable Player Powers

name: Zulu
description:
"Zulu" is a wargame simulation of the battles of the Zulu War of 1879, reflected on a board with fictional names for British held forts.

This a typical 1970's hex based wargame with UGO/IGO turn sequencing.
Sequence of play:
1- Zulu move
2- Zulu attacks resolution
3- British move
4- British artillery attacks resolution
5- British infantry attacks resolution

Victory conditions:

Zulu eliminates all British units or
Zulu occupy 3 forts hexes at end of British turn.

British eliminates all Zulu units or
British occupy 5 Zulu village hexes at end of Zulu turn.

Anything else is a draw at game end.

The copies are very scarce. The game is a highly competitive simulation.

Box contents:
150 die-cut counters
2 rules folders (4 pages each)
1 11" x 15" color map
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Movement Points, Ratio / Combat Results Table, Simulation, Zone of Control

name: Beastly Bust-Up
description:
Description from the publisher:

Who would win in a fight between an elephant and a rhino? What if both of them were standing on an iceberg? What if there was an octopus involved somewhere? What if the octopus was being worried by a tortoise?

In Beastly Bust-Up, a gang of irascible animals from all corners of the globe come together to duke it out for the coveted elephant head trophy. Players wrangle their teams of fighters, trying to send the right beasts to the right places to win the most points.

Battles take place in various habitats, each worth a number of points. Players take it in turns to dispatch fighters of various ranks to contest those habitats, hoping to have the highest total rank in each habitat at the end of the game and claim the points.

This would all be straightforward enough, but each animal has its own special strengths and weaknesses to throw into the mix. Fierce ones can scare others off, cowardly ones need babysitting, agile ones can avoid being squashed, speedy ones can slip in unnoticed... from the mighty lion to the lowly mouse, every fighter can contribute something.

Beastly Bust-Up is a scaleable game that can fill a ten minute coffee break or launch a multiplayer tournament across several hours.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Fighting, Humor, Math, Print & Play
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: Le Billard Finlandais
description:
Le Billard Finlandais is a handmade woodgame with a elastic strap shooting device.

The players use a shooting device to shoot a wooden disk and to try to knock over wooden pins, which are marked with numbers from 1 to 12. The pins are initially placed in a tight group in an upright position. Knocking over one pin scores the amount of points marked on the pin. Knocking 2 or more pins scores the number of pins knocked over. After each throw, the pins are stood up again in the exact location where they landed. The first one to reach exactly 50 points wins the game. Scoring more than 50 will be penalised by setting the player's score back to 25 points. A player will be eliminated from the game if they miss all of the target pins three times in a row.
mechanics: Player Elimination

name: Ten-Minute Dungeon Delve
description:
Build a party of heroes, explore rooms in a dungeon, slay monsters (or be slain...) and grab the loot. Improve your survival chances by using your heroes' special abilities and/or some of the cool stuff you grabbed off the monsters you've dispatched. Make it through seven rooms and you've survived the dungeon - now tally up the gold value of the items you've escaped with.

Gameplay is simple: take the attacker's attack value, subtract the defender's defense value and then add in a 20-sided die roll (die included!). If it's over 10 it's a hit, and you subtract the damage. Or you can use your Special Ability, or one of the items you've picked up from a prior room. Repeat until there are no monsters or heroes alive in the room.

Play cooperatively, solo or semi-competitively - all in less time than it takes to convince your gaming buddies that playing an Elven Hunter is not cliche.
mechanics: Role Playing

name: TradeWarz
description:
Finally the 8th continent has been discovered! After years of hostility behind thick curtains of mist, hidden by Kushan pirates in attempt to keep its infinite resources guarded, the continent of infinity has been unveiled. With the guardians been made void and the curtains of secrecy now destroyed… more and more brave rulers set sail to this new and unexplored continent of Xadlagon.

Xadlagon, this vast continent is in need of leadership and who better to provide it than YOU? Be it as a righteous king or as a ruthless warlord, conquer trade and scheme your way to the top, because here on Xadlagon, YOU rule...Because you CAN!!!
We present to you the a unique experience in tabletop board games, the all South African developed TradeWarz
T – Trade with allies
R – Raid your adversaries
A – Advance your economy
D – Deploy your armies and
E – Exploit the natural resources

The game TradeWarz was developed as one big fun challenge to create strategy board game where “Lady Luck” takes a back row seat to strategic planning and player cunning. This is the "first of its kind" to be developed in South Africa and can compete with the best the rest of the world has to offer with respects to board games in this genre....or any other genre for that matter.

TradeWarz can also serve as an educational tool to educate younger players how to take calculated risks in the game and also further on in life. Players young and old will have to weigh up the trade-offs between various risks and rewards while negotiating a better deal for themselves or their alliance in the game.

This game caters for every personality type as there are many ways to win be it by military might and aggression, expansive economic hoarding or a cautious defensive approach or a combination of these strategies…..you are the King and you decide!!!
categories: Bluffing, Civilization, Economic, Medieval, Political, Territory Building, Wargame
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Commodity Speculation, Enclosure, Hand Management, Trading, Worker Placement

name: Remix
description: this is a dice rolling math based children's game. The dice are then used to make equations. The more dice that are used, the higher the equation is scored. The theme is DJ rat.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Panzer Grenadier: Variant Panthers
description:
From the Avalanche Press website:

No intelligence reports had prepared the German Army for the new Soviet T-34/76 medium tank: a well-balanced vehicle with much better firepower, armor protection and mobility than anything in the German arsenal or even on German drawing boards. In December 1941, the Germany Army’s Weapons Bureau ordered two firms, MAN (Maschinenfabrik Augsburg-Nürnberg) and Daimler-Benz, to produce designs for a new medium tank to out-perform the Soviet T34/76. A third firm, Skoda, was not invited to participate but submitted a design anyway.

After initially selecting the Daimler-Benz tank and bestowing the name “Panther” on it, German leader Adolf Hitler later backtracked and ordered the MAN tank into production instead. The Daimler-Benz prototype, known as the VK3002, was shunted aside as was Skoda’s T25. The MAN Panther eventually became a formidable weapon, but initial production models suffered mechanical problems thanks to its rushed development. Either of the other two tanks would likely have been available sooner.

Variant Panthers lets you try out these rejected tanks on the battlefields of Kursk, in South Flank and Burning Tigers. The Groundhog Day 2016 Golden Journal includes 24 new laser-cut, mounted pieces depicting these two tanks in both German Army and Waffen SS livery. It’s a good-looking set. Plus you get scenarios for their use.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board, Secret Unit Deployment, Simulation

name: My Little Pony: Friendship is Magic – The Cooperative Adventure Game
description:
Players take on the roll of the mane six ponies from the animated series and work together to prepare for a confrontation with one of the series villains. If the ponies have made enough progress, they can thwart the villain.

Each turn the players move their ponies around the game board, which is a map of Ponyville and Equestria. They then attempt to deal with plot issue cards by rolling dice; other ponies can help them by rolling additional dice. Successfully dealing with the issue cards allows them to advance on their Element track. When they advance far enough, they will gain their Element of Harmony.

Meanwhile, the villain is plotting. The villain has a progress track which advances each turn and when new issue cards come into play. Villain event cards will come into play as the track advances and which will cause problems for the ponies. Once the villain track reached the final space, the confrontation begins. Ponies then attempt to defeat the villain with a series of dice rolls. Their success will depend largely on how many Elements of Harmony they have obtained during the game.

Each of the mane six ponies has her own special ability: Twilight Sparkle can advance Element tracks by doing research, Rarity can collect gems to help her resolve issues, Fluttershy is good with animals, Rainbow Dash's movement is faster than the others, Applejack is good at helping other ponies resolve their issues, and Pinkie Pie can help other ponies avoid setbacks.

Players can play stand-alone games or a campaign game made up of a series of games, with a different villain in each game. The ponies can gain new abilities and even become alicorns as the campaign continues.
categories: Adventure, Animals, Card Game, Dice, Fantasy, Print & Play, Travel
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Point to Point Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Guild Ball: The Farmer's Guild – The Honest Land
description:
“Farming is a senseless pursuit. You sow what you may reap, then you reap what you may sow. Senseless.”

— Obulus, Mortician’s Guild

Honest as a day’s work, Grange is no country bumpkin. Filled with unflinching resolve and unbreakable constitution, he’s just a little rough around the edges. When trouble crops up, he’ll plant himself to face it head-on.

Grange is all about grit: cultivating strategies planted at the start of a game, he waits for his plans to mature before reaping the fruits of his labor. Strong communities are built around food we trust to nourish our bodies, and this Guild Ball roster is no different. Emboldened by their sturdy captain, his resilient team works hard to reap what they sow. Patient coaches looking for a Guild that plays more like a family than a team will enjoy the hearty Farmers.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Medieval, Miniatures, Sports, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: BattleTech: Handbook – House Liao
description:
Assailed for centuries by enemies on every side, House Liao’s Capellan Confederation faced its own oblivion time and again. Now, nearly forty years since the realm teetered on the very brink of collapse, the Confederation has returned, reclaiming the pride and unity lost when the armies of Steiner and Davion rolled across their worlds to shatter them. Led by the crafty and charismatic Sun-Tzu Liao, and embracing the spirit of Xin Sheng—rebirth—House Liao once again has become a political and military power to be reckoned with, defying those who would see them fail, and deadly to all who oppose them.

Handbook: House Liao compiles the history, politics, and cultures of the Inner Sphere’s smallest—and perhaps least understood—Great House. This sourcebook also includes game rules for use with Total Warfare, Tactical Operations and A Time of War: The BattleTech RPG, including new support vehicles, equipment, creatures, and more!

Handbook: House Liao continues the faction-based Handbook series that updates the political, economic, and historical details of the major realms in the BattleTech universe.

Era: Civil War Era
Universe Date 3067
Timeline 2086 - 3067
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Variable Player Powers

name: Madcap
description:
Madcap is a quick game that pits two players against each other in a struggle to score more points. Players do not own anything -- neither the runners that score nor the dice that power them -- so they must always think hard about their opponent's response in order to avoid a surprise score. Despite the dice, there is no luck in the usual sense -- the dice simply set the stage and then are never rolled again.

Players use the pre-rolled dice to move the three runners up and down the track. They score points by landing one runner on another -- the higher up on the track, the higher the score. Each turn one of the twelve dice disappears, so players have just six brain-burning turns to score more points than their opponent.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Heroes of Karth: Deathmatch
description:
The Heroes of Karth Deathmatch Basic Game is available for FREE at PNP Arcade as a print-to-play version with the original color art! Other decks will also be added throughout 2022!! Check it out at https://www.pnparcade.com/products/heroes-of-karth-deathmatc....

About the Deck Building Card Game:

Heroes of Karth: Deathmatch is a fantasy deck-building card game based on the Heroes of Karth book series. Choose 2 hero cards to lead your unit cards! Arm yourself with spell and treasure cards!! Then hire and position your cards onto the battlefield, with victory coming to the first to collect 40 unspent gold or 25 kill points!

Players try and outwit their opponent’s strategy in a tabletop game where the cards are the game pieces and players use gold to spawn additional cards onto the battlefield. Balance between using gold to hire units, mercenaries and heroes and saving your gold for the win condition. Utilize a wide range of strategies including ranged or melee classes, spells, pets, magic items, traps, poison, stealth units, healers, totems, and the undead curse. With over 200 cards rendered with stunningly beautiful original artwork, the deck-building choices are unlimited. Play a deathmatch where the careful management of resources and placement of your cards can make the difference between winning and losing!

The Story

From deep in the bowels of the Mines of Taas to the human kingdom of Hathaway, the Curse of the Undead is spreading across Green Valley like the vilest of plagues, wiping out all life in its path. Employing his army of shades to drain their life energy, Xeon the Undead Shadow Dragon has destroyed thousands of worlds throughout the millennia, and the world of Karth is next in his path of destruction. A chance meeting between Llythwain, autistic son of an elf Ranger and Killian, an undead shade has altered the familiar pattern of events, sowing the seeds of a monumental clash between the living and the dead, between good and evil, between the Allegiance and the Shard and Xeon's ferocious undead army. "The Undead Curse threatens Green Valley! The human necromancers are to blame!" With the utterance of those words by the Elven Lords, the Allegiance pact between humans, elves, dwarves, gnomes, and barbarians weakens, just as that of the Shard races grows in strength. By uniting the ogres, goblins, spiders, orcs, kobolds and hill giants under one banner, Xeon has awakened ancient hatred between the two mighty factions and the Shard is ready for war. A group of heroes, a human, gnome, and two dwarves led by an elf mage must gather the strength and courage to unlock the secret of the Undead Curse, but their time is running out.
categories: Card Game, Fantasy, Fighting, Medieval, Print & Play, Zombies
mechanics: Area Movement, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Player Elimination, Team-Based Game

name: Dragon Brew: Expansion Pack One
description:
This 31 card expansion adds four additional player races.

All the races in this expansion have 8 race cards, except Tree Men which have 7.

Tree Men
Leprechaun
Free Gnomes
Fairy Folk
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Worker Placement

name: Aventuria: Promokarte "Nachahmung"
description:
Promocard #23 for Aventuria card game. It was available in the "Drachling" box.

It reads:
Deine Angriffsproben gegen Tiere sind um 2 Punkte erleichtert.

Roughly translated:
Your attack-tests against animals are relieved by 2.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Role Playing, Variable Player Powers

name: Esport Manager
description:
Are you ready to create a team that will go down in the esports history? Become the best esports manager. Train your pupils, be in the spotlight, become the legend! But remember, you are not the only one who dream about it.

Esports Manager is the first esports game that at the very same time is a... board game! As a CEO of an esports team you will be getting more and more prestige and cash, which will allow you to hire the best players.

During a round players have to perform one of 4 actions:
1. Use an Action card. Player can perform action described on the card and pick certain amount of money and prestige.
2. Pick an Action card.
3. Buy a contract. However, player has to remember about having proper level of prestige.
4. Hire any amount of players.

The game is over while the last contract card is being bought.

The main goal of the game is hire the most valuable players. At the end of the game, players will get points for each of their contracted players as well as for coach cards and complementing a set of players of the same type. The person with the most points wins the game.

The game consists of:

30 Action cards
15 Player cards
4 Team cards
3 Coach cards
3 Special cards
16 money tokens
4 prestige tokens
Manual
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Dungeon Twister: Amazone
description:
The Amazone is a mini expansion for the Dungeon Twister series of games. Its stats are Movement 3, Combat 3. She has the ability to seduce an opposing male character in an adjacent field. This then performs (3 AP) valid actions in the interests of the Amazon.

Originally the character of the Collector's Box of the old base game was included (at least as a stand-up, the figure had to be ordered separately), the Amazon will be included in a slightly different form in the new extension "Fallen".
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting, Maze
mechanics: Action Points, Hand Management, Modular Board, Secret Unit Deployment, Tile Placement

name: Cerberus Deck-Building Game: Cryptozoic 2017 Volunteer Promo Card
description:
A normal card to add to any Cerberus game. These cards were printed in extremely limited supply and given to the volunteers that helped demo Cryptozoic's games during the 2017 season of conventions.

Dungstar the Poo Pope
Villain

+ 2 power

You may discard a card from your hand and say, "Total crap!" If you do, look at the top X cards of your deck, where X is the cost of the card you discarded. Put one of them on top of your deck. Discard the rest.
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building

name: Hive Mind: Board Game Card
description: The Hive Mind: Board Game Card is a promotional item that adds six new questions to Hive Mind.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Paper-and-Pencil

name: Dominion of the Stars
description:
Dominion of the Stars is a solitaire game in which you take the role of a world empire expanding its sovereignty into space. This calls for sending starships from your home planet to explore deep space. Along the way you will make various discoveries while trying to colonize as many planets as possible. Colonization of a planet is achieved after its discovery, conquest, and development have taken place. In addition, you must retain control of your planets by protecting them from the game-controlled enemy race.

Planet Discovery
Dominion of the Stars takes place in a fictitious galaxy where many formidable findings await. Among your findings will be planets requiring commitment and investment if you hope to colonize them. Assessing a planet’s profile requires the determination of the following key data:

• The value of the planet’s natural resources.

• The presence of intelligent lifeforms.

• The difficulty of development/colonization.

Quadrant Accessibility
At the onset, the only major discovery is a WarpGate located within your home quadrant. A WarpGate provides instantaneous travel to other quadrants. As more WarpGates are discovered, more quadrants become accessible. The game provides a total of 7 quadrants that can be explored based on access.

Starship Movement
Normal space travel is performed using hex-to-hex movement. In addition to moving from hex to hex, a player may move from level to level (within a hex). Hex level is represented by counter placement; how a counter is orientated or whether it is inverted.

Starship Types
The player oversees the following types of starships on behalf of the empire:

• Exploration starships –used to discover habitable planets in deep space (among other discoveries).

• Military starships --used to secure fleets during exploration, and to conquer/defend planets.

• Development starships -- used on one-way missions, these starships are necessary for colonizing planets.

Winning/Losing
There are different degrees of win and loss as outlined by the Achievement Scale. Through the process of discovering and controlling planets, it is possible to win the game. If you are unable to discover and control the necessary number of planets by the end of 26 turns, the game is lost.

Dominion of the Stars is available as a free Print & Play game (uploaded to BGG) or as a Print-on-Demand (see official link). In the Print & Play version, counters replace all the non-cardboard pieces (except for the rolling dice).
categories: Card Game, Print & Play, Science Fiction, Space Exploration, Wargame
mechanics: Chit-Pull System, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Three Dimensional Movement

name: Frostgrave: Ghost Archipelago – Gods of Fire
description: In the shifting labyrinth of the Ghost Archipelago, there is one group of islands that can almost always be found; the Islands of Fire. Surrounded by a grey haze of sooty smoke, the islands contain numerous active volcanoes. Despite the constant threat of annihilation, many tribal groups call these islands home, building their villages on the rocky slopes or in the black jungles of gnarled and stunted trees that surround the mountains. In this supplement for Frostgrave: Ghost Archipelago, the Heritors lead their crew to these blighted isles in search of clues to the location of the Crystal Pool. Containing a host of new scenarios, crewmen types, creatures, and treasure, this volume also includes guidelines for building unique tribes to use as adversaries in scenarios or as allies to the Heritors in their quest.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Nova Aetas: Architect
description:
This hero will be your preferred if you love to modify the battlefield and surprise your enemies with genial inventions. Even the 2 specializations use special equipment like Meccano or Artifacts.

The Architect's equipment is a mix of technological inventions just created and antique objects lost in time and recovered from a far past!

The Antiquarian can use powerful Artifacts during a battle. These incredible relics are randomly picked from his bag and used once per mission.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Mythology, Renaissance
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Role Playing, Storytelling, Team-Based Game, Turn Order: Time Track, Variable Player Powers

name: Ascension: Gift of the Elements – Lirys, Skirmish Seer Promo Card
description:
Promo card from the Unrivaled Championships Las Vegas 2017 and pre-ordering Ascension: Gift of the Elements from the publisher.

Lifebound Hero

* Cost 4 Runes
* Gain 2 Runes
* Unite: Gain Power equal to the cost of the next Hero you acquire this turn.
* Value: 3 Honor
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: Roil: Defy Fate
description:
Roil is played in a series of hands. Each hand typically includes 4 or more turns. Players can play a set number of hands or to a pre-determined point value.

Each turn of a hand, the player draws three cards and then may play as many cards to the table (to their "court") as they wish. Once a card is played to the table, it cannot be moved except by the action of a Shadow House or Fate card. At the end of their turn, a player may only have five cards in their held hand.

The first Court that includes one card of each rank of the court -- a perfect court -- or to a predetermined value, wins the hand. The scores are recorded and another hand begins.
mechanics: Pattern Building, Set Collection

name: Traveller Customizable Card Game: Aliens of the Imperium
description: Aliens of the Imperium adds 19 new Captain's Cards and 1 new Adventure Card, expanding on some of the alien races inhabiting the empire.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Space Exploration
mechanics: Hand Management

name: Star Saga: The Terror in the Deep
description:
The once peaceful Nameless are leaving their home worlds and expanding further into GCPS space. Their distinctive ships have been spotted on abandoned trade routes before quickly disappearing into slip space. Seemingly random attacks on GCPS monitoring posts are taking place throughout the galaxy.

Now the Council has received information that a group of Nameless has settled on a planet on the edge of Corporation space, building a hi-tech biosphere deep beneath the ocean. Blaine and his team of mercenaries have been hired to find out why the Nameless are making these incursions into GCPS space, while also stealing any samples of the arcane technology used by these mysterious beings. But heading underwater, into the natural environment of the Nameless, could prove to be their most dangerous mission yet…
—description from publisher's website

This is the first expansion for Star Saga, the science fiction dungeon crawler for 1-5 players,where one player becomes the Nexus Player, who is responsible for controlling the actions of the minions and bosses, all represented by the new Nameless aliens plastic 28mm miniatures. The other players take the role of the mercenaries, with 2 new mercenaries miniatures in this expansion.

The box includes the new storyline 'The Terror in the Deep' Mission Book, with 6 new missions to play through, and contains:
2 Pre-assembled Plastic Mercenaries
2 Pre-assembled Plastic Bosses
18 Pre-assembled Plastic Minions
2 Mercenary Cards
2 Boss Cards
6 Minion Cards
21 Equipment Cards
14 Nexus Cards
8 Skill Cards
6 High Quality, Double-sided, Cardstock Tiles
24 High Quality, Double-sided, Cardstock Counters
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Miniatures, Science Fiction
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board

name: A.E.G.I.S.: Combining Robot Strategy Game – Variant Command Expansion Set
description:
During the Five Nations War's greatest battles, the robots of these new heroes and villains took on powerful new forms when the situation was dire!

Promo set of Variant Commander Robots for A.E.G.I.S. for use after the campaign mode, variants each have a combination of alternative attack abilities, modified states, or alternative commander powers.Each robot in the expansion uses an existing game piece.

These new robots can be included in commander draft, or in constructed play, and allow for new and different strategies.

This expansion was previously available as a part of the kickstarter campaign, but does not come included in the retail base set. In A.E.G.I.S' numbering system, this is "Expansion Set 6"
mechanics: Action Points, Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Player Elimination

name: Blood Red Skies: German – Junkers JU-88 A Bomber
description:
Originally designed as a Schnellbomber (fast Bomber) the Junker JU88 became Germany's most successful multi-role combat aircraft in World War II. The production ran from 1936 to 1945 and over 16,000 were built, more than any other twin-engine plane in the Luftwaffe. Miniatures are supplied unpainted and some assembly may be required

Contents:

3 Junkers JU-88 A German Bombers
3 Decal Sheets
3 Advantage Flying Base & Extension
3 Double-sided Pilot Skill Discs
1 Aircraft Card
1 Assembly Instruction Leaflet
categories: Aviation / Flight, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Flames of War: Battle of Stalingrad – War on the Eastern Front
description:
Stalingrad is your introduction to the exciting world of Flames Of War, the world's most popular World War II miniatures game.

The Flames Of War 'Start Here' booklet is designed to get you playing Flames Of War as soon as possible. Glue your tanks together, grab some dice, a tape measure and an opponent and follow the instructions in this booklet to play a simple game. Once you get the hang of the basic rules in this booklet, you can delve into the full rules and start playing larger, more detailed games.

Once you've played a few games and have a solid grasp of the rules you might find yourself wanting to expand your force with infantry, artillery, aircraft, or even a second unit of tanks! Flames Of War has rules and models that cover all of this, and more, and is available both online and in your local gaming store.

Contains:

1x Plastic Panzer III Tank
1x Plastic Panzer IV Tank
1x Plastic KV Tank
1x Plastic T-34 Tank
1x Plastic Valentine Tank
2x Plastic Tank Commander Sprues
1x Flames of War Mini Rulebook
1x Flames of War 'Start Here Booklet'
2x Terrain Cards
6x Dice
9x Unit Cards
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Normandy 1944
description:
This is a card-driven game on the 1944 Normandy landing. Basically, the system is the same as Manstein's Trump: The Third Battle of Kharkov.

Components:

120 pieces (15 mm)
1 map (A2 size)
4 card sheets
One rule book (12 pages in Japanese)


--

Issue game in Command Magazine Japan #141
mechanics: Action/Event, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hexagon Grid, Movement Points, Ratio / Combat Results Table, Simulation, Zone of Control

name: Spellcaster: the Frostgrave Magazine #2
description: Containing optional rules for Frostgrave and Frostgrave: Ghost Archipelago. This issue includes Dragons, traps and Mech Wars.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Role Playing, Variable Player Powers

name: Warfighter: Expansion #37 – K9 & Handlers
description:
The military working dogs are ready for action!

The K9 expansion brings a different soldier type to your team. When you bring a K9 unit on a mission you will draw an event card when you place a location card, before drawing for hostiles. These events will range from, bombs, intimidation, rescue, takedown or threat classification. Each K9 has varying stats to check against when rolling to resolve these events. There are plenty of skills and equipment K9 units can be equipped with to gain bonuses against the threats.

This expansion offers 80 cards including:


9 Player Soldier Handlers (4 US, 1 Israel, 1 Australia, 1 UK, 1 Russian, 1 Poland)
9 Squad K9 Soldiers (4 US, 1 Israel, 1 Australia, 1 UK, 1 Russian, 1 Poland)
18 Weapons (4 Israel, 4 Australia, 3 UK, 3 Russian, 4 Poland)
6 Equipment
11 Skills (3 Human, 8 K9)
21 K9 Encounters
6 K9 Objectives


—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Modern Warfare
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Hand Management

name: Haunt the House: Deluxe Edition
description:
Deluxe edition of the game includes:

- The Graveyard
- The Darker Corner
- A glow-in-the-dark box

In Haunt the House, we are ghosts competing to scare Ghost Hunters out of the various Rooms of our haunted house, and collecting their exploration gear as trophies. Each Ghost Hunter is scared out only by a specific combination of Scares. Each player has a hand of Scares they will use to try and get those Ghost Hunters out!

On your turn, do one of two things; Play Scares, or call BOO! When you Play Scares, you can play them face down to a Ghost Hunter (so that other players won't know what you've played), or face up (which gives other players information, but allows you to activate the awesome power of the Room that Ghost Hunter is in.)

When you call BOO!, point to a Ghost Hunter and reveal any facedown Scares, then (if more Scares are needed and if you have them) add Scares from your hand to finish off the Ghost Hunter. Congratulations... you've scared out that Ghost Hunter and grab their gear for your collection!

At the end of the game, the ghost who has collected the most valuable sets of gear wins the game!

The experienced version of the game introduces a variety of Phantoms; helpful allies that you can play to activate game-changing powers.
mechanics: Hand Management, Push Your Luck, Set Collection

name: Burning Suns: Parallel Galaxies
description:
32 new systems, 10 new factions, and more miscellaneous tokens for Burning Suns. The "new" factions are duplicates of the originals with different names and associated art, allowing two players to have the "same" core race. For example, the Terrans and Terran Marauders have the same Race profiles (same ship stats, same number of technology slots and ship upgrade slots). The ideology and framework tiles are exact duplicates.

It's another set of 18 punchboard sheets just like in the core game.

—user summary
categories: Civilization, Fighting, Science Fiction, Space Exploration, Territory Building
mechanics: Action Points, Action Queue, Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Area-Impulse, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers, Worker Placement

name: Heroes of the Road
description:
A solitaire sports replay game which enables the player to replay Cycling Grand Tours stage by stage.
Chart and dice system, which requires a race data book for each tour. Each data book contains the ratings of each cyclist in the particular tour.
The race unfolds stage by stage. It allows for time gaps, mountain points and finish line sprint points to be totalled.
Flat stages hilly stages, mountain stages and time trials are all included.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil

name: Pen & Paper Football
description:
Pen & Paper Football is football without the commercials, endless merchandizing and prison sentences. A few dice and some paper is all you need to simulate an American football game. Just find some friends (or play solo), roll up some teams and pit them against each other in League Play, which requires eight simple dice rolls to play a game, or in Head-to-Head play, which simulates a game play-by-play.

P&PF has all the rules you need to play a whole season of football, with rules for passing, running, kicking, penalties, injuries and even off-season rules for team development. There are dozens of sample teams you can use and handy record sheets for teams, leagues and games.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling

name: Blinq
description:
Blinq (Binary + link) is a connection game that uses dual coloured square tiles composed of two rectangles and shared by both players.

Players alternate turns placing those blocks according to some simple stacking rules, each trying to connect the two sides of the board of her colour. Notice that on their turn, players play both colours at once, as the blocks are indivisible.

EQUIPMENT

There are two editions of Blinq:


Basic: 30 dual-coloured blocks and a 4×4 board printed in a carrying bag.
Advanced; 54 dual-coloured blocks, a special ‘neutral’ block and a carrying bag with a 4×4 board printed on one side, and a 5×5 board on the other.
mechanics: Network and Route Building, Tile Placement

name: Promise Reborn
description:
Overview: Promise Reborn is a 2-4 player deck-building game where players try to deliver cards back to their Realm in order to gain Prosperity and win the game. Players begin with 6 cards in their deck, and draw 4 cards for their hand. 4 cards form a main deck is placed in the center row. On their turn, a player plays all the cards from their hand, gaining Strength and other special abilities. Players spend their Strength to either Gather cards to their discard pile, or Deliver cards to their Realm to be scored for Prosperity. At their end of their turn, the player draws 4 cards form their deck, shuffling their discard pile to form a new deck if they ever run out of cards in their deck. When a player has 20 or more Prosperity at the end of a round, the game stops. The player with the most Prosperity wins. The game is light, fast, and fun.

The Story: After the Great Cataclysm the realms of Promise were shattered. Once great empires now lay in ruin. It is time to rebuild our realms, and you have been chosen to help. Explore the realmsscape in search for Artifacts, lost Knowledge, Allies, and key Resources Gather what you find to help you in your quest, or deliver them to your realm to bring prosperity. The realm with the most prosperity will be a beacon of light to all in Promise Reborn.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building

name: マーダーミステリー～約束の場所へ～ (Murder Mystery: To the Promised Place)
description: マーダーミステリー～約束の場所へ～ (Murder Mystery: To the Promised Place) is a murder mystery scenario for first-time players of such that can be played without needing a game master. Each player takes the role of someone related to the murder victim, and all of you will be interviewed to facilitate the investigation, but could the murderer be someone among you?
mechanics: Unspecified

name: God of War: The Card Game – Boy!
description:
Originally given out at GenCon 2019 for playing a demo of God of War: The Card Game.

This Promo card is designed to be used in the Solo Player mode. During Setup, shuffle this card among your Starting deck. The 'Boy!' card functions exactly like other Special cards, and when used, allows you to refresh 1 of Atreus' abilities.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Pathfinder Adventure Card Game: Core Set – Corpse Plate promo card
description:
Promo card given out as participation prize at Gen Con 2019.

Card type: Armor
Check to acquire: Constitution, Fortitude 12

Powers:
Display. While displayed:
- You may evade Undead monsters you encounter.
- When you suffer any damage, you may draw this card to reduce it by 1.
- If proficient, when you suffer any damage, you may discard to reduce it to 0; you may succeed at Fortitude 7 check to recharge instead.

Keywords: Heavy Armor, Magic
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Role Playing

name: Cancelletto
description:
Cancelletto (Hash) is a fast cooperative abstract game for 2 players, played on a modular board. The goal is to move all the meeples in their right cell before the board collapses.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action Queue, Cooperative Game, Grid Movement, Map Reduction, Modular Board, Pattern Recognition, Square Grid, Variable Set-up

name: Shitenno: Chonin Promo
description:
The Chonin is a promotional add-on role for Shitenno.

Rule: the Chonin has no honor, so he is always the last player.
His power is that he has a discount of 3 kokus for the acquisition of a province by bribery.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Set Collection

name: Nations At War: Starter Kit
description:
The Nation At War (NaW) Starter Kit v3.0 has everything you need to learn the NaW game system. This pack contains the full one-piece map, counters, and player aid for you to get the most of the FREE scenario in the FREE NaW Core Rules download. We understand how hard it is getting into a new and complex rule system, which is why we’ve provided this kit so you can play the scenario in the same way as you would a full scenario in a core game.

The NaW Core Rules v3.0 contains the latest set of guidelines and regulations for the game system, with a focus on the necessary rules for basic infantry combat. Our goal is to present the rules in a straight forward manner without disrupting their existing structure and foundation from previous versions. For clarity, some rule sections have been modified not with content but with a new structure,
e.g., additional subsections, more bullet points, or more images and examples. Additional cross-referencing of rules and expanded unit-image diagrams have also been added.

Requires the Nations At War Core Rules v3.0 manual to play.

Nations At War Core Rules are now available in the following format Editions for downloads.

PDF - http://bit.ly/NaW-PDF-CR
EPUB - http://bit.ly/NaW-EPUB
MP3 - http://bit.ly/NaW-MP3
Audiobook - http://bit.ly/NaW-Audiobook
Hardcover and Audible - http://bit.ly/NaW-Amazon
We want to also remind you about our Boot Camp training videos.
NaW Bootcamp - http://bit.ly/NaW-Bootcamp

All are free downloads except for the Hardcover and Audible versions.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Hexagon Grid

name: Blood Bowl (2016 edition): Lizardmen Pitch & Dugout Set
description:
The jungles of the New World are riddled with the remains of ancient temples, built by the Lizardmen in service to their Slann masters. This reversible Blood Bowl pitch features one such ruin, in two different states. On one, the temple lies dormant, the flora and fauna of the rainforest threatening to reclaim it. On the other side, the temple has been pressed into new service by the Lizardmen, with fresh glyphs and blazing pyres.

You’ll also find a pair of matching double-sided dugouts to complete the theme. Each dugout features a score tracker, boxes for Reserves, Knocked Out and Serious Injury, plus goal and re-roll trackers. Rules to use each side of the pitch are included for easy reference.

—description from publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures, Sports
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Quodd Heroes: Promo Pack 2
description:
Promo pack contains 3 promo cards.

- World Event "Synergy", where you may have up to three items/pets.

- World Event "An End to Chaos...", which gets rid of the world event deck, after giving each player an individual works event card to pay at will.

- World Event "Free Motion", where tunnels and teleporters don't end movement.

Released at conventions in 2019.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy
mechanics: Action Queue

name: Rucksack
description:
Rucksack is a lighthearted card game that throws each player into the most extreme scenarios you can think of. But don’t worry, you get to collect 5 (maybe not so useful) items to help you survive. It’s up to you to figure out how to use them and convince the other players that you would make it out alive!

Each round, a scenario card is drawn describing an intense survival situation that all players must survive. Players draw item cards and choose whether to keep them or discard them for the chance at better items.

Once everyone has 5 cards, players take turns describing how they would use those items to survive the scenario. Your story can be as crazy, funny, or realistic as you like. All players then vote to see whose story wins the round. The player with the most votes after 3 rounds wins the game!
mechanics: Open Drafting, Storytelling, Voting

name: Test Match Card Game
description:
Enjoy authentic cricket fun with this compact card and dice game. Take turns batting, bowling and rolling to see who can score the most runs from two quick innings. Fun and easy to play with just the right amount of strategy and surprise for cricket fans of all ages.

Each round the players takes on the role of batsman and bowler during an over. Each drawing 6 cards from either the stroke deck or bowl deck representing the 6 balls in an over. During each turn, the bowler plays a bowl card from his hand and the batsman responds with a stroke card. The result of the ball is resolved. When fielding is resolved, the top card of the fielding deck is revealed and the fielding dice is rolled to determine the outcome.
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Dice Rolling, Die Icon Resolution, Simulation

name: Woods of Tarnaris: 6 Player Expansion
description: This expansion for Woods of Tarnaris: Path to Luslaria adds two card decks with 20 cards each for the 5th and 6th player.
categories: Educational, Expansion for Base-game, Memory, Number
mechanics: Memory, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Kopi Dash
description:
Do you have what it takes to be a lightning-fast barista?
A super-fast card game where you alone or with other make drinks under 5 minutes! Play the right ingredient cards to fulfill the customer's orders. Pick your card wisely and avoid wasting time, you need to be FAST!

Set up the game by shuffling each customer and ingredients deck. The customer deck is set to face down and the ingredients deck divided into 2 face-up stacks. Give every player ingredients card according to the number of players involved, and set up a 5-minute timer. The timer starts after the first customer card is opened. Every player contributes to fulfilling the customer’s order by placing the right ingredients cards. refill ingredients card from the stacks every time the amount of card in hand decreased. If an order cannot be fulfilled, a player can discard their card in hand face down into the used ingredients pile and refill their hand from the ingredients stack, then start the order from the beginning. After the stacks of ingredients exhausted, take all the used ingredients card and do a 10-second shuffle then divide them by 2 stacks as usual. The game ends after either the players have completed all the orders which resulted in a win or the timer ends which the players lose.

-description from designer
mechanics: Pattern Recognition, Speed Matching

name: Gruppe Nord: The German Kriegsmarine in World War II (2012 Standard)
description:
Gruppe Nord traces the history of the German Kriegsmarine’s surface fleet in the North Atlantic, the North and Norwegian Seas in WW II.

Misunderstood and misused by Hitler and his generals, the roster of Germany’s surface ships is filled with famous names: Bismarck, Admiral Graf Spee, Scharnhorstand many others. However, the battle history of these powerful combatants and first-class crews was more a series of pursuits and defeats than victories. There were some successes at sea, like the raiders, and their story is included in Gruppe Nord’s 128 pages.

Packed with seventeen historical and hypothetical battles, historical sidebars and introductory material expand the background of some of the most famous naval battles of the era. The Trilogy-standard annexes cover the Kriegsmarine and Luftwaffe, including many hypothetical units.

The information in this booklet is not only compatible with Command At Sea 4th edition, the data is now in the same format and uses the same standards as Harpoon and Fear God & Dread Nought, the other core games in the Admiralty Trilogy.

Gruppe Nord has been updated to use the 2012 Standard, an improved formula to calculate a ship’s damage points. Please make sure that all ships on both sides in a scenario are using either the older 2006 Standard, or the new 2012 Standard.

—description from publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Nautical, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Simulation

name: Pocket Investigations: Apollo 22
description:
Pocket Investigations is a series of "escape boxes", i.e. cooperative board games that are based on escape games, but playable at home.

The scenario Apollo 22, the players lead the investigation on a mission to the moon and try to start restart the space shuttle.
mechanics: Cooperative Game

name: MAYA!
description:
Background

In the Myth story of Maya culture, the twins Hunahpu and Xbalanque occasionally found their talent in kicking soccer.
They played soccer everyday and had practiced it really hard.
However, the Gods in underground were finally provoked since the twins were too noisy.
The Gods summon Hunahpu and Xbalanque to underground and force them to take a series of terrific trials in different rooms where filled with dancing swords made with dragonglass or bloody bats that could eat their heads off.
If the twins can pass these trials they can get to have a final soccer battle with the Gods.

Gameplay
The players are acting the fans of the twins and will have to assist them to complete the rooms challenges.
The fast player who helps the twins to complete the challenges will get the bonus.
The player with most bonus points will win the game and get to witness the final battle.

—description from the publisher
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Collectible Components, Dice, Mythology, Party Game
mechanics: Action Drafting, Dice Rolling

name: Blood Sweat & Iron: A Simple Set of American Civil War Ironclad River Combat Rules
description:
Blood Sweat & Iron is a simple American Civil War Ironclad river actions rule set, it uses a very simple combat system to allow you to play battles within a couple of hours.

The system uses datasheets for each ship in the game, all are at the back of the rules ready for you to print out and use.

It is meant to be a fun game that offers the players a feel for the river battles of the era, this is not meant to be a true historical simulation.

There are no huge charts needed to play as almost everything you need is either on the ship’s datasheets or on a Quick Reference Sheet, all tokens are supplied as well.

The rules cover over eighty ships of the time, plus a few extras to add to your games like shore forts, barges and fire rafts etc. etc.

—description from the publisher
categories: American Civil War, Miniatures, Nautical, Print & Play, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Paper-and-Pencil

name: Donnybrook: Skirmish Rules, 1660-1760
description:
Donnybrook is a fast and fun skirmish game which is easy to pick up and full of period flavour (Lace Wars).

The book is 110 pages of rich colour with:

186 beautiful photographs,
maps,
original artwork,
seven scenarios,
example game in comic strip format,
period primer for numerous conflicts,
faction guides/force builder,
points system.


—description from the publisher
categories: Age of Reason, Book, Miniatures, Pike and Shot, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement

name: To Rule the Waves: Naval Battles in the Mediterranean in the 1880s.
description:
“The surer of himself an admiral is, the finer the tactical development of his fleet, the better his captains, the more reluctant must he necessarily be to enter into a melee with equal forces, in which all these advantages will be thrown away, chance reign supreme, and his fleet be place on terms of equality with an assemblage of ships which have never before acted together.”—Alfred Thayer Mahan, The Influence of Seapower Upon History, 1660-1783.

To Rule The Waves is an introductory level wargame simulation on the British Navy’s bombardment of the Egyptian Forts at Alexandria in 1882, as well as several “what if” naval battles that could have occurred amongst the European powers in the Mediterranean during the 1880s. This decade was marked by peace amongst the Imperialist nations, but there were events that “rocked the boat” and could very easily have led to conflict; especially in the Mediterranean Sea that for ages has been the nexus of commerce as well as conflict. This decade was also marked by tremendous innovation in warship design and tactics. The pace of change was such that no nation could rest assured that their fleet’s composition was proven or superior to that of their opponent. This was not an easy time for Admirals and ships’ captains…

The game design is meant to be simple and highly playable, yet one that portrays the historical challenges facing the combatants.

Learn and enjoy!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Simulation, Variable Set-up

name: Fistful of Lead: Bigger Battles!
description:
What Fistful of Lead Core Rules are to skirmish level wargaming, Bigger Battles is for large scale wargaming.

The beloved Fistful of Lead card mechanics are still there to drive the action, but now each card controls a unit, rather than one soldier.
How many units, you ask? How many cards are in a deck, my friend? Yep. You can play 52 units on a table! That is a bigger battle.

In most games, each player can control up to 5-6 units and their Commanders and Heroes without much trouble.
Games can have up to 8 players without slowing down the game.
Now, you can dig out all your old miniatures gathering dust and have a game ready to go in a few minutes.

Experienced wargamers and new players alike will enjoy this game.
Bigger Battles is perfect for convention games and just one-on-one contests.

—description from the publisher
categories: Ancient, Book, Fantasy, Medieval, Miniatures, Post-Napoleonic, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Turn Order: Random

name: Infamy, Infamy!
description:
Infamy, Infamy! are rules for large skirmishes in the Roman world.

This, the first volume in a series of three parts, focusses on Rome's wars with their western barbarian enemies, from 60 BC to AD100.
Covering the campaigns in Gaul, Britannia and Germania, the rules use unique game mechanism to reflect the asymmetrical of these wars, with the discipline and drill of Rome versus the frenzy and passion of their northern neighbours.

Infamy, Infamy! is a challenging game that places you in the shoes of a Roman Centurion or Barbarian warlord on the frontiers of the Empire. Commanding a core force of around 50 figures you will be able to fight your way through a year on the border using the Infamy campaign system.
Can you achieve a Triumph, or will your campaign end in Infamy?

This is the core rule book.

To fully enjoy Infamy, Infamy! you will also need the Infamy Card Deck and we also recommend the Infamy Token Set.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Simulation

name: Roll for Lasers
description:
Our museum brings science and history together for people of all ages. From our Kids Zone engaging children through STEM activities to our ever-popular Dinosaurs exhibit, the rotating Weapons Through the Ages, and our latest exhibit on Ancient Egypt, losing a single item would be heartbreaking. We MUST be protected. A handsome sum awaits for the team who can best demonstrate how they will safeguard us from greedy robbers.

Goal!
Have the most points at the end of 4 rounds.

Setup
You will need 6 dice and writing tool!
Each player takes a corner of the grid where the sign is.

Game play
4 rounds and 3 turns a round.

Roll six dice and place circles.
Roll six dice and place mirrors.
Roll 6 dice and fire lasers!


—description from the publisher
mechanics: Paper-and-Pencil, Re-rolling and Locking

name: Looters of the Labyrinth
description:
At last you've found it; a legendary and mysterious labyrinth, rumored to hold many treasures! Unfortunately, you're not alone; you've been followed by other treasure raiders, and you'll have to act quickly and shrewdly to secure the plunder for yourself.

OVERVIEW
This is a thematic abstract spatial strategy game for 2-8 players in which players place and demolish walls to be the first to reach the treasures in the center of the labyrinth.
It's recommended to play with 2-4 individual players or 2 teams of 2-4 players each. Game length scales by player count; roughly 15 minutes per player.

SETUP
The game is played on a square grid board, which is empty at setup except for 13 treasures near the center and player pawns adjacent to the corners. At the start of the game, players are dealt a hand of labyrinth wall cards which correspond to labyrinth wall pieces which are played on the board throughout the course of the game.

TURNS
Players take turns in clockwise order, choosing to perform one of four actions each turn; moving their player pawn, playing a labyrinth wall card to place a labyrinth wall on the board, weakening one of their own labyrinth walls on the board, or placing their rubble token on any labyrinth wall on the board.

MECHANICS
Pawns can only move orthogonally and can only stop when hitting either a labyrinth wall or the edge of the board, and pass through other pawns. Pawns collect treasure by moving through the treasure's square. Labyrinth walls are weakened whenever a pawn hits them, eventually being demolished instead and removed from the board. Players can only draw a new card when one of their labyrinth walls is removed from the board. Each player has only one rubble token; this can be played on any labyrinth wall on the board and acts as an open square, but must remain on that wall until the wall is demolished.

TEAM PLAY
Playing the game with two teams is the same as playing with individuals, except that collected treasure is pooled for each team on a team treasure board, and public table talk is typically allowed.

STRATEGY
Basic strategies involve placing labyrinth walls to either let your pawn stop in line with treasure, or to block other player's pawns. More advanced strategies include accomplishing both of the above with a single wall placement, using other player's constructions to your advantage, and placing walls to create an unblockable path to one or more treasures. Additionally, being careful to not run out of cards and using your rubble token wisely are both important.
The ability to visualize and plan potential routes and layouts is key to mastering the game's strategy. Team play brings even more strategic depth; teammates can help each other achieve goals and work together to thwart the competition.

GAME END
The game ends immediately once it is no longer possible for the player(s) with the fewest treasures to gain enough treasures to have the most treasures. The number of treasures needed to win per player count is specified in the instruction manual for clarity.

—description from the designer
categories: Abstract Strategy, Adventure, Ancient, Exploration, Maze, Mythology
mechanics: Catch the Leader, Grid Coverage, Grid Movement, Pattern Movement, Race, Square Grid, Take That, Team-Based Game

name: Roll to the Hill: Colina Abajo
description:
The kids in neighborhood Doragua and GATO NEGRO compete in who's built the fastest kart.
They've organized wacky kart's races along the highest hills in the city. Who's got the fastest kart?

Roll the dice. Each player chooses from the same dice results and simultaneously draw, with arrows, his kart's movements downhill (six in total). In every movement, or action, the karts go down a level, except for brake and boost.


Español

Los chicos del barrio a y la población b compiten por quien ha construido el carro más rápido. Han organizado carreras de autos locos a lo largo de las colinas más altas de la ciudad. ¿Quién será el más veloz?

Lanzan los dados y todos los jugadores, con los mismos resultados y simultáneamente, dibujan con flechas los movimientos de su carrito durante el descenso a la colina. Considerando que entre cada acción los carros descienden un nivel –excepto freno e impulso-.

-description from designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Different Dice Movement, Paper-and-Pencil, Pattern Movement
publishers: Caracol Juegos de Mesa, Ornitorrinco Sessions

name: Warhammer Age of Sigmar: Warcry – Gotrek Gurnisson Promo Card
description: From the December 2019 issue of White Dwarf. Add the legendary hero Gotrek Gurnisson to your games of Warcry.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Dungeonology: Unruly Students
description:
There is an air of rebellion in Rocca Civetta! The aspiring professors got tired of the rules of the University and accompanied by their brotherhoods, they will enter the dungeons causing chaos.

With this expansion, the Scholars of the core game become fearsome Boss. Each of them will be at the head of a new university brotherhood with specific Students, of different colors, who will act against the players in the most disparate ways.

When one of these new Boss is used in the game, the Students of its brotherhood can be used in addition to the standard Students of the core game, and drawing one of them from the University Bag will activate the boss special powers!

Finally, in this expansion, you will find rules for playing games with two of these Bosses in the same game; double threat, double fun!

--description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Miniatures, Mythology, Renaissance
mechanics: Area Movement, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Hand Management, Modular Board, Pick-up and Deliver, Take That, Tile Placement, Variable Player Powers
publishers: Ares Games, Fishbone Games, Ludus Magnus Studio

name: NOVA: Race from the Sun
description:
Centuries into the future, scientists experimenting with fusion technology have triggered the Sun to go Super Nova! To escape the expanding corona, players must mine resources, manage their crew population and research sufficient technology to traverse actual locations in our Solar System and escape into the greater Milky Way Galaxy.

On a turn, players have a variable number of actions to perform based on their Crew size. Actions include Mining (taking a resource die from their current planet or moon), Researching (gaining a technology card for new abilities), and Traveling (attempting a roll with resource dice to get to the next orbital location away from the sun). There are also interactive actions between players including Hacking (stealing a technology card), Spying (using another player's tech), and Attacking to steal a resource.

The ultimate goal is to escape the Sun's corona beyond Pluto and into the greater Milky Way with the highest number of crew.

The base game contains a Solar System board, 10 transparent corona covers, and over 75 dice in 8 different colors, 49 technology cards and 4 spaceship player markers.

NOVA: Race from the Sun also features a distinct Solo Mode with 864 possible combinations of technology and a unique scoring system for high replayability.

Write your chapter in humanity's Solar saga!

-description from designer
categories: Adventure, Dice, Print & Play, Space Exploration
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Events, Race

name: Flames of War: Afrika Korps – German Forces In The Desert 1942-43
description:
The German Afrika Korps is a hard-fighting force of tough veteran troops who have won many battles and expect to win many more. Their Panzer III and Panzer IV tanks outclass the British tanks they face, and have been steadily upgraded to maintain their edge over the opposition. Their infantry are organized to have "few men, many weapons," so they pack a ferocious punch whether facing infantry or tanks. These are backed by the famous "88" dual-purpose anti-tank/anti-aircraft gun and the Stuka dive bomber.

Inside this book you'll find:
- Background on the German Afrika Korps and its part in the fall of Tobruk, the battle of Alam el Halfa, and the Battle of Medenine.
- Instruction on how to build a Panzer III Tank Company, Panzer IV Tank Company, or Africa Rifle Company.
- A detailed painting guide to help you prepare your German troops for combat.

—description from the publisher's website
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation

name: Until the Bitter End:  Tanks
description:
Until the Bitter End - Tanks is a World War 2 wargame. This is the third game in the Until the Bitter End series and the first that focuses, solely, on tank (and other armoured fighting vehicles) battles. This is a print and play game for solitaire and two-players. This is a standalone game in my series of WW2 print and play games. You don't need to have played or own the first games - all of the digital PDF files are included (you simply print it out, provide yourself with a regular six sided dice and a pencil).

—description from the designer
mechanics: Ratio / Combat Results Table

name: First Strike!
description:
First Strike looks at, well, the "first strike" by British airplanes. On Christmas Day, 1914, float planes were brought near land by the earliest "seaplane tenders" and turned loose on an "air reconnaissance" by planes which just happened to be carrying bombs and looking for Zeppelin sheds. There was also hope of luring out the German fleet, and an unexpected result of having the British naval force attacked by German airplanes.

Who would guess the very first "carrier-based air attack" would happen on Christmas Day, 1914? Yes, it happened! British seaplane tenders supported a "reconnaissance" against the German naval base at Cuxhaven . . . carrying bombs in the hopes of destroying the Zeppelin sheds that were there also. The fleet was attacked by German seaplanes in turn, and a remarkable adventure ended with few casualties on either side. It would make a great movie, but for now, it's a great game!

-description from publisher's website
categories: Aviation / Flight, Nautical, Wargame, World War I
mechanics: Chit-Pull System, Dice Rolling, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Warhammer 40,000 (Ninth Edition): Codex Supplement – Deathwatch
description:
The Deathwatch are a widespread Chapter of Space Marines and the Imperium's greatest weapon against the manifold threats posed by countless xenos races. From their hidden bases in orbiting watch fortresses, the Deathwatch despatch carefully selected operatives to hunt down and exterminate alien presences wherever they may be found. Each of these post-human warriors is a veteran of countless battles, tithed by their original Chapter to undertake the Long Vigil with the Deathwatch, guarding against alien incursion. Only the most skilled of xenos-hunters are afforded this honour and, amongst their new battle-brothers, they learn tactics and strategies to slay a wide range of alien races. The Deathwatch are an elite force equipped with a variety of specialist ammunition types, unusual weapons and secret wargear developed to more efficiently cut down their scuttling enemies. They are black-armoured hunters, filled with a righteous detestation for the xenos, and will not rest until the stain of the alien is scoured from the Galaxy.

Inside this 64-page hardback codex, you'll find everything you need to unleash the Deathwatch in battle, plus thrilling lore and art to inspire your own collection.

Inside this book, you'll find:

The history of the Deathwatch, with a look at how they guard the Imperium against every alien threat – from without and within
A Deathwatch bestiary with background details for every unit and Character featured
A showcase of stunningly painted Citadel miniatures
Rules for Space Marines units that are uniquely available to the Deathwatch
Rules for fielding mixed units and Kill Teams with different specialisations
Stratagems, Warlord Traits, the bespoke Xenopurge psychic discipline, Relics of the Deathwatch, and optional secondary objectives that define the ways that the Deathwatch wage war
Bespoke Crusade rules providing new Agendas, Requisitions, Battle Traits, Honorifics, and Crusade Relics that are unique to the Deathwatch
And more!


You will need a copy of Codex: Space Marines and the Warhammer 40,000 Core Book to use the rules included in this codex.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Mr. Cabbagehead's Garden: Donty Monn promo card
description:
Promo neighbor for the KS campaign "Mr. Cabbagehead's Garden returns!" (2020)
Donty Monn …is the self-proclaimed Village garden expert and always knows just what goes where.
Donty's transplant ability will cause the card with the highest Vegetable number to be replaced with a card previously discarded.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Farming, Puzzle
mechanics: Open Drafting, Pattern Recognition, Push Your Luck, Set Collection, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Nice to Meet You
description:
"Which animal card best represents me?"
The answer you believe may not be the same one your friends think. Get to know your old friends - and new aquaintances - with a game that can bring an entirely new understanding to the way you view yourself and others.

How to play and how to win the game: Each player will have a same set of animal cards. The players take turns to draw a question card, choose one question from the card and all the players will answer that question with an animal card of their choice. Don't let the others players see which card you chose and reveal the cards at the same time. If you played the same animal card as the host (the player who drew the card), you can get a point. Talk about why you chose this card, if the host wants, they can choose a Best Answer player and give them another point. At the end of the game, the players with the most points wins.
mechanics: Player Judge, Storytelling

name: Grimdark Future: Firefight – Gang Wars
description:
Gang Wars is an expansion for Grimdark Future: Firefight that provides additional rules for violent gang combat in the streets of the dangerous and futuristic Hive City. The game mechanics are designed to be easy to learn but hard to master, bringing engaging gang skirmishes for new and experienced players alike.

This game expansion for Grimdark Future: Firefight adds lots of extra content to the core rules, providing you with countless hours of epic gang skirmishes that you can customize however you like. The rules are written to be concise and to the point, and come with beautiful illustrations as well as helpful gang and city sheets.

Here's everything that's included in this expansion:


Campaign Rules
Campaign Setup
Playing Missions
Post-Game Sequence
Hero Skills
Upgrading Gangs
Hive City Armory
Territory Control
Special Territories
Territory Exploration

Additional Rules
Gang Missions
City Fighting
Hazardous Terrain
Critical Hits
Random Events



Note that to play this expansion you’re going to need the free core rules for Grimdark Future: Firefight as well as some army lists.

-description from publisher's website
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Warhammer 40,000 (Ninth Edition): Codex – Death Guard
description:
The Death Guard are the greatest champions of the Plague God, Grandfather Nurgle, his favoured spreaders of his bounteous gifts. Look upon them and see the signs: pus seeping from festering wounds that never heal; miasmic smogs of corrosive, stinking gas hanging thickly in the air wherever Nurgle’s chosen tread; the wriggling, lamprey-mouthed tick-leeches that clamp on to their rotting flesh; the droning billions of plague flies that swarm the battlefields they stalk and the ships in which they course through the stars.

Few armies offer such a rich canvas for painting and modelling as the Death Guard. Every miniature is riddled with gruesome details and grisly flourishes, showing the blessings they have received from Nurgle, and in turn how they will spread the Lord of Decay’s infections. With them you can craft a truly head turning – not to mention stomach turning – force that can terrify your enemies and be disgustingly powerful on the battlefield. This book is the ultimate guide to the Death Guard, featuring in depth lore and background and the rules that you need to field them in Warhammer 40,000.

Inside this book, you'll find:

– Background on the reunification of Mortarion with the Death Guard during the Great Crusade, his eventual fall into heresy, and the process inflicted upon the Death Guard as Nurgle's Destroyer Plague took them.
– Information on the organisational structure of the Death Guard following the Horus Heresy and how their cohesion meant they were better able to enact war upon the galaxy.
– Incredible photography of units, single miniatures, and armies on terrain, both on their own and as part of battle scenes.
– Datasheets that cover every unit fieldable by a Death Guard army.
– Death Guard-specific Stratagems, Warlord Traits, Relics, and psychic powers.
– In-depth Crusade rules that let you grow your force as it spreads diseases and plague across the galaxy.
– And more!
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: The Belgian Beers Race: Events expansion
description: A 24 cards expansion for the Belgian Beers Race. It is a BYR exclusive and included in the All-in pledge on Kickstarter.
mechanics: Area Movement, Movement Points, Race, Variable Set-up

name: Script Terror
description:
You are the director of a B terror movie, but you have concurrence. You must run to to show your movie in to the audience before your opponents. Gather the perfect crew, find a suitable location and delay your opponents efforts on these funny card game.

Each turn the player buys a card from a shared deck of cards containing all types of cards (from actors to locations) or the top card from the discard pile, and see if the card fits in his goals (according to his script card, some sort of objective card).

After that, the active player must use one action card or discard a card.

The first player to fulfill his script cart is the winner.

The game was self published by the author after a successful Catarse (the equivalent of KS in Brazil) campaign.
mechanics: Hand Management, Take That

name: Flames of War: Bagration – German Forces on the Eastern Front 1944
description:
Bagration: German is the third German themed book in the Flames Of War Late-war series of army handbooks (after D-Day: German and D-Day: Waffen-SS).
It is also the second of the Bagration series, bringing you German Eastern Front forces fighting against Soviet Operation Bagration as featured in Bagration: Soviet.

Bagration: German covers the German forces fighting all across the Eastern Front from Finland in the north to Romania and Hungary in the south from January 1944 to January 1945.

There is a great variety of formations and units available to field, from tanks and armoured infantry to grenadiers and tank-hunters.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Mage War
description:
Mage War is a FREE trading card game where you construct your own cards and make decks to battle other players. It is a game of strategy with a focus on balanced mechanics that put opponents on equal footing. (No need to worry about an opponent having an advantage over you because they spent more money to build their deck.) The rules lay out all the guidelines for designing and creating your own cards and decks as well as how to play. The limits of your power are the limits of your own imagination! Craft your own cards and build your own strategy around your own play style and pit your ideas against your friends.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Unspecified

name: World of Tanks Miniatures Game: German – Panzer III J Expansion
description:
