ASL STARTER SET - Hedge Rules examples of play by Multi-Man Publishing
CONSCRIPTS IN RED FACTORIES - One Man's Treasure by Vincent Maresca
OCS 101 - Smolensk: Barbarossa Derailed by Chip Saltsman
DESIGNER'S PREVIEW - VCS Kharkov by Greg Blanchett


ASL/ASLSK Scenarios:


ASLSK Scenario S72 - Stretched Thin at Altavilla, Americans vs Germans
ASLSK Scenario S73 - West of the Vire, Americans vs Germans
ASL Scenario O17 - White Russians, Americans vs Germans
ASL Scenario O18 - Purple Heart Hill, Americans vs Germans
mechanics: Area Movement, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Simulation

name: Star Wars: X-Wing (Second Edition) – Hotshots and Aces II Reinforcements Pack
description:
New pilots launch into Star Wars: X-Wing in this new pack! The Hotshots and Aces II pack gives players even more options for their squadrons of every faction with 35 new ship cards for a wide variety of ships. Among them, players will find a number of iconic pilots with all new ways to benefit their squadrons, including Tycho Celchu, Kit Fisto, Aurra Sing, Poe Dameron, Hondo Ohnaka, and Doctor Aphra.

-description from publisher's website
categories: Aviation / Flight, Bluffing, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers
publishers: Atomic Mass Games, Fantasy Flight Games

name: Thanos Rising: Avengers Infinity War – Captain Marvel Promo Card
description:
Originally available at GenCon 2019.

Ability: Roll an extra die of your choice each turn. If you have a Battle, Technology, and Mystic hero on your team, roll two extra dice instead.
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Open Drafting

name: Undercover Turbo Duckies
description:
STORYLINE
Welcome guys! You are the brand new members of the Turbo Duckies, the prestigious intergalactic bounty hunting team!
Travel through space incognito, behind the wheel of your food truck and prepare to face hordes of Zenemies and Bosses, each one more powerful and delirious than the last!

THE GAME
Undercover Turbo Duckies offers a scalable gaming system, entirely composed of cards.

Campaign mode (Non-destructive legacy): the very first time you open the box, many elements are hidden and will be unlocked as you progress through the original adventure.
So, once you've finished the main mode, you'll be able to fully rediscover the game with new ways to play and new characters!
Unlock the 1v1 mode, and Overlord Mode: one player plays 4-of-all bosses!

Play through 20 episodes, defeat all your Zenemies and bosses, collect SeedZ accoss the galaxy and make the perfect bounty hunting team!
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Cooperative Game, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Spartan Chess
description:
Spartan chess is a chess variant played on a standard 8x8 chess board. The two sides have pieces and pawns with different characteristics and capabilities. Such differences you would expect between opponents on an actual ancient battlefield.

The Black side represents the Spartans and the White the Persians. The Persians have pawns, pieces, an initial placement, and move in accord with the rules of orthodox chess.

The Spartans have two Kings and with the exception of their Kings, every Spartan playing piece moves differently from any piece found in orthodox chess.

Spartan Chess Features:
• A Persian army (white) identical to that of orthodox chess
• A Spartan army led by two Kings
• Spartan pawns (hoplites) that move differently than orthodox pawns
• Spartan pieces that move differently than any found in orthodox chess
mechanics: Grid Movement

name: Pathfinder Adventure Card Game: "Nok-Nok" Promo Character Card Set
description:
This year's Free RPG Day promo character for Pathfinder Adventure Card Game is the goblin Nok-Nok. You can play Nok-Nok with any Pathfinder Adventure Card Game set, including Rise of the Runelords, Skull & Shackles, Wrath of the Righteous, or Mummy's Mask.

Nok-Nok's character card (and role and token cards) work just like the others in the Pathfinder Adventure Card Game."

Pack includes:

Free RPG Day card
Token card
Nok-Nok character card (Male Goblin Thief)
Role card - Head Drum/Tha Fith Gawd


-description from publisher's website
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Castle Rooms
description:
Will you be the most skilled castle builder in the kingdom?
Place room cards to grow your castle, but be careful!
The other builders could use dragons to block your construction!!!

PURPOSE OF THE GAME
Be the most skilled castle builder in the kingdom. You will have to place the room cards of the castle by matching the stairs and the corridors of entry with those of exit of the previous card placed on the left.
The player who manages to put 10 room cards in a row wins first.

PREPARATION AND DEVELOPMENT
For 4 players you have to use all 64 cards
For 2-3 players you have to remove 2 Dragons and 2 Knights of your choice

Shuffle the cards and deal 2 face down to each player, the remaining cards are placed in the center of the playing area to create the draw deck.
The player who last visited a castle begins the game and continues clockwise. During his turn, eachplayer draws 2 cards to add to his hand and creates his own row or row of room cards in front of him starting from the left and adding other cards only to the right of the previous one. Each player can play as many cards as he wants from his hand, the important thing is that to pass the turn he does not have more than 2 cards in his hand. If you have 3 or more cards in your hand you cannot pass the turn but you will have to play them until you remain with 2 cards or less. WARNING: if you have 3 or more DRAGON or KNIGHT cards in your hand and you cannot use them, they will be discarded until you have 2 cards in your hand.

CREATING A ROW OF ROOMS
The rows of rooms are created starting from the first card on the left and adding the other cards always to the right of the previous one, by matching the stairs and the entrance corridors with those of exit of the previous card, it is not possible to add cards to the left of the row. All room cards have two identical symbols, positioned on the top and bottom sides and are an HELMET and a couple of CROSSED SWORDS. When building a row of rooms, it is mandatory that all symbols face the same direction, therefore, if you start a row with the HELMET facing up, all the cards that make up the row must have the HELMETS facing up. If you have no cards in your hand that can be added to a row that you are building and you have more than 2 cards in your hand, then you cannot pass the turn, you will have to start a new row, always matching HELMETS and CROSSED SWORDS, therefore, if your first row has the HELMET symbol facing upwards, the row that you will build must have the same symbol facing downwards. There is no limit to the number of rows of rooms you can build.

USING DRAGON CARDS AND KNIGHT CARDS
DRAGON cards can be used against an opponent, during your turn they can be placed to the right of a row of rooms to block the construction, because from this moment the opponent cannot add ROOM CARDS on his own row. The KNIGHT cards instead must be used on their own row of rooms where a DRAGON card has been placed to remove it and be able to continue building on that row. Once played it must be discarded together with the removed DRAGON card, these cards can no longer be used.

WINNING THE GAME
The player who first creates a row of 10 ROOM cards wins the game. If the cards in the draw deck finish,and no one had made a 10-card row, in this case the player who made the longest row of rooms wins, if there is an equal merit, whoever has made the second longest row, if there is still a tie, will check the third and so on.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Chaining, Connections

name: Nova Aetas: Under Siege
description:
This awe-inspiring second expansion will catapult you into the midst of the conflict between Emperor Charles V and Pope Clement VII of Rome.

The Lansquenet troops led by General Georg Von Frundsberg cross through Italy to punish the Pope and take over the eternal city, and only one person dares to stand in their way... Captain Giovanni dalle Bande Nere with his free company.

Will you join forces with him in a desperate attempt to save Rome? Or will you join the siege, uniting with the Emperor's troops? The choice is yours, but once again, history is in your hands!

Nova Aetas Under Siege includes 10 new missions and a new hero class: the Lancer; two new groups: the Lansquenets and the Black Bands led by their charismatic captains (13 miniatures in total).; a new scenic element: the church, and everything else needed to dive into this desperate and overwhelming series of adventures!
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Mythology, Renaissance
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Role Playing, Storytelling, Team-Based Game, Turn Order: Time Track, Variable Player Powers

name: Disposition
description:
The board contains 2 circular tracks, 20 spaces long, and with a coloured dot that separates each two neighboring spaces. In the center is space for 3 plastic containers with a slot in the lid. Each player gets 2 pawns, 5 fuel chips in each of the 4 colours, and 3 sticks. Each player places their pawns on the board, one on each track, next to a dot of their colour. The aim of the game is to be the first player to return both pieces to their starting positions, moving one pawn round clockwise, and the other anti-clockwise.

It is a diceless game: players are in control of their own movement. Any unoccupied space can be reached as long as, and here’s the twist, the player has enough “fuel” to reach that square. Remember those chips? For each square traveled, one chip has to be handed in. The landing space determines which colour those chips should be. Used chips are then put through the slots of the containers in the middle, spread between them at will. At the start of the game, each player only has enough chips to get one pawn round the board. To get both pieces round additional fuel need to be bought. During your turn, you can buy the hidden contents of one of the containers by discarding one of your three sticks. If you have run out of sticks and you haven’t got the right chips left to get home than you are out of the game.

It’s a lightweight but rather clever racing game for the entire family, but its diceless movement system sets it apart from most racing games aimed at this market.

Disposition was licensed from B.L.A. and published by Berliner Spielkarten in their "Spiel-O-Thek" range.
mechanics: Hand Management

name: Chef de bataillon: A Baton In Every Knapsack!
description:
Chef de bataillon introduces you to the exciting world of tactical warfare in the Napoleonic period. Especially designed for use with historical miniatures, Chef de bataillon places you in command of the units of history’s most colorful and heroic era. You are the Chef de bataillon, in command of a infantry battalion, cavalry regiment, or a battery of artillery.

Battalion and regimental officers, as well as command personalities are incorporated into Chef de bataillon’s unique rules system. Battles may be played with miniatures in any range from 5mm to 25mm. Chef de bataillon is so flexible it allows you to play tactical level battles throughout the entire horse and musket era.

In Chef de bataillon, battle is quick and dangerous. Created by the award-winning designers of Empire, Chef de bataillon is easy to learn, fast moving, and exciting to play. In addition Chef de bataillon scenarios allow you to jump into battle right away!

Discover the challenge and excitement of true tactical warfare in the Napoleonic era. Discover the most original approach in miniatures wargaming. Discover Chef de bataillon - you can almost smell the powder smoke!

Chef de bataillon contains:
A 196 page rule set;
a set of 65 pages of ratings, data and scenarios;
20 quick reference charts; and
2 die cut counter sheets.

Chef de bataillon brings to life the capabilities of troops and weapons and the effects of terrain in a new and innovative way. But most importantly, Chef de bataillon places you at the head of the troops. You must provide the leadership! You must master the art of war at the tactical level! You must find the bravery to lead your formation into the very mouths of the guns for victory and glory!

(source: Emperor's press website)
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Simulation

name: Operation Warboard
description: An entry level tabletop wargame, that in fact has a greater level of detail than most "beginner" rule sets. Taking the approach of low cost gaming, the pictures and diagrams all depict ways to cut costs and begin gaming, and as such tends to relegate this rule set to a "beginner" level. Set as a platoon or company level engagement, the rules have a unique MG grid to infantry fire resolution. A good example of "low detail" for those that are "painting" impaired.
mechanics: Simultaneous Action Selection
publishers: David McKay, The History of Wargaming Project

name: Path of Dice
description:
In Path of Dice the goal is to create a connected path of dice from your starting area to the opposite end of the board by placing the just-rolled dice according to a few simple rules. Your opponent is of course doing the same from the other end thus creating a lot of conflict.

It's a fun, fast, simple and surprisingly strategic game for two or four players.

A 2-player game is played in about ten minutes with strategic decisions being made on most throws.

With so many dice being rolled luck does play a big part in who wins the game. But the strategic depth of the game could still surprise its creator even after 50+ played games.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Dice, Party Game, Territory Building
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Network and Route Building, Push Your Luck, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Consumption: Picky Eater Expansion
description:
Originally available as part of the Deluxe edition of Consumption, it is now available by itself from the publisher.

Add a new diet challenge to your game. The Picky Eater expansion adds another player board and dietary restrictions for you to navigate on the road to good health.
mechanics: Worker Placement

name: SiegeStorm: Seraphia
description:
The radiant army of Seraphia is full of pompous Elves and boring do-gooders. They specialize in arts of protection, healing, and control - often outlasting their enemy. And if that fails, they can always hope for one of their overpowered angels to swoop in and slaughter the opponent or even grant you an additional turn.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting
mechanics: Chaining, Deck Construction, Hand Management, Take That
publishers: Albi, Awaken Realms Lite, Van Ryder Games

name: Hollerith⁵
description:
Hollerith⁵ consists of a 6x6 game board with a hole in each space large enough to hold a marble, as well as marbles in two colors and five perforated plates; each plate covers a 3x3 area, which means that four of the plates together cover the entire game board. Each perforated plate has nine holes so that you can see whether a hole in the game board is filled with a marble, but only one or two holes per plate are large enough for a marble to pass through. (These holes are marked as such on the plates.)

On a turn, you push the fifth plate onto the game board, displacing one of the plates already there, then you insert one of your marbles into an unoccupied hollow of the game board. Players alternate turns until one of them forms a row of four marbles and wins. Note that if you cannot insert a marble into an empty space on the game board, you lose instantly.
mechanics: Square Grid

name: Expediente Iberia
description:
A competitive game for 1 to 5 players in which cases, allies, resources, and events will be collected to face unexplained mysteries such as the Faces of Belmez, The Ummo Case, The Manises File, and all kinds of encounters with the impossible.

Every player takes the role of a detective of different kinds of X-files mysteries. Each round the players try to 'investigate' some cases ranked by difficulty using their personal skills and cards as resources. At the end of the game the researchers add up their solved cases (each one has a different score) and the player with the most point is the winner.

Juego de cartas ambientado y tematizado con los expedientes más emblemáticos del misterio en España. Es un juego competitivo compuesto por una serie de cartas y fichas en las que se recogerán casos, aliados, recursos y eventos donde de 1 a 5 jugadores podrán enfrentarse a misterios como las Caras de Belmez, El Caso Ummo, Expediente Manises, y todo tipo de encuentros con lo imposible.

—description from publisher
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Murder/Mystery, Science Fiction
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Taierzhuang
description:
The Battle of Taierzhuang: Covers the fighting that climaxed in the first (failed) Japanese offensive of 1938 in China.

Each hex on the map represents .25 miles or .4km. Each game turn represents two days. Units of maneuver are Japanese infantry battalions and tank companies; and Chinese regiments.

22 x 34-inch game map with both battles; Stalin’s First Victory 48 5/8-inch counters; Taierzhuang 128 5/8-inch counters.

Taierzhuang / Stalin's First Victory were both published in World at War #91, June 2023

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Spirits of the Forest: The Golden Fireflies
description:
The Golden Fireflies was sold as an addon during the Kickstarter campaign.

The publisher states:
"We will be releasing small variants in small batches as this will be actively worked on for some time, this doesn't mean the ruleset is incomplete but rather that there will be more content being released through the year that will change the way this expansion plays.
When we publish the final variant we will surprise you with some special news for this game for which we've been working during the past few months."

There will be a public PDF with the rules available on the publisher’s webpage.

So far, there are rules released for the following variants that uses the Golden Fireflies:
- The Single Golden Firefly Variant A
- The Single Golden Firefly Variant B
mechanics: Open Drafting, Set Collection

name: Malaysian/Singaporean Checkers
description:
This game is part of the checkers family.

It is mainly played in Malaysia and Singapore, particularly amongst the older men. It is distinct from Checkers and Canadian Checkers. A common alternative name used locally for this game is Dum.

It is played on a board of 144 squares with 30 pieces on a side. Un-promoted pieces can only move and capture forward. A promoted piece (king) moves like a chess bishop, and can capture a piece anywhere along its line of movement.

A turn must capture the maximum possible number of pieces. Failing to do so results in forfeiture of that piece. If there is a choice between pieces to use for capturing, the king takes precedence.
mechanics: Grid Movement

name: So Long, My World: Remnants of the Moon
description:
"You owe something to the Moon. Therefore, it demands a sacrifice. Its pale radiance leads you to new, hidden memories. It is said that only the remnants of the Moon will have an open path laid before them. Do you belong to that ancestry?"

The first add on is a mainly thematic expansion, cards are focused on the value of choice and sacrifice. Your willingness to sacrifice yourself without expecting anything in return will be tested.

A new type of card, the Purpose card, is introduced by this expansion. Each player starts with one and has to fulfill its requests (usually spending a Feeling on a different Vision card each turn) to win extra Insight points at the end of the game. These cards can also be part of the karma chain, so use them carefully!

Offering a new scenario for solo mode, Remnants of the Moon is compatible with solo mode.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Horror
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Transformers Deck-Building Game: Bonus Pack 1
description: A promo pack for Transformers Deck-Building Game containing a new character (Jazz) and four other cards.
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building

name: En Garde!: Swashbuckling Skirmish Wargames Rules
description:
En Garde! is a small-scale skirmish game based on the successful Ronin rules, in which small groups of warriors fight each other for honour or riches. Rather than just rolling a few dice, the rules allow players to make tactical decisions about how the models that they control will fight - offensively, defensively, or by applying special skills and abilities.En Garde! covers the conflicts of the 16th, 17th and early 18th centuries, when black-powder weapons started to become common in battle but martial prowess still determined the outcome.

Play as Border Reivers, Conquistadors, Landsknechts, Aztecs, French Musketeers, Caribbean Pirates and many more, in scenarios that evoke classic engagements of the genre. Sub-plots (secondary objectives for each side) have also been introduced, making gameplay even more varied and exciting. Simple campaign rules allow multiple scenarios to be played in sequence and permit warbands to develop over time. An appendix is also included to provide brief rules for supernatural creatures of the period - monsters, demons, revenants and witches - and new abilities and equipment to fight them, making En Garde! the perfect ruleset for gamers who want something a bit different from the norm.
categories: Book, Fantasy, Miniatures, Pike and Shot, Pirates, Renaissance, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling

name: Magic: The Gathering – Ravnica Allegiance
description: Ravnica Allegiance is the 80th Magic expansion. It was released on January 25, 2019. Officially, it is not part of a block. However, it is part of a series of three that is set on the same world, unofficially called the Guilds of Ravnica block.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Hand Management, Take That

name: Cuba & Filipinas: Spanish-American War
description:
The Spanish-American War of 1898 was decided at sea, where both navies, with their shortcomings and strengths, gave their best.

Cuba & Filipinas is the expansion of Mar Rojo that covers this forgotten conflict. To play Cuba & Filipinas a copy of Mar Rojo is essential.

What does the Cuba & Filipinas expansion include:


A deck of 50 new fleet cards, including all the important ships of the conflict, and others that in differents circumstances could have participated (such as the battleship Pelayo or the armored cruiser Maine).



Two new action cards: RAM and DYNAMITE.



A four-page mini rulebook with two new scenarios and the possibility of DYO scenarios.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Nautical, Post-Napoleonic, Wargame
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven

name: Zendo Cards
description:
A deck of 60 cards to expand the Looney Pyramids collection in the style of Pyramid Arcade. This is not a complete game, only cards. Contains reworked rules cards from Zendo standalone game and Zendo Rules Expansion #1 and Zendo Rules Expansion #2 adjusted to work with pyramids.

Zendo is a game of inductive logic in which the Master creates a rule and the Students attempt to discover it by building and studying small arrangements of Looney Pyramids. The first student to state the rule correctly wins.

Also needed:

Rules to play from LooneyLabs.com/rules/zendo

A supply of Looney Pyramids in 3-4 colors

A supply of tokens or stones in 3 different colors

2 small clips (plastic paper clips or bobby pins)
categories: Abstract Strategy, Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Puzzle
mechanics: Induction, Pattern Recognition, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Tanks: Panther Tank Expansion
description: Considered one of the best tanks of World War II for its excellent firepower and protection the Panther tank was Germany’s answer to the Soviet T-34. Built on the same chassis, the Jagdpanzer traded the Panther’s turret for extra armour and a much bigger gun.
categories: Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers
publishers: Battlefront Miniatures Ltd, Gale Force Nine, LLC

name: Warhammer Quest: Silver Tower – Lord of Plagues
description: An additional promo player character, the datacard for which was published in White Dwarf 121 (21 May 2016). Does not come with represetational miniature.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Role Playing, Variable Player Powers

name: Warhammer 40,000: Index – Imperium 1
description:
Description from the publisher:

One of five books covering the range of Citadel miniatures used to play games of Warhammer 40,000, Index: Imperium 1 is an essential purchase for those wanting to play games of Warhammer 40,000, packed with updated rules and complete points values for Space Marines armies*.

It includes 207 datasheets covering the Space Marines range of miniatures, with overviews of a number of Chapters. Updated abilities, psychic powers, weapon profiles and points values allow you to field your collection in games of Warhammer 40,000. There’s also a blank army roster and detachment roster, which you are free to photocopy and use when building a Battle-Forged army in Matched Play games.

Covered in the 224-page softback book:

Adeptus Astartes

An overview of the Space Marines, including a typical Chapter organisation;
A Space Marines army list, with explanations of the Chapter keyword, the Librarius psychic discipline and the And They Shall Know No Fear Ability;
70 datasheets for Space Marines miniatures.


Ultramarines

An overview of the Ultramarines;
10 datasheets for Ultramarines miniatures.


Blood Angels

An overview of the Blood Angels;

name: Rainbow Bunny Bop
description:
Rainbow Rabbits

Get ready for fur-iously flipping family fun with the adorable Rainbow Rabbits -- Blossom, Butters, Cupcake, and Douglas.

In this colorful sequencing game. players race to build rainbows as fast as they can and be the first to play all of their cards. It's a little bit co-hoperation, and little bit competition, and a whole lot of chaos.

Kids love it. Adults love it. Kids love always winning against the adults. Adults don't love that part as much.

Feeling skeptical? Fact: even the most cynical player will yell “Red! Orange! Yellow! Green! Blue! Indigo! VIOLET!” by the end of the the first round.

—description from the designer
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Party Game
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building

name: Folklore: The Affliction – Soothsayer Promo Card
description:
This is a promo card for Folklore: The Affliction.

This promo adds a new Militia card to the game. The soothsayer has the following ability: "When she becomes your companion, gain either a Ritual and +1 OCCULT, or a Prayer and +1 FAITH."

This promo has card id "CO#FP03".

This promo was included in Game Trade Magazine #222 (August 2018).

This promo was also included in the Folklore Missing Card Pack (GNEFL47).
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Santorini: Nyx Promo Card
description:
Promotional card offered during Gen Con 2018 (very few escaped from booth due to a misprint).

Setup: Before players choose powers, the Challenger publicly selects a God Power card with the Golden Fleece icon to be Nyx’s Night Power, which will start the game facedown.

End of all Turns: If there are an odd number of Complete Towers in play, turn your Night Power card faceup and your opponent’s God Power card card(s) facedown. If there are an even number of Complete Towers in play, turn your Night Power card facedown and your opponent’s God Power card card(s) faceup.

All Times: God Power cards that are facedown have no effect.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Ancient, Expansion for Base-game, Mythology
mechanics: Grid Movement, Tile Placement, Variable Player Powers

name: Squirrel
description:
Squirrel is a family friendly game of tactical foraging. To win you must gather the biggest hand of acorns before the last leaf of Autumn turns brown.

The game starts with a grid of 9 green leaf piles. Under each green leaf card is a chance to find either a brown leaf or 1 to 3 brown acorns.

Players must each build a maximum hand of 3 cards by hopping their squirrel counter from one leaf pile to the next. After each move they must take 1 card from the top of a neighboring leaf pile to add to their hand.

If their hand exceeds 3 cards or they make a gap in the grid, they must drop a card with its brown side face up. In this way the leaf piles change color from green to brown and when the top card of all 9 leaf piles shows a brown face, the game (and autumn) has ended. Players must then reveal their hands and the player with the greatest total number of acorns is the winner.

Beware.
The best foragers may be pushing their luck. A squirrel who holds more than 3 acorn cards must drop one in plain view. An opponent who stands on a dropped acorn can steal from your hand!
Wise foragers can manage their hand as well as the length of the game by choosing when to voluntarily drop a card and which green leaf piles to cover or reveal.

Squirrel has enough gameplay for adults and older children to enjoy with enough luck to keep young children in the game without constantly feeling out-maneuvered.

-description from designer
mechanics: Hand Management, Push Your Luck

name: Baseball Highlights: 2045 – Ryan Funkhouser Promo Card
description:
A new free agent to add to the free agent deck for Baseball Highlights: 2045.

Released as part of the Promo Paradise Kickstarter campaign (2019).
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Sports
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Take That

name: Quiz Club: Brett- & Kartenspiele
description:
Quiz Club is a tactical quiz game in which cooperative and competitive rounds alternate.

Brett- & Kartenspiele is an expansion for Quiz Club with 120 themed questions to expand and personalize your game experience.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Party Game, Trivia
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Cooperative Game, Semi-Cooperative Game

name: Red Christmas II: ATS
description:
This Advanced Tobruk System (ATS) expansion allows players to recreate the action around Novo Orlovka, USSR, in December 1941.

Red Christmas II includes revised scenarios and two cardstock mapboards of the villages of Orlovka Ivanovka and Novo Orlovka, each depicted in a "winterized" theme. This expansion replaces and updates the previously released Avanti Savoia.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Line of Sight, Simulation

name: Hour of Need: Gem & Ice
description:
A Kickstarter Exclusive stand-alone expansion for Hour of Need, giving you everything you need to play with 1-2 players ... or create a 1-6 player experience when combined with the Hour of Need core box!

This expansion adds 2 new heroes and their unique fixed decks to the roster: Gem and Ice! It also contains 1 new villain and their unique fixed deck, the nefarious Astasia! 2 brand-new issue decks await as well (complete with their own boards), providing you with exciting new locales to explore and schemes to thwart!

Also contains everything you need to play such as dice, clue cards and tokens!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Cooperative Game, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Cactus Town: The Lost Chief
description:
This expansion introduces an all-new gameplay feeling to Cactus Town: the search for the LOST CHIEF.

Dakota will pay the town a visit in search of her father, so the party starts with one standee and (hopefully) gains a second. The player’s available actions change depending on whether Dakota is alone or reunited with her father. All the while they try to teach the townsfolk a lesson not to get involved with a Native American princess and her erstwhile peaceful tribe.

The expansion opens up new party combination options and adds yet another unique experience to how the game plays out.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling

name: Stop Thief!: Kickstarter Promo Cards
description:
Two promo cards shipped to Kickstarter backers.

Text from the cards:

Robért Legasse: When Captured, Write your name and date on this card, $9,000

Jacob D. Justice, Esq: While At Large, Anyone arguing about the rules must put $1,000 onto this card, $9,000*
mechanics: Grid Movement, Hand Management, Memory, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Deutscher Spielepreis Classic Goodie Box
description:
Deutscher Spielepreis Classic Goodie Box contains five expansions for previous DSP winners.

The promos are for:

IceCool - (Kinderspiel 2017) https://boardgamegeek.com/boardgameexpansion/292884/icecool-...
Imhotep - (2016 - number 8) https://boardgamegeek.com/boardgameexpansion/292887/imhotep-...

Puerto Rico - (2002 - number 1) https://boardgamegeek.com/boardgame/292912/puerto-rico-bucca...

Bonus:
Imhotep Duel
mechanics: Unspecified

name: The Night Cage: The Endbringer promo
description:
The Endbringer - Boss Monster - A new boss that speeds up the end game by causing tiles to be discarded on each player's turn.

After 5 Omens are drawn, the Endbringer sits on top of the draw deck. At the end of each player's turn, discard a tile from the Draw stack. This effect continues until the Final Flickers begins.

If playing within the Dirge, use the 5 Omens as both Boss Monsters.

Given out at GenCon 2021 and in Game Trade Magazine # 260.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Grid Movement, Pieces as Map, Sudden Death Ending, Tile Placement

name: Rum & Bones: Madeline Tyler
description:
Madeline Tyler is a kickstarter exclusive, single character expansion that came with the optional purchase of the La Brise Sanguine expansion.

Included is a single green hero miniature, 2 deck cannon miniatures and a stat card, packaged in her own separate brown box without
retail style art.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Nautical, Pirates
mechanics: Action Points, Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Variable Player Powers, Worker Placement

name: Magic: The Gathering – Duel Decks: Elves vs. Goblins
description:
Description from the publisher:

Wage war between elves and goblins—the most popular tribes in Magic. This Duel Decks features popular cards selected from six years of Magic expansions, from the Apocalypse to Lorwyn sets.

These two 60-card theme decks include eight rares (including two alternate art foil cards), a full-color insert with strategies for each deck, and three token cards. Each card in these two decks is black-bordered and tournament-legal. They were designed to be played right out of the box, with no deckbuilding required.
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Hand Management, Player Elimination

name: British vs Pirates: Volume 1 – Spanish Armada Add-on
description:
Full faction add-on that adds the Spanish Armada to the core game of British Vs Pirates.
Originally this faction came with 25 Skill Cards, but after reaching a Social Goal the number was increased to 27 Skill Cards.

This add-on features:


18 D6 dice (purple)


Ship miniatures (yellow):


2 Sloop
1 Fluyt
1 Zebec
2 Frigate
3 Galleon


Additional miniatures (yellow):


1 Fort


Cards:


27 Skill Cards
9 Ship Cards
5 Captain Cards


Tokens:


6 Crew Tokens
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board

name: The 6 Pack of Paper & Pencil Games
description:
This is a collection of special pads to play six paper-and-pencil games. Four of the games were apparently designed solely by Sid Sackson (they appeared under his name in early issues of Games magazine):

Oil Strike! - 2-4 players. A dice-based placement game.
The Great Races - 2-4 players. This is reminiscent of Can't Stop and may be a precursor to that game.
Spy! - 2 players. A deduction game.
Financier - 2-4 players. A stock market game.

The other two games may have been designed by Phil Orbanes Sr. or by Orbanes and Sackson together (the game credits both of them as designers):

Pay Off - 2-4 players. Another dice-based placement game.
Words Times Three - 1-4 players. An adaptation of a traditional game where players select letters in turn to be entered in a grid (each player using their own grid), but with hexagons instead of squares, allowing words to be formed in three directions.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Stock Holding

name: Vinyl: Top Shelf
description:
The Top Shelf expansion is a Kickstarter exclusive included in the Gold and Platinum editions of the game that includes the following:


1 Game Board
8 Top Shelf Albums
New Genre: Swing (18 Album Cards, 16 Mag Rack Cards, 2 Genre Tokens)


—description from the publisher
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection

name: Cleopatra and the Society of Architects: Deluxe Edition – The Cult of Sobek
description:
Sobek, the Crocodile God, can also be very merciful to you and help you get rid of some of your corruption. Obviously, you will have to show him your gratitude. How? You have to build a statue in his honor into your Sanctuary.
Be careful, though, because Sobek’s generosity is limited and only the fastest architects can enjoy it.
So don’t waste your time!
categories: Ancient, City Building, Expansion for Base-game, Mythology
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Enclosure, Hand Management, Set Collection

name: Paratrooper: Great Airborne Assaults – Korea
description:
"Paratrooper: Great Airborne Assaults, Korea" is a wargame system simulating airborne operations. There are two players, commanding the airborne and defending forces. Each game in the system will include one or more scenarios, representing different airborne operations. Units represent airborne (parachute, glider) and ground forces, plus air support. Combat resolution is quasi-tactical. Central to play of the game is the command system, with players expending command points to conduct special actions. Scale: Ground units are companies and platoons. Each turn is about a third of a day's operations. Each hex is about 600 meters (half a mile).

This wargame includes two scenarios:

OPERATION TOMAHAWK: Ridgway Springs the Trap, March 1951
SUKCHON-SUNCHON: Air Assualt on North Korea, October 1950

Components: One 22" x 34" map & 176 counters.

This is the game contained in Strategy & Tactics Magazine #321.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Movement Points, Ratio / Combat Results Table, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation, Variable Set-up, Zone of Control

name: A game about counting cats' shapes and colours, that keeps getting trickier.
description:
Each turn, someone flips over a card!

Card backs show uncoloured cats, or scribbled colours. Fronts show 3 cats, coloured in red or purple.

The newly-revealed back tells you what shape(s) or colour to count. First to yell the number and slap the card wins that card, or loses everything if they were wrong.

Each card you win is more cats to count!

First to 5 cards wins!

Normally, the first slapper becomes the flipper for the next round and cannot compete. In the 2-player variants, players take turns flipping a card from the deck and they can both compete.

The main restriction for the upper playercount is the number of players able to reach the flipped card to slap it.

—description from the designer
categories: Action / Dexterity, Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Math, Party Game, Real-time
mechanics: Matching, Race, Real-Time, Speed Matching

name: Towers of Hamburg
description:
(From back of box:)

Years ago it was the Empire State Building in New York, later the Sears Tower in Chicago. Today it's standing in Kuala Lumpur and soon it might be standing in London, Tokyo or somewhere in Germany - the tallest building in the world. All intend to build it, but who will win the race? In "Towers of Hamburg" the competition to have the tallest tower is decided on the gameboard.

Towers.. is a fascinating game that impresses one highly, in spite of its simple rules. The rules are easy to understand and quick to learn. Unlike in other games, e.g. chess, the moves in Towers.. are played upwards. Move by move towers are build - and, intelligently positioned they foil the strategy of the opponent.

--
The game sports very nice components that inviting to play, heavy enough to make them fun to pick up. Every playing piece has troughs on the upper and knobs on the lower side that hold the stacked pieces neatly on the board and onto each other.
mechanics: Grid Movement, Square Grid

name: Mothership: Call of the Void
description:
Distress Beacons call from the void of space. Will you answer? Play through 52x small story missions, each with two outcomes to choose from. Also included are new Objective cards. Complete secret Objectives and choose between 2 different rewards.

—description from the designer

description:
Prussian Army Expansion, that consists of 57 Prussia-themed cards.
You will have an opportunity to substitute British army with Prussians or add Prussian army forces to play with British player against two French players according with the special multiplayer rules.

Expand your copy of Rolling Realms with this set of 6 promo cards, inspired by Fleet: The Dice Game.

To play this realm you must mark rewards and go deep in the sea. When you discover a treasure, you engage its ability for the rest of the round. These abilities change the rules of a round of Rolling Realms. Can you use them wisely to get to 6 stars?

-description from developer

A character deck takes the place of the individual deck in the Hero Realms card game.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Rubber Tree [Floor]

Each require one of each resource (water, food & light) to get 2 and then 6 points.

name: Fridericus Rex
description: Inspired by the 19th century war between Prussia and Austria, this is a tactical-level battle game. The two-sided color map features various terrain in a triangular grid. Units, including different types of infantry and cavalry, are represented by wooden disks. Target locations are indicated with flags placed at the intersection of the triangles. Victory is won by controlling the spaces around these key locations or by defeating the enemy field marshal.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence

name: Speed Circuit: Tournament Tracks
description:
The "Speed Circuit Tournament Tracks" are designed for road racing game enthusiasts who wish to expand on Avalon Hill's racing game, Speed Circuit.
The gameboard consists of two tracks: the qualifying track (normal track), and the tournament track (double track).
This module for Speed Circuit is intended to give the players more flexibility in track selection, an optional method for determining starting position, and a larger more exciting track for running tournaments.
The packaging notes that the designers were the first and second place finishers at the Origins '79 Speed Circuit tournament.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Italian Campaign: Sicily to the Alps
description:
This is a traditional wargame that simulates the WWII invasion of Sicily and Italy between the years of 1943 - 1945.

Players can choose to play the full Campaign game ('43-'45) or one of the two smaller games - "Winter Line"; the first part of the Allied conquest of Italy (July '43 to April '44) or the "Gothic Line"; the final phase of the war in Italy (May '44 to April' 45).

The game contains 196 counters (showing strength and movement) ranging from Battalion to Division sized, an Appearance Chart displaying the arrival times and an oversized map of Sicily and Italy (22" X 28" )
mechanics: Hexagon Grid

name: Talengarde
description:
From the back of the box:

Twoelk the hunter looked at Alyta and then at the portal at the far side of the vast hall. She, too, knew it was their one chance of getting home again. The fog that rolled out of the portal had left stones in the fortress slick with dew, so the two of them approached it with caution. According to what the avatar at the oracle had said, Urrick would be here, and he would be unbeatable without the aid of a spell caster. That is why, as a sinister form began to take shape within the eldritch mists of the portal, Twoelk’s trepidation grew. He slowly drew the magic arrow from his quiver, and glanced sideways at the amazon. Alyta’s eyes were fixed on the portal and the terror within. They could now discern the immense stature of the Rakshasa as it stepped through the vapors. It was Urrick.

As the tiger-man’s pale eyes narrowed on the two adventurers, he sneered. He would enjoy eviscerating these foolish humans, and dining upon their entrails. But before he could pounce upon his victims, an unseen force left him suspended in mid-leap. It seemed the Twoelk and Alyta were equally stunned. “Now, my friends! Strike now!” It was the voice of Brannig, whom they believed had been killed in the ruins south of the oracle. Twoelk stammered, stymied. “You can’t keep a good mage down,” Brannig replied to their unvoiced question. “But magic will only keep Urrick immobile a few seconds more. Now be quick!”

Welcome to Talengarde, A world of fantasy and adventure, heroes and quests, magic and chance. This game features a customizable playing area, numerous beings, and dozens of secret objectives and plot twists ensuring hours of fascination and thousands of game scenarios. And, unlike many role-playing games, Talengarde does not require a “game master.” It includes everything you need to start your adventures.

Box contains:
6 – Map Boards
36 – Map Building Pieces
6 – Colored Dice
6 – Colored Pawns
396 – Game Cards Featuring Original Artwork
200 – Game Markers
1 – Instruction Booklet
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board, Role Playing, Roll / Spin and Move, Variable Player Powers

name: Flower of Chivalry: A Guide to the Late Middle Ages
description:
Flower of Chivalry is an excellent source book for the miniatures gamer interested in English medieval warfare. The book begins with 14 pages devoted to medieval weapons and armor, battle and siege tactics and heraldry. Next the author provides a simple set of miniatures rules and army lists for gaming battles of the period. The majority of the book is a set of battle scenarios from the Scottish Wars (late 1200's - 1350), the Hundred Years War (1350 - 1450) and the Wars of the Roses (1450 - 1500). Each scenario has a map of the battlefield, lists of units, and special scenario rules. (A solo scenario of the battle of Castillon is included.)

The miniatures rules are designed for 1 unit = 5-800 men, 1" = 40 yds., and 1 turn = 20 minutes. Conversion rules for Tactical, DBA, and WRG 7th edition are also included for those wishing to play with other rules sets.
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Measurement Movement, Simulation

name: Programmed Wargames Scenarios
description:
From the book cover:

"Battles and campaigns for solo and multi-player wargamers -- with programmed enemy deployment, orders and responses for one or both sides."

The 18 scenarios and two mini-campaigns can be set in three time periods: "Ancient", "Horse and Musket", and "Modern."
mechanics: Simulation

name: Silent Death: Overkill – The Ptolemean Wars
description:
OVERKILL:THE PTOLEMEAN WARS

The star-spanning Province of Great House Ptolemus as been invaded by the Colosian Deep Space Fleet. Other war mongering hoards from the Black Plague and Behemoth war bands have staked their claim to Ptolemean worlds. The first provincial outposts have been overrun. Desperate pleas for help crackle over a far-flung net of Tachyon Beam Dictors Interstellar war is at hand.

Squadrons of fast, deadly starfighters fly in the vanguard of these conquering legions. Armed with Disruptoguns, Ion Rams, and "The Undisputed Right of Engagement," they will get first crack at the enemy.

Overkill: The Ptolemean Wars is a grand campaign designed for the Silent Death Metal Express game. In here you will find
• Starcraft Displays for five new Silent Death fighters and two new gunboats: including the Blizzard, Kosmos, Hell Bender Death Wind, Glaive and Drakar
• Blank Starcraft Displays or designing your own Silent Death vessel.
• Complete background and .campaign maps for he Ptolemean Wars.
• Detailed histories and Orders of Battle for twelve: new Fighter Wings.
• Twelve challenging Silent Death scenarios and two campaigns.
• Rules Annex# 1 for Silent Death, which provides guidelines for new Cannons, Projectors, Warheads, Pilot Luck, Life Pods, Gunboat Class vessels and more.
A fume sheet of 180 new color counters displaying new fighters, torps, missiles and other Silent Death game markers.

Expands:

Silent Death
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Hexagon Grid

name: El Cid
description:
From the publisher:
Warfare in the Spanish Reconquista: 900-1250 AD

Rodrigo Diaz, better known as El Cid, is one of the most famous warriors of the Middle Ages. His deeds are legendary and his adventures in a world of Moors and Christians, castillos and caballeros, provide ideal territory for games of Warhammer Ancient Battles.

This source book contains an historical overview and detailed chronologies outlining the important events and battles of the time.

This book will give you 8 detailed lists featuring:


Armies of Christian Spain - The early Christian Kingdoms, the Age of El Cid and the Reconquista.
Armies of Al-Andalus - The Caliphate of Cordoba, the Taifa Kings and the Later Taifas.
Armies of the African Invaders - The Almoravids and the Almohads.
Aliados y Mercenarios - Allies and Mercenaries available for hire to complement your armies.


The age in which El Cid lived is one of the most colourful in military history and the armies are spectacular and varied and this is portrayed in a 16-page color section.

Accompanying each of the army lists are detailed notes on wargaming tactics, and collecting and painting the various armies that fought in Medieval Spain.

The book also contains two new scenarios for games of Warhammer Ancient Battles, as well as a campaign system allowing you to hire El Cid himself!

Expands:

Warhammer Ancient Battles
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Medieval, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Secret Unit Deployment, Variable Player Powers

name: Legends of the Ancient World: The Sorcerer's Manor
description:
There is a new evil in the Maul. Murders and abductions are at an alarming high, and the people are powerless and scared. The evil seems to come from the sorcerer's manor, an ancient structure that predates the current civilization. However, none who have tried to burgle or collect taxes have returned.

This is a complete fantasy mini-adventure for solitaire or group play. It is suitable for one to four players, ages 12 and up. This game includes the adventure book, rules, pieces and playing board and is compatible with other role-playing systems such as GURPS (TM) and The Fantasy Trip (TM).
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Role Playing

name: Yodd
description:
Yodd is a drawless connection and territory game for two players: Black and White. It is played on the spaces (cells) of an initially empty hexagonal grid of hexagons (board). The suggested board size is between 6 and 10 cells per side. Both players must have access to a sufficient supply of black and white stones.

Black plays first, then turns alternate. On your turn, pass or place one or two stones of any colors on empty cells. On their first turn, Black can only place one stone. At the end of your turn, there must be an odd number of groups on the board. A group is an entire set of interconnected stones of the same color. A single stone, not connected to others of its color, is also a group.

When both players pass in succession, the game ends, and the player with fewer groups on the board wins.



NotesDouble placement serves as both a first-move equalizer and a way to make the game playable under the group restriction rule.

Apart from the intended goal of eliminating draws (they would be common otherwise), forcing an odd number of groups at the end of a turn has some interesting tactical implications which make the game feel similar to a single-placement game. For example, groups separated by two empty cells can't be merged on a single turn, since the player runs out of stones to restore the group count to an odd number. Also, the diamond connection (two stones at each end of a four-cell rhombus) is safe if the opponent has exactly zero or two groups adjacent to the intermediate cells, and unsafe otherwise.

Endgames are also quite tricky under this rule: you'll often want to merge two of your own groups or create another enemy group, but you'll be unable to do so because you can't restore the group count anymore!
mechanics: Chaining, Connections, Paper-and-Pencil, Pattern Recognition, Tile Placement

name: Philosophie: Das Spiel
description:
The main part of the game are 30 "quotes" of 20 different philosophers. Each player gets on philosopher at random at the start.

Each round the starting player selects one of his quotes read it aloud. The every other player "answers" with one of his philosopher's quote. At the and of the round each player has three votes "0", "1" and "2" and has to vote for one othewr player.

Points are awarded for 3 differnt categories: Sum of the votes, Wininng a round, losing a round.

Whoever "wins" the first of the three 36 point in total or 5 wins or 5 losses (cynics-score), wins the game.
mechanics: Role Playing, Storytelling, Voting

name: Nightfall: Zombify Promo
description: The promo Zombify is an action that was originally developed with Nightfall: Dark Rages, but was never formally released. It is now being made available for Print-n-Play. Players may print the full sized image within the image gallery or download the new Print-n-Play PDF available on the main Nightfall game's page.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Pattern Building

name: Fierce fight ! Stalingrad Blitzkrieg
description:
This is a waited sequel game of Struggle of Army Group Manstein, and Mansterin's last battle.

The game starts June 1942 at the start of Blau and end December 1942 at the start of Soviet counterattack.
The game uses the same engine as its predecessor. Each player selects his chits each turn, then draw chits one by one and activate part of the force designated by the chit.
This time, there's no special rule. The game rule is easier than Manstein's last battle.
The victory is determined by VPs mainly gained by control important cities. Of course, the most important one is Stalingrad.
mechanics: Chit-Pull System, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid

name: Munchkin Rompi le Uova
description: Munchkin Rompi le Uova (Munchkin Break the Eggs) contains the Italian editions of Munchkin Easter Eggs and Munchkin Naughty & Nice plus three new exclusive promos for a total of 33 foil cards.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Humor
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Trading, Variable Player Powers

name: Munchkin Draghetto o Scherzetto
description: Contains the Italian editions of Munchkin Dragons and Munchkin Tricky Treats plus three new exclusive promos, for a total of 33 foil cards.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Humor
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Trading, Variable Player Powers

name: Firestorm Armada: Stormzone – Return of the Overseers
description:
This exhilarating Firestorm Armada Battle Box brings two stunningly detailed fleets to the gaming table: the fast and nimble Aquan Prime and the stealthy mega-corporation that is the Directorate.

Locked in a deadly conflict above the planet of Proteus Prime, the Commanders of these great fleets must not only do battle with each other, but face the unknown mystery of the giant Dimensional Gate in orbit above the planet and the strange probe ship that has emerged from it. An epic battle is taking place above the planet of Proteus Prime. So gather your forces, Commanders... it is time for war!

Firestorm Armada is a fast paced, exciting tabletop game of spaceship combat set in a deadly, distant future.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling

name: Star Girl
description:
Follow Star Girl and her group of friends on their adventures through the galaxies, in search of ancient alien artifacts and help them fight the Evil Space Queen!

Star Girl is a quick take-that card game for 2-5 players using just 24 cards.

The game is played in a series of rounds.
Rounds consist of players taking turns in clockwise order.

Taking a turn:
Draw a card from the Deck (You will then have 2 cards in your hand)
2. Play a card and apply its effect
3. Pass play to the next player

End of a Round:
The round ends when there are no more cards in the Deck or when there is only a single player left and all others have been knocked out (Players will be knocked out by the effects of some cards).

Winning a round:
You can win a round in 2 different ways:

(Be the only player still in the round (the other players need to be „out of the round“)
Have the lowest ranked card in your hand of all players still in the round.


Winning the game:
You can either play the game as a single round or a series of rounds.
mechanics: Hand Management, Take That

name: Conflict of Plants
description:
Welcome to the complex world of plants. A place where thriving depends on strategy, tactics and maybe a tiny bit of luck .

Plants compete to be the most successful wild plant. Players will be deciding how to use their resources to best support their plants' success in this game's environment. Conflict of Plants at its core is both an action selection and an area control game, but with a twist. The environment does not always favor the most abundant species.

The game consists of 6 rounds. Each round excluding the first, the player with the fewest points swaps two on-map Non-White Tokens with those of the randomly-chosen icons. Each player, in turn order, sends their cubes to tiles have an icon that matches the icon played to their Player mat. Players then in turn perform one action each three times.

Each player then places one Brown Token onto an empty corner of a tile in the map again matching an icon to what was played on their Player Mat. The map is then examined in order to award points and Brown Tokens. The players then balance each region by removing cubes from each tile until the number of Player Cubes in total is equal to or less than the region’s number.

Finally, the players clean up their Player Mats to prepare for the next round.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – U.S.S. Cairo Expansion Pack
description: This ship is the competitive prize for the "Tin Man" episode Organized Play event. It is an Excelsior Class ship.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Fireteam Zero: Fireteam Delta Female Hero Pack
description:
Six new heroes for your Fireteam Zero missions:


Maxine "Moxy" Hall
Evelyn "Quicksilver" Wake
Irena "Phantom" Skarbek
Brigitte "Bombshell" Borrel
Griota "Majka" Novak
Nayana "Black Lotus" Khan


Contains:


6 Miniatures
6 Hero Reference Cards
categories: Adventure, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror, Miniatures, World War II
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Storytelling, Variable Player Powers

name: Vikings Gone Wild: Full House Promo Card
description:
A promotional card offered by "Tantrum House Board Game Reviews: Season 4 Kickstarter".

This mission card rewards you for owning at least 6 buildings with 2 victory points.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Humor, Medieval, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management

description:
In 1918, newly independent Finland is in turmoil. The Senate and the Parliament are paralyzed, restless Russian troops are still stationed all over the country, and pro-government and revolutionary paramilitaries are clashing. The Senate flees the troubles from the capital to the north, while its army, the White Guard, starts to disarm Russian garrisons. At the same time in the capital, the People's Delegation declares a revolution and its Red Guard starts to seize power in southern Finland.

In more detail, 1918 is a two-player strategy game of the Finnish civil war. Players are in control of the pro-government Whites and the revolutionary Reds and their respective allies. All factions are unique with different kind of units, creating asymmetrical but balanced gameplay. The game has three scenarios, with different set-ups, objectives, and durations that depict different stages of war. In addition, there is the Grand Campaign, covering the whole war.

Rather than simulating mere fighting and battles, 1918 combines combat, type and quality of units, supply, casualties and fog of war into more complex warfare. On a strategic level, players have to create and maintain an army, keep an eye on the enemy, and secure their supply routes. On a operational level, players must take into account different kind of terrain and infrastructure affecting battles, in addition to their fighting forces.

All factions differ from one another. Factions also differ in every scenario or campaign, both by units available and the phase they come into play. Different objects of scenarios also change the entire way of playing with different sides.

Set-ups, units, and objectives of each scenario and the campaign are converted from real events and situations of the Finnish Civil War. Also each sides' support in the country, their means of support, and the infrastructure and the terrain are taken from respective real-life equivalents.
categories: Civil War, Wargame, World War I
mechanics: Action Points, Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Area-Impulse, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Secret Unit Deployment, Variable Player Powers

name: Viva la Muerte! The Battle of Brunete, July 1937
description:
“Viva la Muerte!”—Rallying cry of the Nationalist forces during much of the Spanish Civil War.

“The boys were confident and kidding. But there was a solemn, deep undertone to all the kidding for we realized fully that many would not come out of it alive.—Reflection by Samuel Levinger, member of the Abraham Lincoln Brigade, about the eve of the Republican Brunete offensive.

The first half of 1937 was an almost complete series of disasters for the Republican cause in the north and west of Spain. Only in the territories leading to Madrid and to the south were the Nationalists thwarted, but at an increasingly bloody cost. The Soviet Union sent massive amounts of weaponry and equipment, while volunteers poured in from throughout Europe, the US and Canada to support the Republican cause. The leadership of the Republican military decided to launch a counter-attack against the Nationalists that were deployed directly west of Madrid. The plan was to attack from the Republican held northern salient to take the crucial town of Brunete, and the main highway leading to Madrid to its south. Success here would compel the fascists to withdraw from the territory closest to the national capitol, and give the Republicans a badly needed victory. One of the largest battles of the war to-date was about to unfold.

Can you do as well or better than your historical counterparts? Learn and enjoy!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Open Drafting

name: Shards of Infinity: Lasav, Tower Commander Promo Card
description:
Lasav, Tower Commander is a promo card included in "Pack B" of The Dice Tower's 2019 Kickstarter campaign.

The Homodeus Champion card can be shuffled into the main Shards of Infinity deck and provides the following effect:

* Health: 5 Health
* Exhaust: Gain 5 Power
* 15 Mastery: Gain an additional 5 Power for each Homodeus Champion you have in play.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Science Fiction
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management

name: Pearls: Neue Halsketten
description:
2 new cards for the game "Pearls" that are part of the annual Abacusspiele catalogue (printed on the backside).

They replace one or two of the pearl-cards from the game.

Card "10" can be taken if the player has 10 pearls of one color. The card counts 10 points and at the end of game, all cards left in hand have a value of 0 (they don't bring minus points).

Card "11" can be taken if within action B (put down hand cards) the player has
a) only 1 card of each color and
b) the sum of all cards has to be exactly 11.

The card counts 11 points.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Nautical
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection

name: Inferno sugli Altipiani: Valsugana
description:
Expansion for "Inferno sugli Altipiani, 1916" released with the issue #3 of the Italian wargaming magazine ”ParaBellum".

It adds a new scenario, Valsugana, with a new little map, a set of additional counters and specific rules and scenario instructions.

—user summary
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War I
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Movement Points, Ratio / Combat Results Table, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation, Zone of Control

name: Magic: The Gathering – Hour of Devastation
description:
Amonkhet is a Magic: The Gathering expansion block consisting of the sets Amonkhet and Hour of Devastation. Amonkhet was released on April 28, 2017, and Hour of Devastation was released on July 14, 2017. The eponymous plane has an ancient Egyptian theme, and features concepts like mummies and embalming.

Hour of Devastation introduced two additional mechanics:

Eternalize: Similar to Embalm, paying a creature's Eternalize cost and exiling it from the graveyard creates a black zombie creature token copy of that creature with base power and toughness 4/4, as with Champion of Wits.
Afflict: A creature with Afflict will cause an opponent to lose a defined amount of life when the creature becomes blocked in combat, as with Neheb, the Eternal.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Hand Management, Take That

name: TURBO G.E.M.
description:
Do you have what it takes to become a…Turbo G.E.M.? A Galactic, Expert, Miner! Climb into your spaceship and get ready to gather the most valuable resources before the other Galactic Miners. Pilot your 3D ship using your Turbo blower, watch out for passing meteorites, explore new planets and mine powerful gems! Race back to your 3D Mother-ship, exchange your gems either to upgrade your spaceship or get the most VPs.

Go into Turbo mode and become a Galactic, Expert, Miner with Turbo G.E.M!

Gameplay:

The modular game board consists of a 3D Mother-ship, 3 planets, 6 3D spaceships, gems, quests, asteroids and upgrades.

Players set up the board in any way they chose, pick up a spacecraft and place it next to the Mother-ship.

Then they grab some quests and on their turn, they get to blow their spaceship, moving it towards their goal. Their goal is to navigate their craft towards planets, mine gems and return them to the Mother-ship, completing quests.

They can also sell the gems in order to buy upgrades for their ships (which attach onto their spaceship). These include tractor beams, bigger engines, more storage space or state of the art sensors.

The space between the Mother-ship and the planets is full of asteroids that might hide power ups or danger!

The game ends when a player collects a set number of points.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Flicking, Pick-up and Deliver, Point to Point Movement, Take That

name: Board Royale: The Island – Founder's Expansion
description: This Kick-Starter Exclusive pack brings a little flavour from other packs and more. Some military, some disaster, some NSFW and a lot of fun packed in this little box! Don’t think of it as a remix, it also has its own items to extend your island to your liking. Struggle with weather, have powerful and experimental weapons, face bizarre things, all in one!
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Pocket Investigations: Merry Christmas
description:
Pocket Investigations is a series of "escape boxes", i.e. cooperative investigation board games that are based on escape games, with real items for clues, and playable at home.

In this scenario, Santa Claus' memory is no longer what it used to be...: he forgot his bank account details and can't log in to buy his Christmas gifts. Will you help him recover his lost information? Merry Christmas is a light initiation scenario to discover Pocket Investigations.
mechanics: Cooperative Game

name: The Resistance: Avalon X
description: The battles of Good and Evil is even more troublesome with the exclusive expansion. With Lancelot, you can never trust your friends again, when one can switch side during these missions. Furthermore, Excalibur gives the leader very powerful abilities, yet great strength must be used wisely. Last but not least, Plot cards can change the tide of the battle if you execute them at the right moment.
categories: Bluffing, Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Medieval, Negotiation, Party Game, Spies/Secret Agents
mechanics: Hidden Roles, Memory, Roles with Asymmetric Information, Simultaneous Action Selection, Team-Based Game, Traitor Game, Variable Player Powers, Voting

name: Albastini Card Game
description:
Albastini is a competitive trick-taking multiplayer card game which is originally from Tanzania, East Africa.

It can be played with 2 to 8 players individually or in teams of 2, 3, or 4 players (i.e. 2v2, 3v3, 2v2v2, 4v4, or 2v2v2v2).

There are 72 cards per deck (8 suits with 9 cards per suit) A=11pts; 7=10pts; K=4pts; J=3pts; Q=2pts; 3-6=0pts.

It typically takes 15+ mins to play but players can opt to play with only 4 of the suits for faster game play (this is typically only encouraged if 2 - 4 players are playing).

It is played clockwise with one card per hand. Players start off with five cards and pick a card from the deck every time a hand is played starting with the winner of the last hand. The game ends after all cards within the deck have been played.

The objective of the game is to get the highest number of points.

A trump suit is randomly selected at the beginning of each game which can be used to dominate all other cards regardless of their point value.

The first card played within each round determines the suit that is in play for that round. It can only be beaten if a higher value card within the same suit is played or any trump card. Players do not have to follow suit during each round.

The player (or team) with the highest number of points at the end of the game is declared the winner.
mechanics: Team-Based Game, Trick-taking

name: Naruto: Ninja Arena – Sensei Pack
description:
Require the core game.
The Genin Pack expansion is also required to play up to 5 or 6 players.

Seinsei Pack contains 6 new ninjas to upgrade your game!

Join an all-out dice brawl and prove you’re the best ninja in Konoha village!

Naruto Ninja Arena is the first game using the Roll & Clash system. During the game, you throw your dice as quickly as you can and use the results to activate Techniques without stopping the game. Everyone plays at the same time in a frantic battle to be the last Ninja Standing!

The game ends when all players are K.O. or eliminated except one. The last player standing wins the game!

Ninjas:
Kakashi
Gai
Orochimaru
Tsunade
Jiraiya
3rd Hokage Sarutobi
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Operation Albion: Germany versus Russia in the Baltic, 1917-1918
description:
Operation Albion: Germany versus Russia in the Baltic, 1917-1918 is a two-player operational wargame of the campaign in the Baltic, 1917-18, in which the Germans captured the city of Riga and took critical islands in an amphibious operation. Operation Albion in part led to the collapse of the Russian Provisional Government and brought the final German victory in the East. The campaign was one of the few joint land-naval-air operations of World War I. The game includes the post-Albion German intervention in the Finnish Civil War of 1919.

Albion is a combined naval-air-land campaign. Players conduct actions which encompass discrete combat, logistical, intelligence, and other operations. A player can conduct one or more actions per turn. All units in the game use a similar combat system, showing the interaction of naval, air, and land forces. Each game turn represents from one day to one month depending on the pace of operations. A player may take multiple actions each GT. One inch on the map represents 40 kilometers. Ground units represent regiments, brigades, and divisions, or equivalent formations. Aircraft units represent squadrons. Ship units represent divisions of one to three battleships or battlecruisers, four to eight other cruisers, flotillas of twelve to twenty destroyers, or various numbers of other ships types.

Components: One 22 x 34-inch game map 176 5/8-inch counters

Published in S&T #342
mechanics: Hexagon Grid

name: Smart10: Musiikki
description:
The expansion includes 100 new questions and 1000 new answers.
The theme of the questions is music and include subjects such as pop-musicians, bands, songs, albums, genres, countries and decades.
You can switch the question cards with two theme decks or mix these music questions with half of the general question cards.
mechanics: Push Your Luck

name: Asking for Trobils: Scoundrels – Ship Package 1
description:
Each Ship type comes with a Ship card and 4 of the Ship Minis.

Contains:
The Alyssa
The Centurion Hawk
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Worker Placement

name: Siege Storm: Gunslingers
description: Proud inventors and best riflemen in the world - they are Gunslingers. They use deadly contraptions and perfect aim to destroy anyone who stands in their way. If you like dealing tons of damage and setting up deadly combos this is faction for you!
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Deck Construction

name: 99 Ninja
description:
99 Ninja is a two player competitive tile laying game, where players use transparent cards depicting ninja from 3 different clans to surround (and assassinate) daimyo. Like other games from Prometheus Game Labs there is a lot of tactical play – you will have to time your placement and outmaneuver, but also out think, your opponent! And yes, there are 99 ninja on the cards. We counted.

—description from the publisher
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Print & Play, Puzzle
mechanics: Highest-Lowest Scoring, Tile Placement, Tug of War, Victory Points as a Resource, Zone of Control

name: Titans: Spirit of War
description: Kickstarter exclusive expansion that contains a new deck of Support Cards and 6 special dice. Players may decide to use that deck of Support Cards instead of the standard one or combine them. The new cards work similarly to the standard ones, since players may combine them to create combos in battles, but they need to meet the requirements to do so. Cards give different support in battle, bringing the special dice included in the expansion. These dice will add more strength or activate the special actions on the cards that player used. There are 6 different special actions on those cards, so it allows for more tactical maneuvering and excitement in battles.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Bone Wars
description:
In Bone Wars, players take on the role of a palaeontologist in the late 1800s. During this time, a bitter rivalry was waged between Othniel Marsh and Edward Cope, two world-renowned palaeontologists. They both tried to outdo the other in discovering new species of dinosaurs, going so far as to bribe workers, steal or even destroy bones. The players are palaeontologists working for one of these legendary men or are perhaps working on their own behalf – trying to outdo all competition.

During the game, players have to make clever use of their action cards, which they play in the slots under their player board. These action cards can either activate their team - digging up fossils and discovering new species in the field - or their paleontologist - who spend their time publishing species, debunking other players' papers and getting awards.

Published species cards are added to bonus slots at the top of your player board. Each added species card gives a bonus depending on how many species cards are already in that specific slot.

When your paleontologist publishes a paper, it is added to either Marsh's or Cope's side, depending on which side the player is working for. Specific actions will also reward loyalty points with your current patron. At the end of the game, players multiply the number of loyalty they have (both with Marsh and Cope) with the published papers to gain VP. Published papers, therefore, count for all players. It is up to you to make them count the most for yourself.

-description from designer
mechanics: Hand Management, Multi-Use Cards, Worker Placement, Different Worker Types

name: Mons And Mages
description:
Players take on the role of seasoned wizards and compete with each other in the triannual ‘Mons And Mages’ tournament. Traverse the land to recruit mystical monsters - or mons - into your team, combine their unique abilities, and create the most powerful combo moves to strike down your opponents’ healthcore. Defeat all other wizards and rise to the most prestigious title: The Domitor.

Mons And Mages is a competitive, medium-weight, engine-building and card combo-ing board game about taming and training monsters.

In this world, monsters are wild creatures with extremely strong characteristics and disorderly nature. They always act on their own will and no wizard could ever control them or make them obey. Mechanically, attracting a monster into your team will create a special synergy with others. So, players must be able to mix and match their monsters’ unpredictable powers in a clever way to create the most impressive combos and outplay all their opponents.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Die Icon Resolution, Income, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Rondel, Set Collection, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Battlecrest: Expansion Collection #3
description:
How about some more heroes? With more heroes you can get a lot of variety out of your games. You can also play them in solo (either as or against them) and even play 3-4P team games.

Includes:
