name: Magnets The Game
description:
Magnets: the Game is the marbles of the 21st century. Players take turns tossing disc magnets into a contained field of magnets, in an attempt to cause a stack of magnets to form. Cause a stack to form with your toss and they're yours! Add them to your hand for continued play. When less then 3 magnets are left, the game is done. Collect the most, and you have won. Variations of the rules include tournament play, Co-operative play, and anarchy. Make house rules! ...and toss some magnets

Magnets: the Game comes in a 3"x 1" round tin, contains 30 magnets, and a belt to define the playing field; Plus a fold out rule book with pictures!

WARNING: ! Ages 8+.
Small magnets swallowing hazard: This game conatians small magnets. Swallowed magnets can stick together across intestines causing serious infections and death. Seek medical attention if magnets are swallowed or inhaled.
'Magnets: The Game" can cause time to slow and duties to be delayed. Beware.
mechanics: Action Queue

name: Mage Wars: Raincloud Promo Card
description:
This promo card is given as a reward for participating on Organized play.

Raincloud

Conjuration - Cloud, Weather

Cost 8 Mana
Health 5

Incorporeal. Flying. Hydro Inmunity.

All objects in Raincloud´s zone gains the Flame -2, Acid -2 and regenerate 1 traits. Each Upkeep phase you may remove 1 Burn condition or 1 Corrode condition, from 1 object in Raincloud´s zone, by paying its removal cost. Once per round, immediatly before or after any friendly Action Phase, you may pay 1 mana to move Raincloud 1 zone and attach it to taht zone.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Ardennes Petite: A Battle of the Bulge, Ardennes 1944, Minigame
description:
Ardennes Petite (Ardennes Small) is a very small-scale - only 6 hexes to Namur! - eight 2-day turn (16Dec44-2Jan45) division-to-corps-level Battle of the Bulge minigame, designed as a half-hour-lunch game.

The U.S. starts with 6 units - the Germans with 9.

Combat is a fairly simple 1:2 to 4:1 Disruption/Retreat combat odds system, with no Defender Eliminated outright, except against 14th Cavalry Group, if it is defending alone. Fortification for corps-level infantry units.

German Pressed Attack and Waffen-SS Ruthlessness (and consequential GI Rage) rules.

As you can see in Images, Patrick Tremoureux has his beautiful professional renditions of the map and counters.
categories: Print & Play, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Push Your Luck, Ratio / Combat Results Table, Simulation

name: Made From Scratch
description:
Made From Scratch is a culinary card game in which players compete to complete recipes. The cards that comprise a player's hand consist primarily of ingredients; such as poultry, butter, tomatoes, and spices. In playing those ingredient cards and providing more of the ingredients on a recipe than their opponents, a player gets to claim the recipe and bring it into their prep area. Limited kitchen space forces chefs to try and prep, cook, and score their recipes before they burn.

Made From Scratch captures the essence and complexity of preparing gourmet dishes and packages it in an easy to learn game that is guaranteed to leave you hungry for more.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Trick-taking

name: Dogfight
description:
Dogfight is a board wargame for two players. There are two levels. In the first level there are WWII fighter planes. The second level is more complicated: modern jets use air-to-air missiles beside gun.

The main characteristic is that the game board is covered with a net of equilateral triangles. The vertices of these triangles are points towards which players hold the position and move figurines.

The objective is to shoot down all enemy planes. One figurine can shoot on enemy figurine by moving behind it. The game continues until one player runs out of the plane.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Modern Warfare, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Simulation

name: Blink of Death
description:
No moderator, no elimination, five-minute games.

Blink of Death is a fast game for 4-12 players in which everyone gets a role: One of the Shifter Demons, the Abandoned, the helpful Anchorite, or one of a dozen different characters, each with a special ability. In 30 seconds, The Demon must kill one others or lose.

Because Blink of Death is so fast, fun, and engaging, you'll want to play it again and again, and no two games are ever the same.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Children's Game, Deduction, Horror, Party Game
mechanics: Role Playing

name: Small City: Player boards Expansion #2 – The Rivers
description:
4 New Player boards printed both side (Easy and Expert) for the game Small City.
The rivers cut the player board into two parts and the players will have to build bridges to cross the water...
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Simulation, Variable Player Powers

name: E-lite ASTrA
description:
A solo card game inspired by the 80's computer game Elite. The player assumes the role of a spaceship captain, travelling about and trading between worlds.

Decks of custom cards are used to record the status of the player's ship, as well as generate the space they are travelling through, the marketplaces they trade at, the opponents they fight and missions they can complete. Combat utilizes a combination of resource management and dice rolling.

The game is intended to be played over several sessions with the ability to be quickly packed up and then resumed, whilst being stored in a compact fashion.
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Fighting, Print & Play, Science Fiction, Space Exploration
mechanics: Action Points, Action Queue, Dice Rolling

name: Dystopian Wars: Fleet Action
description:
Calling all Commodores and Generals....Dust off your Dystopian Wars Armies, because we have got some fantastic news for you!

Fleet Action is the new fast play game engine set in the world of Dystopian Wars, which will allow you to take your existing forces and, with no change to what you already own, play a faster, leaner, deadlier game of the world's leading Victorian Super Science Fiction Wargame.

This is the same ruleset included in the Battle For Iceland 2 player box set and it available separately for anyone wanting to take a look, or use other models from the range.
categories: Book, Miniatures, Post-Napoleonic, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Frostgrave: Sellsword
description:
From the publisher:

Sellsword is a digital-only mini-expansion for Frostgrave: Fantasy Wargames in the Frozen City. This expansion gives wizards the option to hire a captain, a special type of soldier, to help lead their warbands. Unlike other soldiers in the game, captains may choose their own weapons, have a few special abilities known as 'tricks of the trade', and gain experience. Of course, such experience and versatility comes at a price, so captains are going to want more than the retainer given to most soldiers – they want a cut of the treasure! Also included in this expansion are three new scenarios designed to give soldiers more of a chance to shine. All feature some type of limitation or obstacle to spellcasting that will force wizards to think a bit more about how much they rely on their magic.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Role Playing, Variable Player Powers

name: Carcassonne: Die Wahrsagerin
description:
This is a fan-made expansion available for download from the Hans im Glück website.

Mysterious fortune tellers have been appearing across the land of Carcassonne, possessing the ability to see what lies ahead. This rare profession may bring an advantage to those hoping to get a glimpse into the future…

This includes 8 new Fortune Teller tiles.

For every meeple on a fortune teller tent the player may draw 1 extra tile (up to 3) out of the bag at the beginning of his turn, and choose one.

When a tile with a fortune teller has tiles on every 4 sides, the tent has been completed and gets scored. The player, who placed the last of the 4 tiles gets 3 points.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Medieval, Print & Play, Territory Building
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Tile Placement

name: TAILITS
description:
TAILITS is an abstract strategy game for 2 players, Black and White, based on the Japanese logic puzzle LITS, and inspired by the game TAIJI. It is a follow-up to Battle of LITS by the same designer. Starting with Black, players take turns placing L-, I-, T-, and S-shaped tetrominoes from a shared supply onto the board. There are three restrictions:

1. Every new piece must share an edge with at least one of the pieces already on the board.
2. No two congruent pieces may share an edge.
3. No four cells in a 2x2 arrangement may all be covered by pieces.

Each piece has two black squares and two white squares. Players attempt to make large groups of squares of their color (horizontal, vertical, and diagonal connections count). When no more pieces can be played, whoever has the largest such group wins. In the event of a tie score, the player who made the last move wins.
mechanics: Grid Coverage, Square Grid

name: Flames of War: Nachtjager – The Battle for Northern Germany March-May 1945
description:
Description from the back of the book:

This is one of the Late War Supplements for Flames of War. It is focused on the British attacks on Germany late March 1945 onward. It includes histories of the battles for the northern Rhine including Operation Plunder. Game options include rules to field a British Rifle Company, Armoured Squadron and the B Squadron, 15th/19th Hussars. Also are rules for fielding a Marine-Grenadier Kompanie, Panzerkampfgruppe Wallenberg and Panzerkampfgruppe von Benninsen.
This supplement features optional rules for fighting battles at night.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Munchkin Halloween Monster Box
description: The Munchkin Halloween Monster Box has room for two thousand Munchkin cards, various Kill-O-Meters, a Level Playing Field or two, Dungeons, Seals, and more. To get you started, it includes twelve holiday-themed Munchkin cards that you can shuffle into any game
mechanics: Unspecified

name: ExSpelled
description:
You're all incoming freshmen at Whimberly's College of the Magical Arts – a magic school located in the center of a mana desert. It's pretty terrible.

...but you don't have much of a choice. You didn't get accepted to any of the more prestigious magic schools – the quill didn't write down your name, you weren't endowed with amazing mutations, you're not exactly what the magic elite want.

But that doesn't mean you can't attend magic school. Magic is for everyone...right?

ExSpelled is a book that transforms into a creative tabletop game for 2-6 players. As you progress through the book, you will create your characters, color them, and customize them. Your characters will face many dangers, brave challenges, and make many decisions that permanently affect the story. You'll use a decision card to track the choices you make as the story moves forward.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Storytelling

name: Kakak Teladan Episode Belanja
description:
Your mom goes to the gathering with her friends, and you get the shopping duty as some of the home supplies runs out. The problem is, you left the shopping list at home! Can you remember all the item?

Kakak Teladan Episode Belanja is a memory game for children and adults which every player must recall the password and item from the shopping list. If succeed, a new item will be added until one of the players fails. First player to fail five times loses and become a disgrace for their family.
mechanics: Memory
publishers: C&Co. Fun Factory, Congkak Fun Factory

name: Wings of War: World War 2 – Supermarine Spitfire
description:
Take your Wings of War game into the third dimension! Each historically-accurate, fully-painted miniature represents an aircraft from Wings of War: The Dawn of World War II. All miniatures come complete with maneuver deck and variable-altitude stand.

The signature fighter plane of the RAF, the Supermarine Spitfire was a fast, highly-maneuverable single-seater.

—description from the publisher
categories: Aviation / Flight, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Queue, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Flames of War: Rising Sun – Russia's Wars with Japan and Finland 1939-1940
description:
Rising Sun is an intelligence handbook for Flames Of War and the fourth book for Early War covering the fighting in the east centered on the Soviet Union along its border in 1939 and 1940.

Inside this book you'll find:

- History of the Japanese in China and their clash with the Soviet Union on the Mongolian border.

- History of the Soviet Union's border expansions and its operations in Manchuria, Poland, and Finland in 1939 and 1940.

- History of the Finnish Winter War against the Soviet Union in 1939 and 1940 and their role in the Invasion of the Soviet Union in 1941.

- Options to field the Japanese Army with tank, infantry, and cavalry forces.

- Options to field the Soviet Red Army in 1939 with heavy tank, light tank, fast tank, motor rifle, infantry, and cavalry forces.

- Options to field the Finnish Army during 1939 to 1941 with infantry, fortified, light infantry, and guerilla forces.

- Terrain guides.

- Winter War weather rules.

- Inspirational color photos.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Point to Point Movement, Simulation, Variable Player Powers

name: Tower of Madness: Dr. Jin Wu Promo Card
description:
This is a promo card for Tower of Madness.

"Dr. Jin Wu" is a new investigator card, allowing players an extra investigator to choose from at the beginning of the game.

Her ability is: "Jin counts each Madness marble as 5 points toward her victory, until she goes Insane."

This promo card was distributed in Game Trade Magazine #224 (October 2018).
categories: Action / Dexterity, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Horror
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Go Dotty
description:
GoDotty is a new abstract family board game, which is easy to learn but takes strategy and tactics to master it. The game is simple, connect the dots to create the most lines-of-three to win the game.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Tile Placement

name: Warhammer Armies (Fifth Edition): Dogs of War
description:
Warhammer Armies: Dogs of War is an expansion to the 5th edition of Warhammer: The Game of Fantasy Battles.

This 96-page softcover book is an army book, that provides all kinds of information required to collect Dogs of War faction and field it on the tabletop.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Battlestar Galactica: Starship Battles – Cylon Raider
description:
The Raider is the primary Cylon assault craft, first encountered during the destruction of the Twelve Colonies. The ship is actually a bio-mechanical, self-aware, living creature, with a complex system of organs, veins and, biological fluids inside its main body.

The Raider is armed with two kinetic energy guns, and it may sometimes carry conventional and nuclear missiles. Capable of FTL jumps, Raiders are also very maneuverable and hard to keep in sight for more than a few seconds.

Contents:
1 Raider
1 Gaming Base
1 Ship Card
1 Maneuver Deck
Set of pilot Cards
categories: Aviation / Flight, Bluffing, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Warfighter: WWII Pacific Combat Card Game – Scenario Book #1
description:
Kickstarter Exclusive Stretch Goal book of 19 scenarios specific to WWII Pacific and European Theaters of War. Not available for retail sale.

8.5" x 11" glossy paper booklet
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling

name: Wasteland Express Delivery Service: The Demons
description:
Was part of the pledge level for backing the Dice Tower 2018 Kickstarter campaign.

An ally card.

Text says:
When you buy 1 cargo space at the mod shop, you may gain an additional one for 1$.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Pick-up and Deliver, Variable Player Powers

name: Shadows over Normandie: Cthulhu Mythos Call #4
description:
You asked for it during the original Shadows over Normandie Kickstarter campaign and you sure had a lot of patience. But here they are, finally! Emerging from the sewers, from the heart of their lair, the ghouls are now joining the Mythos faction.

Cthulhu Mythos Call #4 introduces some creative gameplay because all ghouls have the Burrower special ability. Thanks to this special ability, Ghouls may move underground, approaching their preys as close as possible, before engaging in a close combat assault, their greatest feature.

However, don’t wait too long to get the ghouls to the surface or you’ll risk getting caught, and face the consequences… Although they’re heavily specialized troops – with only one life point – the ghouls are rather fragile.

The Ghoul Clan is lead by a ghoul priest with the disrupting habit, even for necrophagous ghouls, to play with food. This character benefits from the Master of the Dead special ability, supporting his clan’s powers by raising Zombies.

In closing, these punchboards contain a set of thematic options to reinforce your ghouls as well as different terrain elements filling out the elements in Battleground Set #5 - The Sewers.

This product is accompanied by a digital booklet, downloadable from our site, containing the rules to play with The Ghoul Clan as well as two scenarios.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II, Zombies
mechanics: Grid Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Pass-A-Fist
description:
Pass-a-Fist
An overly violent party game for non-violent people.

About:
"Lets face it: we've all had violent thoughts toward our friends and family during game nights..."

Pass-a-Fist is a non-violent party game that allows you to finally live out some of those unhealthy urges (..hypothetically). It's fun, mildly addictive, and almost too easy to learn.

Contents:
The game consists of 162 cards and an 8-page rulebook:

- 55 Attack cards
- 55 Counter cards
- 42 Injury cards
- 10 Special cards

How does Pass-a-Fist work?:
How does a typical, figurative fist fight play out, you ask? Keep scrolling and we'll lay it all out!

To start, shuffle and divide the Fight cards and Injury cards into two separate piles. Players will draw from each throughout the game. Next, deal 5 Fight cards to each player.

To begin a turn (or, "round") - a player draws a Fight card, and then plays an Attack card on another player:

If at any point an Attack card lands on a player, that player can play a Counter card to stop it, or redirect it:

What about those fancy sounding Special cards we mentioned earlier? Those can be played at any time, and they allow players to do... well... special stuff:

If an Attack card lands on a player, and they don't play a Counter card, they place an Injury card face up in front of them:

Once a player has received three (valid) Injury cards, they're out of the game.

The last person standing wins!


Pass-a-Fist is a great time for anyone ages 12 and up (as long as you're okay with cartoonish violence, that is). The game has been very well received by a wide range of people, young and old, who've had a chance to play it. Turns out, everyone likes a pretend fight, especially if it results in some seriously good laughs.

The game is incredibly easy to learn, and only takes about 2 minutes to figure out. There's no mastering it, though - every new round brings about a different style of chaos. No two games are ever alike (...it's not even close).

The game plays pretty quickly (10-15 minutes) with a small group (4 players), or a bit longer (20-25 minutes) with larger groups (8-10 players). Easy game play and rules make it pretty adaptable to most groups, too. Play it with kids! Play it as a drinking game! Play it regularly and demand future expansions!

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Fighting, Humor, Party Game
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Elimination, Take That

name: Foodfighters: The Sweet Expansion
description:
Another delicious expansion faction! The Sweets faction also includes nine new fighters tiles, three Sweets-only power cards, and a sheet of nine thought bubble clingers.

—description from the publisher
categories: Children's Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Set Collection, Variable Player Powers

name: コリントコンストラクション (Corinth Construction)
description:
コリントコンストラクション (Corinth Construction) is a Japanese dexterity game. The designer says "This game is customizable pinball, where you build the common board and launch balls of different materials (glass, wood, iron). Who earns best points?"

In the game, the players begin by placing the components of a wooden pinball machine. The device does not have paddles to keep the ball in play. Instead, the game more closely resembles a pachinko machine, which are very popular in Japan. The ball falls freely after it is fired.

The flat area of the board has regular pinholes, and players start by placing pegs and barriers as they wish. Then they take turns firing a ball into the area. The base of the device has a series of slots with different scoring values. The players are trying to get the different types of pinball to fall to the more valuable slots to win.

The game includes a metal, magnetised peg. When the steel ball is fired, if it strikes the peg, it might stick there.

'Corinth' is the name in Japan for this style of children's toy, from which pachinko machines developed.
user summary
mechanics: Modular Board, Tile Placement
publishers: さとーふぁみりあ (Sato Familie)

name: Imperial Settlers: Empires of the North – Japanese Islands: Feudal Age Solo Scenario
description: This promotional solo scenario allows conquering the Japanese Islands, or just using their resources.
categories: Ancient, Card Game, City Building, Civilization, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Nautical
mechanics: Hand Management, Variable Player Powers, Worker Placement

name: Wings of Glory: World War 1 – Breguet BR.14
description:
The Breguet 14 was one of the best all–round Allied two–seaters of the war, produced in large quantities for both recon and light bombing. Constructed largely of duraluminum and welded steel tubing, the airplane was light, sturdy, and very fast, with many features that were revolutionary for the day. It was the most common French two–seater in 1918 and was also used by USA and Belgium. This aircraft was widely used for both day and night bombing in the last year of the war. About 8000 were built before the war ended.

Breguet BR.14 B2 (Escadrille Br 111)
Breguet 14s were assigned to Escadrille 111 in October 1917. During the war, the unit scored 15 victories. This model includes cards for optional armament and crew skills.

Breguet BR.14 B2 (Audinot/Hellouin De Cénival)
Audinot and Hellouin de Cénival flew several bombing missions of Escadrille BR 127 from November 1917. They were shot down by enemy fighters during a daring mission, on March 28, 1918.

Breguet BR.14 A2 (Stanley/Folger)
Gilbert Stanley and H.T. Folger belonged to the 96th Squadron, that operated from June 12, 1918 to the end of the war engaging in daring bombing missions across the front.

Each WW1 Wings of Glory® Airplane Pack is a ready–to–play model, painted and assembled, 100% compatible with any other WW1 Wings of Glory game product.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, World War I
mechanics: Action Queue, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: H.D.P.: Fútbol y toda su Fauna
description: Thematic expansion focused on "Soccer and all its lot".
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game
mechanics: Hand Management, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Warhammer 40,000 (Eighth Edition): Codex Heretic Astartes – Chaos Space Marines
description:
The Heretic Astartes have expanded a lot since their codex was released in 2017, so we’ve given Codex: Chaos Space Marines a spruce-up! We’ve combined the previous codex with recent rules releases – including new datasheets, psychic powers, and Chapter Approved points changes

Codex: Chaos Space Marines is your complete guide to the Heretic Astartes – a brotherhood of superhuman traitors hell-bent on destroying the Imperium they once helped build.

In this codex, you'll discover how the Chaos Space Marines came to be, their dark plans for the Imperium, and how they fight. Lore and timelines explore the long, shadowed history of these malefic warriors, from the dark days of the Horus Heresy to their renewed assault on realspace following the opening of the Cicatrix Maledictum. Collected art and illustrations bring the dark world of the Chaos Space Marines to life, while rules allow you to field an army from the Black Legion, Alpha Legion, World Eaters, Night Lords, Word Bearers, Emperor's Children, Iron Warriors, as well as renegade warbands, including ones of your own devising.

You'll be able to choose from a dark arsenal, containing everything from frothing, zealous Cultists to daemonforged war engines like the Defiler. Faction rules let you tailor your strategy and tactics to the legendary Traitor Legions, like the bloodthirsty World Eaters or relentless Iron Warriors, while a huge set of Stratagems offer you all manner of dirty tricks to unleash on your foes.

Meanwhile, the book is a fantastic resource for collectors, containing tips for building your army, examples of Chaos Space Marines forces, and loads of invaluable reference material and alternative colour schemes for painters.

This book contains:

- Let the Galaxy Burn: the terrible origin of the Chaos Space Marines, their betrayal of the Emperor during the Horus Heresy that ushered in an era of damnation, a timeline detailing the Ages of Betrayal, Retribution and Apotheosis with key battles and atrocities in gruesome detail (with a further timeline detailing the horrors of Abaddon’s various Crusades) and a map detailing the current, tainted state of the galaxy
- Information and details of the 7 major Chaos Legions – The Black Legion, Alpha Legion, Iron Warriors, Night Lords, Word Bearers, World Eaters and Emperor’s Children – with histories, key battles, heraldries and colour schemes for each
- An in-depth look at each of the characters and units available to each Chaos Space Marines army, with appropriately grisly background
- A showcase of beautifully painted Citadel miniatures, depicting the colour schemes of the Chaos Space Marines expertly painted by the‘Eavy Metal team.
- 45 datasheets covering the Chaos Space Marines range, featuring their rules and statistics for use in games
- Army abilities and wargear lists, alongside a brief explanation of their use and the use of keywords
- Rules profiles for every piece of wargear and every weapon in the Chaos Space Marines’ arsenal
- Points values for all miniatures, weapons and wargear for use in Matched Play games
- Rules for Battle-forged armies – 8 Legion Traits, 1 for each of the original Legions and 1 for Renegade Chapters
- 24 Stratagems of which are Legion-specific; the Dark Hereticus psychic discipline with its 3 powers specific to the Marks of Tzeentch, Nurgle and Slaanesh and 14 weapons and artefacts available only to Chaos Space Marines
- 6 Warlord Traits usable by any Chaos Space Marines Warlord and a further 7 which are Legion-specific
- 6 unique Tactical Objectives for Chaos Space Marines.

Important Note:
In 2019, Games Workshop released a second edition of the Codex to correspond with the release of Vigilus Defiant, Vigilus Ablaze, and Shadowspear. This newer edition contained new art, lore and updated rules encompassing new content from Imperium Nihilus: Vigilus Ablaze, including Prayers to the Dark Gods, updated units, and more. If you already own a copy of Chaos Space Marines and Vigilus Ablaze, you'll find this book a handy compilation. However, you do not need a copy of the original codex or Vigilus Ablaze to use this product.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Turisteando
description:
Travel around South America, a part of the world full of places of international fame as well as fascinating hidden gems that every tourist should know. Compete to be the best tourism reviewer ever!

The game come with enough components to play different modes, which give you a unique way to play the game, each distinct from the other.

To travel, you just have to use the right ticket: bus for the roads, ship for the rivers or the sea, and airplane between airports. You can use it to travel once per turn, but if you pay attention, the tickets also have a destination and if you start or finish your travel in those places, then you can travel one more time!

To win, you must achieve the best reputation among the players. To increase it, you have to meet certain objectives like getting postcards, completing a route, going to trending or unexplored places, and much more according to the mode you're playing in.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Hand Management, Network and Route Building, Open Drafting, Point to Point Movement, Set Collection

name: Warhammer 40,000: Elite Edition
description:
Enter the thrilling world of tabletop gaming in the 41st Millennium with the Elite Edition – a set designed to introduce you to the Warhammer 40,000 hobby. Inside this jam-packed box, you’ll find the makings of two armies plus rules for gaming with them – ideal for kicking off your hobby, sharing with a friend or gifting to someone you’d like to introduce to your favourite game. What’s more, expanding your Elite Edition is easy – grab a Recruit or Command Edition, and check out the huge ranges for Necrons and Space Marines!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Wejdź w Reakcję: Zaginiony eksperyment
description:
Wejdź w Reakcję: Zaginiony eksperyment (Re-action:Lost Experiment) is a hybrid of escape room game and experimental kit. The box contains:

deck of cards with riddles and quizes, which allows players to participate in exciting laboratory investigation
experimental kit of reagents and tools to conduct 10 biochemical experiments.


Joined two different worlds (science and boardgames) provides an unique thematic, immersive game.

Wejdź w Reakcję: Zaginiony eksperyment was published thanks to cooperation of Games Development (boardgame publisher) and BioCen (Foundation of bioeducation).

—description from the designer
mechanics: Real-Time, Solo / Solitaire Game, Storytelling

name: Blood Bowl: Second Season Edition – Special Plays Card Pack
description:
This deck of 64 cards contains all of the universal Special Plays available to every team as inducements in the new edition of Blood Bowl, broken down into handy categories. You’ll also find reminder cards for the results of the Prayers to Nuffle table from the book.

You won’t find these Special Plays anywhere else, so make sure you secure a copy of this deck if you want to take advantage of these strategic inducements to help even the odds.

CONTENTS
– 8 Benefits of Training Special Play cards
– 8 Dirty Tricks Special Play cards
– 8 Heroic Feats Special Play cards
– 8 Magical Memorabilia Special Play cards
– 8 Miscellaneous Mayhem Special Play cards
– 8 Random Events Special Play cards
– 16 Prayers to Nuffle reminder cards

You’ll need a copy of Blood Bowl: The Official Rules to make full use of these cards.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Astro Tussle
description:
"Astro Tussle" is a free-to-play template-based miniatures skirmish wargame set in space. The ruleset can be used with any miniatures to enable skirmishes in your favorite sci-fi settings.

Inspired by other genre greats, X-Wing, Battlestar Galactica: Starship Battles, and Gaslands.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Bluffing, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Movement Template, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Masters of The Universe: Fields of Eternia The Board Game – King Hsss on Tyrantisaurus
description:
King Hsss rides into battle atop a Tyrantisaurus, armed with a shoulder-mounted cannon and razor-sharp teeth. When the techno-organic virus spread through Eternia, the dinosaur that lived there began to grow robotic limbs and weapons.

Package contains:

1x King Hsss on Tyrantisaurus limited miniature with scenic base integrated
1x game card

Item is available in Europe only.
categories: Adventure, Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fighting, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Points, Action/Event, Alliances, Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, Die Icon Resolution, Events, Team-Based Game

name: Virtue Signal: Deplorables
description:
The Deplorables expansion adds over a hundred new cards to the game, and allows you (finally) to grief other players as a disgusting internet troll.

Deplorables is a game within a game. The deplorable players use a separate deck all their own, with unique cards, game mechanics and objectives. You thought it was wild before, hoo boy.

Requires Virtue Signal: The Game to play.

⚠ACHTUNG!⚠ Deplorables is Probably not for kids and definitely not for the thin-skinned. While it doesn't actually portray anything explicit, it makes reference to things that are absolutely disgusting.

-description from publisher's website
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Political
mechanics: Tile Placement

name: Warfighter: WWII Z Expansion #59 – Dagon!
description:
April 1944 // Neutral Portuguese Cape Verde Islands
"Urgent! Most Secret! To Reichsführer-SS Deutsche Forschungsgemeinschaft - This is Agent Z, repeat Agent Z, I have the secret formulae, the Professor's notes provided the key, the Ultimate Weapon is here on this Cape Verde Island! They are closing in on me, send U-boat!"

Warfighter: WWII Z Expansion #59 – Dagon adds 56 cards to your Warfighter WWII Missions! This is a Soldier pack with new Hostiles, Soldiers, Locations, Missions, Objectives,and Skills.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Paco's Party
description:
This weekend was Paco's birthday party and so many fun pictures were taken! But… wait a minute… where is Hippo on this picture? It’s gone!

Race to find what is missing on the cards at play to get rid of your cards. Nothing missing? It’s Paco's Party all over again. Call it out while dancing like Paco, but don’t be the last one, or add all the played cards to your own pile. The first player to get rid of their cards wins the game!
mechanics: Acting, Move Through Deck, Race, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Static Blood Moon
description:
Each time the moon glows that beautiful pinkish-red color, the Gyrples (in their various tribes) host Blood Moon ceremonies. These ceremonies are meant to dig deep into their collective mind’s eye, hoping to satisfy the Great Sage who always rewards a good host. Invite a jiving group of Gyrples from neighboring tribes and you’ll be rewarded with a plethora of prime sustenance for the psyche of a Gyrple: Dendryke root. Earn enough of this Dendryke root and the Great Sage may allow the sun to set one final time, ceasing time, and leaving you to bask in the glory that is being the one to set forth the Static Blood Moon—truly any Gyrple’s idea of paradise.

Static Blood Moon is an abstract strategy, dice drafting/dice placement game for 2 players, which plays over three rounds in about 45 minutes. Players take turns drafting dice, placing them on their player boards (creating unique scoring combos), and scoring points. The player with the most points at the end of three rounds wins!
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Pattern Building, Turn Order: Stat-Based

name: Munchkin Bosses
description: You're pretty good at Munchkin — stabbed some friends, looted some rooms, killed a few monsters, won some games — and now you think you're ready to take on the boss monsters. Well, look no further as Munchkin Bosses has all of the epic monster boosters and munchkin buffers to provide any player with a battle royale (with cheese). Add this special expansion deck to any Munchkin game and get ready to be bossed!
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Humor
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Trading, Variable Player Powers

name: Munchkin Petting Zoo
description:
Ah, the good old petting zoo. Where else can you find adorable animals, screaming children, and the most awful smells?

Munchkin Petting Zoo lets you add a menagerie of surprisingly friendly fauna to your arsenal! But you should probably still wash your hands after you pet that...giraffe.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Humor
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Trading, Variable Player Powers

name: nestorgames GP
description:
nestorgames GP is a fast and furious racing game for 2 to 8 players, derived from Top Speed by the same designer, that simplifies many aspects of its predecessor (same mechanism, but using dice instead of cards) and also adds some fun twists such as special items or shortcuts. It is a tribute to the arcade racing games of the 80’s, such as SuperSprint or Nitro.

GAME OVERVIEW (please refer to the rulebook)

The player with the highest qualifying value goes first in the pit lane, with the rest of the players going in the same order as they are sitting and counterclockwise.

On your turn, if your car is belly up (you crashed on your previous turn) flip it over and pass the turn. You car doesn’t move.

Otherwise, roll one of your dice. Then you can opt to stop rolling dice on roll another one, and so on until you’ve either stopped rolling dice or you’ve rolled the same number twice. Notice that you can’t roll more than 6 dice.

One of these three things can happen:


You’ve rolled the same number twice but the car is not on a corner: Your car does not move.



You’re rolled the same number twice and the car is on a corner. You’ve crashed! (see Crashing) Your car does not move.



You’ve stopped rolling so you don’t have repeated results: Add up all the values of the rolled dice and move your car forward exactly that many spaces along the track. Other cars don’t block your movement.


If your car moves and ends its movement on a non-corner space occupied by another car, you bump into it. Move that car one space forward. If, as a result, that car bumps into another car repeat the process. If a bumped car moves into a corner, it crashes (see Crashing). If there was another car (or more) on that corner then all of them crash on that space.

CRASHING: When a car crashes, flip it over belly-up, take one of its dice and place it on its ‘box’ by the side of the pit lane. You won’t be able to use the dice that are in your ‘box’ unless you Fix the car (see Fixing your car).

Races are usually played to 3 laps, but this can be agreed upon. The first car crossing the finish line after that many laps wins.

Additional rules include fixing your car (recover a die), using a shortcut once per race, picking up and using special items (bombs, wrenches, turbo boosters, rockets and oil spills), championships, teams,...

—description from the designer
mechanics: Push Your Luck, Race, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Reager's Return
description:
Reager's Return is the second game of the Blackbrim Series, the sequel to Blackbrim: 1876

It has been a year since your run-in with the devious criminal Reager Skinner. Since then, there have been no new leads. You begin to accept that the trail has turned cold until a letter from the London Police arrives, asking for your help against Reager in the capital. Letter in hand, you board the next available train, though something feels amiss...

Reager's Return contains one full storyline made up of two parts, with dozens of puzzles to decipher and clues to crack.

--description from the publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deduction, Real-Time, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Titan: For Science!
description:
For Science! introduces a 6th type of Rig to your games of Titan: Science Rigs! These new installations function mostly like normal Rigs - they can be added to your Network and activated as per the normal rules. However each time they’re activated, instead of generating a resource, they allow you to use the special powers shown on the Research Board. New technologies become available each time a Science Rig or Science Module is placed on the board. The more of these you unlock, the more powerful and versatile the Rigs become, but beware - each new power you unlock becomes available to other players too!

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Industry / Manufacturing, Science Fiction, Territory Building
mechanics: Network and Route Building, Take That, Worker Placement

name: Take That Hill!
description:
Take That Hill builds upon a previous version by Prof Phil Sabin of Kings College London. A simple hex and counter, IGO-UGO system introduces players to basic mechanics used in the majority of commercial wargames. Game-play is solo or two-player and does not require an umpire to facilitate. This makes TTH suitable for self-learning, cooperative play, or a larger seminar wargame. Advanced rules add complexity and additional realism as required by the players. whilst staying true to the base rules.

In the game, the player represents a platoon with three sections and a Platoon HQ, which must take hold of an enemy position while minimizing the time inerted as well as the loses incurred. In each turn, each unit can move or fire, unless it is spent because of enemy fire.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid

name: Warlord: Orc Duel
description:
The savage clash for domination.

Battle head to head as you vie for the loyalty of the three Orc factions. Build your strength, sabotage your opposition and utilise the skills of your allies to prove that you have the strength to lead the Orc Horde.

The mighty Orc Warlord is dead - now a new challenger will need to command the respect of their fellow greenskins to claim the Warlord’s mask!

You must fight to win the loyalty of the three Orc factions, drawing strategically from the Orc Horde while using powerful abilities to gain the edge over your opponent. Be mindful, however - while building the strongest Tableau is the name of the game, the collection of the six putrid Vile Ichors offers an alternate and immediate means to victory for either player!
mechanics: Action/Event, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Deck Construction, Hand Management, Set Collection
publishers: Adam Walker Studio, The Square Mile

name: Warhammer 40,000 (Tenth Edition): Introductory Set
description:
Across the far-flung worlds of the Imperium of Mankind, in a galaxy riven by warp storms and unceasing conflict, the armies of Humanity battle for survival. With the Imperium already standing upon the brink of annihilation, the Tyranid hive fleets emerge from the cold void between the stars. The Space Marines stand as the last line of defence between this ravenous alien menace and the beleaguered worlds of the Imperium.

Take your first steps into the 41st Millennium with this Introductory Set for Warhammer 40,000. This box is a great way to get familiar with this amazing hobby, as you build and paint incredible models, then play your first games. It includes two sets of push-fit models, a set of hobby tools and paints, a game mat, helpful guides, tokens and terrain markers, plus all the dice and tools you need to play. Pick the noble Space Marines or swarming Tyranids, give control of the other models to a friend or family member, and battle it out for hours of entertainment. If you’re thinking about giving Warhammer 40,000 a try, this is your chance – it's also an excellent way to expand your existing collections.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Line of Sight, Measurement Movement, Simulation, Variable Player Powers

name: Volfyirion Guilds: Mysthea Champions Deck Promo
description:
This booster contains cards of the 7 Heroes from Mysthea, that could be added to the deck as Arbiters.
This was a promo and add-on for backers of the Volfyirion Guilds Kickstarter.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Open Drafting

name: Bonne Presse
description:
In Bonne Presse, each player takes turns playing the role of Editor-in-Chief, then the player with the most points wins the game.

The Editor-in-Chief draws 5 Word cards at random and chooses a Magazine for which the players will write this round. Trainees try to write a good headline, not off-topic, with as many of the words as possible.

The Editor-in-Chief then validates the headlines that fit in with the theme of the magazine: they score one point for each word drawn and used. Then he awards prizes for the funniest headline, and quite simply for the best headline!
mechanics: Paper-and-Pencil, Player Judge

name: Unchained
description:
The Universal Monsters are unchained!

In the officially licensed deck-building game Unchained, players draft their initial decks for an asymmetric start, then continue purchasing cards on each of their turns while simultaneously sparring with the other players by attacking and defending with cards in their tableau. In more detail, on a player's turn, they:


Spar: Compare their total offense to an opponent's total defense, with a fatigue card going to the player with the lower value.
Chain: Play cards from their hand by matching icons; opponents may add to the chain as well.
Learn: Discard cards for effort, then spend effort to acquire cards.
Draw: Refill their hand to five cards, shuffling as needed and taking a fatigue card on each shuffle.


Each card can chain into other cards, creating powerful combos. Learn the signature moves of the Universal Monsters and try to stay in the fight the longest. The game continues until all fatigue cards have been taken, at which point the player with the least fatigue wins.

Unchained reimplements Nightfall with some notable changes:


An asymmetric starting draft with no pre-set starter decks, so the action starts on turn 1.
Streamlined card costs and abilities for a broader audience.
A new 3x3 purchasing grid system inspired by fan variants of Res Arcana.
Tokens to track card offense and defense.
A shield that can be activated to negate the player's next fatigue card.


-description from designer
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Pattern Building, Take That

name: Prelude to Vicksburg: Chickasaw Bayou, December 26-29, 1862
description:
The Battle of Chickasaw Bayou was a grand missed opportunity for the Union Army in its desire to crush the Rebellion. If Union General Sherman had proceeded with haste, the Federals could have captured Vicksburg and delivered a master stroke against the Rebels seven months before Vicksburg surrendered on July 4, 1863. Historically, the Union took four days to launch their "Grand Assault", giving the Confederate defenders in their trenches ample time to receive much-needed reinforcements. Can you do better than Sherman?

The Prelude to Vicksburg game system is from Revolution Games' popular Blind Swords series that utilizes a chit-pull mechanic emphasizing the three "FOW's" of military conflict: Fog of War, Friction of War, and Fortunes of War.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Chit-Pull System, Hexagon Grid

name: Time Zoo
description:
You landed your dream internship; working for professor Darwina Anning at the Time Zoo. The zoo filled with prehistoric animals is about to open when disaster strikes and all animals escape! It’s up to you to lure them back to the Time Zoo.

Time Zoo is a card game for 2 to 5 players in which you have to lure prehistoric animals by playing different food cards.
The animals all have different properties and are also worth points at the end of the game. The player with the most points at the end of the game is the winner and will receive the highest internship allowance from Professor Anning.

Collect enough of the correct food cards are lure different animals in your part of the Time Zoo. All the prehistoric animals are worth points at the end of the game. Most of the cards also trigger special abilities that can give you more food cards, add points to you score or steal from your opponents.

-description from designer
mechanics: Set Collection, Take That

name: Foundations of Rome: Roads of Fortune – Dice Tower 2023 Promo Road Board
description:
Originally available in Pack Archer from Dice Tower 2023 Kickstarter campaign.

The Road Board has 2 sides:

Your civic buildings on this edge are considered adjacent to:

4 Citizens
2 Silver (or 1 VP)
1 Civic Building


If you have majority influence take 2 Build Actions. If Ceres has majority influence she performs 1 Enlarge Park Action. If Ceres has total control she gains 2 VP and takes 2 Enlarge Park Actions.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Rolling Realms: Praga Caput Regni Promo Pack
description:
Expand your copy of Rolling Realms with this set of 6 promo cards, inspired by Praga Caput Regni.

To play this realm you must assign dice to turn the wheel. Every spin of the wheel awards you with benefits and stars. Can you spin the wheel enough to make it to 6 stars?

-description from developer
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Código secreto: Expansión promocional Andalucía
description:
10 cards with 20 typical words from Andalucía, the South region in Spain.
This promo pack is produced by Devir and it was launched at the XIV Festival Internacional de Juegos Córdoba 2019.
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game, Spies/Secret Agents, Word Game
mechanics: Communication Limits, Memory, Push Your Luck, Team-Based Game
publishers: Devir, Festival Internacional de Juegos de Córdoba, Jugamos Tod@s

name: Kamigami Battles: Avatars of Cosmic Fire
description: Kamigami Battles: Avatars of Cosmic Fire brings Indian gods to the world of Kamigami Battles, and you need one of the base games in order to use this expansion. Play the role of a great God or a team of Gods, defending your reign from rival Gods by using the warriors and disciples loyal to you.
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: One Deck Dungeon: Witch
description:
Witch [Beta] promo card that is a stretch goal for the onedeckdigital.com kickstarter campaign.

It is also included in One Deck Dungeon: Abyssal Depths.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling

name: ICECOOL: Blocked Door promo card
description:
The Blocked Door promo card for ICECOOL came as a reward for certain backers of the Dized Kicktarter campaign on December 2018.

Rules:
At the beginning of the round, current catcher takes the blocked door card and slides it in between two boxes to close any door of his choice.
The door stays closed until a penguin (even the catcher) bumps into the blocked door card. This penguin may then move the blocked door card to any other door between two boxes.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Animals, Children's Game, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Area Movement, Flicking, Take That

name: ShadowSea
description:
ShadowSea is a miniatures skirmish game set in a lost world full of fantasy creatures and archaic magic. The world is being explored by Humans who have recently discovered it.

In the game players use approximately 5-10 miniatures to represent their warband and there are several scenarios that give goals to each player such as capturing an artifact.

ShadowSea is a stand alone game, but uses a modified version of the Song of Blades and Heroes rules as its basis. Like Song of Blades and Heroes, this game uses short, medium and long measuring sticks rather than measurement in inches or centimeters. Also, six sided dice are used for determining action points available and resolving combat. ShadowSea adds an expanded magic system, equipment rules, rules for resolving non-combat actions, and new special abilities to the basic Song of Blades and Heroes rules.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling

name: Prohibitionists
description:
Ever since the passage of the Prohibition Act, Lake City has been struggling with bootlegging and organized crime. Recently, things have taken a turn for the worse as a new boss has risen to power in the Lake City Mob, and the streets are running over with hooch-addled hooligans. In response, the government has established a special task force, dubbed the Prohibitionists, with the sole purpose of taking out the Boss and bringing the law back to Lake City.

You and the other players are those Prohibitionists, working cooperatively to defeat the mob. Every turn, a new card will be dealt off the Obstacles deck, representing everything standing in your way, from hired goons to secret bases to devious schemes to tie up your resources. In response, you'll play a card from your Tactics deck to dispatch the problem via Bribery, Contacts, Investigation, Subterfuge, or good old-fashioned Violence.

You won't be able to take out every Obstacle with one card, so it's essential to coordinate attacks; with a little luck and good planning you can take out multiple Obstacles in one blow. But watch out, because if you can't keep up with the Obstacles you'll be forced to discard cards straight from the Tactics deck, and if that deck ever runs out, you're kaputski, and the Mob will rule over Lake City.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Tokyo Highway: Rainbow City
description:
Tokyo Highway: Rainbow City / トーキョーハイウェイ レインボーシティ is a new edition of Tokyo Highway with new gameplay elements and updated components that make the game easier to play...which can be good or bad depending on your taste for collapsing roads.

At the start of play, each player has cars in their color, along with roadways (sticks), gray column pieces, and yellow column pieces. Players set up the city by placing one of their roadways with one end on the table and the other end on a column, then topping it with one of their cars. Next, they take turns placing city objects — buildings, an airport, a tower, a green area — around the playing area.

On a turn, expand your highway by adding a new stick to the end of it. When you do so, one end of the stick is placed on the column supporting your most recently played stick and the other end goes on a new column that you add to the table; this new column must contain one more or one fewer column pieces than the column on the other end of the stick. (If you create a column with a yellow piece on top and at least one piece under it, you can break this height restriction rule.)

If you've built this piece of the roadway so that your stick is the first to cross over or go under an opponent's stick, then you score by placing one of your cars on this roadway. If you cross over or go under multiple sticks on the same placement, you place one car per stick you top or bottom!

You can branch once from a column of yours topped with a yellow piece. Also, you can place a stick as an exit ramp if one end is placed on a single column piece and the other end on the table. This piece is automatically topped with a car — but it's also the final placement for this branch of your highway, so don't get stuck in a dead end.

If you run out of construction materials, you're out of the game. If you're the only one still in the game or you've placed all of your cars, you win.

Tokyo Highway: Rainbow City includes a "mission" variant in which all of the basic placement rules apply, but your goal is now to score the most points. Every car placed is worth 1 point, three roadways in a row with cars on them is 2 points, a loop around a building is 1 point, an exit ramp at the airport or green area is worth 2 points, placing the same type of car on a roadway as the opponent's car on the road above/below you is worth 1 point, etc.

In this edition of the game, the roadways have small tacky pads on each end, which makes the sticks more stable than in earlier editions when you placed wood sticks on wood columns.
mechanics: Network and Route Building, Stacking and Balancing

name: Pastiche: Expansion Pack #2
description:
Expansion Pack 2 is for those who own the original Pastiche First Edition. It includes 14 new commission cards by Seurat, Cassatt, Vermeer, Homer, Renoir, Toulouse-Lautrec, Monet and Van Gogh.

These cards substitute some cards in the original First edition cards to make the cards the same as the ones in the International edition.
mechanics: Hand Management, Pattern Building, Set Collection, Tile Placement

name: Paraphrase: Songs In Other Words
description:
Paraphrase: Songs in Other Words is a party game where song titles are cleverly disguised through the art of paraphrasing.

Solve the word puzzles, show off your knowledge of song titles, and maybe even win the respect of your fellow teammates with your amazing singing ability! Points are earned by correctly solving the Paraphrase and naming the Song Title. Extra points are earned by correctly guessing the Artist/Band who made it a hit in that decade and/or suddenly burst into song. If you need hints, you will lose points. The team with the most points at the end of the game wins!

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Music, Party Game, Trivia
mechanics: Action Timer, Singing, Targeted Clues, Team-Based Game

name: Studies in Sorcery: Divination
description:
Studies in Sorcery: Divination is an expansion for Studies in Sorcery that adds in the Divination project cards. The school of Divination has several major themes:

Place watchful Fate tokens to prophesy your opponent’s action and be rewarded for successful predictions.
Manipulate perception, placing extra credit tokens and turning demerits into a positive.
Increase knowledge of hidden information which you can use against your opponents.
Be rewarded for surrendering yourself to fate and pushing your luck.


—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Science Fiction
mechanics: Contracts, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Push Your Luck

name: Clank! In! Space!: The Last Starkiller
description: Clank! In! Space!: The Last Starkiller is a promotional card you can use with the Pulsarcade expansion, with this all-purpose card giving you either 3 credits or a 1-token arcade cabinet when you acquire it.
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Open Drafting, Player Elimination, Point to Point Movement, Push Your Luck
publishers: Dire Wolf, Lucrum Games, Renegade Game Studios

name: Stein im Brett
description:
There are many family games out there. On the other hand, Games for 6 players arent available that often - and at least not those with simple rules, which work fine for two and for 6 players.

"Stein im Brett" is one of those few games. There is a big bag, which contains the playing pieces in six colours. If you play a two player game, each player will have three colours. At a game with 3 players, everyone gets two colours and with 4-6 players, each person will just have one colour on his own, whereas the remaining ones will count for nobody.

With all constellations, all playing pieces will be at the bag. You will need them in order to fill up the board three times. A round will end, if there are no empty spaces on the board anymore. You only count your playing pieces and get points, if a piece wont have a neighbour of the same colour and is "isolated" from the others of his kind.

On your turn, you grab three pieces out of the bag and place them onto empty spaces on the board. Bribing the others, telling them the -best- positions for those pieces are a vital point in this fun game, where children and parents are equal at play.


Publishers Info:

"Familienspiele gibt es viele, Spiele für 6 Personen sind schon nicht mehr so häufig anzutreffen - und Spiele mit kurzen, einfachen Regeln, die sowohl für zwei Personen als auch für 6 Personen gut sind, gibt es ganz wenige.

Stein im Brett ist so ein Spiel. Im großen Baumwollbeutel liegen Spielsteine in 6 Farben. Spielt man nur zu zweit, besitzt jeder 3 Farben. Bei drei Spielern sind es je 2 Farben und bei 4 - 6 Spielern wird jedem nur eine einzige Farbe zugeordnet und gewertet.

Es bleiben also immer alle Spielsteine mit im Spiel - das ist wichtig, denn alle Spielsteine sind notwendig, um das Spielbrett genau 3 x komplett zu belegen. Gewertet wird nach jeder Runde. Siegpunkte gibt es immer nur für Spielsteine ohne gleichfarbigen Nachbarstein.

Da die Spielsteine blind aus dem Beutel gegriffen werden, kommt es sicher zu turbulenten Diskussionen, an welche Stelle ein bestimmter Stein gelegt wird. Es entsteht ein kurzweiliges Spiel für den Familien- und Freundeskreis, bei dem Kinder und Erwachsene die gleichen Chancen haben."
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Tajniacy: Fantastyczne Światy
description:
Codenames: Fantastic worlds

Polish mini-expansion
Consist of 10 new cards (with 20 new codenames) in Polish conect with fantastic realities.

Wprowadź do swoich rozgrywek w Tajniaków klimat niezwykłej przygody! Ten dodatek zawiera 10 kart, dzięki Twoja gra zostanie wzbogacona o 20 nowych haseł związanych z fantastyką.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Party Game, Word Game
mechanics: Deduction, Memory, Push Your Luck, Team-Based Game

name: After The End
description:
After The End is 1 to 5 player (14+) cooperative board game with turn based action/tactic RPG mechanics. The game features a story driven dynamic campaign of 30hrs+ divided in scenarios of 45 to 90 minutes in which players actions and choices will define the ending.

After the End is set in a post apocalyptic Chicago lying in ruins and covered with ice and snow. Will you come and fight the harsh blizzard and deadly inhabitants to uncover the truth on the End, forge alliances or just get the most of the loot that is your call? Mind that you can always count on your skills, equipment and companions that you can glean in the city. Combine them to achieve great power.

Welcome to Chicago, heroes!

Mechanics

Fast & easy dice rolling system, fast paced turn action based ; cover and height management to take advantage of the terrain and storytelling features influenced by players’ decisions.

Win conditions depend on the scenario played. They range from the annihilation of enemy troops to the resolution of an investigation (and many others).

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Krosmaster: Arena – Season 2 Exp #3 – Head Hunters
description:
This window box expansion contains 4 new figures with cards for use in Krosmaster: Arena.

Four new figures (Gein, Kivin, Mike Locke, Ghett Outadier)
Four Character Cards
Four "Bonus Elements" -- terrain & tokens
4 "Tricky Trap" tokens (for Gein)
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Open Drafting, Push Your Luck, Variable Player Powers

name: Creed
description:
The world wants peace, but the humans cross swords with each other. The peace will come only after a bloodbath.

The boardgame Creed is a strategic medieval war game using AP system. It's a game in which four kingdoms cross swords at each other insisting their own beliefs.

Players pick one of four kingdoms and lead the armies in the battle field. You will deploy your units to fight on six lanes and try to find and take away the opponent’s king and the commander-in-chief hiding in the camp while protecting your own.

In order to win the game, you need to understand the specialty of each unit. And you have to use your action points as efficiently as possible. Sometimes you have to crouch down and save your action points, so you can throw a big punch later. There are some special actions that can help you achieve glory, but you are allow to use them only once or twice during the game.

Every order you make is critical! Can you lead your army to victory?

The game has play time of 30 to 45 minutes and can be played 1vs1 or 2vs2.

Each kingdom has a very distinctive special unit and background story.

Phoenixia is the most powerful empire in military power. Their heavy armored cavalries are the worst nightmare for the enemies.

Xervin is the united kingdom of hunter tribes. With a good knowledge of projectiles, they’ve developed a bow-shooting machine, ballista.

Zuden is the kingdom of loyalty and fidelity. The Royal Knights who are armed with large shields and swords will never retreat from the battle fields.

Magatias is a mysterious and shadowy kingdom. They might be inferior in power, but they have assassins who can easily infiltrate into enemy’s base.
mechanics: Action Points, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Secret Unit Deployment, Sudden Death Ending, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: MIK 1 Extension Kit for 1853
description:
MIK1 Extension Kit for 1853

Expands:

1853


1992 edition:

Adds 25 Assorted yellow tiles to the game.

4 × #3
4 × #4
1 × #71
2 × #72
3 × #73
2 × #74
1 × #75
1 × #76
1 × #77

From the Sheet that comes with it:
This Kit consists of 16 extra yellow track titles that may be added to the standard game. This increases the number of tiles that are available for the development of new areas of the board and is particularly useful to those who like to lay a lot of metre gauge track.

Includes the following tracks:
2 × #3
2 × #4
2 × #73
2 × #75
1 × #113
